description: An expansion to The Great Debate Game. Covering 50 new questions and icebreakers. In addition, it contains a new voting mechanic.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Senkan Kyosokyoku
description:
Two to four players card game for Naval Arms Race prior World War Two. Mostly card represent hull, gun, engine or other equipment based on used or planed battleships in World War Two.

The game divided to two stages. In the first stage, players design new battleships by combine of parts cards. In the second stage, the winner of design competition is fight against imagined enemy's battleship.

Winner is determined by battleship design competition and combat result.

The first edition named "Senkan Kyosokyoku"(is means Battleship Roaring Songs) had a focus only on battleship design. It was self-published as one of Yuichi Kazama's Competition series. And then, combat rule were added by re-develop.

name: Scuttler's Island
description:
From the publisher:

A map-making, tile-laying adventure for the whole family. Evolving as you play, what might start off as an all-against-all race to the prize might turn into a co-operative challenge, with players needing to work together to navigate the traps and get to the treasure.

2-8 players take on the role of pirate cartographers(map makers) who've washed ashore on the revered "Scuttler's Island" - legendary hiding place for the gold of sunken ships of old.

Players take it in turns to draw tiles and extend their paths, sabotage a rival's or lay down an item token to overcome an obstacle. The first player(s) to reach the X in the middle with an uninterrupted path wins!

With 1 cloth map, 36 item tokens, 140 map tiles and - no two games are the same!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Network and Route Building, Take That, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies Strategy Battle Game
description:
The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey Strategy Battle Game is the tabletop game for two or more players. This free PDF expansion is packed with supplemental rules which enable you to recreate the thrilling events of The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies™ with your collection of Citadel miniatures.

This expansion includes two exciting new scenarios that recreate the pivotal events of The Hobbit: The Battle of Five Armies, allowing you to join in the adventure as Thorin’s Company concludes its quest to reclaim Erebor.

This PDF includes profiles and rules for a host of new Citadel miniatures allowing you to play games with our favorite heroes and villains from The Hobbit: The Battle of Five Armies, from the great and terrible dragon, Smaug, to the mighty heroes of the Free Peoples that form the heart of the White Council.

The updated army lists enable you to field the warring hosts that fought in the climactic Battle of Five Armies on the tabletop, from the valiant survivors of Smaug’s attack on Lake-town to the majestic Elven host led by Thranduil, King of Mirkwood.
categories: Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Death of the Party
description:
Death of the Party is a hidden identity card game with a murder mystery theme. Each player takes on the Persona of a famous detective who has been invited to a party, only to discover their host has been murdered, and one of them is responsible. It is up to the Partygoers to identify and arrest the Killer, or determine if there are multiple Killers, before they get murdered as well.

At the start of the game, there is the hidden identity ritual of having all Killers open their eyes and identify one another. One Killer must decide to make the first murder and then leave a Cause Of Death card and a Clue card, tied to their Persona, on the host's BODY sheet. Regular play begins and everyone goes to the room in which they want to take their turn. Each player, upon entering, takes a Drink card, that determines the order of questioning, and a Drawer card to see if they can find something useful.

When everyone has finished at the table, each player can ask a question of one other, attempting to tie them to the murder, or to uncover the progress of their investigation. Afterwards, the players will disperse to find new players to question. This process of hunting suspects from room to room continues until there is another murder.

At any time during gameplay, one player can attempt to kill another player by giving them a Weapon card (with a Cause Of Death), and a Clue card. But be careful, if the intended victim has a Weapon, they may try to defend themselves. And be sneaky, if the victim sees the attack coming they are allowed a single scream that could be heard by potential witnesses. The wise Killer will sneak up on the other player, and touch the victim on the back. The victim will not get a chance to scream nor defend themselves.

When a murder is discovered an Accusation Phase begins. All the surviving players gather and each is allowed one question to "examine the body." The victim may only reply by showing a card, including the Cause of Death and Clue left behind by the Killer. Based on what everyone has learned over their investigations, an Accusation may be made. All the free and living players vote on whether or not to put the player accused of being a Killer under House Arrest.

Play continues until someone makes a Final Accusation, declaring that they know who all the Killers are. The accuser will name the players (alive, dead, and under arrest) they believe to be Killers. Arguments are made, then a vote is taken. Any accused players who are still free and alive are placed under House Arrest, and the game ends. Identities are revealed, and the players discover who won: the Partygoers or the Killers.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Player Elimination, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Buurman & Buurman Kaartenhuis spel
description: Buurman & Buurman Cardhouse Game is a game where players try to build a house out of cards. Each team (existing of any number of players) starts with a floor and places two "wall cards" on it. After that, both teams try to place more floors and more walls to obtain points and create the biggest card-house. When one of the teams houses falls, the other team wins, or when both players finish their house by placing the roof, the teams count the points they obtained.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: PokÃ©mon TCG: Fossil Expansion
description:
Fossil (Japanese: Mystery of the Fossils) is the name given to the third expansion of cards and Theme Decks for the Pokémon Trading Card Game in both America and Japan. The set's booster pack designs feature Lapras, Kabutops, and Zapdos.


With this Pokemon Fossil Lockdown Pre-Constructed Theme Deck comes with 60 mint Pokemon collectible trading cards. You also a cardboard holographic foil Aerodactyl coin, 10 damage counters, and an english rulebook.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game

name: Trivial Pursuit: 007 Edition
description:
Immerse yourself in the world of James Bond.

This set contains 600 questions and answers on 100 cards from the following categories:

- Cast & Characters
- The Films
- Vehicles
- Gadgets & Weapons
- Locations
- Crew / Behind the Scenes

This set can be used as an expansion along with any Trivial Pursuit base game.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Dark World War
description:
In June 1917, at the start of the Battle of Messines, the mighty British commonwealth faced off against the proud and powerful German Army. 19 huge land mines were detonated, tearing apart the German lines and the fabric between the natural and Supernatural.

Supernatural creatures spewed forth and the western front crumbled, as both sides quickly pulled back from this new enemy. Russia would fall to a new enemy in the resurrected Rasputin the great and the middle east would struggle under the cults of Moloch. The Pacific would see the rise of the Elder Gods with the return of R'lyeh and the cult of Dagon, in the Bermuda the re-emergence of Atlantis would see a new enemy and cult step onto the stage.

Even with all this, mankind still continue to fight each other. Old enemies and grudges reappear, Mexico invades America, the Prussians invade New Guinea, and China invades Manchuria and Japan.

The game is played with company-level sized units of infantry, horsed cavalry, tanks or machine guns. In their turn each player moves their miniatures, conducts artillery fire, resolves aerial attacks and then undertakes combat (ranged or close assault) against their opponent. Morale is also considered; as unit take casualties they may become ineffective, retire to the rear or even surrender.

Players attempt to win by defeating their opponents and driving them from the field or by completing one-off scenario based objectives.
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I, Zombies

name: Tanto Cuore: Private Maid â Pierra Allegrini
description:
At the end of the game if you have 2 or more of Consuela, Denise or Pierra in your private accomodation you get:

2 different maids => 4 VP
3 different maids => 7 VP
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That

name: Let's Make A Baby
description:
Let’s Make A Baby is a strategy card game where the winner is the first person to make a baby - a head, arms, body, legs and diaper. (What did you think we meant by making a baby?)

Sounds simple right? Well while you’re trying to make your baby your opponents are snatching baby parts, cutting them off, muzzling you and soiling your diaper. And that’s if you’re lucky enough to not get leprosy or end up orphaning your entire crazy creature child!

This is baby making like you’ve never experienced before - clothes on and still super fun!
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Animal P-P-P-Pickup
description:
Description from the designer:

A quick microgame of picking animals from a grid to score the most points from various sets. Where you take from on your turn directly affects which cards your opponent can choose from on their turn. Choose wisely to gain the best sets, and avoid the potentially dangerous/unwanted animals!

The game uses a 4*4 grid of cards, with 2 'arrow' cards (one per player) pointing to a row and a column respectively. On each player's turn, they move their arrow card to a new row/column and take the card in the grid pointed to by both arrow cards. Most cards have varying types of set-collection scoring opportunities; others have special actions to swap cards or discard cards.

Once all cards in the grid have been taken, the player with the most points wins!

name: Dust Tactics: Panzerkampflaufer II-C (Flak) â "Leopold (Trop)"
description:
Even though it has some of the most modern planes on the planet, the Axis has learned the hard way that sheer weight of numbers will usually grant the air forces of the Allies and SSU air superiority. So for any Axis field commander, the constant need for ground vehicles with anti-aircraft capabilities is undeniable.

A new version of the famed Luther chassis was developed for the NDAK to deal with this necessity: the Leopold.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Asymmetry
description:
In this 2-player game, players use the cards in their hand to manipulate a function that allows players to trade in their colored cubes for more/different colored cubes in order to complete the goals set out at the beginning of the game. Once a player completes 2 of the 3 goals available, they win!

RULES:
To start the game, shuffle the 5 goal cards and randomly draw 3 of them. Those will be the goals for this game. The other 2 cards can be returned to the box.

Take the 1 Red cube "left" card and the 2 Yellow cubes "right" card from the deck and place them on the table. This is the starting function. Shuffle the rest of the cards and deal three to each player. Then give each player 3 red cubes. The player who was most recently in a math class will go second.

Turns:
Each turn, the current player MUST do the following things
- Play only one card to either side of the equation.
- Perform the equation if they have the cubes on the left side to trade for the cubes on the right side from the supply. If they do not have the necessary cubes, they MUST take 1 red cube from the supply.
- Draw one card from the draw pile.
(Play passes to the next player)

As soon as a player meets the requirements for one of the goals, the MUST trade those cubes into the supply and take that goal card. The first player to complete 2 of the 3 goal cards wins the game.

If the draw pile is exhausted, take the top two equation cards off and leave them on the table. Then you can shuffle the remaining cards to reform the draw pile.

If using the function causes a player to trade for a resource that has been exhausted, they do not get that resource and they do not take a red cube.

name: Pearl Lands
description:
The discovery of Pearl Lands, a galaxy with abundant resources, changed the face of the space race forever. Fleets traveled to Pearl Lands to transport new red shiny Pearl resource to our solar system, an adventure that was not possible before the use of Pearl extensively in every part of space technology. And the gift of Pearl Lands was not limited to Pearl! A green rain made of grain, discovered on a Pearl Lands’ planet, created a new energy source for space technologies, and a curious little yellow flower with beautiful petals provided Mana, a seed to be cultivated with utmost care. So, with these three new resources previously unknown to mankind, space travel to the farthest points of the Pearl Lands galaxy became a reality, and with the establishment of colony after colony Pearl Lands has become a new home for mankind.

Of course, war has never ended. With the use of new technologies, it just became more sophisticated. Fights for planets turned into a fight for resources, whether by using fire power or trade channels. Prosperity was never enough for mankind. There was always more to gain, and more to develop. Now it's your turn to join the race. Trade, fight and build future technologies. Power is a beautiful thing, so make sure you have it all…

Pearl Lands is a 2-4 player resource management strategy game with a sci-fi theme in which you compete to build three main resource buildings before other players. It’s a fast paced game that gets more and more intense with each passing turn.

The game has different strategy elements like attacking opponents to steal their resources, trading resources and using universe cards to change the course of the game (sometimes just slightly and sometimes drastically). Its combat mechanics is similar to Risk, while trade aspect gives it more like a Catan style strategy element. However there is no tile or troop movement factor that complicate things: it’s designed to be fun and straightforward.

Pearl Lands is full of surprises: the game can turn even at the last round. However it’s not a game of pure luck. The player with long term winning strategy will definitely have the upper hand, and most likely will be the target of other players banding together against her. Alliances are of the utmost importance. Cunning players will find the game to their liking, but utilizing only the art of deception may not be enough to win the game. Sometimes desperate measures like a kamikaze attack to destroy five resource crystals by sacrificing an attack ship can change the balance of power. And buying universe cards can pay off greatly if you get one extra attack or defense die, or get to change the resource setup on the board to sabotage an opponent's game plan.

name: Text Twist
description:
Based on an online word game, 'Text Twist' challenges players to make as many words as possible out of a given set of letters within a 2 minute period.

A game consists of 5 rounds. During each round, a card is drawn which lists a series of letters. Information is given on the card detailing how many possible 3,4,5,6 and 7 letter words can be created from that specific mix of letters. Players write the letters on their individual dry erase board, then the timer is flipped and players have 2 minutes to produce as many words as possible. At the end of the 2 minutes, players score points for valid words created (a booklet is included listing all possible words from each combination of letters). The score for that round is recorded, and the next round begins with a new set of letters. After 5 rounds, the player with the highest score wins.

The game can be played as a solo puzzle challenge.

Contents:
4 wipe-off Answer/Score boards
1 Instruction/Solutions booklet
144 cards (864 challenges!)
4 dry-erase markers
1 2-minute timer

name: Simon's Cat Card Game: Promotional "0" Cards
description: Zero value cards for the characters in the game.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Number, Party Game

name: Bakumatsu Kyoto Souran
description:
A game covering the struggle among Edo-bakuhu and Son-noh factions in Kyoto area.

Each player control any one of Aizu-faction, Sin-sen-gumi, Tyousyu-faction, and Son-noh group.
Each player has a different goal in this game. Aizu and Tyousyu are evaluated by support value. On the other hand, Sin-sen-gumi is evaluated by control of areas and Son-noh group is evaluated by placement of their bases.

1 game map. 4 player aid sheets. 1 countersheet.



Issue game of Game Journal #61.

name: Milliardending
description:
Consists of 8 square cards printed on one side with an “X” and on the other side with a “+”. Three of the cards are printed in blue, two in black and three in red. The cards are arranged in a 9 X 9 configuration with the red cards in the upper horizontal row, the black cards in two of the three positions in the middle row and the blue cards in the bottom row. The number and placement of cards marked “X” or “+” may be random or deliberate.

The object of the game is to move the blue cards to the upper horizontal row and the red cards to the bottom row in the fewest possible moves. The cards displaying an “X” may be moved only diagonally to an unoccupied space. The cards displaying a “+” may be moved only horizontally or vertically to an unoccupied space.

The game may be played as a solitaire or with two or more experienced players.
publishers: ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, Oliphante, Unicopli, Venice Connection

name: Ember: Dark Expansion
description:
A miniature expansion that was part of the Light and Dark Kickstarter. It contains the following cards:

Gelatinous Cube
Owlbear
Mimic
Shadow Demon
Soul Reaver
Rust Monster
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Just Survive The Game
description:
Description from the designer:

Use teamwork to help everyone stay alive or lookout for yourself and forget your family and friends

You've just been locked in a bunker holding out to survive a disaster outside. You and the people you're with must do whatever it takes to survive, but only one of you will be able to live.

Use teamwork to help each other stay alive or lookout for yourself and forget your family and friends.

If everyone dies before the Survive card is drawn, you all lose, but once the survive card is drawn, the last player alive wins!

Use abilities like healing others as the doctor or stealing things as the thief.

Keep secrets to yourself like you can see others players cards when you die.

Or be a team player and let everyone know what you can do.

Work as a team to help each other because if everyone dies before the Survive Card is drawn, everyone loses.

Once the survive card is drawn.. then it’s every man for himself. The last player standing wins the game.

Keep secrets to yourself like you can see others players cards when you die.

Players take turns drawing event cards and play out that event.

Play events like deciding which team member should be killed, or if the engineer should fix the pipes today.

Make friends as you work to survive, then stab them in the back to ensure you live.

The game is simple, Just Survive The Game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Take The Kingdom
description:
"A blast - Take The Kingdom combines the weight of epic medieval fantasy with a speed rarely seen in the genre." - Blogcritics.org

A medieval-themed card game for 2, 3 or 4 players. Build your Kingdom, damage everyone else's: The winner is the last Kingdom standing - or the strongest one at the end of the game (when all cards have been played).

Each player starts with a Fort and some Land, which they can fortify with Walls, Moats, Battlements, Hills, Archers, Knights and Traps. Using the cards in the deck, you then defend your Kingdom, attack the defences of other Kingdoms with weapons, and aim to control the fate of your opponents with Earthquakes, Sabotage, Mutiny, Spies and more. Mercy cards also allow a lifeline for each player. 20-30 minutes to play.

Relaunching on Kickstarter in March 2021, and available to play now on Tabletop Simulator.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Firewater of the Fire Mage
description:
This additional drink card came as a reward in the deluxe edition of The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport.

Drink Effect: Gain 2 Alcohol. Draw 2 cards from your Character Deck, then discard 2 cards from your hand. You may not take any game actions between drawing and discarding.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: The F'ing Truth
description:
The F'ing Truth is a talking-about-sex game. Players are prompted by the cards to ask each other questions ("Have you ever had sex with a person on the same day you met them?") and tell each other stories ("Tell a story about something you feel confident about in sexual situations").

Each "yes" answer and story shared allows players to cross off a square on their f'board, until somebody gets a line of five crossed-off squares (you know, kind of like Bingo). That person is the winner!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Bounty Hunters:  The Chaos Hunt
description:
Welcome to the "Chaos Hunt," a game in which you will take on the role of an infamous Bounty Hunter destined for greatness. Your previous exploits have garnered the attention of one of the most prestigious Bounty Hunting Guilds, The Severed Skull. But first, you must prove yourself worthy of initiation, and for that you must compete against others who have also been chosen.

The game takes place over a series of rounds. On your turn, you will be tracking down a variety of the universe's most notorious fugitives.

You start with a hand size of 4 cards, each representing the fugitives you are currently tracking. On each turn, all players will secretly select one fugitive to catch. Once all players have chosen a fugitive, the fugitives are revealed and placed in each player's Temporary Holding Cell aboard their ships. Then, in turn order, starting with the 1st player, each player has the opportunity to activate the Special Action that is awarded for the fugitive’s capture.

After all actions have been taken, the fugitives are then moved from the players’ Temporary Holding Cells to their ships’ Brigs. If at this time any player has 5 different fugitives wanted for 5 different crimes and are wanted by 5 different Bounty Issuing Organizations, then the game promptly ends. If not, all players track new fugitives by drawing back up to 4 cards in hand.

At this time the 1st player marker is passed clockwise, and another round begins.

This cycle continues until someone captures a winning set of fugitives or until there are no more fugitives left to track (i.e., the draw deck runs out). At which time, scores are tallied and a winner is crowned.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Anzio 1944: On patrol with the First Special Service Force
description:
A seven scenario pack dedicated to the members of the American-Canadian First Special Service Force (FSSF) and their actions in the Anzio Beachhead during the early part of 1944. The FSSF remained in combat for 99 days straight without relief, during which it conducted a highly aggressive patrolling strategy that was so effective, the Hermann Göring Division that was in the line across the Mussolini Canal from them, was forced to pull back its front line 1,000 metres and its commander offered a 10-Day furlough to any German who captured one of Die schwarzen Teufel "The Black Devils".

The pack comes with 140 counters of squads, HS, crews, SMC, & support weapons of both the FSSF and the Hermann Göring Division.

Requires ASL Map Boards: 4, 16, 33, 43, 48, and ASL Start Kit Map Board "t"

Scenarios:
WCR-1 Gusville
WCR-2 7th Luftwaffe's Attack
WCR-3 Raid at Sussuno
WCR-4 Hold At All Cost!
WCR-5 Raid at Cerreto Alto
WCR-6 Raid on Litoranea
WCR-7 A Primed Situation
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Daggers
description:
Daggers is a two player micro game. The game is about the size of a deck of playing cards.

Players attempt to accrue the most points by playing a numbered card on each of their turns. Their hand is finite and cards are drawn rarely. They must use the resources they are given in clever ways to win two out of three rounds of play. Special Arcana cards can drastically effect the game, each offering a unique power.

Daggers feels like it belongs in a rich fantasy world. Both the look and play of the game make it seem like a living and immersive piece of a fantasy setting.

The art and feel of Daggers draws on the iconic images of the tarot. Both in name and depiction the cards have an esoteric flavor that add an air of romanticized mystery to the game.

If you've ever experienced the trope of the seedy fantasy tavern, be it in a movie, a book, or perhaps a role-playing game, then you know the scene is not complete without a few shady characters gambling in the greasy lantern light. The game they are playing is Daggers.

name: The Tree of Battles: European Warfare AD1300-1500 Wargame Rules
description:
The Tree of Battles takes Simon Macdowall's Comitatus system and adapts it for Late Medieval Europe, especially the Hundred Years War and the War of the Roses.

The rules emphasize command and control and speed of play rather than details of weapons and equipment, while retaining enough colour to give a feel for the period.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Fetch Quest
description:
Fetch Quest is a family-friendly cooperative deck-building game. Each player represents a pioneer, one of six adventurous dogs on a dangerous quest. The pioneers work together to overcome dangerous challenges and resolve missions. Once the missions are resolved, the quest is finished and the players win the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: La 11 Coffee & Tea Party
description:
In the café La Once, there is a special activity each year in which the guests must play about their food. Only those who play out the finals will be served the tastiest food in a special room. The (fictional) café has now decided to publish the game that is played.

In La 11 Coffee & Tea Party, players have to collect sets of the same cards to grab the sweet dishes on the table. For two of the same card, one may take the corresponding dish from the center of the table; for three of the same, one may steal it from another player. When a player has collected the three dishes in their secret mission card, that player wins. Special cards spice up the game flow.

Rather than being packaged in a box, the game comes in a cookie bag.

name: OrcQuest WarPath: Quests Box â Greedy & Doomed
description:
"Greedy & Doomed" is a new expansion that will enrich the OrcQuest universe with new enemies. With the two Secondary Quests included, your heroes will be able to measure themselves, between two Chapters of your Campaign, against two frightening monsters, giving rise to epic and intense battles.

Meet in the heart of the Bloody Woods, in Abgral's Cave, strewn with skulls and sharp bones, and face the Laughing Troll. Entertain him and maybe he'll accompany you on your quest!

Finish your adventure in cataclysmic apotheosis in front of Cthul'orc, a fallen orc deity, waiting for his hour to return, incarnated in the body of a host worthy of his power, in order to devastate everything in his path. Be glorious or be doomed forever!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Second World War at Sea: Surcouf
description:
This is the twelfth of the Avalanche Press Golden Journal supplements. It contains 70 additional counters as well as variants for two games:

Counters:
The majority of the counters included are "long" rectangle pieces meant to replace ships in a number of other games that were originally represented by "small" square counters. Pieces are replaced in the following games: Strike South, Eastern Fleet, Midway, Bismarck, Bomb Alley, and Leyte Gulf.

Variants:
Second World War at Sea: Bismarck - Adds rules for using the included Surcouf French submarine in several of these scenarios.

Great War at Sea: U.S. Navy Plan Gold - Adds rules for using the included Surcouf French submarine in several of these scenarios.

The countersheet included was originally printed for the Gold Club in 2007.

—user summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Second World War at Sea: Gin Palace
description:
This is the seventeenth of the Avalanche Press Golden Journal supplements. It contains 25 additional counters as well as rules for their use in multiple Second World War at Sea games.

The premise is that the British hoped to sell the battleship Agincourt after World War I. These pieces are various possible roles for which the ship could have been repurposed. These range from an Armored Oiler to a Helicopter Carrier or even an Aircraft Carrier. Pieces are provided in colors of multiple nationalities with suggestions for use in various Second World War at Sea games.

—user summary
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Dust 1947: First Summoning â Cthulhu Mythos Army Set
description:
Something dark has happened in the sands of Babylon... An event that will forever change the World of Dust. The creatures from the First Summoning Army Set are the first direct result of this event. They have come back into this ancient place, where they were old once this land was young. They are now unleashed on this World at War and they won't bring it any peace.

This reference comes in a 30.5 x 21.5 x 10.5 cm size box and includes:
- three miniatures, one Avatar of Nyarlathotep and two Spawns of Cthulhu
- three unit cards, one for each miniature, for the Mythos Bloc
- twelve Mythos Bloc dice
- one army booklet with New Skills and Platoon
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: A Thief's Fortune: Gossipmonger promo card
description:
This is an additional character card for A Thief's Fortune.

This card is included in the Kickstarter edition and will be available at Essen SPIEL '18.

Gameplay Effect: Adds a lamp basic resource and a danger token to the future. As Activate Action the Gossipmonger resets a neutral character.
categories: Arabian, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Cards Against Humanity: Midterm Pack 2018
description: All-new Midterm Pack with 18 cards about the surreal fever dream that is American politics in 2018. All profits will be donated to Run for Something.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Sebastian Fitzek Safehouse: First Aid
description:
Promo expansion for Sebastian Fitzek Safehouse.

A legacy booklet containing stickers to put over blank fields to make the following games easier or harder to win (and their corresponding rules).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Real-time
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Set Collection

name: Dungeon Allies
description:
Each player starts with two adventurers who have beginning spell or weapon abilities. These abilities are designated by a 4 or 6 sided die. Players increase their skill all the way up to a 20 sided die. The die is placed on the area of the board showing their action. They battle creatures in the catacombs, find and fight for crystals and gold, recruit new followers in the tavern, advance their skill with the trainer, gain special bonuses with the sorcerer, and trade crystals in the village. When the catacombs are cleared out, the game ends with the player holding the most special sorcerer points and gold the winner.

—description from the designer

name: Cat Rescue: Get Your Claws Out Expansion
description: Deal one objective card secretly to every player. These objectives are scored at the end of the game, turning Cat Rescue into a semi-coop were there is a winner among the group.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: IAM
description:
IAM is an UNO-style card game with a party game overlay.

Each player starts with 4-7 cards in hand based on the player count. On a turn, play a card from your hand that matches either the number or color of the top card on the discard pile, then ask a question of a fellow player within a number of seats to you equal to the number on the card. (If you play a 2, for example, you must ask either your neighbor or the player next to them, going either clockwise or counter-clockwise depending on the direction of play.)

The topic of your question must be related to the card you just played, with blue cards relating to daily life, green society and community, red love and friendship, and yellow private matters. If the chosen player cannot answer or chooses not to, they must draw two cards, then the next player plays. If they answer the question, then they get to play a card. The game includes special cards, so the player questioned might be able to bounce the question back to the original questioner, pass it on to the next player, or require more people to answer as well.

If you have no matching cards on your turn, you draw a card and your turn ends. Alternatively, you might play a special card that reverses turn order or changes the color of cards that can be played.

Whoever plays all of their cards first wins!

name: Shadows: Amsterdam â Tournament Promo Tile #1
description:
Promo tile for Shadows: Amsterdam distributed during tournaments.

Frontside depicting four seagulls playing a game of Dice Forge.

Backside depicting the silhouette of a signpost and mailbox against the backdrop of a city with orange sky.

Tile can be shuffled in with the other tiles.
categories: Animals, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Party Game, Racing, Real-time, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: De Bello Galactico
description:
De Bello Galactico puts you in control of one the interstellar civilizations competing for galactic supremacy. To prevail, you will need to explore and colonize new star systems, build space ships, research new technologies, politicize in the galactic council, and keep your population happy.

There are many routes to victory; smart plotting and investing in the right political Agenda could secure your political supremacy, or you might science your way to the top, uniting the galaxy in a holistic singularity event. You might slowly plod to economic predominance. An aggressive colonization strategy with the support of your population could secure your superior power, as would the military domination of one of the other big intergalactic players. Reading which path your opponents follow and outsmarting them is key to victory.

De Bello Galactico is a straightforward and streamlined true 4X space game. The vast interstellar distances covered are baked into the Hyperspace movement system, doing away with the need for a board. Each Faction has different upgradeable ships, as well as a different way to handle their population. Thanks to a staggered action and pass system, downtime is minimal and rounds flow fast.

—description from the designer
categories: Civilization, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Action Drafting, Action Points, Action/Event, Advantage Token, Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Events, Income, Ownership, Sudden Death Ending, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up, Voting

name: Panzer Orders Tank Battles
description:
Welcome to Panzer Orders Tank Battles, a World War 2 card game. This is a stand alone game for solitaire and two-players and is fully compatible with the other Panzer Orders games and expansions. This game also includes some new gameplay mechanics and special scenarios to add to the Panzer Orders range.

The game is quick to setup and play, it takes around 30 minutes to play a game and comes complete with everything you need.

You can combine two copies of the game to make either larger or tank-vs-tank games for both solo or multiplayer games or combine this game with existing Panzer Orders games.

With the game you will receive two decks of cards - one deck for the Soviets and one for the Germans, plus rule summary cards (56 cards in total). You also get a full set of the rules plus a dice - everything you need to play.

Each card has a points value based on the card characteristics and special rules. The players agree a point based battle and then build their decks, spending points on specific cards.

Each player must form two columns of any mixture of tanks and then attack the opponents columns. The first player to defeat both their opponents columns or force the opposing player to draw their last card, wins the game.

During the player turn you can choose to dig and defend with your card, moves cards from one column to another or attack with ling range or close combat. Non of these are without their risks and weighing up the risk vs the strategic gain is part of the decision making elements of the game.

Combat is fast, simple but very brutal with all the dice rolls required on the cards - no charts or looking up in the rules. Damaged cards are suppressed first before being removed from the game and can still make a free saving throw on the dice to keep in the fight.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II

name: Platoon Commander Deluxe: The Battle of Kursk â Action Card Add-on Pack
description: A set of nine additional Action Cards for Platoon Commander Deluxe: Kursk. Kursk is NOT a card-driven game, but rather a card-assisted game. Action Cards do the assisting and this set adds the ability for sewer movement, overruns, and much more.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Ultracombat Normandy
description:
Ultracombat: Normandy is an easy, fast-paced set of squad-level skirmish wargames rules for depicting the frenetic close-ranged combat that occurred during the Normandy Campaign of WW2. The system puts players in command of up to a platoon of infantry supported with tanks, AT guns and devastating heavy weapons.

Key Features:

Forces are built in elements, so players can play the real tactics of the day like scouting, suppressive fire, and fire and movement.
Command is an integral part of the game.
Real ranges of weapons are used so measuring on the battlefield is kept to a minimum.
A unique card-based system gives players tactical options in play.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Brook City: The Funkhousers Promo Card
description:
An Ally / Rival card released as part of the Promo Paradise Kickstarter campaign (2019).

The Funkhousers are part of Brook City’s elite, and when they aren’t attending balls or bidding on priceless art, they’re using their wealth and power to influence elections and shape the world around them to their liking. There isn’t a pie that doesn’t have their fingers in it, and nothing happens in our streets without them knowing about it. They’re permanent fixtures at the Capital Hotel casino (heck, some even say they might own it), where they engage in high stakes games of chance while plotting how best to expand their empire. In fact, gambling seems to be their preferred way of interacting with people; if you meet them, expect them to roll the dice in more ways than one!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Twin Stars: Adventure Series â  Captain Crag
description:
A PNP Arcade exclusive Twin Stars Character card of Captain Crag. Later released in the May 2019 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.


Captain Crag navigates starships for the Dynasty. While he's a natural among the stars, he's even better at avoiding his job. Crag knows all the tricks. You'll find him off looking for some made up tool for hours, with a 528-Z Longnose coasting on autopilot. Nobody works as hard as him to not work.

But when the stars align, Crag will take control. He'll save the crew and by the time they go to thank him, he's hiding off somewhere with a co-worker covering for him. It's would be almost comical... if his job wasn't so crucial.

We had a vote at the Button Shy Twin Stars Discord channel, and Crag beat out 4 others to be our fan-made custom character. We chatted about his backstory a bit and then worked on mechanics. Jason and Mike finished him up and wanted to share at PNP Arcade, since Twin Stars doesn't require shuffling. This card can be printed and played along a standard or PNP copy of the game. Enjoy!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Phase Order

name: Blood Red Skies: German â Messerschmitt Me 410 Squadron
description:
The failure of the Me210 program left the aging Me110 filling the gap until a new heavy fighter could be designed. The more powerful Me410 "Hornet" was rushed into production by 1943, first operating as a night bomber and later as a bomber-destroyer with some success. The Me410 had a number of innovative design features including remotely controlled rear-facing guns and a "pallet system" for reconfiguring the aircraft as a bomber, a fighter, or a photo recon aircraft.

Metal components.

Contents:
6 Messerschmitt Me 410 metal Planes
6 Advantage Flying Bases
6 Base Extensions
1 Punchboard with Double-sided Pilot Skill Discs
2 Aircraft Cards
1 Doctrine Card
7 Aircraft Trait Cards
1 Waterslide Decal Sheet
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: è²æ ã«çã¸ã©ï½ããã¯ã«ããã© (Iroha ni Oedo)
description:
è²æ ã«çã¸ã©ï½ããã¯ã«ããã© (Iroha ni Oedo) is a trick-taking game in which players score face value for the lowest card they win in each suit, while subtracting a point for any additional cards won in that suit.

The game uses 60 cards (twelve each in five colors), but the cards used varies by player count. Players must follow any suit previously played to a trick, not strictly the lead suit.

—user summary

name: Bidders!
description:
In Bidders!, a.k.a. ãããã¼ãº, the players are the leaders of craftsmen guilds and try to balance profits and support of the people.

The King has money, and bidding on his projects can be profitable, but your popular support will fall. The Prince is well supported, but has a limited budget.

At the end of the game, the player with the lowest support is ineligible to win, and the player with the most money of the remaining players will win.

—user summary

name: Shake Up: Where Did All The Tech In An IT Firm Go!?
description:
WARNING: PLEASE PLAY THIS ONLY IF YOU HAVE CLOCKED A FEW GAMES IN THE BASE SET! THE EXPANSION ADDS MANY COMPLEXITIES THAT COULD THROW YOU OFF, IN TURN GIVING YOU A LESS THAN IDEAL EXPERIENCE!

Taking the game even further and beyond, the expansion introduces a multitude of various content to an already complete game. What you will get in this expansion:

New value of Income/Loan: More quantity of existing income and loan cards, as well as introducing the terrifying 5K value cards.

New Category "Technology": Cards in this category stay in the play area when played, and either triggers an effect when the right cards show up in hand or boost their abilities.

4th Victory Condition: A new way to win via "Buy Out". By implementing enough technology, the company might be acquired by a larger firm, achieving an immediate win.

New Staff From Every Department: Even more interesting folks have reported for their first day of work! Call for Audits without fear of penalties with your very own internal auditor, secretly assist your competitors' laid off workers to win court cases with your own lawyer, and much more!

Notes:

This box includes extra AI cards to support Solo Mode for expansion as well.

Each copy of this expansion supports 2 players. So if you are playing with 4 players you will need 2 copies of the expansion (to go along with 2 copies of the base game)
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Simulation, Take That

name: Sketch Off
description:
Can you draw a picture of Kim Kardashian playing croquet on a trampoline? Or Tarzan drinking a martini on the Golden Gate Bride? Or perhaps a Playboy Bunny riding a unicycle on a sun lounger?

Show off your creative flair with this crazy game of doodles! Players battle to sketch out hilarious scenes for their teams to guess based on the topic cards. Will your teammates recognize your artistic genius, or will you be a doodling disaster?

—description from the publisher

name: Tale of Carrot: Rise of Hero
description:
In this game you play as Carrot hero who tries to protect its own village from the horde of Rabbits that attack your village. But in reality, Carrot can’t win against Rabbit. You don’t have any other choice than lure it to others village hope it eat them and get full then leave your village alone after that.

This game objective is to be a sole survivor of the game, at the start of the game player will get to choose their hero by randomize. For the start of each turn player will draw invading Rabbit from the deck and place it anywhere on any player’s village board. Each Rabbit will have attack direction on their card at the final phase of your turn. Next, the player can draw adventure card(an event type card) which have various effects.

If you meet the condition you can use your hero Ultimate attack, then you will enter final phase which Rabbits on your village board will go rampage and do damage to direction their pointed at.

If you died in the game you village board will flip to the “Village ruin”, and you became vengeful spirit, when its comes to your turn again draw one rabbit card and place it on any alive player village board(can’t place on any village ruin including your own). Continuing until only last village stands in the game , that is the winner.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Wild One
description:
Before 1860, the West was simply known as the West, but then the Wild family arrived and changed EVERYTHING. Their impact was immediate and far-reaching. The West was no longer the West, it was the WILD WEST!

Now, the year is 1885. The Wild family has made a fortune through various “marketing” strategies, “business” ventures, and “community” projects. More importantly, the Wild family has emblazoned their name on both a territory and an era. After decades of pure wildness, the Wilds are tuckered out and ready for retirement. The family has grown tired of being ridiculously, filthy, stinking rich and they’ve done everything there is to do in the West.

After a raucous family council, the Wilds have decided to give away half of their fortune and head east to retire as New York City slickers. The family wants someone with basic mathematical skills who is also able to wisely manage money without going into debt. Most importantly, though, the Wilds want someone to carry on their Wild legacy in the West; a person with rambunctious spunkiness and tons of true grit.

The family has designed a simple competition to determine who will win the Wild Family Fortune and the glorious title of WILD ONE. Challengers have come from near and far to participate in this unprecedented event. As a challenger, your task is to manage basic income and expenses and stay as close to “1” as possible without going broke or into debt. Of course, there are other challengers attempting to do the exact same thing. Besides being known for their immense wealth, the Wild family also has a reputation for being very “hands-on.” During the contest, they will get down and dirty to help their favorite challenger win. Will you emerge victorious and be named the Wild One?
categories: American West, Card Game, Math, Memory

name: Firepower in Today's World
description:
An article with scenarios intended to bring the 1984 game Firepower up to date with modern tactics and conflicts. It starts with an in-depth review of Firepower's design and then provides the following scenarios:

Meeting Engagement - Ukraine 2015
Ambush - Iraq 2004
Urban Combat - Somalia 1993
Urban Combat - Chechnya 1995
Assaults - Afghanistan 2003
Tank Killers - Iraq 2015

Also provided is an Addenda for New Weapons and Vehicles.

Published in issue 3 of CounterFact magazine.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Chess of Qin Style
description: An abstract chess game which allows 2 players(with 2 base game, up to 4 players) combine their armies to confrontation. The player who occupied the opponent's fort is the winner.

name: Philadelphia
description:
Philadelphia is a TCG-like card game where players aim to develop the advertising agency they work for. Earn money by placing diverse and colorful advertising cards with unique abilities, and aim for combos by combining effects to get large rewards.

Earned money can be used to efficiently collect sets of cards with the same color/industry, which you can present to investors as an attractive set of advertisements, raising your reputation and gain victory points.
Will you be able to hold down rival employees, and stand victorious?

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Lady Death: Last Stand
description:
The first-ever game based on the Lady Death comic series.

Defeat waves of enemies as they attempt to escape Hell and invade Earth. Each turn, encounters are drawn from a deck and are added to a game board where they advance closer to Earth. Using attacks, abilities, strategy, and a little luck, defeat these encounters and achieve the win condition to move on to the next campaign.

—description from the designer

name: Schatzsuche im Wunderwald
description:
Treetop Treasure Hunt

The ingenious internal design of the board allows players to push the animals under the treetops and reclaim their stolen treasures. The player who best keeps a mental map of where their animals are concealed and uses strategy to recover their missing treasures first wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Paranormal Detectives: Heavy Euros Promo Card
description:
A new story card for the game.

The promo was part of Lucky Duck Games Premier Retailer Program launch kit for the game.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Line Drawing, Pattern Recognition, Variable Player Powers

name: 4 ÑÐ²Ð¾ÑÑÐ° (4 tails)
description:
In the jungle, the storygoers found a magic egg from which 4 snakes hatched - 4 multicolored tails sticking in different directions.

GOAL OF THE GAME: Grow real pitons - Jose, Giraffe, Lionel or Hugh!

To score more points, than your opponents.
Everyone grows up a python of the color, feeds him with cheerful rabbits, treats bandage, untangles knots and protects in the impassable jungle. It is possible to disturb pythons of other players, confusing it tails, sending to biting mosquitoes or a prickle of cactuses, and also to take away from them curative bandage which will always be useful to your piton.

name: Unoriginal
description:
Player race against each other to match their cards and be the first to use them all. The game takes the basic mechanics of Crazy Eights, and adds a large amount of cruelty and strategy in the form of SCREW Cards.

SCREW Cards make up about 20% of the deck and each card is unique in both its design and game mechanics. These cards are one time use only and are designed to backfire on the player using them if played carelessly.

Each SCREW Card has multiple uses included so that players can fine tune the rules of the game to accommodate their preferred play style.

—description from the designer

name: Lee's Greatest Victory: Chancellorsville 1863
description:
“My God! What will the Country say?"

-- President A. Lincoln

The Chancellorsville campaign, which took place in and around Virginia’s Wilderness in May 1863, is considered by many to be Robert E. Lee’s masterpiece, a true triumph “against the odds.” Opposing Lee was Union commander Joseph “Fighting Joe” Hooker, who had devised a plan that seemed assured of success. His cavalry would raid deep behind Confederate lines, cutting Lee’s supplies, while Hooker and four of his seven infantry corps would march west, then south, and appear behind the Confederate defenses opposite the city of Fredericksburg.

Lee would be compelled to withdraw south, in which case he would be pursued, or he would be compelled to attack with his numerically inferior army to avoid being crushed between the hammer and anvil of Hooker’s forces. “May God have mercy on General Lee, for I will have none,” Hooker declared.

No plan, however, survives first contact with enemy. With the advantage of interior lines and a great deal of audacity Lee would confound his opponent by continually bringing more rifles to the critical place at the critical time. And it didn’t’ hurt that Lee’s largest corps was commanded by one “Stonewall” Jackson. . . .

Lee’s Greatest Victory is an area-impulse game but one unlike anything seen before. Since the appearance of the “sunset die roll” nearly three decades ago players have alternated activating a single area, with variation coming in the form of an uncertain turn length. Play has a chess-like feel, with players able to act and react with a great deal of prior calculation. Short turns could be frustrating for one or both players. In this revolutionary development of the genre players no longer know how many impulses they, or their opponent, will have, creating both opportunities and crises that cannot be anticipated in advance—just like real combat. The “momentum” swings back and forth but rarely the same way twice. At the same time, each turn lasts as long as the players wish it to last, ensuring something will happen every turn.

Units of maneuver are Union divisions and Confederate brigades for the most part, with historical leaders present to provide a combat boost though at the risk of being wounded or KIA. Pontoon bridges and entrenchments are part of the basic rules while optional rules incorporate weather and optional units for both sides. Best of all, it's just six turns long and very playable in one sitting.

Content:

Map - One full color 22"x34" mapsheet
Counters - 176 full color 5/8" die-cut pieces
Rules length - 12 pages
Charts and tables - 2 pages
Complexity - Medium
Playing time - Up to 3 hours
How challenging is it solitaire? - Poor


Design - Michael Rinella
Development - Paul Rohrbaugh
Graphics - Mark Mahaffey

(from the publisher's website)

name: Cogbug
description:
Cogbug is a mechanical gearboard tabletop game created in Estonia.
You have to PLACE cogwheels, SPIN gear systems and MOVE your bot minions the fastest across the field to your opponent’s base in order to win!
But beware: the road to victory is not easy: the trails may not be straight and your opponents will do anything to stop you!

name: Lost Worlds: "Chiron" Magical Centaur
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.


"Chiron" Magical Centaur booklet in Tunnels and Trolls series

Character created by James L. Walker.

Comes with 3 red spells and 1 random card.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Lost Worlds: "Flaming Cherry" Barbarian Beauty
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Lost Worlds: Unicorn
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.


From inside front page with User Summary:

This book represents "Unicorn" in the LOST WORLDS combat book games and is playable, with all other LOST WORLDS books. Each book is unique and has its own special qualities.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Flying Buffalo, Inc. (FBI), Nova Game Designs, SoftBank Corp.

name: Hunting Me, Hunting You
description:
Players in Hunting Me, Hunting You secretly dish out damage in order to hunt their target. They must also pay attention to where and when damage was dealt to be able to identify who it is that's hunting them!

After Target Cards are dealt out by the all-knowing 'Curator' role player begins, starting with the appointed 'Leader' (a role which changes every phase).
Play takes place over two phases, which repeat until the round is over - The Night Phase and The Day Phase.

During The Night Phase players take turns as the only player with their eyes open - placing up to two damage cubes on other players' character cards. As each player 'wakes up' they will see where damage has been placed but not necessarily who did what.

The Day Phases sees players doing one of three actions:


Reloading - collecting more cubes, up to a maximum of two.
Spying - looking at another player's Target Card.
Identifying - accusing another player of being their attacker.


When identifying, players announce who they think has them as their target. If they are correct the accused player dies and is out of the round (not the game). If they are wrong it is instead they who die!

Games are played in tournaments, in which players compete to win the most coins - with players getting paid after every round based on what they achieved.

It's a game about trickery, deduction and killing your friends for money. 5-8 players, with a 4 player variant.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Bribery, End Game Bonuses, Hidden Roles, Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: Mage Forge
description: In the game we run a magic forge whose goal is to create magical objects. Using a common resource of dice, each player tries to create and improve items so that they finally have the most power. The game requires long-term planning and sensible resource management.In each round, players have 6 dice at their disposal to give magical properties to the objects: they increase their power, unlock the colors of magic, upgrade, and finally create the magical dust necessary to complete the project. After 7 turns, all players compare the collections of created items. The winner is the player whose items are the most powerful

name: Chronicles of Crime: Tantrum House 2020 Promo Card
description:
Available from Tantrum House Season 7 2020 Kickstarter Campaign.

Adds a new suspect based on Tantrum's House Melissa Delp for missions in Chronicles of Crime.
categories: Adventure, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery

name: Candycanes, Inc.
description:
You and your fellow player are interns at Candycanes, Inc., tasked to build the best candy cane in time for the holidays.

Place striped cane bits to lengthen your candy cane, and gain a point for white stripes surrounded by red and green. Bows can be used to modify a card midway. Players alternate until either bows or cards run out. The player with the best score wins.

name: Endangered: TH2 + SiN
description:
Endangered: TH2 + SiN is a micro-expansion for Endangered that consists of two Ambassadors based on the Tantrum House hosts and a "Strength in Numbers" bonus.

Originally available as an Add-on from the Kickstarter campaign for Endangered: New Species.

name: Hoplomachus: Dungeon Master Crowd Favor Gladiator
description:
Contained in the 2018 CTG Promo Pack

Stats:
5 Health
1 Attack Range
2 Move Range
3 Tactical Range
Black Basic Attack Die
Ability - Rocks Fall
Alternate Attack - Everybody Dies
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Evangelion Card Game: EV-02
description:
Evangelion Card Game Asuka Shikinami Langley & Kaworu Nagisa Set EV-02

Contains:

108 Cards (2 decks of of 54 cards)
12 Double-Sized Cards
2 Turn Sequence Cards
A Playmanual (Japanese, Chinese, English, French, Italian, German, Latin-American Spanish, Brazilian Portuguese)
2 Play Sheets
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Papaya Monkey
description:
Papaya Monkey is a competitive, medium light weight, card game from Cayro the Games. Children will have a lot of fun and adults will enjoy the challenge behind.

The jungle is growing non-stop and the monkeys try to hog and gobble as many papayas as possible. But watch out! There are many wild animals lurking.

Each player will place a piece of jungle, place or move his monkeys and also push others with secret attacks. The purpose is to be the player who gets the most papayas with his monkey team at the end of the game. Reward cards also have extra papayas.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Tile Placement, Zone of Control

name: Sendas
description:
Sendas is a two player, abstract strategy board game.
The action takes place in a 9x9 grid board where players control 6 pieces each (differentiated by light and dark colors) starting from mirrored positions on opposite sides.
Players take turns moving and/or rotating one of their pieces in an attempt to reach the opposite side of the board and be the first to take one piece out of it.
The pieces are square blocks with a white line on top called “Senda” (“Path” in English) that comes in three shapes: a straight line, an elbow, a T or a + shape.
The only rule is that all pieces of the same color must stay connected to each other by the senda at all times. You can not make a move if it disconnects your pieces or your opponent's from the rest of the same color.
The sendas of both players can also be connected, creating one long senda that allows for pieces of both colors to get mixed in an intricate pattern.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Pattern Recognition, Square Grid

name: ÅÃ³dÅº 1914
description:
The game covers a clash between German, Austro-Hungarian and Russian armies. It is divided in three scenarios, covering different stages of the battle. Each stage has different objectives, marked by victory points. Supply plays a key role, when planning offensives on enemy soil.

A fourth scenario combines map and units from this game with the map and units from Tannenberg 1914 and covers the Second Battle of Masurian Lakes.

Rules:
The game is using the WB-95 system, which contains additions related to the time period. This rule-set is the base for WB-48.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Teotihuacan: Expert Challenges â Book 2
description:
Teotihuacan: Expert Challenges is a series of setups intended to challenge players who are well familiar with the game.

Book 2 contains two challenges.

Decoration Challenge
This is a challenge for players who have at least some experience playing the base game. It focuses on decorating the temple as it is being built.

Pyramid Challenge
This is a challenge for players who have at least some experience playing the base game. The Action Boards are set up so that players can easily build the Pyramid, and the game end is likely to be triggered early due to the finishing of the Pyramid.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Movement, Rondel, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Track Movement, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: The Front Line: Trench Warfare R&W
description:
WARGAMEVAULT: https://www.wargamevault.com/product/374597/THE-FRONT-LINE-T...

Solo war game in roll and write mode.
OBJECTIVE: The player must lower the enemy's morale to 0 to obtain victory, while your enemy will try to cross the second defensive line or will also try to lower the player's morale to win.

What does it take to play?

Just the printed sheet (it is recommended that the sheet be with a polypropylene protector)
Several dice D6.
An erasable marker.

TO FIGHT!!

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dilemma
description:
Each trick consists of four cards, one of each suit. Non-dealer leads to the first trick and the winner of each subsequent trick leads to the next. Any card may be led.
Playing second to a trick, you must choose one from a different suit. If you play a higher card than the one led then you play the third card, again of a different suit, and the leader plays a card of the fourth suit. But if your second card is equal to or lower than the first card, then the leader plays the third card and you the fourth.
The trick is won by the player whose two cards played to the trick count highest when totalled, taking numerals 2 to 10 at face value, Jack 11, Queen 12, King 13, Ace 14. If tied, then it is won by the player whose two cards produce the higher total when multiplied together. If still equal, then you will both have played equal cards. In this event the trick-winner is whoever was the first to play the highest-ranking card.

name: Utmost Savagery
description:
This solitaire game portrays the battle for the island of Peleliu, which was the hardest-fought and most difficult campaign the 1st Marine Division would ever engage in.
The Japanese on Peleliu were dug in and ready to give the overconfident Americans a blistering fight. Unlike previous island invasions, in which the Marines had crushed ill-prepared defenders, Peleliu would become a strategic nightmare for the Americans.

The Japanese had spent months building defensive fortifications and turning the island into a death trap. Bombarded by battleships and hammered by Corsairs dropping tons of napalm, the Japanese held on and withstood the initial invasion. Skillful night attacks and relentless artillery barrages made the Americans pay dearly for every inch taken.
The terrible 115-degree heat and endless combat sapped American morale and turned a battle projected to be won in 4 days into a vicious 6-week campaign. With the aid of the reinforcing 81st Infantry Division the Marines would eventually win at Peleliu, but the cost was devastatingly high.

You, as the American Player, have a limited amount of time to destroy all 30 Japanese Counters from the map. You win the game as soon as the last enemy counter is destroyed, but lose at any time the Morale Track reaches the 1 box, or the last Time Chit of Level IV Intensity is drawn with Japanese Counters still in play.

name: Blokk! Hazard: The Expansion
description:
In Blokk! Hazard you are the Engineer and have been assigned to obstruct your opponent known as the Architect, in order to construct The Tower.

To start a game, Engineers are given 10 complex Hazard blocks. Architects select one of the three difficulty modes: Hand-pick their own blocks, roll the dice, or draw a card from the deck. Architects use a 5x5 grid to start building their tower.
But Architects beware: your opponent’s blocks will count against you!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Cube Tower, Hand Management, Semi-Cooperative Game, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Fairy Trails: Menhir promo card
description:
The Menhir is a promotional card that helps players to complete one of their paths(and one path of the opponent).

At the start of the game, shuffle the Menhir card together with all other cards. If the Menhir is placed, any path that connects to the Menhir counts as completed even if there is (at most) one open connection left.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Tile Placement
publishers: Paper Plane Games, White Goblin Games

name: MonsDRAWsity: Unusual Suspects
description:
MonsDRAWsity is back with MonsDRAWsity: Unusual Suspects, a brand new, stand-alone edition to one of 2020 and 2021's best party games!

So when Deep Water Games decided to make another version, it made perfect sense to collaborate with the brilliant weirdos at Shut Up and Sit Down, a group of people known for being hilarious, energetic, wonderfully bizarre, and original. MonsDRAWsity: Unusual Suspects features over 100 new monsters conjured up by Shut Up and Sit Down and illustrated by some of your favorite (or soon to be favorite) artists.

—description from the publisher

name: Twisted History
description: A historical trivia game that sees you moving through different time periods and answering questions about that time. For every answer you get wrong, you build part of your own execution device. Get 9 incorrect answers and you are out of the game.

name: HyÅga du Verseau promo card
description:
A card to add to Saint-Seiya The Deckbuilding Game.

Détruire : Tous les Personnages gelés sont détruits.

Destroy: All frozen Characters are destroyed.

Vaincu : En commençant par le joueur actif et jusqu'à ce que le terrain soit vidé, chaque joueur acquiert une carte du terrain qu'il gèle.

Defeated: Starting with the active player and until the field is emptied, each player acquires a card from the field they freeze.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology

name: Raindrops
description:
Raindrops is a game about having fun in the rain.

Every round, players simultaneously choose and play a card from their randomised starting hands. Each card has a specified number of raindrops to be placed on them. The highest unique number (as well as highest unique yellow number) gets to collect raindrops from cards already played, and the lowest unique number receives one raindrop from the bank.

Play cards wisely as same numbers cancel each other out! From the fifth round onwards, raindrops on previously played cards start to evaporate. The player who has collected the most raindrops after 11 rounds wins.

Players can try having the same starting hand for a more competitive variant.

—description from the designer

name: Dukes Of Nukes
description:
The party card game of nuclear thievery. Someone at the table has the holographic Nuke Codes card. But who? Use cards in your hand to find out who and secretly steal them for yourself. Now that you have the codes you will need to protect them and try to throw people off your scent or everyone will be after you! The codes will switch hands multiple times so can you deduce who has them and be the single player with the codes by the time the game abruptly ends?

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Modern Warfare, Party Game, Political

name: Iyados
description:
ããã©ã (Iyados) is a trick-taking game in which players place an "Insert" card into their hand (as originally dealt, without rearranging). Cards to the left of the Insert card are referred to as the "normal" cards, which can be used to lead to a trick or when a player cannot follow suit.

However, cards to the right of the Insert card are the "refuse" cards. These can only be played when a player could follow suit, but announces that they refuse to. Moreover, the number of "refuse" cards chosen also becomes a player's bid.

If a player cannot play a card because they are out of "normal" cards when they need to play one, they are eliminated from the round.

At the end of a round, points are awarded based upon 3 factors, including how many players were eliminated and how close a player came to hitting their bid. After a number of rounds equal to the number of players, the person with the most points wins.

name: Chrononauts: Missing Artifacts
description:
A time traveler's work is never done.

With Chrononauts: Missing Artifacts, you can add six new mission cards to either Chrononauts or Early American Chrononauts — or both! These new missions will send you through time in search of missing treasures like one of the lost Fabergé Eggs, D.B. Cooper's suitcase full of money, a gemstone from Mars, and even the Holy Grail itself. (But make sure you choose the right one!) Or you might need to find a fully functional Antikythera Mechanism, a papyrus containing the secret to how the Great Pyramid was built, or a golden statue of Throk-Trak (hero of the cockroach revolution which happens 83 million years after WW3).

The 18-card Chrononauts: Missing Artifacts expansion also includes a couple of powerful new gadgets: the Reality Shifter and the Temporal Stabilizer.

—description from the publisher


Card List

Actions (1):

Sell an Artifact (Riches Bonus)


Artifacts (9):

Cooper's Cash
Fully Functional Antikythera Mechanism
Great Pyramid Construction Papyrus
Live Silphium Plant
Lost Fabergé Egg
Mars Gemstone
The Holy Grail
The Schmoly Grail
Throk-Trak Statuette


Gadget (2):

Paradox Stabilizer
Reality Shifter


Missions (6):

Back the the Bible
Cash and Prizes
Exotic Flora and Fauna
Founders' Day
Lost Technologies
Pyramid Schemes
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Science Fiction

name: ACW Battles: Stones River
description:
A free print and play quick-playing entry level American Civil War wargame for 2 players, playable in 2 hours, where the intention is to have a core set of rules with which to play a number of different battles/scenarios.

The units are generic, so only need to be printed once. Each map and scenario card is a different battle. The first of which is Stones River.

—description from the designer
categories: American Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Command Cards, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Arcadia Quest: Black Newt
description: The self-named ‘Black Newt’ is the son of a very large and wealthy Arcadian family who had the misfortune of being born last. His sisters were beautiful, his brothers were dashing, and all his elder siblings were intelligent, witty, and noble. Alas, the Black Newt had the heart of a troll. Sniping was his second nature, the cutting barb was his forte, and he even took to stealing their diaries to scrawl snarky comments in the margins. He was eventually disowned. But he had learned swordsmanship to at least a competent degree, and a Guild membership was easy enough for someone of his connections.
