Ironically, he welcomed the invasion, but was cast out when he was found scrawling derisive comments beneath graffiti the orcs would leave on each other’s’ walls. Heart of a troll indeed.
publishers: Cool Mini Or Not, Spaghetti Western Games

name: Bakufu
description:
Bakufu is a competitive and fun strategic card game for 2-4 players, where your choices matter. With multiple paths to victory and game changing cards, how will you outsmart your enemies?

It's 1192 AD in Japan and the Emperor is weak. Through either war or peace, you see an opportunity to become the first Shogun of Japan.

Each turn, you can build up your castle, attack your rivals with soldiers, play characters to change the game, or choose a peaceful path to victory to establish your new Bakufu government. It's easy to turn the tide towards victory, and fun to foil your enemies' plans!

Each game is different, as players can easily change their fortunes to win through two routes:

War or Peace: You choose!
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Turn Order: Claim Action, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Magic: The Gathering â Challenger Deck: Flash of Ferocity
description:
Untap, draw, and pass the turn—then thwart your opponent’s every move with powerful counterspells and flash in your army of creatures at instant speed. The Flash of Ferocity deck has everything you need to beat opponents on their own turn.

The Flash of Ferocity deck is tournament-ready, with 60 cards, plus a 15-card sideboard you can use to fine-tune your strategy between games.

The decklist for Flash of Ferocity is based on a top-tier strategy, so it’s the perfect springboard if you’re looking to get back into Magic: The Gathering (MTG).

A Challenger Deck makes a great Magic: The Gathering (MTG) starter deck, powerful enough to jump right into the competition at Friday Night Magic.

Contents: 60-card ready-to-play deck, 15-card sideboard, 5 double-sided tokens, 1 deck box
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Magic: The Gathering â War of the Spark Planeswalker Deck: Jace, Arcane Strategist
description:
Planeswalker Decks familiarize players who are interested in Magic with basic strategy, plus the games setting, characters, and mechanics of the latest set. Each deck comes with a foil Planeswalker card not found anywhere else.

Jace Beleren likes to stay two steps ahead of his enemies. (The telepathy helps with that...) Dodge your opponents’ defenses, disrupt their plans, and relentlessly take over the board.

Contents: 1 ready-to-play 60-card deck featuring a foil Planeswalker card, 2 War of the Spark booster packs, 1 strategy insert, 1 Magic reference guide, 1 MTG Arena code card, 1 tuck box
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Layers+
description:
Layers+(plus) is a pattern-matching game that requires players to turn, flip, and overlap a set of five layers to complete the pattern shown on a mission card. The faster you complete the pattern, the higher your score will be.

With a variety of levels, you can try to match different patterns on the mission cards using 2 layers up to 5 layers. Each layer has a unique shape and the colors are different in the front and back, so you must be careful as you overlap different layers into one pattern. Complete the pattern quicker than the others to gain more points and win the game!

Layers+ is an upgraded version of Layers. It is more compact than the original Layers and includes additional components.
The rules were also revised - missions using two layers added - and easier and more dynamic gameplay would be available.

-description from publisher

name: GulyÃ¡s
description:
So it begins…
…the annual Gulyás Festival!

Everything is ready for the year’s most prestigious event to be successful. Big cauldron. Quality ingredients. Awesome vibe. What could be missing? You probably got it by now... Yes, You! The famous Gulyás Masters. As soon as it turned out that you’ll be cooking the main course, many Gourmets and Locals flocked around the fire to see what you are up to. Their expectations are high and very much different. You will really have to get it together to impress these guys! And you will have to pay attention whether it is a critical kitty or a seasoned chef you want to blow away. Well, what are you waiting for? Start cooking like the Eskimo dress up! (Quick!)

Gulyás is a half-cooperative game where you will need to cook a soup under changing circumstances but working together the whole time. That is until one of you thinks that it’s ready and yells ‘Gulyás!’. Your gulyás is considered successful when its value reaches 13 points. During the course of the game, you will have to cook more than one gulyás. You will get a different amount of victory points for every meal you cook, depending on whether the soup was successfully made, or which Gourmets were impressed. The ultimate winner will be the person who is the best at navigating between the sneaky Locals, the other chefs and the whims of the Gourmets. And most importantly whoever reaches 7 victory points first.

The game is played through several rounds, the players cooking a separate gulyás in each one of them. The players take actions in clockwise order and can decide between three actions: put an Ingredient in the cauldron, distract a Local or stir the soup. Each player has one Ingredient card in their hands, the active player draws another card - unless they stir the soup - and pick one of the two to take an action. The cards you use always go face down on the game board. Each Ingredient has a separate value so you cannot possibly know the exact value of the gulyás, plus the Locals can steal ingredients from the cauldron if you don't distract them. So take extra care before yelling 'Gulyás!'. If you were brave enough and yelled 'Gulyás!' you will have to check the point value of the soup. If you were right and the cauldron does have 13 points worth of Ingredients in it, you get 2 Victory Points. If you were wrong, all the other players get 1 Victory Point. The players have the option to get additional Victory Points by guessing the Gourmet conditions right. After yelling 'Gulyás!' but before calculating the value of the soup, the players have to guess if any (or both) of the Gourmet conditions are met. If you guessed right, you get an additional Victory Point for each Gourmet. Good luck chefs!

—description from the publisher

name: Turn for the Wurst
description:
Get your buns warmed up for this hotdog building game! Players compete to acquire ingredients, complete recipes, and score points in this rummy style card game. Don't worry if you find yourself in a pickle, there are plenty of rounds to play and earn your cheese. Have fun chilli-n with your friends and don't stress you'll have plenty of time to ketchup on points, and we hope this game doesn't leave you feeling Sauer(kraut)!

Turn for the wurst uses a tongue in cheek art style to flavor this rummy style recipe completion card game. Players begin the game with seven condiment cards and three recipe (goal) cards. On their turn players may do one of the following...
1. Draw two cards off the deck then discard one condiment card.
2. Dig a card from the discard pile, keeping every card on top of it, then discard a condiment card.
3. Draw two recipe cards keeping one and placing one in the community recipe pile.
4. Claim a recipe card from the community pile.

Players may complete a recipe card from their hand or play a set (3 of a kind) of condiment cards at anytime to score points.

A round ends when one player has finished at least three recipe cards and discarded their last card OR "Knockwursts", similar to knocking in gin.

When a round ends all players tally up their score from that round. A full game is played until a player has reached 100 total points.

-description from designer

name: Battlecrest: Expansion Collection #2
description:
How about some more heroes? With more heroes you can get a lot of variety out of your games. You can also play them in solo (either as or against them) and even play 3-4P team games.

Includes:

Korvu Hero set and AI sheet (for solo play).
Pavl Hero set and AI sheet (for solo play).
Hype Hero set and AI sheet (for solo play).



What is the mark of a true champion? Legendary heroes clash across the Neververse to find out.

Battlecrest is a card-based tactical skirmish game for 2 players (1-4 with expansions). With perfect information, players must truly outwit their opponent to win.

Characters are composed of 6-card sets featuring a hero card, a health tracker, and action cards. Occasionally a minion or item will replace an action card.

The map is built of 6 cards as well, with the cards randomly placed in a set pattern.

Players take turns maneuvering their characters around the dynamic, and often dangerous map while unleashing powerful attacks. As action cards are used they open up new possibilities and empower the character’s battlecrests. Build up to decisive strikes or refocus to get powers back. Every character has a unique set of actions and preferred tactics, so no two battles play the same.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Vedur
description:
Vedur is an action selection deck-builder game for 2 – 4 players, ages 12 years and older. There are two versions of the game, the Basic game and the Advanced game. The playing time is about 10 minutes per player in the basic game, 20 minutes per player in the advanced game.

In Vedur, players take on the role of one of the 4 village Seers, each having their own way to foresee and accumulate their visions of the future in order to reveal their weather prophecies.

They visit their village townsfolk to search for omens that they can then use to predict the weather in the most powerful and reliable way through ancient omen-lore, rituals and spirit-talking. They can even open up a portal to their preferred spirit realm, seeking aid directly from the elemental spirits.

When the King is content, he will call the most accurate Seer to the court to become his new High-seer.

May the most resourceful Seer prevail!

A part of Gamia games Nordic Herritage collection, along with Runir and Sagnir (previously known as Mythical Island).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Turn Order: Pass Order, Worker Placement

name: King of the Road
description:
On the streets of King of the Road, only the law of the strongest is in force. Engines roar, weapons quiver. Who will be the first to cross the finish line?
The aim of the game is to complete an agreed number of laps of the course before the others (recommended minimum: 3 laps)

—description from the publisher (translated)

Sulle strade di King of the Road vige solo la legge del più forte. I motori rombano, le armi fremono. Chi sarà il prim oa tagliare il traguardo?
Scopo del gioco è concludere prima degli altri un numero concordato di giri del percorso (minimo consigliato: 3 giri)

—description from the publisher

name: Torres Family
description:
Torres Family features two ways to play, with the first being similar to the 2000 Spiel des Jahres winner Torres, but with simplified rules. In this scenario, "Who will be the new king?", players trying to impress the king by building tall towers and being in as many castles as possible.

In the second scenario, "Impress the King's Envoys!", players seek to be close to the King's Envoys in order to present their buildings. If you build for an envoy, you get double the number of points, but this isn't easy. When building you have to pay attention to the color of the fields as not every tower may be built on every field.

name: Lotta contro i Filistei
description:
Not a game for shy people!

The game's goal is to combine Question and Answers cards in the most nonsense way possible.
The game duration can be designed individually, but the best is to play until you get thrown out of the pub.

The moderator reads the drawn card aloud.
Then each player chooses one or more cards amongst his deck to fill the empty spaces in the Sentence card, to create the most exilarating result.
The moderator then closes his eyes, the payers place their cards on the table facedown, in reading order (the number of cards must be equal to the number of empty spaces on the Sentence card).

At this point, each player draw a number of cards until they have 8 again.
The Moderator role goes to the next clockwise player and a new turn begins!

Once every player has places his cards, the Moderator reads all the resulting sentences and chooses the one he thinks is mor fun.
The owner of the winning cards receives the Sentence card played as prize, and will keep it on the table in front of himself, face up.

In the box you will find the game rules, 100 green Sentence Cards and 300 white tremendous white Answer Cards.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Un gioco da tavolo per persone senza vergogna!

Lo scopo del gioco è combinare nel modo più assurdo possibile carte Frase con carte Risposta.
La durata del gioco può essere progettata individualmente, ma è meglio giocare fino a quando non si viene gettati fuori dal bar.

Il moderatore del gioco legge la carta pescata ad alta voce.
A questo punto ogni altro giocatore sceglie la o le carte in suo possesso che, sostituite agli spazi vuoti nella carta Frase, hanno il risultato più esilarante.
Il moderatore chiude quindi gli occhi e i giocatori posizionano le carte al centro del tavolo, coperte, mantenendo l'ordine di lettura.
Il numero di carte selezionate deve corrispondere al numero di spazi vuoti sulla carta Frase in gioco.

In seguito, tutti i giocatori pescano il numero di carte Risposta necessario per tornare ad averne 8. Il ruolo di moderatore passa al giocatore successivo in senso orario e un nuovo, irriverente turno avrà inizio!

Una volta che ogni giocatore ha posizionato le proprie carte, il moderatore legge tutte le combinazioni ottenute e sceglie quella che più lo ha divertito.
Il proprietario delle carte vincenti riceve quindi come trofeo la carta Frase giocata che terrà davanti a sé, scoperta.

All'interno troverete le Regole del Gioco, 100 carte Frase verdi e 300 perfide carte Risposta bianche.

—description from the publisher

name: Von Manstein's Last Stand
description: Von Manstein’s Last Stand: Russia 1943-44, What If? (VMLS) is an low-complexity, two-player war game simulating the events that could have unfolded during the year following a major switch in east front strategy by Hitler made just prior to the launch of the Kursk offensive. That is, he cancels that ill-fated attack and instead transfers approximately two armies from the east to the west, there to use them against the Anglo-Allies, while leaving von Manstein in charge in Russia. Von Manstein rationalizes the situation by pulling back to the narrowest front possible, the Riga-Odessa line, and there prepares to make a final stand against the Red Army. A complete game generally takes three to four hours to complete, and it is suitable for solitaire play.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Zone of Control

name: Hinadan
description:
We will select members from within the idol group and organize a unit team.
Let's line up the members well so that you can create more areas of expertise than the other team in each genre!
At the end of the game, teams compete for each genre icon and the team with the most points wins. You also score from sun symbols visible by your team's formation.
The player who builds the best team and collects the most ♥ points wins the game.

name: My Shelfie: Bonus Goals
description:
Includes:
3 New common goal cards
3 new personal goal cards

These cards are mixed with other cards and add more variety to the game with new objectives both private and public

name: Rock Band
description:
The “Seagull Rocker” festival is just around the corner! As a lone guitarist, you must try to be the quickest to convince the best musicians to join your band! Here’s a hint: they love food!

In this cards game, should you collect or spend fish? These are the kinds of decisions you need to make to be the first to form your band of 4 musicians, with 1 drummer, 1 bassist, 1 singer and 1 keyboard player.

—description from the publisher

name: Ratoro
description:
Support shops and facilities to develop your village! A mid-level board game from the Worker Placement x Set Collection!

This is the La Toro region where two tribes live, the Uka and the Suma.
As a member of the Uka tribe, you will do your best to develop the village.
Collect resources well and support shops and facilities to contribute to the development of the village and become the best clan.

A board game of worker placement x set collection by Sui Works x Kame's tag team!
In a short time of 4 rounds, you can enjoy a dense interaction with the advanced elements of worker placement!
The essence of Fuki, who has created rich games, can be felt throughout the game!
mechanics: Contracts, Set Collection, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Vs. System 2PCG: AEW
description:
Vs. System 2PCG: AEW is a standalone game that can also be combined with other titles in the Vs. System 2PCG game system. In the game, each player chooses a main character, builds a deck with exactly sixty cards, and attempts to stun the other player's main character.

Vs. System 2PCG: AEW' features 12 new Main Characters and 28 new Supporting Characters, such as Sting and Darby Allin. Will you claim victory with the charismatic mastermind Chris Jericho, the unparalleled force of Kris Statlander, and battle-tested Jon Moxley on team Babyface? Or will you be unstoppable with the fearless and the relentless Dr. Britt Baker D.M.D. and the dominant powerhouse Jade Cargill on team Heel?

name: Cartaventura: Lewis & Clark Mini ScÃ©nario
description:
1804: Louisiana. Can you find a waterway to the Pacific?

"Lewis & Clark" is a free mini-scenario to discover the Cartaventura game!

Cartaventura is a collection of immersive historical adventures in pocket size. Use cards that offer different options, travel, explore, and meet the right people to provide the best possible ending for the hero you play.

Each scenario takes place in a different place and time in history.

—description from the publisher

1804: Louisiane. Parviendrez-vous à trouver une voie fluviale jusqu'au Pacifique.

"Lewis & Clark" est un mini scénario offert pour découvrir le jeu Cartaventura !

Cartaventura est une collection d'aventures historiques immersives au format poche. À l'aide de cartes qui proposent différentes options, voyagez, explorez et faites les bonnes rencontres afin d’offrir la meilleure fin possible au héros que vous incarnez.

Chaque scénario se déroule dans un lieu et une époques différents de l'histoire.

—description from the publisher (French)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: BarRoom Brawl: The Festive Advent Calendar Game!
description:
Behind each of the 24 doors you’ll find a daily surprise, which builds all you need to play the fun festive game of tavern mayhem – Bar Room Brawl.

Get the food and drink back to your friends, avoiding spillages. Avoid the bouncer and don’t go shoving the other guests! The first ‘party’ to fill their table wins the game. Outdo the other players to be named pub champion!

This is a one-print game, containing everything you need to play:

6 limited edition, festive-themed, highly detailed Mantic resin miniatures – 4 players, the barkeep & his bouncer!
All the TerrainCrate furniture you need to build your Tavern & a unique, holiday themed game board.
The game tokens & dice needed to play `BarRoom Brawl’.
Complete game rules – these are in the box, not behind a door – but no peeking until the 24th or you’ll ruin all your surprises!

name: The Flames of Fafnir
description:
Heroes, the mighty and cunning dragon Fafnir — once a mighty nobleman, now transformed into a beast by a cursed treasure — is trying to burn our village to the ground from afar by launching fireballs from his lair in the mountains. You must answer the call and travel with the champion Sigurd through Heathland both to build defenses to protect the village and to collect runes needed to defeat the beast. Fafnir will fall to either Sigurd's sword or one of the heroes' strikes...or will he? While most heroes quest for glory in The Flames of Fafnir to receive the town's honor, one might seek victory through more nefarious means by joining Fafnir in his destruction of the village!

The fireballs launched from Fafnir's mouth toward the town are represented by marbles that will collide with anything in their path, damaging heroes and destroying defenses. Each round, Fafnir acts by changing his angle of attack, spawning monsters, or building up his fiery breath. Eventually, he will release all his charged fireballs towards the town — and if all the town's walls are destroyed, everyone loses.

While walking the Heathland, you'll encounter mythological creatures and monsters; slaying them will aid you in your quest as snow trolls, giant spiders, and selkies guard magical sites where ancient runes can be found. Claim these runes and bring them to bear on Fafnir to kill the dragon. You can gather wood, stone, and gold to construct defenses to protect the town. Barricades, watch towers, and trenches will reduce the carnage, and if your structures intercept the fireballs, you'll be rewarded, so plan your defense well. Praying to Gods and raising defenses will reward you with powerful artifacts that allow you to improve your movement, gain more glory, weaken the dreaded Fafnir, and more.

If an opportunistic hero chooses to join Fafnir, they get to ride the dragon, turning on the other heroes thanks to rider cards while trying to destroy the town in an attempt to take victory for their self!
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Physical Removal, Traitor Game

name: Stay Low
description:
Stay Low is the perfect card game for anyone who loves a good challenge. The objective of the game is to avoid accumulating points by discarding cards from your tableau of 4x3 cards (ten of which are face down at the start of the round).

Each card is numbered from -2 to 12, and on your turn you can do one of two things: take the top card from the discard pile, exchanging it face up with a card from your display, OR take the top card from the face down draw pile. If you do the latter, you can either exchange the card face up with one card from your display, or you can discard it and turn over one of your hidden cards.

The round ends when one player has revealed all their cards, at which point all other players turn over their remaining cards. All the numbers on the cards are added up for scoring. If the player who triggered the end of the round does not have the fewest points, then they must double their score. The game ends after one player has 100 or more points. Whoever has the lowest score wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Chess-Ã -TÃªte
description:
Chess-à-Tête is a strategic Card-Based Twist on a Classic Game!
â
Experience chess like never before. Prepare to engage in a battle of wits, strategy, and cunning tactics with Chess-à-tête is a game that combines the timeless appeal of chess with the excitement of card-based gameplay.
In Chess-à-tête, you'll not only be strategising but also manipulating the game with action cards and unique abilities, ensuring that every match is a thrilling and unpredictable experience.

The aim of the game is to dwindle down your opponents defences, strategise your moves and plan your attacks wisely. Chess-à-tête is completely independent and does not require a chess board. '

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Memory, Move Through Deck

name: Jurassic Roll
description:
Scientists do not all agree on the chronology of the events ... the volcano then the meteorites or the reverse. However, one thing is certain, the dinosaurs have indeed disappeared!

Certain ? Not quite ... You have just been sent a few hours before their disappearance. Your mission ? Save the best specimens in order to bring the dinosaurs back to life and link your destiny to that of the glorious Tyrannosaurs ... or fail and join that of the Erliansorus ... Which one ?!

Will you be up to the event?

Jurassic Roll is a fast roll & write game with a little part of betting and a lot of combos. It was created for the 9th BGG Roll & Write Contest. It won 4 prizes.

—description from the designer''

name: Kopis
description:
Kopis is an abstract, two-player game with an approximate duration of 15 minutes.

In Kopis you have to defend your strongholds, whilst pushing back the incursions from enemy factions. You find yourselves in a battle to secure your strongholds and surrounding settlements and thus provide safe havens to grow and thrive. The Factions have to avoid being too close from enemy strongholds that cause danger and death to those around them, while they will have to develop their own ones, to ensure prosperous and flourishing territories.

—description from the publisher

name: Knights of Crylail
description:
A dark wizard has summoned three mighty Drak-Borgs, equipped them with stones of power and sent them to their death in the Void. When each Drak-Borg meets this fiery doom, the wizard and his legions increase in power. The hope of the Free Lands of Crylail depends on the brave knights and their fellow fighters sent to slay the Drak Borgs in the Lanten fields at the edge of the world.

Knights of Crylail is a dexterity game for 2 or 4 players. Simple rules that will have you playing in minutes on any flat surface. Surprising options and depth of strategy. Plays anywhere - you set the victory conditions.

In Knight's of Crylail you must attempt to flick your pieces closest to the common enemy and try to score the most points in order to prevail!

name: Iron Dragon: Extensions
description:
This is an expansion for Iron Dragon by Mayfair. Tom Wham has said that it may be included (as Optional Rules) in the next printing of Iron Dragon. This adds combat to the game. You have mercenary and ship points that are worth combat points. To win the battle, you need to score higher using your combat points (your train and foreman may have a combat value) and rolling percentile dice than the foe does using the same items. It definitely adds a new dimension to the game. It was released at Origins 2004.



2007 UpdateTom Wham sells the 2007 version directly from his web site. As of summer 2007 he was selling version 34. According to the introduction, the rules were edited out of the original version by Darwin Bromley, who wanted the game family friendly. The cards are printed on Avery business card paper, neat.

Components:

36 New Loco Cards
20 New Ship Cards
20 Mercenary Cards
1 Random Events Chart
Players must provide their own 2 d10's, 1 black and 1 red are recommended


Expands:

Iron Dragon
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Dumpster Diver
description:
Dumpster Diver is a game of glorious trash digging, and turning that trash into treasure. This fast and easy card game is for 2-4 players and can be played in about 20 minutes.

Players search, buy, sell, draw, and dive to create hands. The goal is to have the most victory points at the end of the game. VPs are earned during each game round by playing rooms and assortments.

With colorful art and easy game play, Dumpster Diver is fun for the whole family.

name: Cast & Capture
description:
Cast & Capture is a unique and innovative take on classic fishing card games (ex. Casino).

In Cast & Capture, you are a mage specializing in the collection of wondrous creatures for the Arcane Academy. You must use your knowledge of the elements and arcane powers to capture a variety of mystical and magical creatures before your fellow mages. It is only by using your wits to blend the right spells and group the right creatures that you can earn the title of Master Capturer.

There are 2 decks in the game: a Creature deck and a Spell Deck. Each creature and Spell have a Power and Element tied to them. To begin, mages are given 4 Spells at random from the Spell deck and 4 creatures are placed on the field. Each turn a new creature will come onto the field and the mage whose turn it is will use their Spells to attempt to capture any number of creatures on the field that match the Power and Element of the Spell they cast. If they cannot capture a creature, then their spell is added to the Spell Pool to be used by any mage. Mages refresh their hand of Spells when they run out.

Using the Spell Blending and Creature Grouping mechanics, mages will use light strategy and symbol recognition to blend spells to create new ones and even group creatures together to make bizarre and whimsical combinations. By mastering Blending/Grouping, it helps the mage to ensure that the right spell is always at hand and maximum number of creatures are captured per spell.

With beautiful, hand-drawn illustrations and a unique split-card, dual-deck design; Cast and Capture updates an old gaming favorite for a new generation of players both young and old.

name: Calculus
description:
Calculus is a strategic connection game between black and white. Players alternate pushing stones of their colour onto the board. There is no grid - stones may be pushed to anywhere on the board. When touching stones enclose an area the majority of stones on the perimeter of that area decide who controls the area. It is illegal to create an area which has the same number of black and white stones on its perimeter. Stones that are part of the perimeter of an area are immobilized, but the rest may be pushed again instead of introducing a new stone. The winning player is one who connects their edges of the board.

There is no standard shape of board and no standard stone. You can use a tree stump and real stones if you wish. I prefer to use circular stones.

Calculus may be reproduced for non-commercial purposes.

Power Point files with the rules and a sample game are posted in the files section of this page. (An additional rule up for discussion is posted in the forum: "Arguements about touching".)

name: Capt'n Sharky: Abenteuer auf der Schatzinsel
description:
Capt´n Sharky looks with his crew on a treasure island for jewels. The players must find very quickly articles on the board. Whoever is speedy can pick up a treasure: if you find a pirate, you go home without anything? But if you find jewels, you get to keep them. But you must keep them by using a catapult?!

The game uses a small "centrifuge", some kind of magnet, and a 3-D pirate ship. It's a mix of memory, dexterity & quick reaction time for the whole family.

--paraphrased from a babel-lation of the Spiel des Jahres nomination entry...
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Memory, Nautical, Pirates

name: Posse: Wild West Justice
description:
Posse: Wild West Justice is a wild west themed card and dice game for 2 to 4 players.

Players are lawmen tasked with capturing the outlaws terrorizing the local population. Players will recruit posse members to help bring the lowdown lawbreakers in for some wild west justice. The player that collects the most reward money wins the game.

name: Science Ninjas: Valence Plus
description:
Valence Plus is a fun card game that uses simple math, colors, and cartoon ninjas to teach kids (8+) chemistry! Players combine more than 12 different elements to interact with each other and win the game! Valence Plus expands on the elements and chemical reactions players can make from the original Valence game.

Players draw Element cards from the deck in order to form Molecules. Each Element has a different Valence number that describes how many electrons it has to give (positive) or how many electrons it needs (negative) to have a full valence shell. If the Valence numbers add up to zero, they form a Molecule!

Each Molecule is worth a certain point value. If your molecules add up to 16 points then you win the game! But beware… several molecules are vulnerable to attack from your opponents! Acids attack Bases (4 points) and turn them into Salt and Water (1 point each). Deadly Carbonyls (which have the special power of removing oxygen from the board) are vulnerable to attack by Water. Players interact with each other using real chemical reactions!
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Educational, Expansion for Base-game

name: Shanghaien: Extrakarte 3
description:
This is a small expansion for the base-game Shanghaien.
It is a special reroll card triggered by doubles.

You can download the cards here:

http://www.michaelschacht.net/p/shangXPUS3.pdf (english, letter)
http://www.michaelschacht.net/p/shangXP3.pdf (german, DINA4)

Expands:

Shanghaien

name: The Little Flower Shop: Flower-Filler Promo Pack
description: The Flower-Filler Promo Pack has 8 cards: 4 flower bonus cards, 3 filler bonus cards, plus 1 instruction card. At the game's start, a bonus card of each type is flipped showing the popular flower and filler for the game. Players score bonus flower power for displaying the popular flowers and fillers in their windows.

name: éé­äºº (Shumijin)
description:
éé­äºº is a game about making SAKE (Japanese Rice Wine.)
The player becomes the owner of SAKE brewery and decides which process to focus on SAKE made by himself.
All the attention boards dealt to players are the same. Every round player should bidding for the sequence to get the materiel. For that reason, it is important what kind of criteria you will score on sake made by yourself.

Because the evaluation point of sake is not equal to the victory point, you can scoop up your feet if you are too busy drinking!
No knowledge of sake is necessary, bow hits competing with each other!
publishers: Super Number One Games (ã¹ã¼ãã¼ ãã³ãã¼ã¯ã³ ã²ã¼ã ãº)

name: Si Guo Da Zhan
description:
Si Guo Da Zhan or The Great Battle of Four Countries is a four-player version of Jun Qi (Army Chess) (otherwise known as Lu Zhan Jun Qi or Land Battle Chess). This stratego-like game is played in partnership, 2 players against the other pair. Like Army Chess, the objective is to capture the opposing army’s flags with one’s soldiers. Each player’s army is composed of the same pieces as in Army Chess. Capturing is of a lower ranked piece by a higher ranked one. There are grenades (exploding and destroying everything) and land mines (exploding and destroying everything, but itself destroyed by engineer soldiers). Pieces in camps may not be captured. Pieces on railway tracks move further than the usual one step; engineer soldiers may move as far as they wish on railway tracks.

Hidden Movement / Fog Of War (limited intelligence) Rules
A fifth person acts as a referee who judges outcomes of battles and so limits the information to the other players.

Without a referee the two players involved in each taking move reveal their piece to the other (Normally the attacker reveals his piece and the defender says whether it is a win, lose or draw.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game

name: The Great Battles of Epaminondas
description:
An expansion module for The Great Battles of Alexander the module focuses on key battles for the Thebian general Epaninondas.

Since these battles are not very balanced solitaire play is suggested, and each battle will usually be over in 2 turns.

Leuctra, 371 B.C.
Mantinea, 362 B.C.

In order to play this module both The Great Battles of Alexander: Deluxe Edition and Diadochoi: Great Battles of Alexander Module are required.

This module appears in C3i Magazine Nr7 (RBM Publication).

name: Motto Tanto Cuore
description:
Roughly translated box back

"More Tanto Cuore" is a new series in the Tanto Cuore line. "Tanto Cuore" is a deck building game in which players are masters of a house, and use their small deck of "love" cards to employ cute maids, and gradually expanding their decks. "More Tanto Cuore" enhances this with a "worker placement" mechanism. Each round, players choose one each of the available high class maids to get help from. High class maids' assistance is needed to be able to help out with Food, Decorations or Cleaning errands.
Once the game ends, players account their Food, Decoration and Cleaning cards. Certain maids are also worth victory points by themselves. The player with the most Victory points has contributed best to the upcoming party, and is declared to be the Most Delightful Master.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Worker Placement
publishers: Arclight Games, Japanime Games, Japon Brand

name: Boss Monster: Klonos Promo Card
description:
Klonos (Alien Metamorph) was handed out to visitors of Brotherwise Games booth in GenCon 2016.

The Alien Metamorph can be chosen in Boss Monster or Boss Monster 2.

On leveling up: Choose another Boss. For the rest of the game, this Boss also has that Boss's Level Up ability.

This card is also included in Boss Monster: Crash Landing
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: National Economy Glory
description:
National Economy Glory is the second independent additional set of macro economy game National economy. You can play alone as opposed to the expanded version. The entire building card has been renewed and it has become a completely new playing environment.

The diversity of the strategy has been greatly increased by the new element "machine doll" and the sleeping "remains" of super technology.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Dream Diary
description:
A bizarre light brings your party to a parallel universe. You’ve all been turned into the form of special spirits! Now, your party must jump to the correct locations in this uncanny city in order to return home. Each member’s dreams will guide you to escape this world, but nightmares will try to trap you on this journey. It is not easy to communicate here because you can only send out “adjectives” and your team mates will signal back with hand gestures only. Can you find the way to get out of this universe before it is too late?

A co-op where players work together to eliminate nightmares by asking yes or no questions and try to guess all the dreams to win the game. Lose or win as a team. All the illustrations are of different areas of Ho Chi Minh City through a lens of dreams.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Questions and Answers
publishers: Capital Gains Studio, NgÅ© HÃ nh Games

name: Ninja: The card game of sneak attacks and captures
description:
Description from the publisher:

Ninja is fast paced, fun, and engaging. 2-5 players compete simultaneously to be the top ninja. Choose up to 3 cards from your hand and attack the central Castle. If you have the highest attack, you capture the Castle. Look out for the Castle Guard who blocks attacks. Use the Black Ninja to double your attack. Be the first ninja to 11 Castle points and win!

name: AIRFLIP
description:
AIRFLIP is a flip/roll&write game set in an airport.
Players are in charge of boarding their planes the best possible way while facing picky passengers.

Shuffle the passenger cards and make three piles, flip the first card on their call number side of each pile below them.
Each passenger has a passport value (victory points) and will be able to board your plane if you meet their requirements (some want to seat in the front of the plane, some want to be near an exit, etc...).
Roll your dice and use them to board the passengers you want depending on their call number value (your dice must match or exceed this value).
Plan carefully the boarding of your plan, win bonuses and be the first to board your plane entirely with the most valuable passengers to win the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Mini Garden
description:
Master Scabbers is ready to test the ability of his gardening apprentices to create bright and colorful mini-gardens as quickly as possible to satisfy customers' requests. As an apprentice, try your best to win the title of master gardener from this test!

On a turn in Mini Garden, a.k.a. è¿·ä½ è±å, start by rolling the five dice and placing them on the corresponding flower cards. The number on the die and the corresponding flower cards identify the needs of the customer. After this, each player races to place their six garden cards together — flipping, rotating, and covering them as needed — to match the customer's wishes. Whoever does so first stops play so that others can verify whether the garden is correct; if so, the player scores a point.

After nine rounds, the game ends, and whoever has scored the most points wins!

name: Edgehill: Dawning of the Revolution
description:
This is an easy, introductory game on the first battle of the English Civil War, based on a system derived from the old SPI Thirty Years War system, modified with the introduction of a chit drawing leader activation procedure that makes the game different each time you play it and perfect for solitaire play. Easy to understand and fast playable (less than an hour), and full-color map (with the position of the different units printed on the map for an immediate set-up).

DTP Game.
Zip file contains:

11 x 17" full color map (2 - 8.5 x 11" parts)
113 full color counters.
Rules in English and Italian


This FREE Print-n-Play game is available at WargameDownloads.com
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=552
categories: Civil War, Pike and Shot, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Ð¡ÐµÐ»ÑÐ´ÐºÐ°: Ð¡ÐµÐ²ÐµÑÐ½ÑÐµ Ð¼Ð¾ÑÑ (Herring: Northern Seas)
description:
In this game players create marine ecosystem by playing cards with different animals. Each animal need to be feeded. Small fish eat plankton (it means that player takes new cards in his hand), big animals eat small animals.

Players get points for plaing cards with big animals and for adding on table new animal species. But beware the destruction level! Black marker indicate how points of destruction you are. Cards of destruction and disappearance of animal species from the table move this marker forward. On the end of game it's possible to win only if marker of winner overtook destruction marker on point sheet.

The game ending in two cases:


Active player don't have cards on hand in the beginning of his turn.
Active player have 25 or more points in the beginning of his turn.

name: L.A. Lawless
description:
A game depicting the Los Angeles Riots of April 1992. The units represents groups of varying sizes (up to several thousand people) and each turn equals a half a day. Published in Moves magazine issue 75.

The purpose of the game is to give players a chance to use different game strategies to simulate the confrontation between police and rioters. There are two players in the game: Authority (representing the city government, law enforcement agencies, and the general forces of law and order); and the Rioters (representing the people conducting the disturbances.)
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Operation 'GREIF'
description:
This is actually a 'Variant' for use with the 1965 Version of Avalon Hill's The Battle of the Bulge game. You will have to have the game in order to play this.

The 'Variant' components consist of the following: a RULES set of 6-pages plus an 'Errata' sheet; 3-COLOR-Charts; a set of 'counters' which must be cut-apart and glued to 1/2" square pieces prior to play.

Within the Rules are detailed additions to the 'Tournament' game of 'Bulge-65' with amendments to any of those explained further. Some of these are: Amendment to Zone of Controls-for Combat, Support, & 'Pure'-Armor units; Road Movement-for 'Leg', Motorized, & 'Tracked' units; TAC(Ground Support)-for the Germans; Para-drops-(for the 'von der Heydte' unit); Operation 'GREIF'(the 150th-Pz.Brig.) & the 'Einheit Steilau' Squads; and an Amendment to the Tournament Victory Conditions.

The Charts included are: one WHITE-with the British Order of Appearance, the Play by Mail Para-drop Results Table(10-Results), the Face to Face Para-drop Results Table(6-Results), with explanations for both; one GREEN-with the German Order of Appearance & Reinforcements; one TAN-with the American Order of Appearance & Reinforcements.

The game counters are of the following COLOR types: German~'Wehrmacht'-GRAY, Parachute~BLUE, Waffen 'SS'~BLACK, 150th Pz.Brig.& 'E.S.'~1/2-GRAY & TAN; British~RED; & Americans~TAN. The 'NEW' units include: 'Mixed'-Armor; 'Mixed'-Assault Guns; Headquarters; Artillery; Armored-Artillery; Nebelwerfer; Engineers; 'Jagdpanzer'; Tank-Destroyers; Assault Guns; Armored 'Cavalry'; and the 'Special' 150th Pz.Brig. & 'E.S.' Squads.

This is an entire 'revamping' of the game and just the 'Fortresses', 'Fortifications(Entrenchments)', & 'Direction' markers are used from the original game. Some of the new concepts involved are the Support Units(HQ & Artillery-ALL kinds), Road movement & Zones of Control for 'Motorized', 'Leg', & 'Armored'('Pure'-Armor & Support Units have NO-Z.O.C.!) units, plus the addition of the British Forces, & the 'Special' German units included.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Perry Rhodan Sammelkartenspiel
description:
This German Trading Card Game is based on the weekly science fiction series Perry Rhodan. You you can play over the story from about the first 100 novellas issued. The game is broken up in different phases which you can play separately or one after another for a very long game. The phases with different backsides are:

Phase I: Die Dritte Macht (The Third Power, 1996)
Phase II/III: Topsider & Springer (1996)
Phase IV: Vorstoß nach Arkon (Approach to Arkon, 1997)
Phase V: Atlan & Arkon (2003)

Fanpro canceled the game in 1998. Finally Between The Stars (a company founded by fans of the game) took over and released phase V in 2003.

The player with the most victory points wins this complex game. You get victory points for completing phases and for completing side plots. Only after a phase is completed the players can draw cards from the next phase (you need separate decks for each phase you will play).

The cards show different planets, star systems, mutants with psi-talents, other persons, troops, spaceships, fleets, accessories, event cards and galactic riddles. There is also an action card deck to randomize the fights someway.

Every card can be "Pro", "Anti", or both ("Dual"). In a game you have to play two sides at the same time, the pro-side (the good guys) and the anti-side (the bad boys). After you have built up your fleets and armies (you normally hide them below other cards) you fight space fights and invasions on enemy planets: With your anti-side you attack the pro-sides of your opponents, and with your pro-side you damage their anti-sides.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Novel-based, Science Fiction

name: ÐÐ¾ÑÐ¾Ð´Ð¸Ð½ÑÐºÐ¾Ðµ ÑÑÐ°Ð¶ÐµÐ½Ð¸Ðµ 1812
description:
Another game from Status Belli in series about key battles in Russian history. New wargame from Status Belli covers the key battle of Napoleon's Russian campaign. French player have to break through Russian lines and try to achieve decisive victory on Russians. Russian player have to defend his fortified positions and keep his army strong enough for further battles.

Game scale.
1 hex is 1 km.
1 turn is 2 hours.
The counters represent division or brigade level unit.

name: Kings Plate: Card Game â Series I
description:
In Kings Plate, based on the traditional Japanese chess game Shogi, the player's goal is to checkmate the opponent's king.

To do this, you must use the various units in your army, with each unit having different abilities in terms of movement and special actions. Players can create their own armies from the cards included in the game, thus forcing them (and their opponents) to rethink their strategy each game.

Kings Plate: Card Game - Series I includes a king for each player and a variety of army units. These cards include suits and ranks as in a regular deck of cards, and they can be mixed with the other series in the Kings Plate family.

name: Au Nom d'Allah: l'expansion musulmane (632-732)
description: Solitaire wargame. Depicts the Muslim conquest of Europe in the Middle Ages.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Kaiju
description:
After a nuclear disaster, the contaminated water has created these deadly monsters in the sea. They then sought land where the human civilization was nearly decimated. They then turned on each other in a monster war like no other. Only the fastest and strongest shall win!

Kaiju is a fun party game in which players are the monsters in battle, and they roll a die and have to perform the action as quickly as possible. The slowest person gets a wound which is drawn on by the crayon marker, and the one who gets six wounds is out. The box is also part of the components and is used during the game.

Kaiju comes with two sets of rules, one for the main game and another for a mini game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Super Fantasy Rumble
description:
Super Fantasy Rumble is a tactical skirmish card game with a puzzle-like Battle mechanic. Your goal is to lead your randomly drawn Rumble Fighters to eliminate all your Opponent's Rumble Fighters. The Rumble Fighters and art style is inspired by 80s Saturday Morning Cartoons and video games that we all love.

Players receives six Rumble Fighters - two powerful leaders and four warriors via draft or random draw. Each Rumble Fighter has a health value, an attack value, a defense value, special abilities, and varied Action Points that indicate which directions they can attack and defend.

Each Player places six Rumble Fighters onto a four-by-four grid and then uses your turns doing movements and attacks. Each turn, you have three movements to move your Rumble Fighters into the best position to attack: Dash, Castle, and Slide. When you Dash, you move a single character to an adjacent space. When you Castle, you can exchange two of your adjacent fighters. When you slide, you can move an entire row or column of fighter in either direction.

Positioning is the main component of the game. How can I position my Rumble Fighters in the best possible way to eliminate all my Opponent's fighter and win the game?
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Thwarted! A Game of Super-Villainy
description:
Thwarted! A Game of Super-Villainy is a casual card game where players assume the roles of villains and attempt to defeat the superheroes of The City. The only thing standing in each villain's way, are the other villains.

Villains have access to action cards that allow them to steal cards, force discards, counter other villain attacks, and so on. If only the villains worked together, they could easily defeat the arrogant superheroes, but they are too concerned with getting all the credit to work together.

The heroes are represented in the form of cards that are played out of a separate Hero Deck. Each hero has an attack value, that also doubles as their point value at the end of the game. The heroes also have their own superpower that trigger when they are defeated. Some of these superpowers will help the attacking villain, others will hurt the attacking villains, and some will hurt every villain!

The game is over when either of the decks run out of cards. Once the game is over, each player's Victory Points are totaled and one villains is declared as "The Greatest Super-Villain of All Time!"
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Icehouse: The Martian Chess Set
description:
This was the first appearance of the transparent plastic pyramids that would become known as Icehouse Pyramids or Looney Pyramids. The clear plastic box contains four stashes (blue, green, yellow, red) and rules for Martian Chess, Zarcana, IceTowers, and IceTraders (an early version of Homeworlds). The three booklets (Ice Towers and Ice Traders share one) all end with suggestions for "other games to try" (referring readers to Looney Lab's website for the actual rules).

Also included are two Zarcana reference cards, an imprint-and-credits card, and a card with "cover art" and (on the reverse) an explanation why this product called Icehouse doesn't come with the rules for playing the game Icehouse.

"Perhaps you're wondering why we call this an Icehouse set, when the rules for the game called Icehouse aren't included with the pieces. The short answer is, it's kind of like duct tape: Few people who use duct tape actually use it on their ducts... yet everyone still calls it duct tape."

The final item in the package is a sticker featuring Tirade the Broccoli, with the peel-off sheet on the reverse advertising other Looney games as well as their Wunderland "webzine".
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Real-time, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Â¡Ataco al DragÃ³n!
description:
This is a deduction microgame with a fantasy theme, in which each card represents a typical RPG class. On a turn, with two cards in hand players draw a thrid card, and play one card, trying to expose others and knock them from the game. After a victory, the winner takes a die, and having two or more mini dices may choose to roll. If he or she gets a result of 10 or more, that players is the winner of the game.



From the publisher: Ataco al dragón es un juego de mesa de cartas y dados de tipo party game, competitivo. Los jugadores toman turnos para competir y ganar mini dados de seis caras. Una vez colecciones más de dos dados puedes decir ¡Ataco al dragón! Y lanzar los dados que hayas ganado, si obtienes una suma de 10 o más eres el ganador del juego.
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Synthesis
description:
It is a game in which you have to get the chemical elements to be the first to complete chemical compounds.

On your work table you will have the different chemical compounds and you will have to get the element cards to synthesize them. The action cards will help you in your mission. Players can negotiate for cards, discard from their hand or synthesize their compounds.

A good hand management and strategy planning will be fundamental to play the cards well and be the fastest. The game ends when the first player succeeds in making all their compounds.

A balanced and effective mechanics of race, hand management and Take That! that will be a familiar challenge. A fun game in which chemistry will make sparks fly.
mechanics: Hand Management, Race, Set Collection, Take That

name: Fog of War
description:
The term "fog of war" describes the uncertainty in situational awareness experienced by participants in military operations. The term seeks to capture the uncertainty regarding one's own capability, adversary capability, and adversary intent during an engagement, operation, or campaign.

Fog of War is a game for 2-4 players in which you must conquer your opponents' HQ, but take care as you advance your battalion because the battlefield is fraught with hidden dangers!

name: Karambolage
description:
This game with a billiards theme is not a dexterity game as you could expect, but it’s an interesting tactical dice game. Object of the game is to reach as many points as possible by moving the 3 billiard balls across the board with the use of 4 6-sided dice.

Moving the balls is quite unusual, since you don’t move the numbers of the dice rolls, but you must land on fields which show the numbers of these rolls! For that reason, each field of the 7 x 11 gameboard shows a number between 0-6, where the zeros are regarded as jokers. There are several bonus points to achieve - most of them when you manage to hit one ball after the other (like in real billiards). To give you enough strategical possibilities, you are free to choose the billiard ball with which you want to start the moves.

Though the number of players is given from 2-6, it works perfectly as solitaire game, where you can think about your next turn as long as you want.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sharks with Lasers
description:
In Sharks with Lasers, you are a special agent trainee trying to pass an extremely dangerous field exam in order to claim your rightful place in the Mysterious Intelligence Agency (MIA). In this field exam, you are dropped into the fearsome depths of cold, dark waters and your goal is to reach a nearby island… alive. To obstruct any special agent trainee foolish enough to try and pass the exam an army of sharks equipped with lasers has been unleashed in the waters. You and your comrades are all in for a hell of a swim, as you dash for the island and your safety. Are you skilful enough to avoid getting blasted or worse, shredded by one of the fishy monstrosities? Fortunately, you brought along something to help you achieve your ridiculous mission: N’s little science project, a shark-with-laser-dazer. N’s device is capable of controlling the utterly dangerous sharks with lasers and it even comes with a built-in laser shield. That N, isn’t such a nerd after all.

Sharks with lasers is a fast paced boardgame, where players secretly play movement cards to move their agent. In addition, they jointly control the sharks, by secretly playing movement cards on the sharks. The game is played in rounds of which each consists of playing cards and subsequently resolving agent and shark movement. The first player who reaches the island alive, passes the special agent field exam, wins the game and becomes part of the special agent elite of the MIA.
categories: Card Game, Miniatures, Racing, Spies/Secret Agents

name: World Map Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

Introduction

Learningames offers a new and exciting way to have fun while learning geography. Through these innovative and easy-to-play games players master important information about the political and physical geography of the world. A valuable experience for young and old, novice or expert. Learningames are unique, informative, and always enjoyable.

Overview of play

Two to six players sit around the Map Playing Board. The map may include political centers and/or geographical areas. In place of the names of the political centers (including cities, states, and nations) and geographical areas (including physical features, regions, and cultural and economic centers) normally found on the map are numbers 1-50.
To begin the game a player draws a Card form the deck. Each card has the name of a political center or geographical area on one side (Side “A” with the blue background) and a number with important information about the named center or area on the other side (Side “B” with the white background).
In the Basic Game players win cards by locating and naming different political centers or a geographical area on the numbered playing board or by correctly challenging incorrect answers. When playing the Advanced Games, players master important information about the political centers and geographical areas identified in the basic games. Players always find Learningames fun, and best of all, they learn about the world around them.

name: Â¡Knock-on-Word!
description:
Players give crossword-style clues for words that can be placed on the board. A four-player partnership game, with two- and three-player variants.

Knock-on-Word! is sort of a redesign of Joli Kansil's own Montage.

name: Follow
description:
A quantum vortex is rearranging reality... history and fantasy are being jumbled together and somebody needs to untangle the mess! You must find the lost people and creatures then get them to follow you back to their homes. Lead enough followers to safety and you might just be able to destroy the vortex and rescue reality!

Follow is a tile/card matching game based on strategy and luck.
Players create a different board each time by joining together the hex-tiles (111mm max. width) as the game progresses. Each hex shows a different location and in each location there is a 'follower' card (45x63mm).

The locations and characters are well known from history or fantasy but are randomly mixed. The objective is to lead these famous faces to their specific places. For example; you could find a bewildered Dracula in the Wild West and lead him through Ancient Egypt and Camelot to reach his Transylvanian home.

The rules provide a choice of actions each turn, such as exploring new locations and stealing followers from other players as well as the opportunity to have several turns in a row, allowing players to plan strategies.

The followers and locations are colour-coded as yellow, green, blue, purple and red. To win the game a player has to return one follower of each colour to the safety of their specific locations. Upon achieving this feat the player must then succeed a dice roll called the 'Gizmotron roll' in order to reset reality and therefore be declared as the winner.

An eight page (A5) 'Instruction Manual' gives rules for 2 to 6 players aged 8 to adult. A standard game comprises 30 'follower' cards, 30 corresponding location hex-tiles, 6 'vortex' hex-tiles and lasts from 20 to 60 mins, depending on the number of players. The game is made quicker and easier by reducing the number of follower cards involved, along with their location hexes.
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Escape Quest: Alone in Salem
description:
Embark on a series of standalone adventures in which YOU will be the main character, during which to move forward you must solve mysterious puzzles to avoid all the traps and obstacles in your way. But beware! Only faultless logic and clever deduction will let you beat all the riddles and advance through the story. Will you be up to the challenge?

Escape Quest is an adventure gamebook series born of a collaboration between Ynnis’ publishing team and Don’t Panic Games’ design team. It is the fruit of all our combined knowledge of game design and book publishing. Much more than just a “gamified book” or a “book-like game”, we put great care in conceiving each of those volumes - collaborating with award-winning game designers, authors and illustrators - to create an immersive, fun experience that is both a great book and a great game.

ALONE IN SALEM

You say witch like it’s a bad thing!

You are on vacation and treating yourself to a famous “Salem Witch Tour” in the village well-known for its witch trials centuries before. But when you decide to leave your group, the visit quickly turns into an occult nightmare! Find your way into the museum and escape the clutches of a mysterious cult. Signs and omens are everywhere, and your doom seems unavoidable. Will you have the wits to survive? Alone in Salem, do you have what it takes to make it through the night?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: Don't Panic Games, Egmont Polska, Hobby World, SD Games, Ullmann Medien GmbH, Ynnis Ãditions

name: 7 Ghosts
description:
Be the first player to capture seven ghosts!

On their turn, a player chooses a top card from one of the 4 main decks that they will attempt to win. These cards may be ghost, zombie, scary pumpkin, or haunted house cards. They then roll the three dice in an effort to satisfy the conditions to win that card. If successful, the player takes it and places it face-up in front of them, drawing any "spooky action" cards as instructed.

They may PLAY any spooky action cards they have before relinquishing their turn to the next player. Spooky action cards may place a deck "off limits", force an opponent to play for a specific card, manipulate dice, split, etc. There are also three "ghost" cards in this deck that count toward your overall ghost total.

Collecting sets of 3 of zombie, pumpkin, or haunted house cards allow special powers that are important later in the game. A special effect of winning a haunted house card is getting to "peek" at the bottom card of the deck it came from, which helps direct a players strategy.

A few of the main deck cards have a "vanish" effect, which can be spent to move a card from the top of a deck to the bottom, thus keeping it away from an opponent. Spending a "vanish" card in this way may break up a valuable set of three, so care must be given before deciding this course of action.

Play continues until one player has acquired seven ghost cards and is declared the winner.

Contents: 60 cards(25 main deck and 35 spooky action), 3 six-sided colored dice, and rules.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That

name: Pentagame
description:
Pentagame is an abstract strategy game without chance element. It is played on a pentagram star that shows 100 round stops. The 5 corners and the 5 crossings in the pentagram are colored (white, blue, red, green, yellow). It can be played with 2, 3 or 4 players. It looks a bit like a pentagonal ludo, but it is truly different. For example, there is no chance and pieces don't get beaten. Instead, it is all about moving, swapping, about paths and about areas.

Every player plays 5 pieces of one shape, e.g. cats against pawns or whatever. Every player has one white, one blue, one red, one green and one yellow piece. All pieces start the race on the corners of their respective colors. The goal is to bring three of one's pieces from their corners to the crossing of matching color.

There are five black blocks that are neutral pieces. At the beginning they are on the crossings in the center. There are five gray blocks that come into the game as pieces reach their goals.

One can move in any direction on the star or the ring, as far as there is a free path. But one cannot jump. One can either (1) just move to an empty space, (2) beat a black block, taking its place and re-position it on another free stop somewhere, (3) swap two neighboring pieces, one of which must be one's own piece.

As Ko-rule, immediate repetition of the same move is not allowed.

A piece that reaches its destination crossing is removed from the board. A player thus moving a piece out successfully gains a gray block that she can position on any free stop. Such gray blocks are also neutral pieces, but when they get beaten, they are removed again rather than re-positioned.

The game becomes very complex very soon. Nevertheless, a two player game takes often under 20 minutes, a 3-player maybe 45 minutes, a 4-player some 90 minutes. That of course depends on how long players think, or are allowed to think.

—description from the designer

name: Â¡No Pasaran!
description:
¡No Pasaran! is a historical recreation of the Spanish Civil War using Europa map 23 contained in the Spain and Portugal Europa series module (1984). It is a two-player game, with one player controlling the forces of the Republic and the other controlling the forces of the rebel Nationalists. Both players attempt to force the other side to the point of collapse by occupying key cities. Special rules have been included to reflect peculiar regional and political problems of Spain in the 1930's. Three scenarios have been included for those not wishing to play the campaign game.

Counters unmounted.
This variant is approved for use with Game Designers' Workshop (GDW) Spain and Portugal module for Europa.

Rules and counters printed in The Grenadier 27, Jan-Feb 1986.

This Europa add-on was subsequently very much revised and expanded by the designers as the full-blown Europa series game For Whom the Bell Tolls in 1995 which covers the Spanish Civil War and possible involvement by Spain and/or Portugal in WWII operations initiated by the Axis or Allies.
categories: Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: UrbÃ¡nie
description:
Let Urbánie introduce you to the history of cities of the European continent. Build your cities and spread their fame together with your family and fiends. Construct new buildings, magnificent monuments of become a leader and push the mankind's progress forward. Exceed your opponents with wealth and glory of your city, as well as the pride of your population.

In Urbánie your score is the lowest of the scored wealth, prestige and satisfaction. Each monument adds a point as well as 2 points for person who ends the game.

Each turn in Urbánie gives you the choice of 3 possible actions:
- Take a building card from 1 of the 4 stacks and add it to your city. You can either build over a existing building or expand your city. In that case you have to pay with wealth.
- You can take the city growth card for 1 point of either wealth, prestige or satisfaction. The next turn you have to take a building card and can expand for free. You then return the city growth card.
- Claim a monument. For this you have to have the right symbols on your buildings.
Once 3 of the 4 stacks of buildings for the current epoch are empty the current player can end the round. Then all buildings are scored for the current epoch. The player ending the round can start the next round. Urbánie is played over 6 epochs.

The buildings have different point values for the different epochs. Where your standard housing from the start gives you 2 points of satisfaction in the first epoch, it's only 1 point in the second epoch. And going negative from epoch 4 onward. Also several buildings interact with each other, giving extra points if the other building is present in your city.

name: Feierabend: 2F-Spiele Digital-Convention
description:
Without a partner, sometimes the only choice for gaming fun is the internet. The 2F-Spiele Digital-Convention is said to be a lot of fun...at least that's what you heard from some blogger.

Feierabend: 2F-Spiele Digitial-Convention is a small map expansion for Feierabend that offers an additional after-work space. If you have no partners on your factory, whether because you've placed them all or have none to begin with, you can place a worker here to gain 4 relaxation.

Since all real-life game conventions in 2020 are cancelled, this promo card will be included as a thank you with each copy bought directly from the BGG Store and 4x-Brettspielmarkt.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Industry / Manufacturing, Political
mechanics: Income, Investment, Multiple Maps, Race, Solo / Solitaire Game, Victory Points as a Resource, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Keep Flyin'
description:
From the rules:
In Keep Flyin, you are the Captain of a Firefly class mid-bulk transport, trying to eke out a living by taking any jobs you can find, legit or not, do them, and get paid. All the while you will be avoiding the oppressive governing body known as the Alliance, the terrifying Reavers who seek to eat you, and various other local color in the ‘Verse. You will find jobs on planets and even in the deepest parts of the Black. So find a job, don’t care much what it is, and keep flyin’.

Players move from planet to planet looking for jobs and searching abandoned ships. Players then move potential enemy ships, (Alliance or Reavers) after opponent's ships. has mechanic for pursuit and battle is dice based. First player to raise enough money to retire wins.

Home Page: http://users.adelphia.net/~wydraz/firefly/keepflyin.html

name: Koboler
description:
Help your devils to walk through your path of fire.
But watch out thievery and water can make it more difficult to reach your goal.

Each die roll gives an other variaty of options, Find de best way to secure three points.

name: Flotte Krabbe
description:
There are 18 crabs on the beach trying to reach the other side of the board (made by a sort of leather). Your 9 crabs must be faster than the opponent's crabs. A crab cam move a space or jump over one or two adjacent crabs. Ending in a column with either one or three opposing crabs entitles you to an extra move.+

This is the game Sniggle from Sly, but only for two players.

name: FÃ©odalitÃ©
description:
Vae Victis no. 69

A combination map and card game which simulates the Capetian kingdoms after the death of Charlemagne (9th and 10th centuries).
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Green Hell: Burma 1942-1945
description:
Green Hell uses the popular Fire & Movement system (DG Folio Series) to examine two different situations in Burma during World War II: Operation Thursday and The Battle of the Admin Box.

Operation Thursday simulates the British gliderborne assault into Burma in March 1944, after Gen. Slim ordered Gen. Wingate to land behind the Japanese lines to support the Allied offensive in Burma, particularly Gen. Stilwell’s advance to the strategic town of Myitkyina.

The Battle of the Admin Box is a simulation of the Japanese infiltration that surrounded the Indian 7th Infantry Division, and was also moving to trap the Indian 5th Infantry Division in order to annihilate both before the arrival of the Indian 26th and British 36th Divisions from the north. Holding up the entire Japanese plan was the headquarters area of the Indian 7th Division, which formed a defensive perimeter known as the “Admin Box” in the village of Sinzweya.

Game Scale:

Game Turn: ? days
Hex: ? mile / ? km
Units: Company to Regiment (mostly Battalion)



Game Inventory:

One full color map
One dual-side printed countersheet (160 1/2" counters)
One rulebook (including Fire & Movement Standard & Burma exclusive rules)


(from the S&T press website)

name: The Kingdom of Ierendi
description:
The Game is a battle system in the Gazeteer N. 04 of D&D World, cover the naval battle (with Hex and counters) in Mystara world.

The system is very simple and it born for recreate the possible war (tactics battle or entire campaigns) between the various kingdoms that make up the world of Mystara.

name: Yavalanchor
description:
Yavalanchor is a Yavalath derivative for 2 players that can be played with the same set of components (hexhex board of size 5 and counters in 3 colours).

RULES

SETUP

Each player has an allocated colour (White and Black). Red counters are neutral and will act as 'anchors'.

HOW TO PLAY

Starting with White players take turns placing either:

a) A red counter in ANY empty cell or...
b) A counter of their colour in an empty cell adjacent to a red counter.

...until the victory condition is reached.

GAME END

The game ends when a 5-in-a-row containing only counters of a player colour AND red is created. The owner of that colour is the winner.

In the rare case of several lines being created, the player that placed the last counter chooses the winning line.

If the board fills up before reaching this victory condition the game ends in a draw.

name: Card Assassins
description:
Card assassins is not your average card game. It is played at all times behind the scenes. It is the perfect game for group trips, competitive roommates, back stabbing co-workers or courageous families.

How the game works

Assassinate assigned players by getting them to say their “kill word” during a normal conversation. Acquire their target and kill word and move on. Last one standing wins! Don't get assassinated!

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Party Game, Real-time, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Tiny Epic Tactics: Dice Tower 2020 Promo Cards
description:
A pack of 4 new characters for Tiny Epic Tactics!

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Builder Pack.

Suz
Serpent Stone: Deal +2 damage if she is in a water space.
Sea Legs: Gain 2 health if she ends her movement in a water space.

Roy
Lumberguard: If he is in a forest space, all allies within 4 take 1 less damage from all attacks.

Vasel
Tom's Blessing: All allies within range gain 1 health.

Zee
Tower Sword: If he is knocked back by a melee attack, the attacker immediately takes 2 damage.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Rugby Addicts Board Game
description:
The Rugby Addicts Board Game by Gren has arrived. A fantastic game from the much loved and world famous Gren. Take a drop kick, Six Nations Teams, scrum down boys win that ball! Designed by the man himself and made entirely in the UK.

Features:

Contains all the facets of the real game - passing, moving with the ball, kicks, tackling, scrums, ricks and lineouts.

A special kicking device called - The Boot - is included for kicking the ball over the posts.

The game includes a DVD tutorial so no need to plough through countless pages of instructions.

All the fun of the real game without the pain!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Mud, Blood and Steel: The Battle of Hoveyzeh, January 1981
description:
Description from the publisher:

Mud, Blood and Steel: The Battle of Hoveyzeh, January 1981. By the end of 1980 Iraq’s invasion of Iran had degenerated into bloody stalemate all along the front. Iran was able to mobilize over two hundred thousand newly recruited citizen-soldiers into their Pasdaran, and both sides rushed additional regular army troops and equipment to the front lines. The Iranian military high command wanted to await the end of the winter rains to launch an offensive in the Spring that would drive the Iraqi’s out of Islamic Republic. However, the Iranian clergy, that headed the government, did not trust the lay and military leaders, many of whom the clergy suspected of harboring pro-Shah or anti-fundamentalist adherents, and ordered a more limited but immediate offensive in early January. Dubbed Operation Nasr (Victory), the offensive at Hoveyzeh sought to break through and drive back the Iraqi units that threatened the crucial city of Ahwaz.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting, Simulation, Victory Points as a Resource, Zone of Control

name: Kaosball: Ringer â Kutulu
description:
Hold on to your sanity! The Old Ones play Kaosball too!

Kutulu has the following ability:
'At the beginning of your turn, each enemy figure in Kutulu's killzone is knocked down unless its owner burns a live energy card.'

Kutulu is a Kickstarter and convention exclusive Ringer.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Mochiju
description:
Show your power as only the mighty can strike! Bring your favorite space monsters along, and fight for the universe!

Mochiju is a quick card game for 3-6 players. Evolving your monsters down the right path or striking your opponents at the right time is the key to victory! Come enjoy the fun of beating your friends!
