mechanics: Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Chrononauts: Mating Pair of Pterodactyls
description:
This is a one-card expansion. From the Looney Labs website:

This special Artifact works in either type of Chrononauts deck.

It debuted as a promo card at Dragon*Con 2004.

It says, "Counts as any one Live Dinosaur, or a mating pair of Dodo Birds."
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: Timelag
description: Timelag is a strategic science fiction game of combat across the reaches of outer space where Einsteinian time dilation directly effects the flow of play in the game. As the years wear on, the warring civilizations reach higher technological levels. Subsequently, they produce ships which are better than the ships sent out previously. Of course, we are speaking of time relative to each player's home base. The ships themselves will have hardly aged at all relative to their Home Base. The concept presents interesting situations since one never knows for certain the 'age' of his opponent's ships.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Sudden Death Ending, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Sergeants! Scenarios Book 1
description:
From the publisher:

Sergeants!™ Scenarios Book 1 contains 23 new scenarios that appear nowhere else. In addition, inside are Map boards 2, 3 and 4 (which have been provided on our website), and are now included professionally printed along with brand-new Map board 6. Requires at least one Sergeants: On the Eastern Front game set.

Included:

4 Map boards

Scenario Booklet
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Professor Noggin's Ancient Civilizations
description: Professor Noggin steps back in time to explore lost but not forgotten civilizations. Discover facts about ancient places, philosophers, buildings, clothing, arts, and empires on a trivia-filled journey of discovery.
publishers: Ãditions Gladius International, Inc., KENSHO Kft., Outset Media

name: Cloudships & Gunboats
description:
Boarding actions in the skies of space 1889's Mars with mini-scale deckplans, cardstock minis, rules, and ship diagrams.

This expansion was intended to bridge the gap between the boardgame Sky Galleons of Mars and the role-playing game Space 1889. Ship to ship battles can be fought and won; but if there is an opportunity for a Boarding Actions, which were abstracted in Sky Galleons, they are now fleshed out to man-to-man, or man-to-Martian action. This allows for players to add characters from the RPG, but role-playing is not required and as a boardgame Cloudships & Gunboats can stand alone.

Weapons are added, and clarified from Sky Galleons. Rules for designing your own aerial vessels are included.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Bias, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Three Dimensional Movement
publishers: Game Designers' Workshop (GDW Games), Heliograph Incorporated

name: Die Maus Ist Im Haus!
description: This is a game about developing observation and memory for children age five and up. Little mice scurry all over the house. They are crawling on the table, prowling around the cups and glasses. They are snooping everywhere...Only one player can see the picture on the card, and only he may tell the others what is on the card, for example "a little mouse". They he tells the color of the mouse, and finally where it sits. Other players listen attentively and the first player to play a matching card gets points. However, if a cat shows up you'd better watch out....

name: HÃ¤schen hÃ¼pf
description: The players roll a color die and move their little rabbits to the next square of the corresponding color. If that is already occupied, they jump over the occupying rabbit to the next square in that color. Whoever gets all four rabbits over the finish line first, wins.

name: Familia Gladiatoria
description:
The Games of Anceint Rome

Familia Gladiatorius is a simple gaming system for recreating the murrus, the gladiatorial combat, using miniature figures. In the larger campaign game, the player takes the role of a ludus, the operator of a gladiatorial school. The ludus owned a number of slaves trained to fight as gladiators. These slaves and their trainers (often retired gladiators themselves) made up the familia gladiatorius of the ludus. Normally, the ludus was contracted by the editor to provide fighters for the murrus. It was a risky business, and its practitioners were reviled by Roman society. Yet fortunes could be made by providing a bloodthirsty populace with bloody entertainment.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Gulf, Mobile & Ohio: Expansion #1
description: This expansion adds another color group of railroads to the base game. This expansion was part of the Winsome Games' 2009 Essen Set.

name: Gold War (ã´ã¼ã«ãã»ã¦ã©ã¼)
description:
User summary
This expansion for Dungeon War (aka Meikyu Kingdom Card Game: Make You Conquest) adds a new concept of Gold Coins, which you can use to pay your mercenaries, bribe your opponents and rank up your facilities.

Designer's summary

ã¾ãããéã§å­åµãéã£ãããèªå½ã®æ½è¨­ãã©ã³ã¯ã¢ãããã¦ãããåå©ã«è¿ã¥ããã¨ãã§ãã¾ãã

Search through the labyrinth to find and capture the monster lairs in order to expand your own domain. Advance towards victory by hiring mercenaries or making improvements on the facilities within your land.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Antietam
description:
"ANTIETAM" combines traditional hex and counter mechanics with a unique "Orders" system, where players issue orders to their various corps (or Confederate wings) at the beginning of a turn, then alternating phases are conducted by each side.

Union success is closely tied to McClellan's "attitude", or his will to put up a fight via the "Mac's Will" track. The Union player must succeed in combat to do this, but in the meantime Little Mac is an albatross. Additionally, the Orders Cards limit the ability for each side to conduct offensives, and careful planning is necessary.

Included: 1 11" x 17" Full Color mapsheet
1 Illustrated 8-1/2x11" Rulebook
80 Die-cut, full color 5/8" counters
12 2 x 3" precision-cut, plastic coated Orders Cards
1 Player Aid Card
2 6-sided dice
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hexagon Grid

name: Cadwallon: City of Thieves â Cry Havoc!
description:
Cry Havoc! Is a free, mini-expansion for Cadwallon: City of Thieves. It features advanced rules and new Equipment cards to make combat even more interesting. In order to use the new Equipment you will also need to download The Inn expansion. The Inn explains how to utilize these new cards.
Cry Havoc! introduces weapons, traps, and spells that stun or wound player characters.

This mini-expansion add yet another twist to how ducats can be claimed. Players now have the option of racing to collect ritual items for the Gods of Cadwallon, and with a bit of luck, earning wealth and even victory! However, beware of the risk it burdens ,as it might just kill off 1 of your gang members....Are you brave enough to venture into the ritual chamber ?

Another main feature of the expansion is the new combat system! Tired of normal hitting each other and moving the other ? Well now you get to stun and wound your enemies, causing them to lose precious time and action points ! This expansion takes the fight in Cadwallon to a whole new level !
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Hanabi: Festival
description:
Hanabi is a card game for 2-5 players designed by Luke Morris in 2012.

It's the city's big summer festival. As the hot, happy afternoon has worn on there has been much drinking, eating and laughter from the crowds bustling around the brightly coloured stalls.

Now as the sun sets, the people take to the grassy banks of the nearby river to watch the highlight of the day - the spectacular fireworks display.

The players are in charge of the fireworks and will compete to draw the most spectators to their display. Hanabi is a card game based on rummy with players completing sets of fireworks in their hands before laying them down to send them exploding into the night sky and to draw the spectators to their side of the river bank.

name: Die Minen von Zavandor: Die verlorenen Spruchrollen
description:
"Die verlorenen Spruchrollen" (English: "The lost scrolls") is a micro expansion for The Mines of Zavandor by Alexander Pfister.

It adds 4 "scrolls" to the game, which give the players certain benefits. The players can "spend" the benefits after an auction to increase their bid afterwards, but lose the benefit for the rest of the game.

At the moment only a german version of the expansion exists. It was released as give away at the Spiel 2011.

name: REVOLVIQA Blue
description:
REVOLVIQA

RevolvIQa, the revolving game series debuted in Nürnberg Toy Fair 2013. It’s basis is an innovation: playing piece supported revolving mechanism. The supporter is a playing piece onto which a constituted bottom surface in the middle of the revolving device is laid upon. A playing piece supported revolving device can make 6 playing pieces step at once.
RevolvIQa Red and RevolvIQa Blue are two independent games, packed into independent boxes, however these ones are intending to be an overture of revolving game series.
In a RevolvIQa box there are 3 individual games: 2 pcs. revolving puzzle games in varied difficulty levels (1 player) and 1 pc. revolving board game (2 players). Playing adventure and rules are varied, however a.m. structure is the same in both RevolvIQa boxes.
Play with revolving puzzles first:
the basic idea here is to have different coloured balls as a „pixel” of a pic on a playing field. The playing field plate is removable and exchangable. It has a hexagonal shape and it is hole-punched at 37 places in bee-cells pattern. It is to be put onto a basic board having 37 spheric recesses in the same pattern area. After pouring the required balls onto field, revolve until all the coloured balls match with the colours of the graphic. Starting with any ball arrangement results solution! A „Fox” and a „Galaxy” in RevolvIQa Red, a „Parachute” and a „Birthday” in RevolvIQa Blue is available as main theme on graphics of the playing fields.
Play with board games next:
There are equal starting chance arrangements for both players and one after the other order playable games by immediate revolving in both RevolvIQa board games.
Player wins, who revolves 5 in one row of its chosen coloured balls at first: that’s the board game about in RevolvIQa Red. Defeat arrives as magic touch in most of the cases. It’s name: „COLORICA-5”.
Player wins in board game of RevolvIQa Blue, whose all chosen 4 ferries are able to cross the sea first, or the one, whose opponent can’t revolve rule-wise anymore. It’s wintertime and some areas in the sea is frozen (white balls on the board). Revolving rules: revolve on water only (support on dark blue balls only), at least one of revolving player’s ferries shall change place during revolving action, the opponent’s can be revolved at the same time, but only if opponent’s previous revolving action took place elsewhere. Captivating and exciting. It’s name: „FERRY”.


REVOLVIQA Blue
3 games in the box: Parachute, Birthday, Ferry

Revolving puzzle and board games that are developing creativity and logical and strategic skills for 1 or 2 players, children or adults.

Parachute

Revolving puzzle games that are developing creativity and logical skills for 1 player, children or adults. Revolve so that the colored balls could get into their position!

Birthday

Revolving puzzle games that are developing creativity and logical skills for 1 player, children or adults. Revolve so that the colored balls could get into their position!

Ferry

Games developing logical and strategic skills for two players. The purpose of the game is that one of the players should get all 4 balls (ferries) of his to the other side by revolving them.

name: Pixel Tactics: Apprentice / Verona
description: Pixel Tactics Promo card that is a crossover from the Grimoire Shuffle game
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Orcs Orcs Orcs: Mini-Expansion 1
description:
This mini-expansion consists of:

8 Spell cards
5 Fate cards

name: Launch & Iterate
description:
You and your fellow engineers are working cooperatively to launch awesome products and grow the user base. In order to successfully launch products, you must develop the necessary infrastructure while keeping an eye on external events, which might help or hinder your efforts.

Launch & Iterate is a turn based cooperative card game. Tech cards are the primary type of card used in the game. Tech cards enable development of either core infrastructure (e.g. Data Redundancy), or offer one-shot benefits (e.g. Refactor). Tech cards are also used as the primary currency in the game, representing engineering effort required to develop new technology or to contribute to launching new products.

During the game, players focus on launching 1 or (potentially) more products at any given time. Successfully launching products increases the overall user base (in millions of users) and allows players to shift effort onto new products. Players attempt to maximize the total user base by the end of the game by strategically selecting the right products to work on at the right time. Each product has specific infrastructure requirements which must be met, along with a cost (in Tech cards) which must be contributed by players in order to successfully launch the product.

On their turn, players may select a Tech card to play from their hand (making sure that all requirements and costs are met), contribute any number of Tech cards from their hand to help launch an active product, and draw new card(s). At the end of each round, players reveal the next Event card, which can either deliver a benefit or incur a penalty, depending on the card as well as the infrastructure levels players have developed. The game is over after 11 events have been resolved.

A key factor in Launch & Iterate is developing infrastructure across 4 critical technology stacks, (F)eatures, (A)ccessibility, (S)torage, and (T)esting. Each stack is built up over the course of the game, from base level 0 to level 7. Developing infrastructure is critical to successfully launching products, but usually doesn't directly affect the user base. Each stack also offers specific benefits at higher levels, such as reducing or negating negative Event effects, increasing user base, enabling better allocation of resources or increasing development capabilities.

name: Bottom of the 9th: BlÃ¼dle the Noodle
description:
Blüdle the Noodle is a mascot promo card for Bottom of the 9th and was given out to all attendees of Unpub 5.

Blüdle is the first official promo of the game, and therefore is numbered #1P to signify the first card, and the first promo. He has a game altering ability to benefit both sides of the field. He will allow pitchers 1 free roll per at bat, and batters one free adjustment of their pitch tokens.

Use Blüdle carefully though, too much interference of the game can get him ejected!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Lords of War: Elves versus Lizardmen â Reversal of Fortunes Booster Pack
description:
Contains 10 Kickstarter exclusive reinforcements cards:

2 backwards-attacking Lizardmen Bulwarks
2 backwards-attacking Leatherbacks
1 backwards-attacking Crocodilian Brave
2 backwards-attacking Elven Lancewielders
2 backwards-firing Elven Balistas
1 backwards-attacking Elven Royal Guard
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: We Happy Few: The Battle of Agincourt
description:
From the publisher:

Just in time for its 600th Anniversary in October of 2015, Tiny Battle Publishing is proud to present "the only Agincourt game you'll ever need", Tom Russell's We Happy Few. Using a modified version of the Shields & Swords medieval battle system, it recreates one of the most famous battles of the Middle Ages.

Near a place called Agincourt, Henry V of England and the exhausted, disease-ridden remnants of his army took on a French force the size of which vastly outnumbered his own, and proceeded to wipe the floor with 'em. The French may have had the numbers, the knights, and the horses, but Hal had a strong defensive position and the all-important English longbow. The French sneered at the bowmen as only Frenchmen can, but like the man said, don't nock it until you've tried it.

Chief among the game's features is a clever, speedy, and diceless alternative to opportunity/reaction fire concepts that reflects the difficulties inherent in moving under missile fire. This results in a very tough game for the French Player. The English Player is favored to recreate the historical result, but it's not a stroll in the park.

Like other titles in the Shields & Swords series, We Happy Few is an ideal introduction to wargaming, but with just enough grit to satisfy the seasoned counter-clipper.

name: Bad Medicine: Second Opinion
description: Bad Medicine: Second Opinion includes 90 new cards for Bad Medicine and a new "Complication" mechanism that makes your pitches even more hilarious and memorable.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing â Muratas Expansion Pack
description:
Star Trek - Attack Wing: Muratas Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 29 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The Muratas is a Xindi Reptilian Warship class ship.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Tanks: Stuart
description:
The M3 Stuart was mechanically reliable, and even thought it had lighter armor and a smaller gun than the latest German Panthers, its small size and high speed made it well suited to probing enemy defences and fighting a free-wheeling and wild style of moving battle.

This pack contains:
1x Unassembled Stuart tank
1x Stuart tank card
1x Hero card
2x Crew cards
2x Upgrade cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
publishers: Battlefront Miniatures Ltd, Gale Force Nine, LLC

name: Baby Dragon Bedtime
description:
Like most infants, baby dragons hate going to bed! But now Mumma Dragon has declared it bed time and the dragons haven't got their hoards in order. They'll need to scramble as fast as they can to grab the gold and go to sleep, while making sure they get more gold than their siblings!

Baby Dragon Bedtime is the world's first real-time deckbuilder. Players all act at once to move through their decks to find cards that let them peek at the cards face down on the table and then pull them into their hand - assuming they are valuable gold of course and not dustbunnies!

Play takes only about a minute but players have been known to play for hours. And it makes a great family game as kids and adults can play together.

72 cards plus rules.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Real-time
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Memory

name: Martial Art: Clans
description:
The great clans rise for war in this expansion for Martial Art. Clans introduces unique powers, leaders, and dojos.

Each player chooses a clan at the start of the game. Your clan gives you a special power that you can use to build your hand or increase your strength in battle. The 8 clan powers add an incredible new level of strategic depth to your games of Martial Art.

Clan leaders are exceptionally powerful cards which whole strategies can be built around. You gain your clan leader by winning a new type of land card called a dojo. The dojo itself adds interesting new decisions to 3- and 4-player games. Which is more valuable to you, a higher point land or a dojo which gives you your clan leader? The choice is yours.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

description:
Hike the famous 46 peaks of the Adirondack Mountains in this fast, unique flip-and-write.

On your turn, choose a shape to add to your path as you move from a randomly-selected entry point to an exit, the same as everyone else. Your turns are simultaneous, but each shape is randomly paired with another activity- birdwatching, foraging, and more. Move past and around mountains to hike them, and gather up symbols as you combo your way to success. Show off your hiking gear through special challenges and explore specific mountains as you achieve personal goals. Along the way, use your extra water to power through extra stretches and modify your turns. The game ends on the 10th, 11th, or 12th turn, depending on if someone exits the park first. Oh, and be sure to check out Mt. Marcy for bonus points! Unique set-ups make each play different as you race to solve this pathing puzzle.

46 is a free-to-play printable game designed during the COVID-19 crisis, and will remain available here and through the publisher's website forever, with continued support.

-description from designer
mechanics: Line Drawing, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Set-up

name: Tournament at Camelot/Avalon: Mischief Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of the Game Boy Geek 2020 Kickstarter campaign.

Text says:
May be used at any time: Before a melee begins, switch seats with an opponent. All cards, powers, and health totals stay with their players.

Discard after use.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Take That, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: Black Stories: True Crime
description:
Whether it's a hammer murderer, a corpse in the freezer, or soap made from human remains, these eerie mystery stories are guaranteed not for the faint of heart. And the most hair-raising thing about it: They really and truly happened that way! In "black stories True Crime" 50 pitch-black riddles are gathered around real-life criminal cases. Macabre, unbelievable, scary - and 100% true!

How to play:
The card set contains 50 tricky, pitch-black puzzle cards for teens and adults to solve by asking clever questions. Cracking black stories together with friends is the most fun. One player, the bidder, takes a card from the deck, reads the short story written on the front of the card. On the back of the card, the master finds the answer, which he of course keeps to himself. Now the guessing people have to "ask" themselves the solution to the story. The questions should be formulated in such a way that the master can answer "yes" or "no". A spooky and fun guessing game for small and large groups - can also be played digitally.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Trivia

name: Teotihuacan: Expert Challenges â Book 1
description:
Teotihuacan: Expert Challenges is a series of setups intended to challenge players who are well familiar with the game.

Book 1 contains two challenges.

Toughest Challenge
This is a challenge for the most experienced players. The Action Boards are set up in the most challenging way possible, so you can expect final scores lower than average.

Temple Challenge
This is a challenge for experienced players. It introduces a new victory condition and requires the players to advance on the temple tracks to claim victory.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Movement, Rondel, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Track Movement, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Nein Nine
description:
Nein Nine is a vicious trick taker for three players. Consisting of a mere twenty one card deck, all of its cards are dealt out each round. The pain starts right away as players are trying to capture as many tricks as possible while avoiding the capture of 9's.

Described by play testers as a knife fight in a phone booth, Nein Nine is a fast paced trick taker that can be played in about 20 to 30 minutes. It incorporates a unique way to determine the trump suit for the round, 7's can be promoted to the top of the rank, and the deck contains a wild card that allows that player to win or lose the trick.

Capture clean tricks to boost your score and steer clear of the 9's. The player with the highest score at the end of the final round wins the game.

name: ã¦ã«ããªãã³ (Ultriten)
description:
In ã¦ã«ããªãã³ (Ultriten), the players take part in a trick-taking game that features nature, buildings, monsters, and heroes.

Each player has a scoring area for each suit, and it starts as a pristine forest. As things happen to each suit, cards may become "fallen", and their points will change. For instance, a pristine forest is worth more points than one you've erected a building on. However, a monster that has been defeated by a hero will be worth more points.

The trick-taking phase is a must-follow round with no trump suit. The winner takes all the cards from the trick and places them in their scoring areas.

After three rounds, the player with the most points wins.

name: Halves
description:
HALVES is a word game for the ruthless!

At home, the office, band practice, in the bar or on a plane (where this game was conceived!) bring your friends together and find out who is the wordiest of all.
Be careful though, winning cards is the easy bit, staying in the lead is where things get complicated.

To win the game, simply Guess the word on your opponent’s card to win points. Be the player with the most points at the end of the game!

The active player must choose a word from one card in their hand for their opponents to try and guess. The colour behind the chosen word dictates the game type for the round:
- Yellow is CATEGORIES,
- Blue is RHYMES WITH,
- Red is PERFECT PAIRS.

The active player must think of a clue for their word. Then they announce the game type and their clue to all players who have 30 seconds to guess it.
Any cards a player has won from a previous round is at risk from TRAP cards.

Guess, Swap, Bluff or Steal your way to put points on the table and be the envy of all your friends and family!

Created by Carter & Richardson the same minds that make up your favourite punk rock and roll band The Rattlesnakes.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Requiem
description:
Requiem is a wargame for two players who will control the National and Republican sides in the Spanish Civil War. During the game, both sides take turns to play their cards and carry out movements and attacks with their troops against the most relevant towns in Spain at the time of this violent conflict.

A game of Requiem is divided into two stages, column warfare and position warfare, as can be seen in the round track on the board. Each stage is divided into 5 rounds, which in turn are divided into:


Strategy Phase
Battle Phase
Logistics Phase


In each phase, both sides take turns to play cards from their hand and move units on the map, attack towns controlled by the enemy side or request reinforcements, in order to subdue the opponent militarily.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Command Cards

name: Sagrada: Promo 21 â Game Boy Geek 2022 Window Pattern Card
description:
A promo window pattern for Sagrada included in the 2022 Game Boy Geek Kickstarter.

This card features a level 3 and 6 pattern on opposing sides.

name: Hametsu
description:
Hametsu is a solo / co-op (1-4) monster hunting game set in post-apocalyptic feudal Japan. You take on the role of Hunters, warriors trained to fight back against a tide of Oni demons and mythical creatures let loose by The Cataclysm.

Each game of Hametsu sees the Hunters seeking out a mythical beast known as a Boss, and attempting to take it down. At the beginning of the game, the Hunters will be in stealth and wandering Oni will not be aware of their presence. Once the alarm has been raised, the Oni will pursue and target the Hunters until the Boss is found. Then it's up to the Hunters to be the last ones standing.

Hametsu uses standard d6’s for performing tests and saves. Hunters all have stats that govern how many d6 are rolled to perform certain actions. A roll of 4+ is a success. Score enough of those, and you will cast a spell, deal damage, or shrug off a hit.

Carve Your Own Path

Create a Hunter and choose from nine different classes spread among three different schools, all with unique abilities, spells, and playstyles. As you level up, choose new abilities and stats based on your class specific Path of Legend.

Narrative campaign

Hametsu encourages players to track progress from game to game, growing their Hunters and expanding their narrative story. Designed from the ground up for campaign play, dive in to randomly generated scenarios, or fight through the first narrative campaign, The Wolf and the Devil.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Uluk: Wrath of the Gods
description: Wrath of the Gods makes the game more unpredictable by making use of new decks of cards: Blessing and Wrath, all related to each of the six gods from the core game. They are drawn and resolved at the beginning of each season, depending on whether a god’s Monument was built in the previous season or not. Blessings can increase Harvest and provide you with extra resources, while Wrath cards make it harder to feed tribers, hunt and gather resources.

name: Ransom Notes: House Party Edition
description:
A creative party game for making hilariously terrible sentences. Players respond to outlandish situations like "Tell someone you've clogged their toilet at a party" with just their limited pool of word magnets, leaving even master wordsmiths no choice but to create awesomely horrendous phrases. With hundreds of word magnets included, every round is always fresh, wildly creative, and tears-streaming-down-your-face funny.

Each round, the player judge picks a situation and players try to come up with the best answer from their pool of magnets. Each is presented and the judge picks a winner. The game ends at a pre-determined number of rounds the player with the most points wins.
publishers: Evan and Josh's Very Special Games Company

name: Dungeon & Kingdom
description:
Dungeon & Kingdom is a 2-4 players tactical card game played in half an hour.
The game constantly pushes the players’ card arrays to the 7-card limit. Meanwhile, players need to find the perfect point of time to maximize their advantage using the game’s unique Cutting Mechanism to divide their array into Dungeon and Kingdom.
In the Kingdom the Adventurers fight off Monsters and gain Victory Points. In the Dungeon they perform a wide variety of rules-breaking Hero’s Deed combos!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Contracts, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Wolves
description:
Wolves is a semi-cooperative board game for 3-6 players. You take on the role of a community leader attempting to manage limited resources to help get your people through the winter. To survive, you need to co-operate and share through the gifting of what you've gathered and grown, which will dwindle as you head toward winter.

If any player fails to meet their community's needs, all players lose the game — but if everyone makes it through winter, the player who gained the most status will be elected chief of all of the communities and granted an additional victory.

Status is gained through efficient gifting of resources to other players and sharing excesses with your own community. Phases of each turn are played either simultaneously, or in status order, which can change from turn to turn.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Phase Order

name: Now You See It
description: Based on the 1974-75 version of the game show, players hunt for answers in a 4x14 grid of jumbled letters. Right answers win points and advance through the competition. The two high scorers play a final round, and the winner can collect a cash jackpot of at least $5,000 by finding 10 more words in 60 seconds.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Cubist: The Attic
description:
This mini-expansion consists of four cards, a double-sided "Attic" card for each player.

After building an Attic, players can use it to store extra dice in their studio.

name: Catan: Playmat Desert
description:
This is a Playmat for Catan with special rules.

Catan is suffering droughts, cross the desserts to reach the furtile oases.

This game comes with rules in three languages: Dutch, English, and German.

The mat is 61cm x 61cm (42’ x 42’).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Pocket Sports Football
description:
Pocket Football is a fast paced dice simulation of the beautiful game, football.

8 custom made dice represent your players on the field and rolling one die at a time results in an action. Work the ball up to your Forward and shoot on goal to try and find the back of the net.

Everything from headers, volleys, corner kicks and penalties have been distilled into 8 dice that come in their own carry bag with rules, to fit nicely in your pocket!

Challenge your friends and play as your favourite teams - make sure you bring your best commentary voice! Winning is decided by the player that scores the most goals.

Set up your own tournaments and try to take your team to the finals!


2015 New Edition is a re-release of the game with some changes to dice and gameplay. Still 8 dice, but two new changes (TACKLE die & GOALIE die) include the opponent a little more in the action.



Penalties have been improved and more scoring chances!

name: Wazabi: Dice Tower 2017 Promo Pack
description:
6 card promo set given out from the 2017 Dice Tower Indiegogo campaign. Includes 2 copies each of 3 different cards :

Yes But...No! - Cancel the effect of a card played by another player of your choice. This card may be played at any time, does not count as your one card per turn & does not require a Wasabi symbol to play.

Call Me Master! - Play this card in front of you, it will stay in front of you until the start of your next turn, then it is discarded. Before rolling dice, all other players must honor you as the Wazubi master. Any player who does not receives one penalty die from the box (if available) and shame upon their clan.

Take That! - Take 2 dice back from the box (if available) and give them to the player of your choice.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Shock Army
description:
Shock Army was the name given to the elite fighting units of the Republican 'Ejercito Popular' (The Popular Army). The game recreates a number of attacks by these spearhead corps.

Shock Army is designed to be played as a table top game between two players. No map is included, but there are sufficient terrain features to fight four major scenarios.

The game is built around three fundamental concepts. The first is the importance in battle of an army's command system, that is the way in which its headquarters is organized. Orders from HQ's are represented by impulse counters.

The second fundamental concept is that of "fighting power". Each unit has a total fighting power factor. In combat opposing forces compare their total fighting power factors - the unit with the higher fighting power factor is the victor.

Thirdly, every combat unit can move an unlimited distance. However, the further a unit moves in one go, the lower its fighting power will fall. This represents the breakdown of cohesion in a unit if it is pushed too far, too quickly.

name: Valkyrie Strike
description:
Valkyrie Strike (Japanese: ã´ã¡ã«ã­ãªã¼ã¹ãã©ã¤ã¯) is Japanese deck building game. The theme is represented the battle between Valkyrie army and the Monster in world of magic and science.

There are two groups of Valkyrie armies that is represented with two decks: Support deck and Battle deck. The three top cards of each deck is revealed and place consequencely to fight with the monster. All six cards revealed are called "Supply" that is available to recruit (purchase) and add up to each player's deck in his/her turn as usual as other deck building game. Victory points are earned by recuited Valkyrie, the damage that you inflicted to the monster in each turn and some cards that provide the victory point when playing by that card ability itself.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Rhino Millionaire
description:
A card game like traditional Japanese card game——å¤§å¯è±ª, player divided into 2 teams, the player who ran out the card will win the game.
As a classical ladder climbing card game, a player can play cards big than the last player with the same format. If no one can play card, then the last player who played card can choose any card to play.
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Team-Based Game

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Hong Kong
description: The second solitaire map - in principle playable with two as well - for Age of Steam is set in Hong Kong. There are some important rule changes in this expansion, including variability in city demand. Most important is probably that there is no role selection as in most Age of Steam variants.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Trains
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: King of Kings
description:
Players become the emperors/kings of empires/kingdoms of the ancient world. This may appear to be a wargame, but there are numerous roads to victory, as the use of trade and economic advancement is just as likely to prevail, in the end, as territorial expansion and conquest.

King of Kings includes 15 scenarios set from 1700 BC to 1200 AD, ranging from 1 to 5 players. A ruler can try to increase his empire by conquest, increase wealth by trade, or invest in civilisatory improvements that may well be a better path to victory than warfare. Trade is handled by caravans moving from resource areas back to the heart of your empire. As the design notes say, "this is not a wargame".

If players desire, battles can be fought in detail, by using the rules from Good Industries' other game, Ancients. Calls for Divine Intervention, as well as finding out the personal characteristics of your partner in Royal Marriages add to the colour of the game. The game end is variable, depending on the death of monarchs, which can be sudden (although it is possible in principle to continue playing as one's heir).

(source : Publisher and user's desciption)


Reimplemented by Imperator, which replaced the hex-based map with area movement.
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Economic, Medieval, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Encyclopaedist
description:
Encyclopaedist (ç¾ç§å¯©è­°å®) is a three-player only game in which you're trying to give eight correct answers or place a correct answer in each of seven categories. What are those categories, and how is an answer correct? Read on...

To set up the game, lay out the yellow, green, and red loops so that they overlap like a Venn diagram and form seven specific regions: yellow-only, yellow-and-green, all three colors, etc. Each player represents one of these colors. Each player chooses a category in secret, with the category being something that can easily divide answers into "belongs" or "does not belong". Examples might be things with four legs, foods, games by Reiner Knizia, things you can cut, and school subjects. Each player writes something that belongs in their category, then the other two players move those answers to the proper region. (If you're yellow, for example, you must give an answer that belongs in the yellow category, but that answer might also belong in the red or green category as well.)

Following this set-up, on a turn one player places a token in one of the seven regions, e.g., inside the red and green categories but outside the yellow one. Each player now gives an answer that matches the status of their own category, then the other players say whether or not your answer is placed in their categories or not. If your answer fits within the proper region, then you score a point and leave the colored portion of your answer sheet visible; if it's not in the proper region, then you hide the colored portion (to show that you don't score), but leave the answer visible to give information to other players.

The first player to score 1 point in all seven regions or to score 8 points total wins.

name: ããã«ãã¤ã³ (Double Nine)
description:
A Love Letter type game where you are trying to build the highest double digit number by the end of the round.

Each player draws a card then plays it in one of two piles. The first pile is the tens, the second pile is the ones. At the end of the game, the player with the highest number wins. 99 is the max since the cards are numbered 0-9.

However, the number cards from 0 to 9 have various effects such as "one-time break", "card replacement", and "hand exchange" . By making good use of these card effects, players aim to get closer to the strongest number, Double Nine (99).

The second edition includes 20 expansion cards not available in the first edition.
—user summary

name: Yamato Unleashed: Battle off Samar, 25 October 1944
description:
Yamato Unleashed. US forces returned to the Philippines in October 1944. In a desperate attempt to halt the US landings, the remnants of the Japanese fleet sortied. While the last carriers, with only a few planes between them, drew off the massive US carrier strike force, a flotilla of Japanese battleships and cruisers descended on the American invasion fleet in Leyte Gulf. As the Japanese ships rounded the island of Samar, they ran into two task forces of US escort carriers.

Yamato Unleashed picks up the action at this point. The Japanese player must push through the carrier groups and get heavy ships off the edge of the map, where they will find the American transports. The US player must fight for time, using carrier aircraft and light vessels, destroyers and destroyer escorts, to delay the Japanese until a squadron of US battleships arrive to even the odds. Historically the Japanese turned and ran; it might not work out that well this time.

Each counter represents a single ship, or a fighter, dive bomber, or torpedo squadron, each hex is a nautical mile, and each turn is 12 minutes. Ships are rated for main guns, secondary guns, torpedoes, armor, speed, and maneuverability. Hits can cause general damage, start fires, slow a ship, or cause a catastrophic explosion. Simple mechanics and a quick combat resolution keep the game moving.

World at War Issue #46, FEB – MAR 2016

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 228 counters

name: Das Sommercamp: Die Jagd nach der gestohlenen Fahne
description:
Time for summer camp

But the good mood around the campfire is gone. Someone stole the flag!
Head into the wilderness in this adventure game. Explore remote forests, moors and rocky landscapes. Combine different items you find on your journey. Meet different people. Some want your help, others stand in your way. Open secret envelopes and listen to exciting audio book chapters to bring back the stolen flag.

Whether it's a great family game night, a kid's birthday party, a kid's play date, or even for solo adventurers, this game delivers a unique adventure-packed experience for everyone!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Zeit fürs Sommercamp

Doch die gute Stimmung am Lagerfeuer ist dahin. Jemand hat die Fahne gestohlen!
Macht euch in diesem Abenteuerspiel auf in die Wildnis. Erkundet abgelegene Wälder, Moore und Felslandschaften. Kombiniert verschiedene Gegenstände, die ihr auf eurer Reise findet. Trefft unterschiedliche Personen. Manche wollen eure Hilfe, andere stehen euch im Weg. Öffnet geheime Umschläge und lauscht spannenden Hörspielkapiteln, um die gestohlene Fahne zurückzubringen.

Ob bei einem tollen Spieleabend als Familie, einem Kindergeburtstag, einem Kinder-Spieltreffen oder auch für Solo-Abenteurer: Dieses Spiel liefert jedem ein einzigartiges Erlebnis voller Abenteuer!

—description from the publisher

name: Sound Jack!
description: Sound Jack! contains more than four hundred audio files in 25 categories — movies, shows, celebrities, animals, places, songs, and more — to challenge players to a pop culture audio trivia quiz. The interactive "Game Master" leads players through the round, playing sound snippets and resolving all questions. Sound Jack! can be played in two different modes.

name: Waterline
description:
In Waterline, you and each other player are trying to build a single pipeline to connect openings in your player grid — but to maximize your score, you want to do more than just make a connection.

On a turn, the active player rolls the two six-sided dice, then each player uses the die results as they wish to draw pipe segments in their grid. You can use the die numbers separately for basic pipe or sum their values to use one of the special connectors. If doubles were rolled, well, too bad; you get a rock and need to place that somewhere in your grid. If a 7 comes up, you can choose any two basic pipe or one special pipe. Some spots on your player sheet are already filled in, so you can incorporate those pieces or avoid them as you wish. Rocks — you just want to avoid those.

After a certain number of dice rolls, the game ends, and if you have not completed your waterline, you score no points and lose. If you have, then you score based on how well you used existing pipes, how many rows and columns you filled with objects (including rocks and unused pipe), how many starred spaces you incorporated into your pipeline, the total number of pipes used, and whether you used more corner pieces than everyone else.

name: Uncle Albert's Auto Stop & Gunnery Shop 2039 Catalog
description:
Uncle Albert's Auto Stop & Gunnery Shop 2039 Catalog Update is the fifth in a subset of expansion for Car Wars. The Catalogs contain new weapons and options for use with the Car Wars Series of games.

The Uncle Al's subset of expansions includes:

Uncle Al's 2035 Catalog (1985)
Uncle Al's 2036 Catalog Update (1986)
Uncle Al's 2038 Catalog Update (1988)
Uncle Al's 2038 Calendar (1988)
Uncle Al's 2039 Catalog Update (1989)
Uncle Al's Catalog From Hell (1992)
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Squish Blocks
description:
Squish Blocks is an abstract strategy game where players lay square colored cards to create a board. Players try to create a situation of sandwiching a different colored card between two like color cards. When this occurs, the player captures the block in between and scores the points. Players may capture multiple cards in one turn.

Games can be set up for short or quick games depending on the size of the board created. Games can be as short as a couple of minutes and perfect for multiple quick fun games.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Party Game, Puzzle

name: Snorkels
description:
Meet the Snorkels, the friendly aliens from Deneb Gamma IV. One player will control the green Snorkels, and the other player will control the purple Snorkels. Each turn, you place one of your Snorkel pieces on the board. Snorkels never move once they are placed.

Each Snorkel has four breathing tubes coming out of its body. If all of its tubes get blocked by the walls at the edge of the board or by enemy Snorkels, it passes out from lack of air and gets captured by the enemy. The first player to be captured loses the game.

A common practice among Go educators, especially those who work with kids, is to begin by teaching a somewhat simpler variant of Go known as The Capture Game. Snorkels is an adaptation of The Capture Game by Mark Engelberg, who will donate his share of the proceeds to the American Go Foundation.

The Nestorgames edition includes 3 stones that are placed before the game starts, to add variety to the board.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Science Fiction

name: ÐÑÐ°ÑÑÐµÑÑ
description:
"Crafters" - a game against the four urban planners fictional world of time, similar to the early Renaissance. Insatiable King sends us to the fertile plains to establish a town. All is good, but to motivate the king announces that at the end of the work will choose which one of the founders of the rise at the head of the city.

In its course the first thing a player produces one of the starting resources: plants, timber, coal or iron. Then he can buy another resource for their own gold, to hire additional workers to make the resources available from the goods, sell them to spend money to develop drawings of new buildings, to build these buildings and others to invest in the construction drawings (as often, especially at the end of the game , the opponents are beginning to keep them in order to "strangle" this or that branch of production).
categories: City Building, Economic, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing, Renaissance
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Vs. System: Batman VS. Joker
description: The same core concept as the original Vs System still exists but with a new twist. You can now play as Batman or the Joker, but it doesnt stop there. You can enlist the help of other heroes such as Superman, or villains such as Catwoman.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting

name: Origami: Promo Goal Cards
description: A set of goal cards for Origami. At the start of the game, a number are placed face up on the table. Every player can take one (and only one) goal as soon as they meet the criteria, and score a number of additional points.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Harvest
description:
Salutations, neighbor, and welcome to Furroughfield, the Commonwealth of Free Beasts! Ours is a budding farm town with soil ripe for planting.

In Harvest, you take on the role of a farmer, each with their own unique penchant for working the land, and choose a farmhouse with its own special round-to-round benefit. Each round, you draft sunrise cards that give you a one-time income and determine turn order for the round. Following that turn order, move your wheelbarrows around town to gather resources that you'll use to manage your fields. Plant seeds, tend the land, and harvest crops to make money and score points. Clear land to expand your farm, and construct buildings that make your land more efficient and give you endgame bonuses. By the end of harvest season, the farmer with the most points wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Magic: The Gathering â Scars of Mirrodin
description:
The metal plane of Mirrodin shines under the light of five suns. But it’s now tarnished by the deadly scourge known as Phyrexia, and dark conflict is brewing. Which side will you command?

This 249-card, black-bordered expansion includes randomly inserted premium versions of all cards in the set, new mechanics (Metalcraft, Infect, and Proliferate), and new Planeswalker cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Army Group North: The Summer Offensive Against Leningrad, 1941
description:
Army Group North: The Summer Offensive Against Leningrad, 1941, is a World War II division level strategic game of the Barbarossa offensive against Leningrad from 22 Jun to 12 September 1941.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 1 week
Hex: 18.6 miles / 30 kilometers
Units: Regiment to Division

Game Inventory:
One 17 x 22" three color mapsheet
One dual-side printed countersheet (228 9/16" counters)
One 12-page Army Group North rulebook
One 6-sided die

Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 3-10

name: The Army without a General
description:
An expansion for CAESAR: The Great Battles of Julius Caesar â The Civil Wars 48-45 B.C., this module is found in RBM/GMT's C3i Magazine Nr14 and is available here. These scenarios detail Caesar's brief campaign in Spain during the Roman Civil War.

Battles:

Sicoris, 49 B.C.
Ilerda, 49 B.C.


Surprisingly, both of these scenarios favor the Senatorial Army, which lost both engagements. This is rare in most games from Great Battles of History. Both scenarios are of medium size.

name: Spiritual Warfare: Fantasy Mahjong
description:
An ancient curse has been broken and 4 Elemental Spirits escaped, taking possession of 4 mortals turning them into powerful Demigods. Each Demigod took control of one element - Air, Earth, Fire and Water. Not content with what they have, the Demigods plotted against each other. They recruited 3 classes to do their bidding: The Angels, the Undead and the Demons, starting an arms race.

The aim is to be the first to build an army and raid your opponent. The stronger your army the more Spirit coins or Skull Counters you can loot. SNATCH, KIDNAP and AMBUSH your opponents' troops. Use strategy to deter your opponent from forming an army. A game of strategy, skill and an element of luck.

The game is a spin-off from the traditional Mahjong by incorporating new symbols, rules and storyline we hope to allow more people to enjoy this century year old game.

name: Wolf's Lair (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description: A sequel to the Broken Peace fan expansion. Unlock the mysteries of a secret German base at the end of WWII.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Random Fun Generator 2
description:
Random Fun Generator 2 is a 76-page 7" x 10" B&W book that we're offering in both print and PDF. It's written by Sam Mitschke and Randy Scheunemann, and illustrated by Len Peralta, includes over 20 new dice games – all of which can be played with standard six-sided dice.

This is a stand-alone sequel to Random Fun Generator and can be enjoyed on its own. The original collection is not required to use these new games!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Spoils: Decade of Deckadence
description:
The Spoils: Decade of Deckadence is the next evolution in The Spoils card game, with this serving as both a standalone core set that is self-contained and a "cube" drafting set.

As a standalone core set, you can put together draft packs from the cards included, draft those cards, then play — or you can combine two decks to play in a sealed deck format or to build your own decks for the next VICTORS tournament.

As a “cube” drafting product, the purpose of DoD is to provide an easy entry point for new players with access to many of the most powerful cards in The Spoils history. Many of the cards in the DoD are extremely powerful!

name: Super Giant Monster Showdown: Destroy Tokyo Tower
description: "Destroy Tokyo Tower" is a campaign sourcebook for "Super Giant Monster Showdown". It includes 25 different scenarios with maps showing city card layouts for each, a handful of unique new Defense Units and 25 new Event cards. Scenarios include "The Great Monster Egg War" where a giant egg falls from space and will eventually grow into a baby monster, and "Terror at the North Pole" where the monsters play as 2 teams - the Ice monsters goal is to change the entire map into a glacier, the other team's goal is to melt all the ice on the map.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Millennium Wars: Korea
description:
Millennium Wars: Korea depicts modern warfare on the Korean peninsula. Rules cover political and psi-ops warfare as well as other innovative systems in a small package.

Contents:
(140) die-cut counters
(1) 11x17" color map
(1) 12-page rule booklet
(1) 8-page tables/charts booklet
(1) 4-page scenario booklet

Expanded by:

Millennium Wars: Air War

name: My Shelfie: The Dice Game
description:
You've filled your bookshelf with plants, games, books, awards, and cats! Now that each item has its place, will you be able to find it before the others?

In My Shelfie: The Dice Game, players try to create dice combinations to fill up the spaces in their bookcase. If you manage to fill up a shelf or a column, you block that section to all other players. At game's end, only the sections with at least three spaces filled will be worth points!

Do you like nice plants, or do you prefer cute cats? Will you focus your attention on completing columns, or will you try to run for the shelves?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection

name: The Mother Road: Route 66 â Pink Cadillac Expansion
description: Pink Cadillac expansion which allows a 5th player (or substitutes for one of the other player colors)

name: Harun
description:
from translation:

Harun was originally meant as an "introductory game" to Corona. This time there are seven heavenly bodies, which move on an orbit of 12 fields. Also 4 multicolored fixed stars are distributed on the orbit. The object of the game is it to move the heavenly bodies onto the fields with the fixed stars: But there are points. A new round begins; each player can call aloud the score he believes achievable. Whoever comes up with the highest correct estimate wins. If the player achieves his estimate, he is recompensed plentifully; but receives a punishment if it he does not achieve his estimate...

name: Spit It Out!
description:
This is a different game than the 1988 Games Works Inc title, although with a similar idea.

Spit It Out! is played in teams. Each turn, the playing team takes a Challenge Card from the box. One at a time, team members say words or do actions that meet the Challenge.

For example: Carnivores native to the American continent or A word that starts with the THIRD letter of the previous player's word.

Players must answer in turn order, cannot repeat an answer and are not allowed to confer with their team.

One point is scored for each correct word or action completed in 30 seconds. The team moves its playing piece round the board by the number scored, acquiring bonuses or penalties on the way.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: A Fistfull of Miniatures
description:
From Back of Rule Book:
A Fistful of Miniatures is a fast-playing set of Miniatures rules for beginners and veterans alike. Whether you have 100 figures or 10,000 A fistful of Miniatures can handle it. Indeed, A Fistful of Miniatures has something for everyone:


For the First Time Gamer - An entire section devoted to getting started, from how to organize an army to how to make a battlefield.



For the Novice - Easy to understand basic rules, just 7 pages and you're ready to go!



For the Veteran - Optional Advanced rules add as much detail as you want!


A unique combat system allows figures based from other rules to be used without modification. Fast playing rules allow games to be played to conclusion in 2 hours. Could Rome have defeated the Vikings? Can Greeks defeat Gargoyles? Find out with: A Fistful of Miniatures.

More Info:
The game uses 15mm with instructions for scaling up to 25mm figures.

Re-implemented by:

A Fistfull of Miniatures Basic Game (Second Edition)
categories: Ancient, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Federation & Empire: F & E Module 2 â Marine Assault
description:
This expansion includes Marine Ground Assaults, Special Attack Forces, Monitors, and Prime Teams.

Six scenarios included: The Hydran Expedition, The Wayward Wind, Reptilicon Revenged, Cold Front, Tholian Gambit, The Late Kingdom.

16-page rulebook, Sector A map, and 432 die-cut counters.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame

name: Space Race
description:
A multiplayer game of competition to land on the moon.

From the company description:

"The year is 1959 and you have just entered the 'SPACE RACE.'

You are Mission Control in this fast-paced and exciting game of early space exploration. There are 19 different missions to choose from, and you must decide which to try and when in order to stay ahead of your opponenent(s).

But the strategy doesn't end with just exciting space missions. There are satellites, research and investments to consider also. Proper planning here can make the difference.

The game also includes a brief historical synopsis so you can compare your plan with actual U.S. - U.S.S.R. achievements, which makes for an excellent solitaire game.

SPACE RACE is a paper and pencil game of moderate complexity for any number of players. Playing time is approximately two hours. A 10- or 20-sided die is required for play."

The game consists of a 32-page "Micro Game" sized booklet and two player aid charts. Several charts are located in the center of the rules booklet.

Expanded by:

Space Race Expansion Kit

name: Le Volpi del Mare
description: Naval warfare simulation in World War I about the attacks of German privateers against the British Royal Navy.

name: San Martino 24 Giugno 1859
description:
A game over the battle of San Martino.
Battalion/squadron level, 500 counters, one map, 9 game tables, rules and scenarios folders.
Linking with Solferino 24 Giugno 1859
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: Platoon Leader
description:
Platoon Leader comes in a solid booklet format, complete with all errata for previous Historical SQUADS & LEADERS modules from CH, a newly-designed purchase record table, and all the charts you need for quick reference on a back cover play aid. You'll find the cover of PL 2.5 depicted at the top of the left column of this web page. Overall, it's a very nice package for Campaign Gaming, as everything you need to conduct the campaign is right in the booklet.

Platoon Leader campaign game rules for Historical SQUADS & LEADERS enthusiasts are now available in version 2.5. As the version number suggests, this is still PL 2 at heart, but with many improvements. More than just a minor upgrade, this is an under-the-hood overhaul that was expressly aimed at making the existing line of modules easier and more fun to play. In fact, our testers report that these rules work great for RB, PB and KGP, too! Head to the bottom of this page for links to the latest version.

The approach was simple: bring in some of the system's harshest critics and some top talent for a down-to-earth review of the strengths and weaknesses of the system. A round table was conducted by our PL team, with many other folks providing comments and insight. The resulting enhancements, fixes and improvements make PL more user-friendly without introducing any major changes to familiar terms and methods.

Platoon Leader provides one set of rules to learn before embarking on your personal 'campaigning' to the different 'fronts' CH has and will continue to bring you. (In recent months, North Africa, PTO, France 40, Normandy, Market Garden and more.) And since it's a rulebook aimed at campaigns only, the emphasis is on enhancing that particular gaming experience.

Expanded by:

The Sunrise Bridge

name: Black Powder Battles
description: Miniature wargame rules for the Black Powder weapons era including the French and Indian War, American War of Independence and Napoleonic Wars. These are skirmish rules based on 2 Hour Wargames Chain Reaction 2.0 system.
categories: American Revolutionary War, Dice, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame
publishers: Rebel Minis, Two Hour Wargames (THW Game Design)

name: Perilous Encounters
description:
Excerpts from the Publisher's Forward:

"Perilous Encounters is a beginner's set of rules, presented for those persons who are attracted to the field but too unfamiliar with it to feel comfortable with the intricacies of more 'realistic' rules."

"Additionally, Perilous Encounters provides the experienced wargamer with a fast-moving set of rules for those situations where he would rather sit down and play a game of miniatures rather than having to work so hard at it."

"Also, lords and castle-owners in role-playing campaign games will find these rules especially adaptable to their games. You can use Perilous Encounters for those situations when you are tired of sending out puny expeditions and decide to amass your mobs and hordes for a major invasion."

44 page soft cover rule book with 3 pages of pullout reference sheets and templates.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Set-up

name: En Pointe Toujours V: Afrique contemporaine
description:
Units are squads, Heavy Weapon Teams, and individual Leaders, vehicles & guns. During play, players alternate activating formations under their respective leaders, with each activated unit able to take a single action - commonly move, fire or move 1/2 distance plus fire at reduced effect. A variety of other actions common to tactical scale games are possible - break down/assemble Heavy Weapons, entrench, etc.

Infantry Combat is resolved on a CRT, with units being 'Stopped', 'Neutralised' (demoralised), Eliminated or losing a step. Anti-armour combat is resolved by a smaller CRT, using the difference between attack & defence factors such as penetration, armour, terrain, movement, range, etc.

Morale is measured per formation, with reduced efficiency (-1 to all actions, and must roll to activate at all) or even Rout possible after a certain number of losses.

from the rulebook:
"En pointe toujours ! is a game of company-level tactical combat. Volume V covers military operations in Africa in the second half of the 20th century."

Contains 3 scenarios :

41-"Hélicos sur Béni Erda" (Helicopters over Beni Erda - Beginning 1971) French against Chadians
42-"Blindés katangais" (Katangan armour - 19 May 1978) French against Katangan
43-"Echec à Salal" (Failure at Salal - 16 April 1978) French & Chadians against Lybians


4 geomorphic maps, format A4 : map O, P, Q and R.

Like all Vae Victis games, counters must be assembled prior to play, and the rules are in French.

Game published in Vae Victis No. 80 with Sauter sur Kolwezi .
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: The Battle of Telamon, 225 B.C.
description:
A new battle module for SPQR found in RBM/GMT's C3i Magazine Nr6. Leader counters for this module were shipped in C3i Magazine Nr9.

The module highlights the Celtic invasion 160 years after the capture of Rome by the Gauls. The Celtic army was caught between two Roman armies, one to the North and one to the south. In the ensuing battle the Celtic army was destroyed with 40,000 killed and 10,000 captured.

name: iDetective #1: The Case of the Burglary at Bellamy's
description:
In these Instant Download PDF Game Book series (iDetective is NOT an iPhone App!), you are the Detective.

Have you ever had the desire to walk the streets of Victorian London with Sherlock Holmes. To walk up Baker Street as the fog is rolling in and hear Holmes cry out, "Come, Watson, come! The game is afoot!"?
With iDetective you can! You can capture the mystery and excitement of Holmes' London in these challenging single player gamebook series. You, the player, will match your deductive abilities against the master sleuth himself, Sherlock Holmes, using a unique paragraph system, like in the old do-it-yourself adventure books.
You are presented with a mystery to solve, and it is then up to you to trace the threads of evidence through the byways and mansions of nineteenth century London. You will interview suspects, search for clues, and put together the facts to reach a solution.

iDetective presents a new downloadable Game Book in the series every month.
This first iDetective: The Case of the Burglary at Bellamy's uses the basic iDetective rules only. Future Game Books will include special rules that modify the game experience, while retaining the easy to understand format.

iDetective: The Case of the Burglary at Bellamy's contains:

Rules
Case Introduction
Location Entries
Quiz
Solution & Answers
MP3s of Author reading the Case Introduction and Solution
CASE UNIQUE: MP3 of the complete Winter Symphony
categories: Adventure, Book, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based, Print & Play

name: Big Three
description:
A climbing game played with a standard 52 card deck primarily meant for three players, (though there is a four player variant). It is similar to "Fight the Landlord" (Dou Di Zhu) but with some noticeable differences - the biggest being that the 3 (not the 2) is the high card, but also in the number of cards in the pot and allowable plays. Because the runs are relatively limited (4 through K only) and because there are no "bombs" it is a bit more predictable in its gameplay than Dou Di Zhu.

Each round starts with dealing the cards (except for four of them) and an auction for the remaining cards. The winner of the auction then picks up the cards and plays against the other two opponents who are now in a temporary partnership.

The goal for each round is to shed your cards. The winning bidder needs to shed all his cards first before one of the opposing players sheds all of their cards. Allowable plays are singles, pairs, triplets, quads and runs of three+ cards and staircases of three+ sets (note that runs/staircases may only involve 4's through K's). There are no "bombs".

If the high bidder wins, then the other players pay him the amount of points bid, and if the high bidder loses, then the each of the other players are paid the amount of points bid. Online implementations of the game generally play for a predetermined number of rounds and the individual player with the most points at the end of the last round is considered the winner.

name: Fireknife!
description:
For centuries, Samoan warriors have spun and tossed their weapons in dazzling demonstrations of courage and skill. The traditional wooden war clubs were later replaced with hooked steel machetes. In 1946, a young knife dancer, “Freddie” Letuli, was performing in San Francisco at an event that also featured a Hindu fire eater and a girl who twirled a baton with light bulbs on the ends. Letuli wrapped some towels around the ends of his knife, dipped them in fuel, set them alight, and invented fireknife dancing.

The fireknife dance (siva afi) is now a major feature of Samoan culture and the pinnacle of any lu’au.

In the Fireknife! card game, players take on the role of fireknife dancers, trying to impress the audience with the best routines. The first player to earn enough points (acclaim from the audience) wins.

There are 100 cards in the deck. Most of these represent moves that a dancer might perform, but a few are mistakes to be played on other players. In addition to the cards, players will need pencil and paper to keep score.

Fireknife! is intended as a light or family game. Mechanically, it is related to Mille Bornes or Mystery Rummy: Jack the Ripper. There are also echoes of Ticket to Ride (“Should I take more stuff or use what I've accumulated?”) and Kill Dr. Lucky (“Should I stop the leader from scoring or hope someone else can do it?”).
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Total Extinction
description:
It is the year 562, the Age of the Diaspora. Humanity, established in hundreds of worlds throughout the known universe, is fighting for survival against cruel alien races, and even against each other as confronted by disputes that appear increasingly absurd.

One world after another is engulfed by the fury of the war while the contenders are fighting ruthlessly to prevent Total Extinction.

Total Extinction is a futuristic wargame with miniatures of 28mm for 2 or more players.

Players take command of a battalion of troops from one of the Star Nations (Glorlon, Union of Colonies, Regulatory Corporation, Elohim, Skraldar or Theocracy) facing a relentless war for survival. Each battalion is divided into units consisting of between 1 and 9 miniatures and led by a commander.

The game is divided into a series of turns (typically up to 6) which can be solved in about 2 hours. On each turn, alternately, players are activating their units that can move, shoot and even assault enemy units to take control of key areas of the battlefield (Objectives) and win the game. To achieve the victory, the armies also have the help of their commanders, who, by skillful tactics (represented by cards), can provide better techniques to attain their goals.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Mage Wars: Elfric's Life Ring Promo Card
description:
First distribution Origins 2013

Mage gains Life +4.

Card Number MWPROMO7
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Infamy: Triggerman Mini-Expansion
description:
The Triggerman Mini-Expansion is the second small expansion for Mercury Games' Infamy.

It contains 6 new Mission Cards, one for each sector in Infamy.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Mafia, Science Fiction
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Mental Blox
description:
Stack, pattern and match the multicolor shapes. Don’t be fooled by appearances, these endlessly enjoyable blocks mean brain-boosting business. Mental Blox help children practice following verbal instructions, asking questions and build critical thinking skills. Activity cards provide children with examples of what to build. Children can recreate what is on the card or can give verbal instructions to a partner or group.

Ways of playing:

Stack, pattern, and match the multicolor shapes, but don't be fooled by appearances: these endlessly enjoyable blocks mean brain-boosting business
Twenty activity cards keep strategic thinking skills in tip-top shape, while ensuring all players use strategy and visual literacy in a variety of clever cognitive activities.
Re-create a hidden arrangement or listen to verbal instructions


How to play

Game #1: Look & Build
2 teams receive 10 identical blocks each. A player will be the counter.
A card is placed away.
A player of each team will go to see the card, return to his place an take a block to start building the structure, This must be done before the counter gets to 10. Then a another player from each team will do the same and so on until a team agree that they correctly built the structure calls out “Mental Blox!”
Check the team’s structure against the card. If he team built the structure correctly, they can keep the card. If they built the structure incorrectly, see if the other team came closer to re-creating the structure; if so, that team keeps the card. Continue playing for three rounds.

Game 2: Listen & Build;;
In this game, you’ll have one caller and two builders. Divide blocks so that each player has an identical set of 10 blocks. The caller should take a card and, with his or her back to the builders, describe the structure to the builders. After the caller finishes describing the structure and the builders complete their re-creations, compare the card to the structures. Which builder came closest to re-creating the picture with blocks? The most accurate builder can keep the card. Continue playing for three rounds.

Both games have a variant where players should answer the bonus question on the bottom of the card.
mechanics: Memory, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Manresa 1724: ReconstruÃ¯m la ciutat cremada
description:
After the destruction of most of Manresa during the War of the Spanish Succession, the four main classes of the city start working to rebuild it: the bourgeois and the traders build a palace that will house the city hall, once the old ones affected by the 1713 fire are demolished; the artisans and the farmers rebuild the burnt houses from most of the city; the clerks request the manufacturing of a new altarpiece for the Seu (the city’s cathedral) because the old ones were burnt, and the bourbonic army strengthens the city’s defenses by fortifying the barracks in Puig Mercadal.

The game is a slightly asymmetrical worker placement, where players try to be the first to finish the three reconstruction phases of their buildings.

Each round, the players send the workers outside the city to the production placements; then some misfortunes could stop the production of resources (fires, droughts or collapses); after that the players gather their production (stone for the walls, salt to pay workers’ and artisans’ salaries, water to make mortar or wood for the scaffoldings); finally they use the resources to finish if possible one of the reconstruction phases.

There is an advanced variant adding a fourth reconstruction phase (the new banner of the city) and a different skill for each class.

name: Deck Quest
description:
Deck Quest (DQ) is an open-ended tabletop RPG condensed into four decks!

Much of DQ's gameplay relies on the exciting, funny, and creative power of the human mind to come up with solutions and plans for various situations.

DQ takes place in a fantasy world with dragons, paladins, mages, and other similar aspects--perhaps even the famous DQ blizzard!

The goal of the game is to complete whatever quests the Game Master presents to the players. The players may decide to work in teams and/or individually--the game is completed when the given quest or quests are all accomplished.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Role Playing

name: Order of the Gilded Compass: Tools of Power/Treasure Fragments expansion
description:
Includes 2 mini-expansions:
- 4 "wild" magical items to be mixed in with the others found in the Hidden Temple, and usable by any specialist.
- Goblet Fragments to be mixed in with the others in the Treasure Tower, which are more valuable when both halves are collected

name: PokÃ©mon TCG: XY Expansion
description: In this theme deck box you will find: 60-card deck, 1 card checklist, 1 metallic coin, 2-player playmat and rulesheet, 1 code card to play the deck online, 1 deckbox and damage counters.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers
publishers: The PokÃ©mon Company International, Wizards of the Coast

name: One-Minute Che Guevara: Bolivia 1967
description:
One-Minute Che Guevara is a microgame attempting to portray Che Guevara gerilla campaign in Bolivia in 1967 with a small map and a limited number of counters.
