One-Minute Che Guevara is a solitaire challenge and the entire campaign can be played in a minute or two. However, the game offers a player most of the political and military choices available to Guevara in 1967.
The player represents Guevara and guerilla units represent small groups approximately the size of a platoon. Bolivian army units represent elements of the 2nd Ranger Battalion at the company level. Historical factors like propaganda, supply shortages, and Guevara's limited tactical options are contained in the rules. The political phase is played on a map of Bolivia; the military phase is played on a separate battlefield map. Event Cards are used to guide the narrative but several different outcomes are possible. Victory is determined by the level of Guevara's political and military success ... if he survives.

(Excerpt from the Rules booklet)
categories: Civil War, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Minimap Resolution

name: Booz Mooz
description:
SUMMARY
Booz Mooz is a party game with cards, where players let each other take sips or drinks (alcoholic or non-alcoholic) in a sly and playful way.

INTRODUCTION - theme
Every year, in some deep dark forest, all mooz of the world gather for the great Mooz Fest. A gathering so secret even we don't really know what happens there. All we know things tend to get quite rough. All mooz (players) are eager to have a nice drink (or two, or three, or more...) but the real boozers get lost in the forest. Their follow-mooz cannot wait to find them and lush up together. Are you curious about what kind of mooz you are going to meet? Before you know it, you are in a world of choices, speed, agility and above all: lots of fun!

GOAL
The goal of the game is simple: The player who has the least blood alcohol content (bac) points when the game ends, wins. The game ends when all cards are face up.

GAMEPLAY
STEP 1: Gather some friends and take a seat. Clear the table.
STEP 2: Make sure everyone has a glass and fill this glass with a drink of choice.
STEP 3: Spread all cards on the table face down.
The youngest player starts the game by turning a card of choice face up. Turns go clockwise until all cards are face up.

Does the Question Mooz has it in for you? Or are you, as Royal Mooz, calling the shots? Are you a Gentlemooz or do you steal booz from your neighbors? Everything is possible, as long as you finish the game as the mooz with the least points.

Servant Mooz, another round please!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Snappy Maths
description:
Snappy the crocodile is hungry! Help him catch some fishies for his lunch by matching the number of fish in the stream to earn fish tokens.

Snappy Maths is a quick-fire educational game for children, designed by a 10 year-old. Two players race to compose simple math equations (addition, subtraction and multiplication of numbers 1, 2 and 3) to match a target number determined by a six-sided die. Each of the nine cards can be used in two ways: as a number (1 to 3), or as an operator (+, - or ×) depending on which way up you place it. The first player to arrange their cards to match the target number wins the round and receives a fish token, and the first player to earn five tokens wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number, Print & Play

name: Frozen Forest
description:
Warning: This is a hard game with some prime number math involved. As such, this game is not for everyone, but it is very rewarding when played well.

A little girl named Mina and her best pal, a friendly yeti named Yuki, play hide-and-seek in a magical frozen forest. Not only do the trees grow perfectly aligned in a 10×10 grid, but the trees themselves grow straight up. This means that a skinny little girl could easily hide behind one. A yeti, however, is far too big not to be seen. So, that is why Mina always hides, Yuki always seeks, and they always have fun! But seeking takes a lot of energy for someone as big as Yuki, and the trees also happen to be very much to Yuki’s tastes. So he cannot resist munching every last splinter of every tree he encounters. In fact, if he runs out of trees to eat, he gets too hungry and gives up.

One player plays Yuki and the other player plays Mina. Yuki and Mina take turns moving from tree to tree. Yuki moves slowly, because with every step, he devours an entire tree (don’t worry, no real magical trees will be harmed during the game). On the contrary, Mina moves as far as she wants.

EQUIPMENT

- Board with 10×10 tree spots
- 70 snow spots (white discs)
- Yuki (an ‘ice’ meeple)
- Mina (a red meeple)

HOW TO WIN:

One player plays Yuki and the other player plays Mina.

Play twice swapping roles to see who does best. In many cases Yuki eventually catches Mina, but sometimes she manages to leave Yuki with no valid moves.

- If both players win playing Yuki the one that ate fewer trees wins.

- If both players win playing Mina, the one that ate more trees wins.

- If a player wins playing both Yuki and Mina this player is clearly a hide-and-seek master!

The paradox:

The strategy on the second game will depend on the result of the first one:

- If Yuki wins the first game, the player playing Yuki in the second game must eat fewer trees (catch Mina sooner).

- If Mina wins the first game, the player playing Yuki in the second game (who won as Mina), must eat as many trees as the other player did (trying to catch Mina later!) just in case Mina eventually escapes.

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team â The Slicing Noose: Drukhari Starter Set
description:
The Wyches of the Drukhari – also known as Dark Eldar – are vicious and cunning, their fighting style based on a foundation of raw speed. Their Wych Kill Teams can dodge an enemy’s blade as easily as if it were moving through treacle, artfully lopping off limbs and heads as they dance through the melee.

An expansion for Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team, this box includes 10 plastic miniatures, a scenery set (with exclusive rules!), and brand-new Tactics and Mission cards. Included:

- A 10-model Drukhari Kill Team: supplied on purple plastic, these can be used to represent The Slicing Noose or your own Drukhari Kill Team. This kit includes 14 different heads and 10 different bodies (six female variants and four male variants);
- A set of 2 Eldritch Ruins: overgrown and deadly scenery pieces representative of fearful deathworlds. Covered in symbols and entwined with malevolent deathworld flora, they’ll give your games of Kill Team an extra-arcane look;
- 11 Tactics cards and 2 Mission cards: the Tactics cards are split between the 4 Drukhari Tactics taken from the Kill Team Core Manual and 6 Drukhari Tactics exclusive to this set, giving you new ways to play with your Drukhari kill team. Also included is a Tactics card for the included scenery, providing rules for incorporating them into your games. The 2 Mission cards are split between 1 Matched Play and 1 Narrative Play mission;
- An 8-page booklet describing The Slicing Noose, their history and background, along with a showcase of painted miniatures and a timeline of their deployments;
- 10 datacards for The Slicing Noose, ready for you to use right away;
- A sheet of card gaming tokens, including 10 Move/Charge tokens, 10 Fall Back/Advance tokens, 10 Shaken tokens, 10 Ready/Shoot tokens, and 6 Objective tokens.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who Fluxx: Coin & Doctors
description: Doctor Who Fluxx: Coin & Doctors is a small expansion for Doctor Who Fluxx that contains the long-awaited 13th Doctor as well as The War Doctor, which was previously released as a promotional item. This expansion also features an enameled turn token, along with a rule card that references the token and keeps players' eyes on the game since they could be penalized otherwise.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Warhammer Armies (Fifth Edition): Bretonnia
description:
Warhammer Armies: Bretonnia is an expansion to the 5th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Bretonnia faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Agents Of S.M.U.S.H.
description:
It’s the ‘70s - a time of cool spies, cool crimes and a complete lack of health and safety laws for villains. In this asymmetric game of hidden information and wits, take control of either the cunning, gadget-laden super-spy Harmony Grace, or construct the diabolical base defences of Dr Baron Von Death as S.M.U.S.H, defending him as he seeks to complete a moon-crystal-powered death ray. If Harmony can’t steal all three moon crystals back before the end of round six, it’s nighty nighty for freedom and liberty.

Inspired by the cyber tussles of Android: Netrunner, but condensed into just nine cards, this is a mint-tin sized PnP game with a big mental contest inside it. It packs in all the thrills and dread of having to deduce what dastardly traps your opponent has in store, and all the tension of watching Harmony select her loadout each round, knowing that the right choices will cut through your lines like a laser watch through a Soviet train floor, but the wrong one will end in her certain capture.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Exiled Legends: Earth & Air
description:
The Banesphere crackles with a new energy as two new Legends assemble their Heroes for battle. Only one will emerge victorious. Will it be the sturdy and powerful Chained Titan, or the swift and unpredictable Sylph Queen?

The Earth & Air expansion for Exiled Legends adds two new legends to the game, increasing the supported player size to by two.

—description from the publisher

name: Drako: Promo tiles
description:
These promo tiles can be used in both Drako: Dragon & Dwarves and Drako: Knights & Trolls and affect the movement/attack rules in various ways. The first player will decide which one of these four tiles to use, while the second player will decide its placement.

—user summary
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Lost Worlds: Winged Gargoyle with Scimitar
description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces. Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters. Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons. Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on). Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience. In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.
mechanics: Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Make-a-Snake
description:
The snakes need the sun to hunt and play. As they crawl from their hiding spaces early in the morning, they try to coil themselves so that their tail and their head are as close as possible. This way they are all snuggly and warm until they can soak up the sunshine.

Roll the die and add new parts to your snake! Bend it, coil it, extend it! At the end of the game, measure the distance between the snake's head and its tail. The player with the shortest distance takes the prize!

-description from publisher
publishers: DV Games, Gigamic, Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Mercurio, Outland, Rebel Sp. z o.o., Red Cat Games

name: Floor Plan: Kira & Ryan Client Promos
description:
One Build Client (Kira) and one Design Client (Ryan) for Floor Plan

Kira:

Soundproof Studio - Bedroom touching the edge of the grid connected to a Living room (5 pts)

Home Office - Dining Room containing 4 or more unique arrangements of furnishings (9 pts)

Ryan:

Asymmetrical Playspace - 2 decks of at least 4 squares in unique arrangements on opposite sides of a furnished room (4 pts)

See You Schoon - Room with windows to a tree and a pool (9 pts)

- Originally available as part of the 2019 Man vs Meeple Season 3 KS campaign -
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Clash of Galliformes
description:
Explore, build and battle in this strategy and resource management game with ground-living birds set in an alternate timeline where birds work alongside tribal clans. As the clans have developed close to their feathery mounts, their cultures have been formed by their specific clan birds. Some have mastered the way of faster bird breeding while others have gone down a more warlike path. Now is the time to choose your bird and in so doing, your way of life.

Players must expand their territory to find supplies and new technologies for their tribes. The threat from rival clans is also constant, so you have to adapt your strategies and think ahead of your opponents to survive. Will you conquer the other clans by force or will your memory live on through the peaceful measure of completing cave paintings? The choice is yours!

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Animals, Exploration, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Map Addition, Modular Board, Multiple Maps, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: The Snallygaster Situation: Kids on Bikes Board Game â Far Out Rides Bonus Pack
description:
Promo pack for pre-ordering the base game. Pack contains:

1 Alien Kid standee (plastic base not included)
3 Ride cards (Sparkles, Sweet Heat, and Jeff's Lame Ride)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Hidden Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Escape Your House: Spy Team
description:
Work together, solve riddles, and find keys. Turn your home into an Escape Room with the help of your family or friends! This game is perfect for family game night or as a gift for kids.

The Super Secret Spy Team (SSST) is an organization that protects the world against dangers. One of the main characteristics of spies is that they go unnoticed. And what would be less noticeable than a sweet, innocent family or a bunch of keen friends? Which is exactly why the SSST is looking for people like you!

SOLVE THE PUZZLE:
Take on the challenge of the Super Secret Spy Team (SSST) in 6 thrilling missions. In each mission, you have 15 minutes to escape your house. Work together to solve the puzzles which have been left across the house, so you'll ultimately locate the key for the door lock. This game includes an easy-to-use door lock & timer, which counts down from 15 minutes right when you hit start. Simply place the door lock onto your front door or the door handle of any room you’re in, and it will lock into place. In an emergency, you can use the door key if you are not able to solve the mystery in time. Use the area arrangement card, so you know exactly how to turn your home into a top-secret mission. With all these supplies on hand and a variety of mission options and puzzle cards, you will have everything you need for a family game night full of adventures. Get ready for a wild ride of solving puzzles, finishing missions, and of course… escaping your house!

15 MINUTES TO ESCAPE:
Test not only your mind, but also your speed… because you only have a limited time. Finish one strategy game and wanting more? Simply move on to another mission.

6 THRILLING MISSIONS:
The Super Secret Spy Team is always needed for the world’s most high-profile missions. Choose from one of six missions to uncover the mystery and unlock the door.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending
publishers: Cranio Creations, Identity Games International B.V., Noris Spiele, Spin Master Ltd.

name: Eagle Leader
description:
Eagle Leader is a solitaire air tactical game which depicts NATO's air war in a series of hypothetical Cold War Gone Hot scenarios. The game covers the late Cold War, from 1976 (the introduction year of the Eagle) to 1991, with featured aircraft including the F-15C Eagle, the F-15E Strike Eagle, the F-111 Aardvark, the EF-111 Raven, and the F-16 Viper.

Eagle Leader focuses on force packaging-- the selection of the right aircraft and the right munitions will make the difference between success and failure for your squadron. You will be asked to make decisions that NATO Air Planners would've had to consider in the real world.

This game adds new aspects to the Leader series such as electronic warfare aircraft, US and NATO-specific skills, and an expanded "Squadron Operations" module for Leader players looking for the most detailed experience.

The core game contains 312 cards and 672 counters, including:


198 x Aircraft cards
F-15C Eagle
F-15E Strike Eagle
F-15J Eagle (Japan)
F-16C Fighting Falcon
F-16 ADF
CF-18 Hornet (Canada)
EF-111 Raven
F-111C Aardvark (Australia)
F-111F Aardvark
F-4F Wild Weasel
A-4K Kahu (New Zealand)
A-7D Corsair II
Tornado GR.1A (United Kingdom)

11 x Squadron Asset cards
RF-4 Flash Phantom
A-10 Thunderbolt II
F-117 Nighthawk
E-3 Sentry
KC-10 Extender
KC-135 Stratotanker

6 x Support cards
Airborne Battalion
Army Attack Helicopters
M270 MLRS
PJ Teams
SOF Team
Tomahawk Strike

50 x Target cards
37 x Event cards
10 x Special Condition cards


In addition, the core box includes:


8 x Campaign sheets
3 x Player Help sheets
1 x Airbase Squadron Control sheet
1 x Player Log sheet
1 x Tactical Display board
1 x Rulebook


—description from the publisher

name: Stroganov: Game Brewer Promo Pack
description:
A card that is part of a Promo Pack Game Brewer created to help cover the rising cost of ocean freight.

Description from the publisher:

Adds one 2 sided card. In Spring, Summer, and Autumn a fur will be added to the card. Hunting or gaining a fur that matches the one on the card will gain or lose players extra story points.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Map Addition, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Claim Action, Worker Placement

name: Trailblazers: Travel-Friendly Expansions
description:
1 - 4 players

Enjoy both expansions on the go!

60 animal tokens (punchboard)
12 traveler tokens (wood)
21 campfire tokens (wood)

- Fits in the clamshell case with all 1-4p cards. Compatible with the Travel, Super Travel, and Deluxe Editions. Components are not waterproof.

- Includes both Animal Expansion and Adventurer Expansion. Physical rulebooks and Solo Achievement sheet not included, QR code and link to rules and sheet provided. Key rules summary card also provided.

Note that the Animal Expansion and Adventurer Expansion are already contained in the Standard and Deluxe Editions with enough components for 1-8 players. This expansion is considered "Travel-Friendly" because it replaces those components with smaller components, and only enough for 1-4 players, so they will fit in the clamshell container. The clamshell container is part of the Travel, Super Travel and, Deluxe Editions but not the Standard Edition.

name: Love Is Dead
description:
These days, dating can be downright scary. Seriously, who wants to get ghosted?

In the light strategy party card game Love Is Dead, players compete to match with Boos in the dating pool by playing trait cards that correspond to the Boo's traits. Will you match with AJ who's only looking for a date to their cousin's funeral? Or Niah, who'll ghost you just for being an Aries? Opponents can play negative cards, like deal-breakers, to sabotage one another.

Once a player matches with three Boos, the game ends, and whoever scores the most points from their matches wins!

name: Dinosaur World: Lawyer Promo Card
description:
Originally available in pack C of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

Place this card next to the Worker Database cards.

To mark its use, place on of your unused Route Tokens on this card.

Text: Once per game, you can ignore all danger rolls in a round. You must decide to use this ability before you begin rolling.
If not used by end of game: gain 4 victory points.

name: Balkan Railways
description:
The Balkans have long been a land of mystery and strife. The promise of the newfangled railways has brought unusual co-operation to the leaders of the disparate states of this land. Croatia, Serbia, Bosnia, Kosovo, and Bulgaria, along with the powerful rulers of the Ottoman Empire and the Austrian-Hungarian Empire, see the immense bounty to be realized with railways connecting East and West. Steep mountains must be overcome, and isolated valleys must be reached to attain the goal of a true Orient Express. Merchants see the vast potential wealth to be gained and work to fund this dream and become rich themselves. Hooray for the Orient Express!

In Balkan Railways, players are rich merchants and powerful leaders investing their wealth and status in building railroads in this forbidding land. Loans are taken and serviced, opportunities must be recognized and seized. Savvy fiscal manipulators will come out on top in this no-luck economic knife fight.

Note that while Balkan Railways was originally released as an expansion for Iberian Railways, this edition of the game is a standalone design that includes everything you need to play.
mechanics: Connections, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Income, Loans, Network and Route Building, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Stalin's First Victory
description:
Stalin’s First Victory (SFV): Covers the five-day campaign that determined the outcome of the 1929 Sino-Soviet War.
A low complexity two-player grand tactical game at 1.25 miles/2 km/hex, and one day turns. Units are battalions, companies and regiments.

22 x 34-inch game map with both battles; Stalin’s First Victory 48 5/8-inch counters; Taierzhuang 128 5/8-inch counters.

Taierzhuang / Stalin's First Victory were both published in World at War #91, June 2023

(description from the publisher)

name: Void Intentions
description:
Void Intentions is a dungeon-crawling, print-and-play, roll-and-write game. It's set in the same world as Void Halls, but the roles are reversed. Now, take on the role of a "hero", explore, and plunder this dungeon. The dice are rolled, fate is written, and riches await you. But be careful — death might find you, as these dungeons are full of dangers and traps. It's an unbalanced, solo game, that provides a different experience in every playthrough.

Choose your character. Each character possesses distinctive starting attributes, Life and unique quest. Your inventory is where you keep track of your supplies and treasures gained. There are 30 rounds: 23 hourglass rounds and 7 camp rounds. In each round, move your character onto an adjacent square on the dungeon map. After you move, roll as many dice as the level of the room you're in (indicated next to it) - to determine what encounter you have found on the specific square on the map. Draw the exploration icon on the map square that you have just explored. Each encounter affects you in a certain way. Inventory items can be used while camping. You may spend the treasures and supplies that you have collected to do some actions. The game ends upon reaching the final stairs at the 5th level.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Stardust Imperium
description:
Here comes the new era of the space develop. For the foundation of the greatest empire, You must build establishments connected with combo among a lot of others, and use their functions to produce victory points and to keep the other nations in check.

Overview
Players play the game with the cards representing various establishments and political systems. Players take their turns in order. During their turns, they should RESEARCH to draw cards or BUILD to play their cards. The cost for the build is paid by selling cards from their hands, so players should choose which card to build and which card to sell prudently. And players can use the functions of the cards in their tableau to draw extra cards, to get victory points, to steal cards from the other players, or to keep them in check by getting some advantages triggered by them. In the simple play, making the combos with various cards and maximizing the effects will be a key for the game.

In a simple explanation, Stardust Imperium is a game which is hybrid of "Race for the galaxy" and "Magic the gathering". I'm a huge fan of them, but I had to make a game which can substitute them because those games are little bit hard for my friends. Consequently, I made a game in which players use abilities of their cards so they directly interact with each other like "Magic the gathering" in a frame in which players build their nations like "Race for the galaxy". It took the merits of those games, but it was easy, simple and short. I'm satisfied with the basis of this game and while I'm continuing balancing tests, I decided to open this game in 3 languages so that more people enjoy this game and give me feedbacks. Please enjoy this game freely under non commercial use.

categories: Card Game, Civilization, Print & Play, Science Fiction
publishers: (Web published), KIGS: Korea Indie Game Shop

name: Alibi: 3 Intricate Mysteries
description:
Alibi is a murder mystery game inspired by dinner parties with a crime theme, designed for players aged 14 and above. The game begins by choosing one of the following scenarios:


Murder on the Nile, a vacation on the river that ends in tragedy;
A Dish to Die For, the last "poisonous" episode of a cooking program;
Blood on the Tartan, in the villa of a Scottish gentleman inspired by a Sherlock Holmes story.


All five players are suspects, and through clues and discussions, they must reconstruct the events while concealing or revealing the secrets of the story.

In Alibi, it is important to carefully follow the order of card decks. If there are six (or more) players, the Detective (or investigation team) comes into play. With only four players, one innocent suspect deck will be removed from the game.

No one knows who the killer is — not even the guilty party — until the final phase of the game, which begins with the Revelation when each player learns their guilt or innocence from their own deck of cards. At this point, all players provide their reconstruction of the events before the voting. Will the killer manage to direct the suspicions of other players towards an innocent person to win the game?

Three mysteries to experience firsthand in an innovative blend of board game and role-playing game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: YN
description:
Billions of years ago, when the earth was just an incandescent globe that began to cool - big masses of rocks and ores, that were before in a liquid state, started to solidify, creating what we call today a terrestrial crust. The magma, still boiling and liquid, started big waves around an unstable soil and this huge rock layers collided and rose from the soil, creating the mountains. In the abstract game YN a player will experience the idea of creating these mountain rages using sequences of dices in a scenario that simulates the Earth at its formation process. The player with less numbers in the dices outside the board wins the game.

Each player have a bunch of dice (that represents mountains) and need to put in the board, but there's a problem: a dice only can touch another dice with a same value like a domino mechanic and after each turn a player can put a small token to create blockades to the opponent. The objective of the game is to be the player with few numbers in the dices out of the board.

name: Villages: Royalty Pack
description:
This extension pack was exclusive to Kickstarter backers.

The Royalty pack includes 30+ cards created by people around the globe to extend Villages with fun new cards.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Catch Phrase Junior
description:
Same as Catch Phrase but words or phrases that appear on the readout are familiar to adults and well as children. Anyone who can read can play. Players sit in a circle and divide teams into every other person. One person is selected as the starting player or "Clue Giver." After reading the "target word" on the game's display, the clue giver yells out associated words, hints, sounds until his/her team guesses the target word. As soon as this happens the player presses the Next button and passes the game device to next player who must now give clues to his/her team. All the while the timer is ticking down. Beep...Beep...Beep..Beep..Beep.Beep.BeepBeepBeep!
If your team is not in possession of the game device when the buzzer goes off and you score! First team to 7 wins!!

name: Space Merchant
description: Space Merchant is a card game for three to six players. Each player represents the economic resources of a planetary system. Players invest in their economies to produce commodities, and trade those commodities with other players in order to corner various markets and thus take advantage of higher value of their commodities.

name: Admin Test Item
description:
Vaporware. I checked for this game at my FLGS and I was told that it was in perpetual playtesting. Phooey!

Rumor has it that this is going to be released on Amazon as soon as their drone delivery system is available. It was also mentioned that the app may come pre-installed on the Amazon Fire phone.

Cache testing... part 6. Edited by...
mechanics: Acting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid, Variable Phase Order
publishers: Admin Test Publisher, Test Video Game Company, Test Video Game Company 2

name: Flotsam Float
description:
Skill is required in this game of island hopping. Flotsam Float contains 24 colorful stacking stones. This flotsam and jetsam must be collected and stacked on the wobbly raft. You need a steady hand because the fully loaded raft must be balanced to the next island.

In clockwise order, players pick a wooden piece and must stack it on one of the raft cards on top of the already existing found objects. In doing so, they must not move the other pieces. If no piece fell, that player may take an island card that has shells and a symbol on it. The symbol indicates which island the raft must be balanced to in the second phase. The islands are each four cards with a symbol on them, which are randomly distributed in the game area during the set-up. The raft card must be moved, but the found objects may not be touched. If again nothing has fallen down, this player gets the number of shells credited as points. The game is over as soon as only one island has island cards left. The player with the most shells wins.

name: Jenga Jokers
description:
Well the box says...
Jenga, the original game of tower-building fun, has been combined with the skill of card playing. Get rid of your cards before your opponents, by moving the matching blocks in the tower. But be careful! Keep your hand steady and play your cards well - you do not want to be holding high-scoring cards when the tower collapses!
publishers: Hasbro, MB Jeux, MB Spellen, Milton Bradley

name: Ice Solo
description:
A solitaire games using Icehouse/Treehouse pieces. The original version involved starting with 60 pyramids (4 monochrome Icehouse "stashes") arranged in randomly-colored trees (small on medium on large) in a 5x4 grid. The object to hop pieces to other stacks in the same row or column and end up with monochrome nests (large on medium on small). Score is based on number and pattern of completed nests.

The original 5x4 game for four monochrome stashes can easily be extended to 5x5 to accommodate the pyramids that come with five Treehouse sets, which could also be considered a "Volcano set". Also, a Volcano board makes Ice Solo just that much nicer.

This page quotes the original 5x4 rules and gives a little more info on the 5x5 version.

name: Penguin Panic: The Great Icescape
description: In Penguin Panic: The Great Icescape, the players control penguin placement in a prison yard. Using a Venn diagram the players place penguins into various places that will benefit themselves, filling up the area they have control of. Each player needs to help penguins escape from the prison. Careful placement allows the penguins to escape the region they have filled up (without helping their opponents too much, due to overlapping the Venn diagram prison yard allows).
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Triassic Terror: Promo Pack
description:
This promo item features 2 new Predator tiles and a Pterodactyl for your first player marker!

The tiles function by replacing the two predator tiles that are already in the game, and make these new predators that much more destructive and vicious.

name: Norsgard
description:
Norsgard; is a tabletop wargame set in the cold realm of Isbran - a land of ice and fire. The players in this game play out the skirmishes of small bands of warriors led into battle by heroes.
"During the game the situation changes rapidly - until you have secured your victory, you can never be sure of it. React to your opponents actions, block their charges, and keep them from blocking yours at the crucial moment. Play Special Cards to turn the tide of battle to give yourself the advantage and when combat commences, choose the right Tactic and push your enemies onto the defensive. From turn to turn build your dominance and win combats so that the initiative stays with you. Press your opponent until you reach your goals. Together, create an epic battle in which every warrior plays their part!


"Never again will you have to depend on a single dice roll - in this game you literally roll a handful. Watch as they shape the fate of your warriors and thanks to simple, easy-to-learn mechanics you will be able to concentrate on your strategy instead of trying to remember an obscure rules technicality.
"Create your own saga, direct your heroes, and influence their future. In many cases the players will decide the fate of their characters; in big tournaments and during fierce battles they may acquire legendary artifacts or gain experience - become a great leader, a fearsome warrior - or they may perish... Norsgard awaits it's heroes, and always remember:
Fortune favours the bold!

name: Broken Contract: Deep Underground
description: Broken Contract is a miniature adventure board game for 2-8 players. Indentured mine workers in a distant future rise up against the hired security forces of their corporate overlords and attempt to flee the mines. Each player controls one or more characters in a high tension escape attempt or in hot pursuit of the fleeing miners. Elements of RPGs, board games, and miniature wargames are blended together to give you high adventure without heavy overly detailed mechanics.

name: Von Moltke's Triumph: Fall of the Second Empire, 1870
description:
Von Moltke's Triumph recreates the decisive 1870 campaign of the Franco-Prussian War. Under Helmuth von Moltke the Elder, the German states used superior logistics, advanced artillery, and a strategy of envelopment to terrorize the sluggish and unprepared French.

Historically, it ended with the capitulation and capture of Napoleon III after a mere five weeks. The game slants historically but is intended for competitive play: the French will almost always lose the war, but a good French Player can win the game.

Amabel Holland's designs tend to have unusual combat or activation mechanisms, but in this game she utilizes a mostly traditional, odds-based CRT and Logistics-Move-Combat sequence of play. A liberal strategic movement rule allows for lightning-fast encirclements, while subtle differences in each side's logistic phase, organizational structure, and the rounding of combat factors reflect the doctrinal and technological differences that proved decisive.

name: Myth: MERCS Recon Kickstarter Rewards
description:
This is a set of Kickstarter Exclusive rewards for Myth that was part of the MERCS: Recon Kickstarter. These were stretch goals that were unlocked during the Kickstarter campaign and were part of the "Myth Pledge Level" and "Agent Pledge Level" (and higher pledge levels).

This set includes the following miniatures with associated cards:


Inquisitor Alger (Agent)
Hunter (Hero; 2 figures: Male and Female)
X-3ONE (Mini-Boss)
Infected (4 figures)


The Agent Hero, X-3ONE Mini-Boss, and Infected may also be used with MERCS: Recon and include cards for both Myth and MERCS: Recon. The Infected are the same as the Infected in the MERCS: Recon - Blood Contagion expansion (which is a Myth Crossover).
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Forged Realms
description:
Forged Realms is a simultaneous tactical dueling card game that plays in about 10 minutes

Players build an army from a large pool of spells and creatures including the Border Knight, Necromancer, Siege Troll, Crypt Wolf, Goblin King and more. You then have only 5 turns to try and drive your opponent from the battle field using tactics, scouting, speed, flanking, and combat

Each turn you will place one Creature or Spell faced-down in each open Rank on the battlefield at the same time as your opponent. When both players are finished deploying, you then simultaneously reveal cards in the same Rank and resolve the spells and abilities of creatures. The newest Rank also is called a Scouting Rank where the fastest creature outmaneuvers the slower creature and immediately deals its damage to the opponent. Finally, any creatures that were revealed in earlier turns do battle with each other to try and defeat the opposing creature in that rank. Once opened, the creature here can go right through and do it's damage directly to the player

Forged Realms is a game of planning, surprise, scouting, using abilities/spells and controlling ranks to try and defeat your opponent by lowering their armies moral to 0 in only 5 turns

With 4 factions to choose from in the Core Set, you have up to 10 combinations to make your army with. Each pre-built deck can be changed and built as see fit thus giving players hundreds of deck combinations
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Park DinozaurÃ³w
description:
A cooperative game for small children!

You are going to the Dinosaur Park with your family. But what is this? Dinosaurs scattered around the park and the meteor shower has just been announced on the radio.
Help the dinosaurs return to their catwalks before a cosmic storm begins.

Dinosaur Park is a game that evolves with children - after defeating the basic level you can struggle with more difficult tasks.

name: Crazy Cultists
description:
Crazy Cultists is a quirky, fast-paced, competitive card game where 3-6 players race against each other to summon The Dark One!

Gain the Unholy Adversary’s favor and thwart your competition by unleashing terrible hexes on them or by giving them a good ol' fashioned “Beelze-Beatdown”.

Players take turns either building favor with The Dark One by creating a Favor Stack, or sabotaging a rival cultist by playing Hijinx Cards. Favor Cards are stacked one on top of the other so that the corner number can still be seen. Once a player has reached 10+ Favor Points in his or her stack, the stack is discarded and that player earns a candle token.

It's a no-holds-barred free-for-all fight to be the first to light all 5 candles in your pentagram and usher in a thousand years of darkness!

—description from the publisher

name: Smoke & Mirrors: Deduction
description:
Did you see that? The magician just dropped a card out of their sleeve!

Smoke & Mirrors: Deduction adds a fourth set of cards to the main game. These 6 cards include one "mirror" and five cards with value "-1". This set's icon is an attention sign.


Released in the July 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Little Panic Island
description:
The cooperative party-game for children !

In Little Panic Island, children are immersed in a cooperative game mixing memory, speed and fun, all in… 2 minutes ! Progress together in this evolutionary game with 3 levels of difficulty.

All together, you have 2 minutes to find all Cro-Magnons and Dodods by flipping 2 tiles to try to have a pair. But be carefull, the monkeys have hiden funny traps to slow you down.

name: Egeo
description:
Egeo is based on the nautical battles of the Diadochi (sucessors of Alexander the Great). It is a typical dice game with combat between the fleets of the players. It can be played by 2-6 opponents (ideal 3-6) and it spends about 25 minutes.
Each player receives an equal set of cards with the typical ships of the period. Different boats can do different attacks (projectile, ram, ...). In their turn players select a ship and an attack, then with dices they decide if the attack is a success or not. Some attacks could be risky for the attacker, and their own boat could be affected.
—description from the designer

Egeo trata sobre las batallas navales de los Diadocos (herederos de Alejandro Magno). Es un juego de dados típico con combate entre las flotas de los jugadores. Pueden jugar de 2-6 oponentes (ideal de 3-6) y dura unos 25 minutos.
Cada jugador recibe un set idéntico de cartas con los navíos típicos del periodo. Diferentes barcos pueden realizar diferentes ataques (proyectiles, embestir con el espolón…). En su turno los jugadores seleccionan naves y su ataque, luego con dados deciden si el ataque tiene éxito o no. Algunos ataques pueden ser arriesgados para el atacante, y su barco podría verse afectado.
—description from the designer (Spanish)
categories: Ancient, Dice, Fighting, Nautical, Party Game, Print & Play

name: The Only Word Cubes
description:
The sequel in the popular series The Only Word - now on dice!

Call for your imagination and think of The Only One Word to describe several different images on the dice. It is a fast game, in which everyone plays for themself. Very compact, with handy components and easy rules, for any number of players – it is a party game which works great even on picnics or trips, as you do not need a table to play it.

Roll 9 special dice with images and put them on the colored game board, right in the box. Each player is dealt an equal number of challenge cards. The color code on the challenge cards indicates the dice on the game board. The task is to find a one-word association to describe (or bridge) 2 or even 3 images of your secret challenge task. The other players should crack the clue and guess right your dice. The fastest player to guess and the Cluegiver each discard 1 challenge card. The winner is the first player who got rid of the challenge cards.

The game is great fun! It sharpens your wits, hones your imagination and helps you to tune up with your friends.
The game also has cooperative and solo modes.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Deduction, Dice, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Induction, Solo / Solitaire Game, Speed Matching, Targeted Clues

name: Tiny Epic Zombies: Game Boy Geek Promo Card
description:
Promo Player Card, originally available through Game Boy Geek's 2020 Kickstarter campaign.

Human-side text: Game Time! When you end your turn in a Store with another Human, gain 2 *bullet*. (Courtyard does not count as a store)
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: ISO
description:
In ISO you will delve into a world of isometry where you will compete against your opponets for the completion of objectives in one of the 3 different perspectives.

It is for 1-3 players and lasts about 5-10 minutes per game, and it will most definitely be testing your conception of space and perspective. Control the three dimensions and be a step ahead of your opponents intentions to achieve the victory, or enjoy a rewarding cooperative challenge together.

Players will take turns playing the topmost tile of the pile, with the purpose of claiming some of the revealed objectives and not letting the other players claim them when their turns arrive. As soon as all tiles are placed, the game will end and the player with most points will be the winner.

May your eyes don´t play tricks on you while at it :)

name: Bittake
description: Bittake is a card game based on trick-taking. The cards in your hand determine "who" and "how many" bits you get. Win the game by guessing the bits to score points and collect the required number of chips as quickly as possible.

name: Nomad City: The Founders
description:
Nomad City: The Founders is a strategy game based on the Arknights universe featuring resource management, area control, and pattern building. You will play as the entrepreneurs who manage and develop Nomadic Cities, titanic mobile platforms that ensure the survival of civilization in this hazardous land called Terra, from the ground up. You will compete with rival entrepreneurs for resources and control of Pioneering Zone 105, gain trust from Columbian Union, and develop a prosperous Nomadic City.

Each player has a total of six main actions to choose from during each turn.

Deploy: Allows you to place your influence.
Allocate: Allows you to move your influence.
Explore: Allows you to discover resources in the wilderness.
Move City: Allows you to move your Nomadic City to show your influences.
Build: Allows you to build more structures in your Nomadic City.
Special Action: Through pattern building, you will unlock stronger special actions during your gameplay.


There are also 15 different characters from Arknights that will grant assistance for the players. The game ends after eight complete rounds with two turns in each round. After a final scoring of resources and area controls, player with the most VP wins the game. The winning entrepreneur will gain jurisdiction over Pioneering Zone 105 and become the true master of this place.
categories: American West, City Building, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Building, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Rhodes: The Colossus
description:
In Rhodes: The Colossus, the first expansion to Rhodes, players may help to build the great statue The Colossus. Whether it will be finished in time is uncertain, though.

This expansion brings more strategy and excitement to the game. Introducing 16 new development tiles, a new temple with high potential for players who enjoy developing their estate, a second production option, and of course, the construction site of the Colossus. The game play is extended to 90-120 minutes!

In order to build the Colossus, bronze is a vital element. It is quite a scarce element in the game, therefore creating more tension and smart playing with new interaction in the temple, the production, and the Colossus site. The bonus track of the Colossus creates extra incentives for helping to build the Colossus and it creates interesting competition.

As in Rhodes, The Colossus also creates interesting interaction and "cooperative" play, but still only one player can win this game. Now several tactics and strategies will give more options to the players to seize their victory in The Colossus.

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Nautical, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Pick-up and Deliver, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Trading, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Missouri (fan expansion for Age of Steam)
description:
Missouri is a fan made, print and play expansion that is detailed in this thread:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/360600

Missouri's only difference from the base game is simple geography, as it has no special rules.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Shinobi WAT-AAH!: Saitenza Promo Card
description:
Promo card gift during Cannes Fair 2014.

Yokai Panda called Saitenza to be added to the game.

The card is added to the game deck. Saitenza destroys all other yokais in play when it comes into play.

name: Bezzerwizzer Kompakt
description:
Not to be confused with bezzerwizzer kompakt. This version contains no board.

BEZZERWIZZER Kompakt is a new way to play BEZZERWIZZER that makes it easier to play on the go, at the beach or anywhere else for that sake.

The game contains 150 cards with questions in the same 20 categories as the original game, which means that they can be used as new challenges in the original game as well.

To start with the players are divided into two to six teams. Each team can consist of one or more players. Each team then gets a bezzerwizzer token that can be used once per round (see below).

Now the game starts: Each team picks a token at random out of the included bag. There are 20 tokens - one for each category in the game. The token must be kept secret from the other players. The first team to go then choose either to answer a question in the category on their token or to swap with one of the other teams, without knowing what they will get. If they answer the question that they end up with correctly, they will receive 3 points - a wrong answer does nothing. Scoring is kept on the included pad. This continues till all teams have answered a question. The last team will not have the opportunity to swap, as all other teams have used up their categories.

Each turn, each of the teams have one opportunity to bezzerwizze one of the other teams question. This means that if the team does not answer the question correctly, the team that has bezzerwizze'd has a chance to answer it as well. If the first team answers correctly however, the other team will have wasted their chance to bezzerwizze this round. The number of points you get for bezzerwizzing and answering correct depends on when you choose to do it; if you choose to bezzerwizze after the category is revealed, but before the question is read aloud you will get 2 points for a correct answer. If you do it after the question has been read aloud, you will only get 1 point for a correct answer. If the teams that bezzerwizzet can not answer correctly either, the original team will receive the points.

The turn order then switches one place and the process starts again. If there are fewer category tokens in the bag than the number of teams when a new turn is started, all of the tokens are returned to the bag.

The game ends when one of the teams has 20 points (continuing the round to completion to allow other teams to reach 20 as well). Alternately, teams can choose to only play until the bag is empty.

name: Tiki Island
description:
From the publisher:

There it is...the smoke bellowing from the mountain peak. It's been rumored for the last two generations. Lucky you. With a great BOOM the top of the mountain is gone and a brilliant red cloud of destruction has filled the void. There's no time to waste! Grab your Tiki, grab your four....err....three...oh no...TWO closest friends and get as far away as possible! You've heard rumor of another island, rich in abundance, on the edge of the horizon. Head to the sea and cross the ocean to find your new home.

Tiki Island is best described as a light strategy game with some...interesting elements thrown in. The goal is simple; get from one side of the ocean to the other. The only problem is that everyone else is trying to do the same, and the vast ocean is only so big.

Use your magical Tiki to build an island chain from one side of the map to the other. Try to avoid the other players, because along with the ability to build new islands, Tikis can hurl powerful runes and utilize devastating combinations to keep you from reaching your goal. Are you going to try for the tortoise or the hare approach? A complete path makes a world of difference...but then again, so does a well timed lightning bolt!

Using simple and intuitive strategy, Tiki Island was designed from the ground up to be a family experience.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Network and Route Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Lava Land
description:
Have you heard of Lava Land, a paradise island for tourists and explorers? There is plenty to enjoy: emerald plateaus with ancient temples, tropical fruit growing at every step, and the famous volcano erupting with lava… Wait, what?

On a tour to the main temple of the island, a rather nosy tourist pushed a peculiar lever… and the spirits of the island have awakened! You will be trying to save your lives and the relics of this island by outrunning the lava — with the help of the spirits, if you’re lucky, or hindrance… if not so lucky.

When (and if) you get back home, the World Island Culture Organization will happily accept your miraculously saved relics and offer a handsome reward for your bravery. On your way to the mainland, a continental breakfast you had in the morning will not be enough. Make sure to stash some food for the journey, but don’t drop your guard: your companions can fall victim to the mischievous spirits of the island and push you right into the boiling lava! Oh boy!



GAMEPLAY1. Picking up dice — Simultaneously
All dice are rolled, and each player must take any three of them — one at a time, with one hand only — as fast as they can.
2. Resolving your combination — Taking turns
Each player resolves all effects of their combination: advancing along the corresponding tracks, purchasing cards, activating traps, and advancing lava!



GAME ENDIf you have 7 bananas, you may enter the rescue boat.
When all players are either in the boat or out of the race, the survivor with the most relics wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Party Game, Racing, Real-time
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Kill Steal, King of the Hill, Player Elimination, Race, Real-Time, Take That, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: The Who, What or Where Game
description: Players are given a category, then secretly bid from $5-$50 of their winnings on their ability to answer one of three questions (Who, What or Where). Easy questions pay even money, harder questions can pay up to 4:1. Only the highest bidder gets to play, and if there's a tie, players tying bid back and forth, and can wager up to their entire stake. The tenth category allows each player to make one final bid up to all their holdings, and the player with the most money after everyone gets a chance to moderate wins.

name: Rudis: The Wooden Sword â Rules for Gladiatorial Combat
description:
A set of miniatures rules for gladiatorial combat to be played on a hexagonal mapsheet. For two or more players. There are three separate sets of rules included. Rudis 1 is basic hand-to-hand combat between small groups of gladiators. Rudis 2 is for larger and more spectacular combats. Finally, Rudis 3 is a set of chariot racing rules.

A small print run (200 copies) was done by the Bradford University Wargames Society. The first Tabletop Games edition followed around 1976, with a second edition (as revised by the designer) released in 1980.

name: D-Day: Normandy 1944
description:
Players play battles of Normandy in 1944.

Contents:
660 counters
59 x 84 cm map (printed in Japanese)
25 pages of rules (printed in Japanese) Northern part of France in 1944 is printed on a map.

Turn Length: 4 days
Unit Size: Battalion & Regiment
No. of Player: 1-3
Playing Time: 7 hours
Solitaire Suitability: Medium (on a scale of Low-Medium-High)

name: A Fistful of TOWs
description:
'A Fistful of TOWs' (FFoT) is a set of rules for modern miniatures wargaming. It is designed around 6mm (micro armor) scale miniatures with each miniature (or stand of miniatures in the case of infantry) representing a platoon.

The current version is designed around modern era wargaming. The upcoming 3rd edition will handle WW2 to the present.

A subset of the rules are available for free at:
http://fftows.blogspot.com/

name: Arrondissement
description:
1871; France has just lost the war with Prussia, which ended the rule of Napoleon III. Upon this loss the Parisians organized an revolutionary counsel, the Commune. To rule and control the city each arrondissement had its own elected counsel. ‘Government of the people by the people’ as Marx diagnosed its administration.
But this experiment was about to short lived, in may 1871 the regular French army made an end to the Commune.

In arrondissement the player place their influence in the arrondissements. At the end of each round two arrondissements are valued. The player with the most influence in the valued arrondissement receives points. The winner is the player with the most points at the end of the game.

The game is played in nine rounds in which all arrondissements shall be valued. A round begins with a voting phase, by majority of votes the players decide of which 2 routes an arrondissement will be valued at the end of that round (in the last round there is no voting phase, because the remaining 4 arrondissements will be valued). After voting all players play an influence card, and they have the choice of playing an action card. The last phase in a round is the valuation of the arrondissements and the order of play for the next round.

Arrondissement is a game in which planning, waiting and knowing when and where to take control, are the keys to victory.

name: Baltimore & Ohio: Technology Level Seven Expansion
description:
Eddie Robbins' Baltimore & Ohio: Technology Level Seven expansion extends the game into the 1940s and includes the Tech 7 Capital Equipment deck. This simple expansion not only extends the endgame but completely changes the game arc and timing. Seasoned Baltimore & Ohio players may find themselves rethinking how they expand companies and when to start new ones.

Baltimore & Ohio: Technology Level Seven is one of the two games and seven expansions from Winsome Games to be released at Spiel 2011.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: The Lord of the Rings: Strategy Battle Game â Mordor
description:
Mordor is home to the mighty armies of the Dark Lord Sauron, a place of darkness and destruction, watched over by the Great Eye, and bathed in the fires of Mount Doom. It is through the Black Gates of Mordor that hundreds upon thousands of Orcs march, their goal: to conquer the entirety of Middle-earth and enslave the people that live there. Led by the powerful Nazgûl and supported by monstrous Trolls, the lands of Elves, Men and Dwarves will all fall to the might of Mordor and its vast armies. It is only a matter of time.

This 48-page Sourcebook for The Lord of the Rings contains all the rules you'll need to field an army of Mordor, as well as detailed background information and scenarios.

You must possess a copy of The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game in order to use the contents of this book.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Pair of Ducks
description:
Pair of Ducks is a 2-4 player game of hidden roles. However, unlike other hidden role games, the player whose identity you don’t know is your own! Players wear their character card on their forehead.

Be the first player to get to 5 points by figuring out who you are. You can see who the other players are, and who they are affects how you play the game. For instance, if you see the Angel character, you must answer any question asked of you honestly. If you see the Ninja character card, you must not answer questions verbally (instead, use silent hand gestures and/or basic grunting). Based upon the way other players are answering questions, you should be able to figure out what character you are!

name: Moral Conflict
description:
IT IS A TIME OF DECISION!

Summer 1941

Will you relive or will you reshape history?

The stakes are high as you take your role as a leader of a great power in the darkest days of the 20th Century. The scene is set, will the Axis launch Barbarossa, the greatest military campaign in history, which set the course for the rest of the Second World War? You can sit on the sideline and watch as world events occur. You can co-operate with other players to defend and develop your lands, or you can trust no one but yourself, as you build up your power and influence around the globe.

Interact with your friends in 5 dimensions in this realistic civilization game, as you build up your strength using different resources and skills to gain advantage.

Set your heart and mind on one or more of the 5 dimensions.

MILITARY WAR: Great land, sea and air battles.

ECONOMIC CRISIS: Struggle for strategic resources and economic growth.

DIPLOMATIC PRESSURE: Coerce or persuade new nations into trade or war.

TECHNOLOGY RACE: Develop new weapons or industrial production breakthroughs.

MORAL CONFLICT: Join the eternal battle between good and evil.

How will you guide your power?

This inspiring game can be played in either a co-operative or non-co-operative way. In this fast moving non-turn based educational game, opportunities are continuously presented to make decisions and act. The rules you need to play are not difficult but to master the dimensions many skills are needed. Each dimension is learned one at a time and the rules are written to allow players to gradually add more dimensions. As the intricacy increases with added dimensions, you will enjoy the growing challenge to plan more strategically, think more long-term and more effectively leverage the inter dependency of the dimensions.

REALITY CHANGE GAME

As you take your path through the seasons and steps of this challenging lost world, it is like your walk through life, making decisions and developing new people and mind skills and even heart change. The challenge to grow in strength in the game, encourages learning in critical thinking and problem solving, in team work, negotiation, and strategy, which can change the attitudes and thoughts of both your mind and heart.

Write to info@playfordgames.com on the Playford Games web site to receive the improved 2019 rule book.

Complete with an extra strategy guide that provides inspiration and ideas to equip to survive the game and succeed in your every day conflict when the game is over.
categories: Civilization, Economic, Educational, Fighting, Modern Warfare, Negotiation, Religious, Territory Building, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Commodity Speculation, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Problem Picnic: Attack of the Ants â Picnic Basket Promo
description:
Kickstarter exclusive promo.

Play when you win a picnic card. Discard that card, look through the deck, and pick any card of your choice as a replacement to add to your colony.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Staropolski wokabularz
description:
„It’s 1893 AD. It has been almost thirty years since the fall of the January Insurrection, and the repressions of the invaders still continue. But the spirit of freedom still lasts in Poles…
Young conspirators are plotting against the oppressants by all possible means – the stake is the survival of culture, art and Polish language. In Old-Polish Glossary you take the role of plotters who want to remember about the Old-Polish language. Create sets of words and perform tasks in this marvelously – illustrated lexical memory game.”

Staropolski wokabularz ("Old-Polish Glossary") is a game for two people with about twenty minutes playing time. Players alternate taking turns. On their turn a player is manipulating his cards in order to gather a set of four cards of the same category one after another. Categories stem from various areas of medieval life (i.e. medicine, science, handicraft, cookery) which are represented on cards by Old – Polish words coming from medieval manuscripts. The game can be also won by realizing two out of four available task cards (in every game 4 out of 6 available task cards are being used). A player’s turn is based on action points. A player can spend them in five possible ways:

Take another card to their stand
Exchange cards within their stand
Exchange cards between stands
Reject a card from their stand
Peek at any card in the deck


What is interesting about Staropolski wokabularz is that players put most cards on special stands back to a player and what makes it easier to remember them are… colourful clips, which can be used to mark cards!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team â Magos Dalathrust: Adeptus Mechanicus Commander Set
description:
Always watching, always studying, Magus Dalathrust is an unblinking spider in the tangled webs of Megaborealis. It is his desire to unlock the secrets of the alien technology that lies beneath Vigilus’ skin. He has determined that the Skitarii kill team known as Gamma-Zhul 881 are the most likely of their kind to survive fierce resistance, and he has commandeered them as a bodyguard as he peels back the layers of mystery that shroud the planet – killing anyone that stands in his way.

Add a Commander – a powerful hero character with unique abilities and rules – to your Adeptus Mechanicus kill team with this set. It contains a multipart plastic Tech-Priest Dominus miniature, a set of cards packed with exclusive rules and a sheet of tokens for use in-game:

- A Tech-Priest Dominus: this multipart plastic kit is used to represent Magos Dalathrust – or the Commander of any Adeptus Mechanicus Kill Team you wish – a Tech-Priest augmented to the point of being almost entirely cybernetic, scuttling on several insectile legs which poke out from beneath a tattered robe; this only adds to the sinister air provided by his choices of armament with a volkite blaster, a macrostubber, an eradication ray, a phosphor serpenta and a power axe – his badge of office – and detailed with a microphone and loudspeaker
- A datacard for Magos Dalathrust, featuring his characteristics, weapons, abilities and specialisms, along with a card featuring his background
- A card featuring Magos Dalathrust’s skill tree – Tech-Priest Dominus specialisms which can only be used by that character
- 4 Adeptus Mechanicus Commander Tactics cards, including 2 Tactics exclusive to this set
- A sheet of tokens for use in games of Kill Team – this includes 1 Move/Charge token, 1 Fall Back/Advance token, 1 Ready/Shoot token, 6 Tactic/psychic power tokens, 3 wound tokens, and 3 objective tokens.

— description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: The Big Shuffle: A Film Noir Card Game
description:
The Big Shuffle is a film noir card game where you are trying to make your way in an uncaring city. You play a classic noir character who is trying to set up the perfect scene for their agenda. You have to play smart though, as it is easy for someone else to change the scene for their benefit also. Full of role playing opportunities, The Big Shuffle pairs well with a cigar, whiskey, and smooth jazz.

In essence it is a 2-4 player game where everyone gets a different set of win conditions and you are trying to stop the others from hitting theirs with the scene cards in the middle. You not only have to plan your turn to try and change it to your win condition, but also use your reaction cards to try and stop others from winning on their turn keeping gameplay interactive and interesting even when someone else is trying to swing things in their favor.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Interrupts, Move Through Deck, Negotiation, Role Playing, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Cinema Code
description:
There are illustrated cards that captured famous scenes from 80 different movies.

Cinema Code is a party game that players try to guess the movie card which is referred by the clues given by a presenter.

Game Play
(1) Set the movie cards to make a 6x5 grid.
(2) One player becomes a presenter and takes a ticket card which indicates a movie card on the table.
(3) The presenter draws a hint token from the bag and place it on any other movie card to give a clue.

There are four types of hint tokens: icons, colors, locations, and genres.
The presenter may give up to five clues.


(4) The other players look at the hint tokens and find 'the movie card' that presenter is trying to tell.

As more hints get drawn, the points players will get reduces.


(5) Replace the movie cards and the next player becomes a new presenter.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Mooncake Master
description:
Mooncake season is almost here! You and your fellow apprentices are gathering to see who can create the most beautiful mooncakes while catering to fussy customers.

Over three rounds, players simultaneously draw, share, and fit Mooncake quarter cards, creating beautiful mooncakes for judging as well as for selling to customers.

Mooncake Master is a light-hearted interactive puzzle game that brings gamers and families together, and not just for the mooncake season!
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Pattern Building, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tile Placement

name: Riiing!
description:
The alarm clock rings and you're already got up on the wrong side of the bed. Daily routines can sometimes put the brakes on your best days.

Burnt toast, slip in the shower and spilled coffee will slow you down in your race to start the day. Overcome all the obstacles, be the first to discard all your cards and win before the bus leaves without you.

Preparation
Shuffle all the cards and deal seven cards to each player. Turn over the top card from the deck to make the discard pile. The person who gets up earliest starts.

How the game works
When it is your turn, play a card from your hand on the last card played or, if you can't, draw a card from the deck. Then the turn passes to the player on your left.

To play a card from your hand, it must match the condition on the back of the top card of the deck (+,-,=...).

If you can't play a card from your hand because you don't have a card that meets the condition, draw a card from the deck. This changes the condition for the next player, and the turn then passes to the person on your left.

There are also some special cards that can be played at any time regardless of the condition shown on the top card (burnt toast, dropped soap, broken alarm clock...).

The game ends when a player gets rid of all the of cards in their hand. Now you're ready to get on the bus and start your day in the best way!

—description from the publisher

name: Gladstone's Games to Go
description:
Gladstone's Games to Go describes over 45 games, none requiring any special equipment beyond paper, pencils, and coins. The book is divided into the following sections:

I. VERBAL GAMES (no equipment needed)

II. COIN GAMES

III. PEN-AND-PAPER GAMES
A. General (Tic-Tac-Toe variants and Nim)
B. "Dots and Doodles"
C. "Hidden Secrets"
D. Word Games

Most of the games can be played by two players; some can be played with a large group, and others can even be played solitaire. Some of the games, like Ghost and Nim, are well-known: others, like Moka and Tri-Dots, may be less familiar.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Book, Deduction, Memory, Party Game, Puzzle, Word Game

name: Car Wars Arena Book 1
description:
Car Wars Arena presents 11 arena designs and scenarios to go with each of them. In addition, two new Division 15 vehicle designs and a large selection of counters (including small fold-up bunkers and towers) are included to make your games more exciting. Car Wars Arena also includes rules for AADA League Combat and Gold Cross Cloning.

Like the Car Wars Starter Sets, this book is designed to be taken apart. The inside front cover has two new Vehicle Sheets. The back cover has more counters for your game, including those needed for the two new vehicles. The center counter sheet includes fold-up bunkers (in which drivers and vehicle crew may hide) and tall TV towers.

Car Wars Arena is a supplement. You need at least one Car Wars starter set to play.

Part of the Car Wars Series.

Expands:

Car Wars
Car Wars (Fifth Edition)
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Schwarze LÃ¶cher
description:
A three-dimensional challenge - from solid wood

Is played on a lavishly designed game board made of solid oiled beech and the pieces being walnut and maple. Four wells, the "black holes", are refined with dark felt.

The aim is to bring the first player to own four of the pieces in the right position before the "black holes" and to sink. One's playing pieces may simply move by tilting, turning and by the black holes assisting.

Tactically, it is important to leave little room for paths. With little to block, their own movement may help their opponent.

name: Tannenberg: East Prussia, August 1914
description:
In August 1914, two Russian armies, Rennenkampf’s First and Samsonov’s Second, invaded the German province of East Prussia. The lone German army there, Hindenburg’s Eighth, had to rely on interior lines and railroads to concentrate against each Russian army in turn. This game focuses on the southern half of the campaign, with the northern half factored into the victory conditions. Those victory conditions vary with the strategic options chosen by each player so neither knows the other’s intent.

Tannenberg uses a modification of the Fire & Movement game system. Developed to portray the mechanized battlefields of a later generation, F&M stresses the use of rapidly-concentrated fire support to generate breakthroughs, followed by a rapid penetration by mobile reserves. In 1914, although railroads allowed the rapid shifting of forces on a large scale, no one moved faster than a man on foot on the battlefield, making exploitation ineffective. However, here both players have hidden movement, allowing them to concentrate in unexpected locations to surround and destroy isolated enemy units. The clumsy and inflexible fire support is represented by the artillery brigades available to division and corps commanders. It must be brought to the point of decision, then supplied to give it the firepower to affect the fighting.

The historical outcome at Tannenberg was the destruction of Samsonov’s army, but it need not have been so. Both players have options and can achieve decisive success. The player who makes the better choices, and backs his strategy to the hilt, will emerge the victor.

Details:

Level: Brigade
Hex: 3 miles (5 km)

name: DANGEROUS Board Game
description:
Contents such as games, manga, novels, etc. being deployed "Battle destruction school Dangelos"
Together with 34 manga artists and illustrators, this is the first board game created by the original author!

â  Details
Worker Placement x Deck Building x Dice Battle!

The player becomes a "transfer student" who has been appointed to annihilate the devil, and gets into the Majin Gakuen where the Student Council and the Bancho Group conflict!

Score the character's demonic spell, add one after another to your friends and strengthen your strength!
Using 12 kinds of items, destroy the boss, with further strength in hand,
At the end play a death match which washes the blood with deck and blood blooded by other players!

Make full use of the capabilities of various devils, overwhelm your other players with a combat, a brutal crucifixion combo.
Wisdom and luck and overwhelming firepower divide victory and defeat. Those who were standing on the battlefield until the end, the only one is the winner -!

—description from the publisher (translated)
