—description from the publisher

name: Magic: The Gathering â Avacyn Restored
description:
The archangel Avacyn has returned! Backed by a flight of angels overhead, humanity takes up arms to finally drive back Innistrad’s creatures of the night.

The Avacyn Restored set features 244 black-bordered cards, including randomly inserted premium versions of all cards in the set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Ice Tumble
description:
Players take turns rolling the die and taking ice blocks from the center of the game area based on the die roll (1 block, 2 blocks, take 1 from an opponent, etc). When you remove a block from the center, you may only use one hand and can not have any other piece move aside from the one you are taking. If that happens, you must take another block as a penalty. Continue to go clock wise rolling the die and collecting ice blocks until they are all gone. Then phase two begins.

Players roll the die and resolve which will result in placing 1 ice block, 2 ice blocks, or giving an ice block to an opponent.
If any part of the tower falls, all pieces go into the game box and that player must take 2 of them and add them to their supply.

Play continues like this until one player to successfully places their last ice block(s) and their fox pawn on the sculpture.

Game Includes:
24 Ice Blocks
4 Fox Pawns
2 Sculpture Platforms
1 Die
1 Game Mat
1 Storage Bag
1 Rules Booklet
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Physical Removal, Stacking and Balancing

name: Just Heroes
description:
As a hero defending the city, the player tries to fight off the attacking villains. Just Heroes is a must-follow trick-taking game, and the hero with the highest number in his suit is the one who performs the best attack.

The hero using the highest number of attributes (suits) is the most successful. If the total number of cards played is much higher than the villain’s resistance, the damage to the city will occur and the hero’s fame is reduced. If the total number of cards played is less than the villain’s resistance, all the heroes’ fame is reduced. The heroes, together, need to attack the villain “just right”.

In addition, heroes have an “attack limit.” No matter how powerful a hero is, they can’t keep fighting at full strength. If a hero keeps winning through trickery, they will become exhausted and collapse.

The winner of the game is the hero who “moderately” wins the battle against the villain and protects the city.

name: Within Walls
description:
Within Walls is a Paranoia driven hidden traitor game with social deduction elements set in the early 20th century horror setting. The gameplay is heavily focused on player interaction with intuitive rules that are designed merely as a catalyst for player interaction and serve the purpose to define available options.
You are agents sent to investigate an incident in a local sanatorium. Upon arrival on the scene you realize there is an impostor among you.
Your goal is to gather as much information as possible while making sure all witnesses remain alive for further questioning.

Move through the Story by drawing Event cards and playing them during your turn in accordance with your agenda, the mandatory play means you will be faced with several bad choices - in this game most choices are bad. As the story advances more and more clues are found about the traitor, however reaching the end of any story Act with the traitor alive means that the agents lose the game. The traitor(s) must be stopped before reaching the completion of his mission. A unique story progress board is used to mark the progress of the team as a whole while individual Mind sheets follow players' descent into inevitable madness.
The game ends either when the Agents win by discovering and eliminating the Traitor or when the Traitor wins by either eliminating all Agents or reaching the end of the story and completing his goal.
The special 2 player game mode keeps the suspense, social deduction elements and paranoia with only minor rule changes.
Included is one Investigation focus die made of wood, as imperfect as the world you are playing in and unique,, again.. as this world.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Events, Hidden Roles, Role Playing, Traitor Game, Voting

name: Eight Epics: Hakkenden
description: Shin Satomi hakkenden (æ°éè¦å«ç¬ä¼, literally "New Legend of the Eight Dogs of Satomi"), aka Eight Epics: Hakkenden, is a licensed version of Seiji Kanai's Eight Epics that draws on Toshio Kamata's 1982 novel of the same title – which was also the basis of Kadokawa's 1983 movie Legend of the Eight Samurai (éè¦å«ç¬ä¼ Satomi hakkenden) – for its setting, with players trying to use the dice-manipulation powers of the eight characters in the game to chase away evil spirits.
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Renaissance

name: Shanghaien: Crazy Captain
description:
This is part 9 of the Abacusspiele Catalogue edition.

With the two Crazy Captain extra cards you are able to control your opponent a complete round by blocking several actions.

You can find the catalog here: http://www.abacusspiele.de/neueseite/katalog/index.html
The extra cards are on the last page

name: Creature Features
description:
Creature Features is a Monopoly-style game in which the players attempt to make a fortune through producing classic monster movies, using actual films and stars from the twenties through the early seventies. The relationship to Monopoly is so blatant that at the start of the rules (and in the rules' largest font) is this quote: "This game plays similarly to the famous Monopoly game."

The board features a rectangular track with spaces for each movie featured in the game (akin to Monopoly properties). There are also Tombstone Award and Dead or Alive spaces (causing card draws, as with Chance and Community Chest in Monopoly). Finally, there are Ghoul Agency spaces that allow you to draw and purchase actor cards.

As you travel around the board, you buy movies and acquire stars. There are two actors associated with each movie and upon landing on a Ghoul Agency space you draw three actors for possible purchase. You can attempt to buy any actors who are in a movie that you already own or, if none match, you may still choose to purchase one of the three cards drawn. The price of an actor card is determined by a roll of the dice, multiplied by a base dollar amount.

Completing a production (acquiring the movie card and both associated actor cards) requires other plays to pay you a fee if they land on the movie's space on the board (making the actors somewhat like adding houses to a property in Monopoly). Also, having a completed production allows you to draw a card when you land on an award space. If you win a major award, you place it on the movie and anyone landing there has to pay you a premium (similar to having a hotel on a property in Monopoly).
categories: Economic, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Events, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading
publishers: Research Games, Inc. / Athol / RGI / ARC

name: La Guerra Civil EspaÃ±ola (1936): EdiciÃ³n 2009
description:
This is a remake of La Guerra Civil EspaÃ±ola (1936) (The Spanish Civil War), which was published in Spain by NAC in 1981 and was problaby the first wargame ever published in that country about the conflict.

"La Guerra Civil Española (1936) - Edición 2009" includes both, the original version of the game and a completely new, more realistic version with a new set of rules. The components´ stuff and counter art have been improved over the old version.
This new version has been created by a group of NAC fans and is an amateur product. No other information have been made available about the re-design authors.

More info and pictures: http://www.laguerracivilespanola.es/

name: Snitch
description:
Snitch is a fast-paced game with social deduction and semi co-operative mechanics where players try to win the most money.

Each round one player selects the number of cards (characters) that must then be matched from the groups' cards (characters)- these are drawn from the deck and the players negotiate which cards (characters) they will contribute.

Each player contributes one card towards the pattern. If the players collectively complete the required pattern, everyone wins - if not, the group loses. Winners gain loot, the losers gain nothing - with the amount of loot determined by the number of cards matched. After 8 rounds, the winner is the player with the most loot.

There's always a chance though that one player was the Snitch - trying to make the group fail in order to win by themselves! The Snitch causes others to miss out on the loot, and steals some of their existing loot. Being the snitch at the right time is key to winning the game!

Players have a limited number of Snitch cards - when will you Snitch on your friends? When will they Snitch on you?! Everyone has to Snitch at some point...
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Negotiation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Battle of Ebro 1938: Spanish Civil War
description:
Game covers the battle of Ebro, the longest and largest battle of the Spanish Civil War (1936-1939). It was fought between July and November 1938, with fighting mainly concentrated in two areas on the lower course of the Ebro River, the Terra Alta comarca of Catalonia, and the Auts area close to Fayón in the lower Matarranya, Eastern Lower Aragon. The results of the battle were disastrous for the Republican forces, with tens of thousands of dead and wounded and little effect on the advance of the Nationalists.

Game uses brigade-battalion scale. One of the most important aspects of the game is to keep as many bridges on ebro as possible, since it's the only way for tanks, artiller and supply to cross the river. Nationalists may use their air forces to destroy the bridges, slowing the Republican advance down.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Ocean Crisis: Catastrophe
description:
Ocean Crisis: Catastrophe is the expansion of the main game, with brand new engaging missions and scenarios, including Oil Tank Spill, Beached Whale, and Ghost Nets; at the same time, we present the futuristic Ocean Vacuum Research Project. Will the research be in time to save our future? Get ready for the challenge!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Timeline: Louvre
description:
Which came first? The Venus de Milo or the Mona Lisa? From the early Cuneiform tablets to the filming of a Beyoncé and Jay-Z's music video, The Louvre's historical providence and prominent collection go hand in hand. See if you can remember when the The Louvre Pyramid was installed, or when Delacroix painted Liberty Leading the People. The artifacts of the Louvre have never been this much fun!

Timeline: Louvre takes the players through a historical tour of the Louvre. Each player has a hand of cards, and they take turns trying to place those cards correctly into the growing timeline. Guess correctly to get rid of all your cards and win!

Timeline: Louvre can be combined with any other title in the Timeline series.

—user summary

name: Bandido: MissÃ£o ImpossÃ­vel 2
description:
Use this super card in place of the one from the base game in order to make it more difficult to block all the tunnels and prevent the prisoner from escaping!

But be careful! Using this super card with 8 exits will make the challenge even more impossible!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Network and Route Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Les DÃ©bogueurs
description:
This game is a snakes and ladder kind of race with a twist.
Set inside a computer, the goal is to race from start to finish. Special face-down tiles are placed on the board with various chaotic effects. Movement is driven by cards and players will get attacked or powered up by viruses along the way.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: 1914: Opening Moves
description:
"1914: Opening Moves is a simple solitaire game where the gamer plays the German, and the game system plays the allies. The object of the game is to get enough victory points (VP) to win. VP can be gained by holding VP hexes on the western front (on the map, vs. the western allies), and through rolls simulating developments on the eastern front (vs. Russia). The gamer sets up, moves, and conducts the German offensives as he chooses. The game system handles the allies, who are generally on the defensive. Specific rules will instruct allied units about when/where to attack, how to retreat if a retreat occurs, and general movement directions. The game lasts a total of five turns, representing mid-August to early September, 1914, the most fluid period in the west during the Great War."

Panzerschreck Magazine, Issue 7, Winter 2001-02.
This solitaire "mini-sim" has a 5.5"x8.5" b&w map of the western front totaling 87 hexes. 48 black on white or gray counters need to be mounted for play.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Wizard Dodgeball
description:
Wizard Dodgeball is a sports game covering the annual all-star game of the Interplanar Wizard Dodgeball League (IWDL). Just like the dodgeball you know, the players who don't dodge the ball are eliminated; a caught ball eliminates the thrower, and the winner is the last team left on the court — but that's just the beginning as Wizard Dodgeball allows teams to throw spells in addition to balls. Boost your team, freeze your opponents, teleport balls back to your side, and watch out for fireballs!

In the game, players are dealt a team of five wizards each, and the turn order is determined by the order of the deal. Players then select spell cards based on how many spells their team can have. Each wizard has two action points that can be spent on moving, throwing balls, casting spells, or carrying out some combination of actions. Picking up or putting down balls is a free action.

Each wizard has a physical and magical range, and physical and magical attack and dodge bonuses. The outcome of throwing/casting and dodging is handled by high roll on d6s, with ties going to the defender.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing â Kyana Prime Expansion Pack
description:
This expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

Krenim Timeship Independent Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 14 expansion packs from WizKids Games.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: H.D.P. 3: Hasta Donde Puedas
description: Expansion that adds more cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Wizard: The Christmas Wizards
description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2015 for Day 15.

The four wizards in festive garb replace the usual wizard cards in your Wizard deck. Obviously, they are particularly suited for play during the holiday season. The rules remain the same.

There is also an 8 wizard variant.

name: Frontline General: Italian Campaign Introduction
description:
Frontline General: Italian Campaign Introduction introduces players to the Frontline General 'Land, Air, & Sea Tabletop Simulation', an Operational and Tactical Level WWII Consim. The system covers Land, Air, and Sea wargaming mostly at the Operational level with a tactical 'feel'. The Campaign may optionally be used to 'drive' more detailed tabletop miniatures battles for decisive engagements. Miniatures combat expands on the level of detail.

A basic Economic and Supply System challenges players to choose and supply an effective balance of Units for the objectives at hand. Event and Command Cards provide more options during the game. Team Play Command allows players to split turn responsibilities among a General and subordinate Commanders.

The introductory version of the 'Southern Italy Campaign' is the first release in a series and is available as a production version and free via Print & Play.
categories: Economic, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Keys to the Ice Castle
description:
Keys to the Ice Castle is a tile-based game of strategy and luck. Based on the Keys to the Castle game players choose a knight token and then race through a tile based maze to get to the other side.

By opening and locking doors (the tiles) each player can help him or herself while hindering their opponents. Use the special cards such as the axe, magic wand, slide, or freeze to add even more to the gameplay.

The game is easy to learn and quick to play. With the tiles acting as the "board", there is a new outcome to each game every time the tiles and cards are shuffled.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Take That

name: Hyper Roll & Write Railroads -Udon Infinity-
description: Hyper Roll & Write Railroads -Udon Infinity- is a roll and write game based on Roll & Write Railroads. In this map, players are developing their udon cooking skills and the points they gain each round are multiplied by their oden skills.

name: Golem Arcana: Zikia â Spirits of the Wildwood Expansion
description: The Great Khan is dead, plunging the world of Eretsu into total war as the Khan's heirs square off against outsiders and each other for control of his shattered Dominion. The combatants' most fearsome weapons are Golems, magically animated behemoths created and piloted by powerful sorcerers. Now it's your turn to take control of a Golem army to fight for the honor of your liege!
categories: Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Starving Artists: 5-6 Player Expansion
description: Expansion includes player references, player tokens, and rule changes sheet to increase the game of Starving Artists up to 6 players.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game

name: The Agents: Bounties
description: Get your rivals to do your dirty work. By putting a bounty on an Agent’s head, you can manipulate your opponents to do your bidding. This expansions forces you to enlist the help of other players to get the job done. But WHO is the job? This expansion also contains brand new, much requested, point TOKENS!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Space Ninja
description:
Where there is light, there is shadow. Beyond the millions of stars of the Milky Way, above the nations, politics and the conflicts of the people who live there, a force is operating. You cannot search for them. If you knew their secrets, you'd be dead. You cannot use them because you are the one being used. The overlords are ruling the universe. Even their existence is not confirmed, but people call them Shinobi...

In Space Ninja, the players command a group of Shinobi (Ninja) and try to manipulate the people of various planets. The game has four rounds. Each round, players decides which planet to send two of his/her shinobi to. Every planet has an independent government and individual powers and the planets interacts with each other in terms of population growth or decline. You can send out Shinobi to interfere with the politics on the planet and gain points by influencing them. At the end of each round, each planet's effect will be resolved, affecting its population, before scoring occurs. The top two player-factions with the most control (majority) will score according to the population. Each planet is scored sequentially. After 4 rounds and sending 8 Shinobi per player, the game is over. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: ALDR: The High Sage
description:
Long before sages battled in the arena, Aldr, the first High Sage, mastered the elements and passed his teachings on to his students. However, even the most powerful cannot train every day. Aldr himself created this game of strategy to reinforce sharpen their minds and reinforce is hard-won lessons.

ALDR: The High Sage is a card game unlike any other. Tactically place drafted cards to build the four elemental patterns before your opponents can. Place your sages strategically to restrict the options of other players, and move Aldr himself to further thwart your opponents. Be the first to place your four sages and claim victory in this unique card game of area control.

Although ALDR: The High Sage is a standalone game, rules are included to use ALDR as an expansion to Element!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Layering, Melding and Splaying, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Raffi Raffzahn
description:
The stolen jewels must be returned to the princess! To do this, Raffi Raffzahn makes his way through the forest to the mysterious castle of the wizard bear — but the little dragon runs the risk of being turned into a piggy on every space.

Raffi Raffzahn is a magical-magnetic memo game.

—description from the publisher

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Colony
description:
The third solitaire map for Age of Steam takes the game to a whole new level, mixing it with elements from other game genres such as civilization games. The game starts on a more or less blank map. The player arrives on an undeveloped island, a colony, and in 40 turns (!), he/she has to build towns, cities, railroads, et cetera.
There are very extensive rule changes in this variant, but still it is Age of Steam.
categories: Civilization, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Trains
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: ASL Comp: Hill of Blood
description:
MAMAEV KURGAN, STALINGRAD, RUSSIA, 27 September 1942: Acknowledging the damage done to his army in assaulting the southern and central sections of the city, General von Paulus had systematically reconfigured his forces for a fresh assault. Two shock groups were formed, with one consisting primarily of the 100th Jäger Division, whose task was to clear and control Mamaev Kurgan, followed by an advance into the Tennis Racket and the Bannyi Ravine and finally to occupy the Krasnyi Oktiabr workers' settlements. Paulus' counterpart, General Chuikov was well aware of these preparations and had planned appropriate spoiling attacks, though he was unaware of the fresh German reinforcements. His attack was disrupted before it could even begin, with waves of Stukas strafing his advancing forces. His strongpoint on the crest of the burial mound was destroyed. Bombs and artillery cut down the attackers, decimating their ranks and allowing the following German advance to gain ground. The jägers advanced two regiments abreast and captured the western slopes, but initially failed to take the southern slopes. The 227th Jäger Regiment's vigorous assaults, supported by intense artillery, destroyed the Russian ability to hold on. The Germans would secure the summit that evening (though some bypassed remnants would harass the Germans on the southern and western slopes for the next few days). By day's end, the 95th Division retained a foothold on the northern and eastern slopes of the burial mound, but was down to only 400 effective fighting men.

The Battle of Stalingrad has received no shortage of treatment in the wargame realm since Red BarricadesTM first focused the attention of ASLers on the factory complexes of the doomed city. No tactical-level game has ever treated the titanic and unique battle for Stalingrad's Mamayev Hill, aka Mamayev Kurgan ... until NOW. From the first thrusts of Hitler's Wehrmacht on 13 September to the last days of 1942 the hill changed hands time and again. By 27 September the Germans had again captured half of Mamayev Kurgan. The Soviets held their own positions on the slopes of the hill, as the 284th Rifle Division desperately defended key strongholds. The defenders held out until 26 January 1943, when the Soviet winter offensive known as Operation Uranus, relieved them, in the process trapping and destroying the German VI Armee in the tomb of Stalingrad.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Inventing the Future
description:
In Inventing the Future, players race to invent the flying car, teleportation and time travel. Whoever can best manage the bottlenecks of research, development and production stands to earn everlasting glory, fame and power.

To accomplish this, players must assemble teams to perform research, testing, and manufacturing. Specialist teams provide more powerful abilities. To support all of this, players must raise both public and private funding.

Each round six dice are rolled and players take turns drafting them, marking the corresponding intersection of number and color on their boards. In each row only one choice is possible. When all rows are filled, players execute the action phases, their type and order having been determined via the same dice.
categories: Dice, Industry / Manufacturing, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Variable Phase Order

name: Lords of Vegas: Mob Rules & Union of the Shakes
description:
INITIAL SETUP

These 2 mini expansions can be added individually or can be used in combination with each other depending on the type of game you would like to play. Put the desired markers face up on Frank Sinatra Drive.

TAKE OVER

If you fail to take over a Casino, you may choose to take one of the markers, use it powers and then place the marker in front of you face down to show that you have used it. You must be able to use the power to take the marker. You may not take any markers if you have a marker in front of you. Markers are intentionally limited.

MOB RULES

Mob Support - If you have fewer dice than the boss of the casino you just failed to take, you may immediately reroll 1 of your dice in that casino for free.

UNION OF THE SHAKES

Union Support - If you have more dice than the boss of the casino you just failed to take, you may immediately reroll 1 of your dice in that casino for free.

name: Voyage Home: An Odyssey
description:
The story of Odysseus' journey home from Troy starts with his fleet leaving Troy after the end of the Trojan war. As the captain of one of his ships, you must get your crew home to Ithaca, but complete a series of missions on the way home, whilst the Gods will Bless and Curse your ship.

Will you make it home wealthy, will you make it home at all?


Voyage home is an adventure game where you must sail your ship home after completing a series of quests! The other players are also trying to do the same thing, but each player will also play the part of the GODS. Some of the Gods are out to destroy enemy ships whilst other GODS are out to help your ship! Some Blessings, Curses and other effect spells are working in great combination with each other to help you complete the game before everyone else!


Gameplay Detail - The game is divided into two ACTS. ACT I is the main part of the game, ACT II is the end game, which may not involve all of the players.ACT I has X amount of turns, which is dictated by 10 "oversized" cards that are on display at all times on the table, they are randomly sorted before the game starts so that only one is visible at a time. Once all the "oversized" cards have been exhausted then the game goes to ACT II which is a sudden death ending to the game.

Phase 1 is made up of a card draw phase where players can choose to draw cards from the GODS deck (which makes up their hand during the game which allows the players to also play the part of the Gods themselves, they can play blessings and curses as well as effect cards that effect either other players ships, their own ships, other players, areas on the map or the general gameplay state (called Global effects). Phase one usually takes around 20 seconds.

Phase 2 is the Card playing phase where each player will choose which cards they want to play and then play them. There is a special order that cards are played in and a player order so players must all choose which cards they're playing first for that turn before all the cards are revealed. During this phase any and all cards that are played will also be resolved if possible. It's good to make up combos of cards in your hand, and then play them all at once, so that you can propel your ship more quickly through the quests. This is the most lengthy phase of the game. Some players may have larger hand sizes and will take some time to work out what they're going to play, and once cards have been played they need to be actioned. This could take 3 or 4 minutes per player to work through, depending on how experienced players are at the game and how many players there actually are.

Phase 3 is the movement phase where you will each roll your dice and move your ship across the map. You need to complete all 6 quests before you can head back to Ithaca. It doesn't necesarrily have to be ACT II for you to be travelling home to Ithaca if you have been so successful to have completed everything before then. However, it's quite unlikely that you'd be heading back so soon, considering the temperament of the Gods after all. Movement is important as other players can't land on the same spot as you, and ports can only be visited by two ships at once. Player order plays a reasonable role on how effective your movement phase is going to be, as does your dice roll. You can skip your movement phase to instead draw off a SHIP deck (another deck of cards) which enables you to upgrade your ship to enhance your ability in some aspect or another. Although movement itself is done in player order, it shouldn't take more than a minutes for each player to work out where to move their ship to once they've rolled their movement dice.

Phase 4 is cleanup. You will remove one of the "oversized" cards if required (which reduces the length of the game, you will also perform any other cleanup actions (some cards require you to perform actions during this phase. Then the player 1 ICON is rotated clockwise, so each players number order changes for the next turn. This phase isn't very complex and is usually over in a minute or so. It usually just involved an oversize card being removed and all the cards that got played this turn being discarded to the discard pile.

Quests and finishing the game: Each ship must complete all 6 quests before being able to return to Ithaca. Each ship must closely monitor it's supplies (which keep the crew well fed!) and crew number as well as its riches (GOLD!) as this may become very important as you endeavor to finish the game before time runs out!

To win you must be one of the players who made it back for starters! If players have not completed all 6 quests when ACT I ends, then they're lost at sea and take no further part in the game. There is some sudden death rules that effect the remaining players but as long as you make it back you have a chance to win! The amount of crew is the first factor in deciding a winner, whilst Gold is the secondary factor, but usually a winner is obvious!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: Tournament Fishing: The Deckbuilding Game â Locations
description:
In Tournament Fishing: Locations, experience new and exciting things as each game now feels even more like you are visiting a new lake!

During set up of the Tournament, each Lake Spot will get a random Location card tucked under it and all the Lake cards on that Spot will be modified with a unique effect. With 17 locations in the expansion, every game is a new adventure!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Memory, Push Your Luck

name: Building Sword as Soon as Possible
description:
In Building Sword as Soon as Possible, a.k.a. ãã«ãã¤ã®ã¤ãã, players each have their own set of six cards that depict portions of elaborate swords.

Each round, reveal one request card from the deck to show the one or two swords that need to be created. Players then race to arrange their cards the proper way — flipping and overlapping them as needed — to recreate those swords in front of them. Whoever does so first claims the request card, and whoever first collects five request cards or three cards bearing the same guild icon wins!

name: Circustar
description:
Circustar is a perfect filler game for your game night. Each round, players receives 5 performance cards and players can score once per each performance during the game. So you have to manage your cards and choose which performance to score in each round to earn best score.
But be careful! Other players may mess up your plan.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Academic Society
description:
In the 17th century, significant advancements were made in the field of science owing to the establishment of academic societies across Europe. As the leader of a faction within one such academic society, you must strive to earn prestige through your studies so that your faction can grow.
Myriad matters compete for your attention as you endeavor to maintain your influence in each of the sciences. Contributing to the kingdom’s growth by completing royal commissions, presenting your findings at conferences, and taking sabbaticals to gather knowledge in foreign lands are just a few of the tasks laid before you.
Will your quest for knowledge earn you prestige within your academic society and allow you to expand your faction?
c Society, you’ll compete to earn the most Prestige through the game’s three primary systems.

The first system involves the society board’s action spaces. Each round, you’ll place your scholars on various action spaces and perform the corresponding main actions.
Some action spaces allow you to perform a bonus action in addition to a main action; however, since there aren’t many of these special action spaces, you’ll have to anticipate what the other players will do and act accordingly.

The second system involves the management board’s influence track. At the end of the game, you’ll earn Prestige from the spaces occupied by your scholars on this track.
You can also choose to remove your scholars from the influence track and use them to perform actions starting from the next round.
Once removed, scholars cannot be returned to the influence track, forcing you to choose between earning extra Prestige at the end of the game or having more scholars on hand to perform actions with.

The third system involves the sabbatical tracks on your player board. Advancing your scholars along these tracks will earn you permanent bonuses.
However, scholars assigned to a sabbatical track stay there for the rest of the game, which means you’ll have fewer scholars available to perform actions.
Deciding if and when to assign your scholars to these tracks will require careful consideration.

As each of these systems involves your scholars, you’ll have to manage them wisely if you hope to emerge victorious.

name: Hordes: High Command â Gargantuan Might
description:
Bolster your armies with Gargantuan Might, the fourth expansion for Hordes: High Command!

Gargantuan Might contains 5 copies each of 16 different cards, plus 4 additional warlock cards, to bring new strategies to your Trollblood, Circle Orboros, Skorne, and Legion of Everblight decks.

Requires Hordes: High Command core set to play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Libra
description:
Libra symbolizes balance and harmony.

LIBRA was invented by Néstor Romeral Andrés on January 2013.

LIBRA is a 2-player board game of asymmetrical goals played on a hexagonal grid of any shape and size. Two players (MORE and LESS) share a common pool of stones in two colours. MORE will try to create as many groups of connected stones of the same colour as possible, while LESS will try to avoid that many groups from being created.

LIBRA combines these well known mechanics into a new interesting game:

- MORE vs LESS (asymmetrical goal)
- Group counting
- Placement of any colour

COMPONENTS

- A hexagonal grid of any size and shape. For beginners, a hexagon of 5 cells per side is recommended.
- A supply of stones in 2 colours.

The nestorgames edition will include around 200 stones in two colours and a hexagonal board (with 5, 6 or 7 hexes per side depending on skill level).

GAMEPLAY

There are 2 types of gameplay:

Duel: The game takes place over two rounds. In the first round, one player plays as ‘MORE’, the other as ‘LESS’. In the second round, the roles reverse. Whoever creates more groups playing the ‘MORE’ role wins the game.

Bid: Before the game starts players take turns announcing how many groups they think they can create, raising the number each time. The player that passes first plays as ‘LESS’, and the other player plays as ‘MORE’ and must create at least as many groups as she bid to win.

RULES

Starting with ‘LESS’, players alternate turns placing a stone of any colour on an empty cell of the board. The game ends when all the cells have been occupied (or by mutual consent).

Count the number of groups of connected stones for both colours. This is the ‘MORE’ score. Isolated stones are also considered groups.

name: ReFloristation
description:
ReFloristation: Best Buds is a new card game designed by Paul Harris and Published by Invincible Games.

Run your own successful floristry business in this clever card collection drafting and order completion game. Plant flowers, recruit and manage staff, visit the flower market for fresh cuts, and pack your orders off in your delivery van to earn enough money to beat your rivals’.

Choose efficient times to water your existing plants and complete the right orders to chain actions together efficiently. Can you make the best of the flowers you pick up?

ReFloristation: Best Buds is remarkably strategic and replayable; making clever choices to create the best combination of staff, and timing your moves for the best possible advantage make the game exciting and thematic. ReFloristation: Best Buds is suitable for gamers of all ages and abilities, whether you ever dreamed of owning a flower shop or not.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Trinity
description:
Trinity is an abstract two player strategy game where you can exercise your tactical expertise and pattern recognition skills to capture your opponent. The game is designed to be compact, yet engaging for ease-of-travel and making more use of downtime during your adventures.

Players have 5 tokens each and can either place a token, move a token, or place a dead space on the board. You capture your opponent's token by maneuvering your own to restrict their movement. The opponent then receives a dead space token to potentially turn the tides. A player wins when 3 of the opponent's tokens are captured.

-description from designer

name: Narcos Plata o Plomo
description:
In 1989, El Patrón declared total war against the government of Colombia, as well as the police and the army. He controls more than 80% of drug trafficking worldwide. His personal fortune is estimated between 25 and 30 billion dollars. Those who oppose him and refuse to be bribed are murdered by his men. He is one of the most powerful men in the world, and only the DEA and a small group of incorruptible local agents stand between him and his ultimate goal: to become the President of Colombia.

In Narcos Plata o Plomo one player takes control of El Patrón's empire while the other players have to cooperate to surround and capture him in Medellin before he gets enough influence to achieve his goal. For the law forces it is a race against time: the advance of El Patrón is implacable, so they must gather all their strength and recover control of the city comuna to comuna, cornering him before the elections turn him into the future President of the country and, therefore, untouchable to the forces of law.

—description from the designer
categories: Deduction, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Territory Building

name: KATATU
description:
KATATU is derived from a very old board game originating from the Roman Empire and passed down through Europe into Egypt and eventually to Southern Africa. Curtlin Toys and Games has created a unique version of the game which has roots to Nine Mens Morris, but has added diagonal lines to make it play better. KATATU is a 100% strategy abstract game that uses magnetic bees and grasshoppers as game pieces. The object of the game is to eliminate your opponents 'bugs' by forming 'three in a rows' or mills. By forming a three in a row you can then select an opponents game piece and remove it from the game board. Once you have gone through the stages of placing, sliding & flying the bugs you win if you have eliminated your opponent down to only two bugs (game pieces) so they cannot for a mill.

Re-implements:

Twelve Men's Morris

name: Pack O Game: Set 2
description:
Pack O Game is a series of easily portable card-based strategy micro games in a gum-sized tuck box with a variety of mechanics, complexity and theme. Each game is 30 cards size 1"X3" and a 1 sheet rules.

Pack O Game: Set 2 includes all 8 games from the 2nd set of Pack O Game from Perplext. This set includes: Orc, Gym, Rum, Dig, Box, Spy, Sow, and Boo.

name: On the Farm
description:
Welcome to life on the farm. As a fourth generation farmer, you take much pride in your livelihood. With this year’s state fair just around the corner, you know this is going to be your opportunity to show all that you’re the best. Unfortunately, the other farmers in your state want the blue ribbon as well. May the best farmer win.

On the Farm is a card game where players try to obtain the most valuable sets of the various animals on their farms by the end of the game.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Farming, Print & Play

name: Lokomoto
description:
Your career is going really well: you started out as a ticket collector on a small railway, then you were a train driver and later, as a railway engineer, you also learned the ins and outs of track planning. Now you are the director of the Railway Development Company! You decide what length of main and branch lines you build, and how expensive or special the locomotives that you put on them will be. Be the most skilful rail network builder and get your favourite trains!

During the game, players draw railway lines on the map sheet using their own colored markers. If you have several sections that are joined (they can also be branch lines!), you can redeem them for a train card with the same number as the number of stages. You can also earn extra points by matching different formations of shapes.
In each round you can decide to draw one line with your color. Or you can reserve two lines with dotted lines in your color which you can draw later and others cannot take from you. Or you can decide to use up your lines to buy train cards. If the lines spent for a train card match a face up shape bonus card you get extra points.
The game ends when there are no more empty lines on the map. Be careful because if you have lines left (dotted lines do not count) you get penalty points for each.

All the train cards in the game show a real train type that some day (or even today) was used on the Hungarian railway lines.

-description from publisher

name: Adidoku: Mona Lisa
description:
Adidoku is a new generation of puzzles with a fun mix of characters, places and phrases. Guess the connections and stimulate your brain !

To resolve Adidoku, distribute on a table all the pieces showing the "Pancho Villa" tiles side. Connect the pieces by checking the words and phrases that seem related. For example: connect "Speedy" with "Gonzalez" or "Mexico lindo" with "y querido".

Contains:
222 puzzle pieces
2 cloth bags
1 score pad
1 pencil
1 rulebook

name: No Caboose!
description:
No Caboose! is a serious game with a whimsical name that takes about 2-3 hours to play.

No Caboose! is not an 18xx game. It is not a crayon game. It is a unique game about the early years of railroad building in the 19th century U.S., with six railroads along the Atlantic Coast poised to build their lines to the Midwest heartland. Its main feature is a more realistic stock market model than any other game. The stock market in No Caboose! includes the effects of supply and demand due to stock trading, it embodies the effects of the nation's changing economic climate. Watch stock prices soar during economic booms! Watch those stock prices plunge during economic Panics. Players can buy stock to pump the stock price, or sell stock to depress the price. Players may choose a strategy of holding a diversified portfolio with stock in many railroads, or put all their money into one or two railroads.

Another difference in No Caboose! is that players are not railroad presidents and are not bogged down in the detail running a particular railroad. Instead, players are financiers who arrange the routes railroads build and arrange the merger of small local lines into the bigger railroads. That is, players are in the role of banker J.P. Morgan, not the role of president Jim Hill. Players can help any railroad build a new line, which earns the player stock and money for arranging the new route.

A player's goal is simple. Being a financier, the only goal of a player is to be the richer than any rival financier at the end of the game.

There are important decisions for players to make every turn, and players must watch what their rivals are doing. There are subtle strategies in selecting routes to build, stocks to buy or sell, and opportunities can be seized or missed. No player is ever out of the game, and victory in most games is in doubt until the final tally.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Supermoney
description:
Players speculate in six major world currencies with the goal of becoming the richest player at the end of the game. This is done by buying currencies, manipulating their prices by playing market cards, and striving to control currencies when they are revalued and bonuses are paid.

Similar to Acquire in that players compete for majority-holder bonuses, and can manipulate currency values by playing cards out of their hand.

name: Murder! Mystery! Mastermind!
description:
Murder! Mystery! Mastermind! (M3) is a modern brain-twisting take on crime solving and the deduction boardgame genre. The game is divided into two phases: the Investigative Phase and the Trial Phase.

In the Investigative Phase, players scour the city as the Detective, Police, CSI or the Widow to find the evidence, motive and witness of the crime. Once these are pieced together, the clues will point to the location(s), where the crime was actually committed. In this phase, you will feel the drama and suspense of a crime-solving novel or TV drama series, where each clue that the players reveal will lead to more clues and a deeper understanding of the murder. Players can also learn clues from each other privately while using their unique occupational powers to the fullest.

To make matters even more intriguing, you suspect that one of the players is actually the Mastermind behind the murder. It's a mad rush to the murder trial, and the Mastermind is doing his or her best to confound the investigations, with an ability to lie.

The fifth player will play the reporter – and true to form of the unrelenting paparazzi – will ambush players at locations to query them or shadow players and learn what they learn. Their objective? Get the exposé before the trial even commences.

At the trial, players will start presenting their accusations in court on what the murder evidence, motive, and witness are and where the crime was committed as well as the mastermind behind the murder. The trial will gradually build up to a scintillating climax where the player who has placed the most correct accusation tokens wins. However, if not enough of the case has been built up, the Mastermind will walk free. Will justice ultimately prevail? It's all in your hands – or brain.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Micro Civilization
description:
The object of the game is to build your civilization from humble beginnings to greatness. At the end of the game you get victory points from Prestige icons that your civilization has collected, and also from the longest Wall your civilization has built.

There are four starting civilizations to choose from: Rome, Greece, Babylon and Egypt. Each turn you may add a card to your tableau, using a unique mechanism of partial overlap. However you must make sure that your civilization produces enough resources of military, science and gold to cover its own growing needs. You may also collect prestige icons which have no effect during the game but convert into victory points at the end of the game. Each card also has a piece of wall on one of its 4 sides. By placing the cards in a certain way, you might be able to build a long wall and score a lot of points. But keep an eye on your opponent's military strength, lest she attack your developing micro civilization.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Civilization, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Tile Placement

name: Magic: The Gathering â Fate Reforged
description:
Khans of Tarkir is a Magic: The Gathering block consisting of Khans of Tarkir (September 26, 2014), Fate Reforged (January 23, 2015), and Dragons of Tarkir (March 27, 2015). The block's setting is based on a mix of cultures of Central and East Asia. It is the last block to have three expansion sets.

Tarkir is the birthplace of the dragon-worshipping planeswalker Sarkhan Vol, first introduced in Shards of Alara. At the beginning of the Khans set, Sarkhan returns to Tarkir and learns that the extinction of Tarkir's dragons was linked to one specific event. Some thousand years ago, there was an epic battle between two dragon planeswalkers: Nicol Bolas, one of the greatest manipulators in the multiverse, and Ugin the Spirit Dragon, who helped trap the Eldrazi on Zendikar. Now that the Eldrazi have arisen again, both Sarkhan and Sorin Markov have arrived on Tarkir, the last known location of Ugin, in search of his help. Discovering that Ugin is dead, Sarkhan resolves to travel back in time and save him. His travels in the Tarkir of 1,280 years ago are chronicled in the set Fate Reforged. He finds a world where the five human clans do not fight each other, instead fending off constant attacks from Tarkir's many dragons; the clans still model themselves on a particular quality, which is epitomized by a Legendary Dragon creature whom each clan reveres and strives to emulate. The set focuses more on the color at the center of each wedge and its ally, with the enemy color given very little presence. The dragons who serve as the inspiration for each clan have their own watermarks, which are modified versions of the clan sigil. Additionally, Morph is missing; instead, a mechanic which is described as being Morph's precursor, "Manifest," allows players to put any card face-down as a 2/2 creature, and flip them again only if their obverse was a creature to begin with.

The Abzan Houses (White, Black, Green) are led by Daghatar the Adamant, an aloof and analytical leader. They revere Dromoka, the Eternal. In the past, their mechanic is "Bolster," which lets players strengthen the weakest of their creatures.
The Jeskai Way (Blue, White, Red) are led by Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest, who seeks to preserve knowledge. They revere Ojutai, Soul of Winter. They retain the Prowess mechanic.
The Sultai Brood (Black, Green, Blue) are led by Tasigur, the Golden Fang, an indolent and spoiled prince. They revere Silumgar, the Drifting Death. They retain the Delve mechanic.
The Mardu Horde (Red, White, Black) are led by Alesha, Who Smiles At Death, a transgender warrior who managed to negotiate a position as equals for her clan. They revere Kolaghan, the Storm's Fury. In the past, their mechanic is "Dash," which allows players to cast creatures at reduced mana cost, but with the added corollary that the creature must return to hand at the end of the turn.
The Temur Frontier (Green, Blue, Red) are led by Yasova Dragonclaw (all Temur khans take the title "Dragonclaw"), Sarkhan Vol's first friend in the past, who dreams of a world where the humans of Tarkir are no longer prey to dragons. They revere Atarka, World Render. They retain the Ferocious mechanic.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: è»¢ããèæµ (The after story of "Shibahama")
description:
è»¢ããèæµ (The after story of "Shibahama") is based on a human-interest rakugo vignette named "Shibahama". The title "è»¢ããèæµ" (pronounced "Korogaru Shibahama") means "Rolling Shibahama", and the game has area control and resource management mechanisms and uses action dice.

You are an industrious fish merchant in Edo (ancient Tokyo). You used to be a lazy drunkard, but with a support of your wife, you have changed your mind and successfully abstained — but you cannot force your employees to abstain, and sometimes booze is required to keep business relationships. Are you able to manage your business while staying away from temptation?

You roll and place novice-worker dice and senior-worker dice on the game board to obtain fish, but you have to use these fish early because they gradually decay.

•••

publisher's summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Set Collection, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: AiaGaia
description:
AiaGaia is an hilarious, fast paced party game, appropriate and enjoying for children, and funny for adults and gamers. The game is entirely language independent.

Players try to score points by putting in play the animals of a farm, or special characters like the Farmer and his family, playing Foxes and Moles against other players, and trying to avoid the terrible black Wolf...

Every card in play has a value in points, as every card in hand entail a penalty...
In addition, many animals (and all the characters), have special "effects" based on the other cards on the play field...
But beware! When you put a card in play, you have to simulate the "voice" of the animal (or character) on the card: if you forget, or if you mistake, the card jumps back in your hand, and you lose your turn!

High interaction, many laughs and a bit of tactics are the recipe of this game, designed by Marco Valtriani and illustrated by Angelo Porazzi.

THE GAME IS OUT OF STOCK and will not be reprinted. It has been restyled (rules, graphics, illustrations) and published by Red Glove.
New page here: http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/165651/merry-yard
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Firefly: Out to the Black â Serenity Bonus Pack
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Think you've mastered the 'verse in Firefly: Out to the Black? Well, not so fast my friend as you can now expand your game with the Firefly: Out to the Black – Serenity Bonus Pack, which adds more than 15 new cards that are focused on the characters you have in play. Will Jayne get greedy and hump the mission, or will River be able to read the hidden cards before they get played? You never know what may happen when you're out in the black!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Area 1851: Express
description:
Area 1851: Express combines card drafting and set collection in the Wild West, where aliens have landed and are trading technology with the local natives and settlers to create out-of-this-world gadgets with comical modifications that are sure to bring lots of laughter to your game night.

During the game, each player will spend three rounds drafting cards to build and modify gadgets. Doing so will provide them with Reputation (points) as well as various bonuses ranging from extra Reputation up to tokens that provide special abilities on later turns.

At the end of three rounds, the player that has managed to earn the highest reputation wins.

-description from designer
categories: American West, Card Game, Real-time, Science Fiction

name: Zulu: Ulundi
description: Under the hot copper shield of an African sun, clouds of white and grey smoke rose over the battle field of Ulundi: the massed crash of British Imperial infantry rifle fire was decimating the ranks of Cetshwayo's Zulu Army of twenty thousand warriors. Wave after wave of Zulu might flowed against the bulwark of Imperial infantry, only to be drive back by the combined forces of rifle, machine gun and artillery fire. As the smoke rose into the different sky on that July day of 1879, the hopes of the Zulu nation for independence from Imperial rule went with it, dissipating into the realm of what-might-have-been.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Simulation, Square Grid

name: Oddball Aeronauts: Snowtide Mercenary Cards
description:
Snowtide Mercenary Cards is a mini-expansion for Oddball Aeronauts and/or for Oddball Aeronauts 2, which contains 5 cards. It was a paid add-on during the Oddball Aeronauts 2: Double the Trouble Kickstarter campaign in 2014. The 5 cards are: Fir Fae, Flurriers, Snow Heralds, the Dragoneer, and the Drift Patrol.

From the Kickstarter page:
"But, not to be outdone, the Fir Fae witches have been weaving their frosty spells and have conjured from the icicles on the Snowmaker’s runners a Snowtide add-on (...) you can get your grubby paws on 5 Snowtide Mercenaries, including a new Dragoneer!."

name: School of Sorcery: Wizard's Consolation Pack
description:
This is a mini-expansion pack for School of Sorcery, originally offered during the Kickstarter campaign for the base game. The pack is not "Kickstarter-exclusive," but it must be purchased separately and directly from Dr Finn's Games, if not acquired during the Kickstarter campaign.

The pack consists of 5 cards with strong special powers. If you lose a sorcery card during Phase IV and you have a crystal on it, you can get a "consolation card" which can be used one time in place of one of your permanent powers.

name: Yaburo Quest
description:
Yaburo Quest is a game for at least two players in which you tear a sheet of paper into tiny pieces to represent your attempts to defeat the monster of the current round. For instance, you may have a goal card that shows purple bows and arrows and a purple monster. You score points if you tear off a piece of paper that has exactly one such weapon and one such monster — and more points if it has one such weapon and two monsters.

Players tearing their sheet at the same time during a two-minute round, and they get only one sheet of paper to use over four rounds.

On the back of the sheet are treasures, coins, and ghosts that can provide positive or negative points. Try not to rip them when you're focusing on the front of the paper.

The player with the most points after four rounds wins.

name: Doctor Who: Invasion Earth
description: A miniatures game set in the "Doctor Who" universe, recreating various scenarios in a Dalek invasion of Earth - also includes rules for a campaign game. General miniature mechanics for movement, firing arc, line of sight, cover, etc., with templates for various characters from the TV show plus generic UNIT soldiers and Daleks, and specialized rules for equipment particular to these characters. Box contains a 35 page rulebook; six sheets of firing-blast-measuring templates, counters, and cardboard buildings to be assembled; one blister box of UNIT soldiers and one of Daleks; and two dice.
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Stars *n* Bars
description:
STARS *n* BARS is a regimental level miniatures game for the American Civil War. It draws heavily on the EMPIRE 3rd edition Napoleonic miniatures rules (co-designed by Scotty Bowden with Jim Getz). The rules emphasize the importance of command and control issues and the balance between tactical and grand tactical thinking on the battlefield.

Contents include:

Spiral-bound rulebook
Color-coded reference charts
Die-cut order counters

name: BOBO BOBO
description:
It is an ingenious, simple and strategic game, in which you must use your creativity to make the opposing team believe your lie.


Form 2 teams (red vs. blue).
Deal 16 cards to each team.


Step 1: each team draws a card and isolates itself to make up 2 false answers to the question on the card. These answers you will have to write them down on the sheet next to the correct one.

Step 2: when both teams have prepared all their answers, they will come together. Turn by turn, each team shows its question to the opposing team. The answering team has to place their counters on the answer they think is correct. It must place
all of its counters, but they can distribute them among several answers in case of doubts among the team.

The correct answer is then revealed: the team will keep only the counters that they have placed on the good answer, while the good answer, while the rest will be taken out of the game.

Step 3: when the 2 teams have played, we start again from step 1. To answer the next question, you will only have the counters you have been able to keep!

The first team to run out of counters loses the game. In case of a tie, start a new game again!

name: Pirates Dragons Treasure
description:
Pirates Dragons Treasure (PDT) is a competitive tabletop card game for 2-6 players. Take on the role of pirate captain and race to be the first to defeat the dragon!

Dish out devastating curses, claim valuable bounties, recruit pirate crews and equip your ship with powerful upgrades to increase your odds of victory. PDT is a lightweight, swashbuckling adventure that’s easy to learn and quick to play.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Bribery, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Singing, Trading

name: Seriously!?
description:
Seriously!? is een snel kaartspel wat makkelijk te spelen is, maar moeilijk te beïnvloeden. Dat laatste creëert veel speelplezier en af en toe de behoefte om heel hard 'SERIEUS!!' te roepen.
Door kaarten uit je hand te spelen probeer je op de beste score te eindigen. De monsters op de gespeelde kaart bepalen hoeveel stappen je verzet op het scorebord en in welke richting. Actiekaarten zorgen voor leuke en speelse twists, waardoor je je het hele spel zult afvragen wie er nu uiteindelijk gaat winnen.

Het spel kan op twee manieren eindigen en dat heeft weer invloed op de eindscore. Je positie op het scorebord kan namelijk in pluspunten geteld worden of in minpunten.

Dit spel biedt Seriously veel speelplezier aan 2 tot 8 spelers. Daag iemand uit voor een chaotisch 1 op 1 spel of val van je stoel van het lachen als iemand net heeft ontdekt dat ze een negatieve score hebben behaald in plaats van te winnen. Verwacht het onverwachte!

ENG

Seriously!? is a fast-paced, easy to play but hard to control game that ensures tons of fun. Move around the scoreboard by playing cards from your hand. The monsters on your card determine how many steps you move and in which direction. Action cards provide fun twists which will keep you guessing throughout the entire game who will win.

Steer towards one of two unique endgoals, but be prepared for the rules to change at the last second. And if someone else wins, you earn yourself the right to shout out "SERIOUSLY!?" at the top of your lungs.

Seriously!? is a lovely game for 2-8 players, which is played in rounds of mere minutes. Enjoy battling in a chaotic 1v1 or die of laughter together when someone realizes they've just gained a negative score instead of a win. Expect the unexpected!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Number, Party Game

name: The Addams Family: A Delightfully Frightful Creepy Board Game
description:
Two to Seven ghouls compete in a race around the Addams family mansion to finish tasks (collect tokens) so they can enter the path to the swamp and arrive there first!

Along the way fellow family members may try to trick you into helping them via possession, push you backwards when they land on your space, have a roll-off with someone to win tokens... or perhaps the mansion itself may try to trap you. Visit the cemetery, the haunted tree and more grotesque locations on your quest!

name: Krosmaster: Arena â Season 1 Alternate Terrain and Demonic Rewards Tiles
description: This is a small expansion that was included in the first Kickstarter package. It contains alternate Trees and bushes for use in Krosmaster: Arena, as well as new "Demonic Rewards" tiles not available in the base game.

name: DC Deck-Building Game: Gypsy Promo
description:
Originally Given out to winners of selected events at Origins and GenCon of 2017. Said to later be a prize of Organize Play for stores.

This promo is designed to work with mechanics from DC Deck-Building Game: Crossover Pack 6 – Birds of Prey.

This Promo is a Hero Card, with Cost 2, and Worth 1 VP.

Card Text:

Ongoing: When this card rotates upright, draw a card and this card gains a card type of your choice this turn.

Each time you play a card that shares a card type with this card, rotate this card 90° Clockwise.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zooloretto: Kea
description:
An expansion for Zooloretto, given for free by Abacus at Spiel 2016 in Essen. This expansion consists of 1 tile with a Kea.

Use the normal rules for Zooloretto, except for one rule: the first player to fill his 6-space enclosure takes the Kea enclosure from the middle of the table.

The owner of the Kea enclosure may give away 1 coin to any other player as an action, if he additionally places 1 coin on the Kea enclosure.

Scoring: At the end of the game the owner of the Kea enclosure scores 1 point per coin that is present there.

name: Konradin oder Interregnum
description:
Konradin oder Interregnum is a medieval multi-player board-wargame recreating the European Medieval area from 1250 to 1348.
To win you have to fulfill player specific victory conditions that are drawn at the beginning of the game.
You can make alliances with other regions when you help them in conflicts etc., you can siege cities, vote the new emperor etc.

name: The Great Migration
description:
During the nineteenth century, settlers expanded rapidly across North America, from the eastern seaboard all the way to the west coast. Players' pieces represent the wagons of a bold family just arrived from the Old World and working to reach the west coast. Performance is based not on how well any one wagon does, but on how well players manage all of their wagons.

The game is played as a trick-taking game. The goal of the game is to advance wagons as quickly as possible. Every trick scores movement points. These points propel wagons across the board.

Every hand also features a hand evaluation step. Bidding a hand correctly scores extra movement points. Missing a bid scores nothing.

Blocking is also an important element of the game. By placing wagons on the game board’s prime paths, players can force each other to either go around or give up some of their precious points to push opponents forward and out of the way.

This game has been self published (at prototype quality) in an edition not to exceed 200 copies.
categories: American West, Card Game, Racing, Travel

name: Libero
description:
Abstract Soccer Game played on a grid of squares. Each player has eleven wooden tokens - nine basic ones, one libero (sweeper) and one goalkeeper. Each piece has a small dent on top so the ball can be placed on it.
In a turn, the active player can pass the ball as many times as s/he wishes, in a straight unblocked line (diagonal, too), and move one piece. Regular pieces move any distance diagonally, while the libero can move orthogonally as well (same as the goalie, who is restricted to the box, though). A piece that reaches a field adjacent to an opponent piece with the ball can grab the ball. Goals can be scored if a piece that is not offside can play the ball into the goal in a straight line.

One half time is played until a player has scored three goals. After two half times, the player with most goals is the winner (in case of a tie, an extension is played).

name: Colliding Circles
description: Board is a series of circles, nineteen interlocked, each with six circular spaces. Each player has a hand of five dice which are placed on the circles.By forming number patterns with your circles you score points. What's particularly interesting is that you can move the dice-pieces and in so doing change the numbers. This is a highly original, uniquely interesting game, with a number of innovative mechanisms that flow nicely together. It's a territorial game, slightly reminiscent of GO, but with an engaging, even exciting random factor (each turn you throw one or two dice to replenish your hand).

name: Lancer
description:
"Lancer is a fast-moving strategy game that combines the best parts of checkers and Chinese checkers, with original variations of its own. It is played on a board of hexagons, so that movement and capture can take place in six different directions. Any number of captures can be made in one turn and pieces may jump over their own men. The game includes two playing surfaces, one on each side of the board-one for two players, one for three players"
-from rulebook

Re-Implements:

Astro Blitz

name: Philately
description:
A Monopoly clone stamp collecting game. There are 4 sets of 40 different stamps plus 10 spares. Players roll the die and move around the complex track, buying, selling, swapping, collecting, inheriting stamps or gaining cash. Display your set in an album as you go. No designer is named, but my box is signed by Tina & Stef (?) Dixon.
The stamps are nice.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Captivation
description:
[from the box]
The Game of Define and Conquer

Needing just one more ring to win, you are contemplating the best tactic to invade that last territory. Just then a juicy prize happens by — an opponent's pawn carrying the ring you need. It's a complex and delicate choice. At times this rival has seemed capable of besting Webster in a war of words, and an ambush would surely bring retaliation. On the other hand, your strategically saved Move Card just might help...

Staged on a battlefield of colorful, intertwining paths, Captivation is an engaging contest of word power and shrewd strategies. Players invade neighboring territories seeking to capture prized rings through a display of vocabulary finesse. The words will fly and the best laid plans fail on the precarious, fun-filled journey home.

The Game of Define
With an emphasis on practical but challenging words, the Captivation questions allow players to test, show off, and maybe even improve their vocabularies.
The questions are carefully crafted to be deceptive, thought-provoking, subtly amusing, and, on occasion, outrageously funny.

...and The Game of Conquer
But this is not strictly a word game. Even the finest definer must constantly re-evaluate the ever-changing strategic situation. Plotting the best course, out-maneuvering opponents, deftly utilizing Move Cards, and a little luck are equally important. The mission is simple, but the path to victory spans a perilous field of shifting fortunes, startling surprises, and captivating fun.

name: Murder Ã  la carte: A Deadly Design
description:
From the box:

The mystery - The Queen of High Fashion, Francesca Baldini, created a Spring collection to die for. Unfortunately, she was found dead at her elegant FAB couture house. Around her are the slashed remains of her Spring collection. Accessorizing the scene is a footprint in blood near her head. You and 5 others are woven into the fabric of this murder. This is a tale of high society and high fashion. It will seduce you into the seamy side with a deadly combination of violence and vogue.

The Suspects:

Gloria Spoddy - She is the aloof and confident international model whose striking looks are perfect for Francesca's designs. Is she capable of murder most fashionable?

Mike Ruffone - Dangerously handsome, this ex-rock star gave up his career for the love of Francesca. But is he strumming her heart strings for his own mysterious reasons?

Doll Chevita - Francesca's younger sister, her meek demeanor covers a violent past. But is this "babydoll" really as innocent as she appears to be?

Minnie Kashfloe - A stylish socialite and devoted follower of Francesca's designs. But below the satin and lace lies a heart of steel that drives her to take whatever she wants.

Cameron Tripod - Francesca's favorite but difficult photographer. As Francesca's ex-lover, has he been over-exposed to her manipulation of his affections?

Ron Dewing - He is the financial clout behind Francesca's salon. But where does his money come from and what secrets thread through his life?

name: Dark Horizon: Notice of Termination
description:
From the rules introduction:

In DH: Notice of Termination, one player controls the agent for an underground organization called PUNT (People for a UNified Tomorrow), as its agents infiltrate the Talobar Technologies megacorp headquarters. The other player controls the Talobar CorpGuards who will do whatever possible to stop them.

From the back of the box:

Dark Horizon: Notice of Termination is both an introduction to the Dark Horizon game system, and an expansion to the popular Dark Horizon: Escape. [...]

Advanced rules include:

Weapon-linked cameras - ceiling-mounted, computer-controlled cameras linked to LazRifles or SMGs
Armor-piercing flechette pistols
Blast weapons like mines, grenades and timed charges. And not all of these blast weapons go "Boom"! Some produce chemical or radiation effects
Rules for aiming and peeking around corners
New rules for Gen2 cybermods for even more enhanced performance
Complete rules for ratigators
Rules for aiming at figure locations, and using weapon scopes
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Riskkapitalist
description:
Riskkapitalist is a Swedish game and a mix between Monopoly and Finance, with a bit more risk taking.
Each player venture their money into different industries, buying/selling stocks and watching the market for changes.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: World War II in the West
description:
World War II in the West a division-corps scale wargame depicting the Second World War in Europe and North and East Africa.

World War II in the West gives you control of all of the major participating nations that fought World War II, and allows you to play a simple yet accurate portrayal of the war. World War II in the West was originally designed for play with Axis and Allies figures and rule, but is now a stand-alone game which includes over 1,600 counters. However, the rules and the hex sizes still allow Axis and Allies fans to get the most accurate World War II wargame they can find while still using the popular rules and pieces if they wish.

In fact, World War II in the West can be used effectively to bring Axis and Allies fans into the wargaming hobby as the game combines some of the features of Axis and Allies and conventional counter wargames to produce a new style of game that is simple yet complex, fun yet challenging.

With World War II in the West, you fight for the convoy routes, have air battles over London, conduct landing operations on the northern French coast, outflank and surround forces on the Eastern Front, and manage the industrial output of your nation.

World War II in the West includes over 1,600 counters depicting the armed forces of the major belligerents as well as informational counters needed to play the game. Along with the major nations, you can find in the counter mix Canadian, Australian, New Zealander, South African, Czech, Indian, and East African units, as well as the well-known Spanish Blue Division that fought on the Eastern Front with the German Army.

The beautifully hand-drawn map is made up of 12-pieces, totalling a size of 50 by 40 inches. Also included is a smaller East African map to be used in play. The map has all of the charts and boxes needed for game play and has a scale of approximately 150km per hex. The hexes are large enough to hold Axis and Allies pieces, but it is ideally played with the counters that are sized to decrease mess and accidents during play.

The game is best played with the grand campaign which runs from September 1939 until the end of 1945, in monthly and bi-weekly turns. Two scenarios are included with the game allowing you to play the war in Africa or Operation Overlord in a shorter time than the campaign game. Also, new scenarios will be posted on the website.
World War II in the West’s complexity is what sets it apart. It sets it apart from the other Axis and Allies games as the complexity is far greater and the history more accurate. It also sets it apart from the conventional counter wargames as its complexity is slightly more simple, yet still depicts the war accurately while being fun and challenging. This is not a simple game, but its complexity allows both experienced and beginner wargamers to understand the rules and enjoy the game.

World War II in the West can be combined with World War II in the East to play the entire global war, both games combining to use over 2,500 counters and 25 square feet of maps!
mechanics: Action Points, Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Icebreaker
description: Icebreaker is an interaction board game designed for four or more players. The aim of the game is to score 2000 points. To gain points, players must perform forfeits. If players refuse to perform or co-operate with a forfeit, points are deducted from their score.
publishers: Brainless games, Paul Lamond Games Ltd

name: Little Red Riding Hood
description:
From Tactic's webpage:

In this funny and colorful game you will get to join Little Red Riding Hood on her visit to see grandmother. On your way through the forest you have to find the contents of your lunch basket that you have dropped on the way. But beware of the wolf that is hiding in the forest! It is also easy to get lost in the forest so be careful. Little Red Riding Hood is a fun board game where good memory and luck will help you to grandmother’s cabin and victory.

The game also includes the fairy tale Little Red Riding Hood. Once upon a time…

Recommended Ages 4 and up

name: The Rise and Fall of the Galactic Empire
description:
Alternate title: Ginga Teikoku no Koubou
