An ambitious multi-player (well, 1-6 player) science fiction game that seeks to recreate the kinds of things you would find in epic-scale science fiction: Giant spaceships with powerful missiles attacking each other, hyper engines that can warp into other dimensions, all-powerful computers, and even ships that can traverse black holes, and so on.

The are 23 "victory condition" cards, and you keep your victory conditions secret from the other players. The game includes 6 counter sheets and 150 cards to provide lots of variety. There are 4 variations (scenarios) to the game, most averaging around 90 minutes.

name: The Game of Top Ten Lists
description: Object is to score the most points by guessing the exact title of a top ten list with the least number of clues given.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Chechnya: The Russian Bear Attacks
description: This game covers the major campaigns in Chechnya in 1999. The game includes an inset map for city fighting within Grozny, an 11 x 17 map showing the greater part of Chechnya for larger operations, and 153 counters which need to be assembled prior to play.

name: Seven Days Battles
description: "It is June 26, 1862. The Army of the Potomac has fought its way nearly 70 miles from the mouth of the York River to a scant dozen miles from the Confederate capitol of Richmond, Virginia. McClellan with his army divided by the rain swollen Chickahominy Creek prepares to assault the city's earthworks. Suddenly, from the north of the Chickahominy, over 50,000 Confederate veterans crash into the Union V Corps. The Battle is joined and the fate of a nation hangs in the balance. Now ... you command the armies! You make the crucial decisions!"

name: Hallo Taxi
description:
In this old Ravensburger game you have to start the game at the theater in the center of the board.
You have to take a taxi to travel around the town.
Each player plays with 4 play-figures.
There's some kind of 'speed-o-meter' in one corner of the board.

name: Stardeck
description:
Stardeck is a five-suited deck of playing cards. The fifth suit is a black and red star, and is called the Suit of Stars. This extra suit brings 13 new cards to the traditional deck of 52 cards, bringing the total to 65 cards.

Interesting new poker hands are available with the addition of the fifth suit, such as five of a kind, rainbow (one cards of each suit), rainbow straight, rainbow full house, rainbow four of a kind, rainbow three of a kind, rainbow two pair, rainbow pair, etc.

The fifth suit also allows for interesting bridge, spades, and hearts variants.

name: German Eagle vs. Russian Bear
description:
German Eagle vs. Russian Bear is a wargame that covers the action from 1941 to 1944 on the Eastern Front during World War 2. The game offers several scenarios that let players recreate and replay the battles between the German and Soviet forces, such as Operations Barbarossa and Bagration.

The players alternate their turns to move and attack with their forces, rolling dice and consulting tables to determine if they have routed or eliminated enemy units. Their combat is further affected by weather, terrain, and fortifications. Supply lines also play a part in the players' strategic concerns.

A game lasts until it has reached a pre-agreed turn or a player has won by achieving his or her victory conditions, which usually involves controlling a certain amount of cities.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Quips & Quotes
description: Quips & Quotes is a Balderdash-style party game. One player reads a quote. If nobody knows the speaker right off the bat, then everybody writes down the name of someone who might have said it. The reader then reads off all the names that were submitted (with the correct answer mixed in) and players vote for which name they think is correct. You score points for guessing the right answer and getting other people to guess the name you submitted. (You also score points if you correctly identify the speaker initially.)

name: A Mere Matter of Marching
description:
From Microgame Design Group website:
"A Mere Matter of Marching is a simulation covering the three summer campaigns on the Niagara Peninsula by the United States Army in the years 1812 to 1814. Historical units are maneuvered on a map until they contact the enemy. Units are then removed to a tactical map and battles are resolved. Units still on the strategic map may attempt to reinforce the battle, or await a further day's action.

The 11" x 17" map represents the Niagara peninsula using a point to point movement system. The 280 counters represent the company-sized combat forces involved in the struggle."

name: Deep Space Navigator
description:
The heart of this game is the plastic template that comes with it. Other components include paper with asteroids printed on it, pads of space ship and fighter records, and a 12-sided die. Players need to supply their own colored pens, a different color for each player.

The template makes this a nearly unique and very satisfying game. You can play on an empty sheet of paper or on the asteroid fields provided. It's a simple game of space ship combat between either two players or two teams.

You first design your spaceships, assigning shields, armor, weapons, fighter hangars, etc., to spaces in a circle with different levels. The core of the circle represents both the bridge and the power plant of the spaceship - you don't want it hit! The circles are divided into twelve sections, like a clock.

Once you all have ships, you draw a triangle for each base and take turns plotting movement. Movement is handled by the template: line the center of the template over your current position, with your previous position directly to the rear. The template is divided into arcs of distance. If you move eight arc lengths last turn, you will continue to move eight in a straight line - make a slight mark on the paper to note that. If you want to change course, you can either accelerate or decelerate, and/or turn left or right. Find the spot on the map you wish to move to - it has to be within the range shown on the template. For each arc of distance you vary, plus a sideways distance, you must burn fuel - check it off on your ship record.

Combat is also handled by the template, which shows ranges of the various weapons. Missiles are the most fun, as you can only use your hand to measure roughly, and must launch them at an angle and speed fairly close to what you want, but probably not exactly. A missile will travel two turns without change of direction or speed, then explode. It's possible to be hurt by your own missile blast ...
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Template, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game, Variable Set-up

name: World Factgame
description:
Are there more people living in Vietnam than in Germany? Are the Swiss citizens richer than citizens from Singapore? Is Malta more densely populated than the Netherlands?
You don't know it? Worry not - just guess, poker, bluff to beat the other players. And after each game you know a little more about the countries of the world.
The World Factgame is a game about numbers, facts and data of all 191 UN member states. Each country is represented by a card containing information about geography, population and economy.
Each player receives nine of these cards, and may only look at front displaying the name of the country, it's flag and it's geographical outline. Each player in turn puts a card on the table, trying to put them in rank order. A player may, instead of adding a card, claim that the order in which the cards were put is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct data revealed.
If the order was correct then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order was incorrect then the previous player, who accepted the order as correct, receives three cards. The first player that gets rid of all the cards wins.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Sand in the Whirlwind
description:
The Anglo Senussi Campaign 1915-1916. Simulation of the British suppression of a Turkish led invasion of Egypt by Senussi tribesmen from Libya during World War One.

(From khberpassgames.com):
"Each combat factor on each combat unit represents approximately 100 men, 1 machine gun or 1 cannon. Each hex equals twenty-five (25) miles across and each game turn represents two (2) weeks.

"The game components consist of two full-color 8.5” x 11” inch maps which are joined lengthwise (creating an 8.5 x 22 inch map in total), two sets of full color counters and a complete set of rules. Players must provide a six (6) sided die as a randomizer for the Combat Results Table (CRT)."

name: Word-Wise
description: Each card contains a consonant. A player can just declare any vowels needed. The players must construct words using the cards dealt to them. Handicapping rules allow players of unequal skill levels to compete.

name: 13: Assassin Collector Card Game
description:
24 cards publisher in TSRs Comics Mudule magazine 13: Assassin #1.

The cards are in four suits (Hero, Villain, Item and Place) with values from 3 to 8. Some cards have more than one suit, but can only be used as one of the suits at the players choice.

Since you start out by dealing 6 cards to each player, you can really only play with 2 players, unless you have more sets, or cards from an expansion. Each turn the player draws a card from the draw pile or from the top of the discard pile. Players win by having:
30 point in any one suit, except Hero which only requires 18.
14 points in 3 of the 4 suits each, except Hero which only requires 12.
one card of the same value in each of the 4 suits.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Spies/Secret Agents

name: World War II in the East
description:
World War II in the East is a division-corps scale wargame depicting the Second World War in Asia and the Pacific.

World War II in the East gives you control of all of the major participating nations that fought World War II, and allows you to play a simple yet accurate portrayal of the war. World War II in the East can be played with Axis and Allies figures and rules, but is meant to be played as a stand-alone game with over 900 counters. However, the rules and the hex sizes still allow Axis and Allies fans to get the most accurate World War II wargame they can find while still using the popular rules and pieces, if they wish.

In fact, World War II in the East can be used effectively to bring Axis and Allies fans into the wargaming hobby as the game combines some of the features of Axis and Allies and conventional counter wargames to produce a new style of game that is simple yet complex, fun yet challenging.

With World War II in the East, you fight major carrier engagements, have air battles over Guadalcanal, conduct landing operations on the many island chains of the Pacific, outflank and surround forces in Burma, as Japan transport resources from Southeast Asia and the East Indies, and manage the industrial output of your nation.

World War II in the East includes over 900 counters depicting the armed forces of the major belligerents as well as informational counters needed to play the game. Along with the major nations, you can find in the counter mix Australian, New Zealander, Indian, and East African units, as well as the well-known American fighter squadron that fought with China against the Japanese.

The beautifully hand-drawn map is made up of 12-pieces, totalling a size of 47 by 36 inches. The map has all of the charts and boxes needed for game play and has a scale of approximately 300km per hex. The hexes are large enough to hold Axis and Allies pieces, but it is ideally played with the counters that are sized to decrease mess and accidents during play.

The game is best played with the grand campaign which runs from December 1941 until the end of 1945, in monthly and bi-weekly turns. Scenarios allowing you to play shorter scenarios will be posted on the publisher's website as they become available.

World War II in the East’s complexity is what sets it apart. It sets it apart from the other Axis and Allies games as the complexity is far greater and the history more accurate. It also sets it apart from the conventional counter wargames as it’s complexity is slightly more simple, yet still depicts the war accurately while being fun and challenging. This is not a simple game, but its complexity allows both experienced and beginner wargamers to understand the rules and enjoy the game.

World War II in the East can be combined with World War II in the West to play the entire global war, both games combining to use over 2,500 counters and 25 square feet of maps!

name: The Russian Portfolio
description:
This is a game from Lou Coatney on the 'web' and available for FREE! as long as you follow his 'guidelines'. You will be given the 'means' to produce the game and then 'Battle' it out in this epic encounter. It involves the German's "Army Groups Centre, North, & South" with their intrepid Minor 'Allies' VS the "Soviet Russians" during the beginning of the "Russian Campaign". There are even 'Army' sized Units for the GERMANS! Most of them are Infantry, but there are some 'Panzers' too.

The scale of THE RUSSIAN PORTFOLIO is 20 days of real time per game-turn, 40 miles/66 kms per hexagon width and corps-army-front (25,000-250,000 men) in unit level.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Balance of Power
description:
You have to place the magnetic balls in the pits on top of the nine dice. There are two variations of the game.
One is to place the balls tighter than your opponent. It's mostly a solitary competition.
The second one is more strategic. You roll all nine dice and have to announce how much of the pits you can fill. Than the next player places the dice in the box. Than every player places as much balls as he wants (and is able to) on top. At last you have to place your announced number of balls or more to get points. If you don't succeed you get the negative of what the other players could overcome your announcement.

name: Spoof
description:
SPOOF: The Cheer-Up Game. Components: 7 wood batons (round, knob-headed sticks) and a 52-card deck (four each of thirteen designs).

The art on the cards is allegedly inspired by "the Incas, high up on the Andes of Peru". Place (n-1) batons (where n=number of players) in the center of the table, within reach of all the players, The complete deck is dealt out to the players. It doesn't matter if the cards don't distribute evenly. Each player chooses a card from their hand and passes it, face down, to the player on their left. Players then pick up the card that was passed to them and choose that card or another card in their hand to pass again to the left. Play is simultaneous and continues in this manner, players passing cards as fast as possible, until someone has a set of 4 cards of the same kind. That player places their cards quietly on the table and takes a baton from the table. All other players must then immediately grab a baton. The last player to do so cannot pick up a baton, as there is one fewer baton than number of players. The player without a baton scores an "S", "the beginning of his descent to the caste of a SPOOF." Rounds are played, with the person failing to secure a baton scoring a letter in the word "SPOOF". Each players' first failure receives an "S", for their second P", their third "O", and so on until one player completes the word "SPOOF", and "is declared to be a creature of that slow moving, dull-witted species."
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Einfalls-Pinsel
description:
Players are employees in an advertising company. However, they never know what they are supposed to advertise.
At the beginning of the game, each player draws three different images onto small sheets of paper. Then s/he puts them into three pouches, hands in the pouches, and all pouches are shuffled. A moderator for the round draws a task now, i.e. something that has to be advertised. S/he randomly picks three pouches then, reveals the pictures and everyone discusses which picture is most suitable for the task. After a time of such discussion, each player secretly votes 2 - 1 - 0 points on the three designs. Votes are simultaneously revealed. Players get bonus points for agreeing on something. Also, a player may make a guess as to who drew a certain picture. If noone is able to guess, the artist gets extra points, if there are correct guesses, these are rewarded.

When all images have been awarded points, a second round starts, in which the same pictures are used again, but for different tasks and in different combinations. At the end of that second round, the final scoring happens: One after one, the players reveal what images were theirs and receive points. The highest overall score wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Negotiation, Party Game

name: Hell for Leather
description:
This is light motorcycle racing game based on the characters of Paul Sample's 'Ogri' comics. It is basically a roll and move game, with a number of cards that can be played at various times to enhance one's own progress or inhibit that of the another player. The game consists of three individual races and a total of six laps around the course, played with different dice to represent the speed / intensity of each race. At the end of each race, players acquire sponsors based on their performance, and have the opportunity to spend money to purchase upgrades to their bikes for future heats. The overall winner is the first player to cross the finish line in the third race. The game is very aesthetically appealing, with board, card, and box art by Paul Sample and pewter miniatures for player pawns.

From the back of the box: "Hell for Leather is a fast, freaky race around the world famous Isle of Man T.T. course, featuring a host of the best loved characters from Paul Sample's cult comic strip Ogri, which has appeared in Bike Magazine since 1972. A game for 2-6 players, Hell for Leather is all about high speeds, hard cash, 'Derring Do', and dirty tricks. Relying on guile, cunning, and hopefully a little luck, set your sights firmly on the chequered flag... and go for it! Pressure builds as you progress through the races with sponsorship funding, heaps of trouble, and laughs aplenty. When fair play and skilful riding are not enough, deft use of your nasty 'nerg nail', 'orrible oil slick' and other 'cheats' picked up along the way may assist you in the 'no holds barred' charge for glory."
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: The Recapture of Kiev
description:
An issue game of Game Journal #9.
Designed by Hideaki Izumoto.
200 counter wargame on the battles for Kiev, 1943.
The game uses a system similar to "Turning the table".

name: Zama 202 B.C.: Hannibal vs. Scipio Africanus
description:
ZAMA: Hannibal vs Scipio, 202 B.C. covers the classic battle between Hannibal and his Carthaginians and the Roman army of Scipio Africanus.

Expect solid rules and non-stereotypical play through the use of game cards. Players can play up to 5 cards each turn, interactively, for movement, combat, or special events. Includes a map, counters, and cards -- but no hexes or CRT.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Print & Play, Wargame

name: VCR Top Rank Boxing Game
description:
From the back of the game box:

"To enjoy hours of fast-paced professional boxing at its best, the TR VCR Top Rank Boxing Game included hundreds of fight action sequences taken from your favorite outstanding boxing contests. See your favorite contenders in action such as Roberto Duran, 'Marvelous' Marvin Hagler, Ray 'Boom Boom' Mancini, and of course, many, many more.

You and your opponent clash throughout 15 rounds of thrilling boxing action, scoring as many points as possible just like authentic professional boxing. But watch out! There is the ever present threat of a knock-out punch that will end match [sic]. Or, if you get in serious trouble the referee will end it for you by calling the match a technical knock-out (or TKO).

Whatever happens, you and your opponent(s) are assured of enjoying the most realistic boxing game ever. So choose your opponent, find a ring-side seat in the comfort of your own home, and join in the boxing excitement with the TR VCR Top Rand Boxing Game."

The game includes a game board, "Fight Action" cards, "Boxer Challenge" cards, "Punch Action" cards, and a "Fight Action" videocassette.

name: All Aboard!
description: Youngsters will love this rollicking race down the piers to hop on the boat. The race is full of surprises as players move the boat from one pier to another and leave their opponents high and dry! A thrilling, entertaining game for two to four players, Ages 5 and up.

name: Schatzsuche: Das Erbe des Seewolfs
description:
From Spielbox:

Schatzsuche: Das Erbe des Seewolfs (Treasure Hunt: The Inheritance of the Sea Wolf) is an exciting treasure hunt for children invented by Klaus Zoch. A brave little wolf is on the search for booty. Gold coins and jewelry get added to Wolfi's as well as his young helpers' possessions when they manage to accumulate as many pairs of identical island- and treasure-cards as possible. But the Devil is in the details: Two of the beautifully-illustrated cards, although they may appear identical at first glance, are actually different upon closer inspection. Guessing wrong impacts Wolfi's treasure hunt: the goods have to be returned. The winner at the end of the adventure is the person who has managed to accumulate the most treasure. An extra dose of excitement is afforded by the little pirates that challenge each other to guessing contests.

name: Defiance: Vital Ground
description:
From the publisher:

Welcome to the Defiance Universal Skirmish System™, the game of near future and science fiction tactical combat that lets you modify or even create the strategic setting in which your battles will take place. With force sizes varying from one unit to several platoons, each trooper matters, and the correct combination of mobility, firepower, command and control is crucial to your success.

The U.S.S. Army Customizer is a comprehensive and statistically based force construction tool that literally allows you to design any weapon, any trooper and any army that you can imagine, all the while being assured that your creation will be balanced for play against any other U.S.S. force list. A lot of work and testing went into the Customizer, and we feel that you will not find a more versatile or more balanced universal force construction tool on the market today.

The 128-page rulebook contains the necessary rules and army lists to allow players to take part in the battles for the Milky Way. Control the ground forces of one of 5 different empires, all jockeying for supremacy in the new power vacuum that the Starslayers have created:


The Vobian Empire, vast and ancient, which utilizes high-tech weaponry and cybernetic beasts to even the odds against its former subjects.
The Tamerlane Khanate, progeny of the last great Mongol Empire, which still clings to a tribal past, despite the urgings of its human neighbors.
The Ka-yi Sultanate, Perseus heir to the Ottoman Empire, which struggles against religious and political tradition to form a united Human Confederacy.
The Nordic Alliance, descendants of the army of Gustavus Adolphus, who have used ingenuity and military know-how to overcome their limitations and become galactic players.
The Meraxillan Empire, ever evolving, which cares only for its own expansion at the expense of all others.


This book contains rules which cover almost every tactical situation, including troop quality, command and control, army discipline, indirect and suppression fire, vehicles from mecha to armored personnel carriers, and more. Also included is the Starslayer Troop Builder, a complete and statistically-balanced troop construction tool that allows you to convert virtually any figure to the Starslayer rules system.

name: Borodino
description:
A French wargame on the battle of Borodino.

18 turns of 45mn

220 counters

A 60x80cm map

name: Stack Gammon
description: Based on backgammon, Stack Gammon integrates the many time-tested, favored and interactive elements of luck, chance, skill and strategy found in other common games.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: N30: We Are Winning!
description:
By 1999, a broad coalition of labor, environmental, anti-corporate and anti-imperial groups united against the World Trade Organization. Left-liberal groups, led by the American Federation of Labor - Congress of Industrial Organizations and the People for Fair Trade - Network Opposed to the World Trade Organization, planned to rally and march, and to petition the governments for reforms, on November 30th. More radical groups, coalescing around the Direct Action Network and the Seattle Anarchist Response, planned to shut down the opening ceremonies, also on November 30th.

N30 portrays the morning blockades and the afternoon confrontations of November 30th. Two players represent the opposing sides; one represents the protesters; the other represents the police, with their incident commanders, Asst. Chief Ed Joiner and Captain Jim Pugel. Each turn represents one hour. Each bloc represents either about 50 police or 50 to 100 direct action protesters, prepared for confrontations. Each crowd represents 500 to 1000 other protesters, unprepared for confrontations.
categories: Educational, Modern Warfare, Political, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Princes of the East
description:
From the publisher's website:
Princes of the East is a political/military game of the period immediately after the first crusade. Each nation strives for supremacy. Only the strongest, most cunning, will leave a legacy of stability and survival for his people.

This game can be played face-to-face or by mail/e-mail. Included are the rules, counters, sheets which allow control of a state, individual named leaders for use as councilors or as generals, tables, expenditure charts and a map of Southern Asia Minor and Northern Syria.

The game begins in the winter of 1100-1101. Each turn represent a season or part of a season. Players write their turns activities, first expenditures and skulduggery, then for
movement and combat. Each winter, taxes are collected and trade deals are made. Any alliances must be thought out carefully, as once trade deals are organized, they can be broken at any time, but not renegotiated until winter.

A state can only run efficiently with an efficient civil service. A player must choose councilors, promoting or dismissing them as the situation requires. Religious leaders, First Citizens, Leading Nobles, and Chief Advisors are real enough, however, and have their own allies and enemies. Attempt to throw out a popular one or keep an
unpopular one, and you risk a revolt which could see you killed by the mob.

Troops of all types are available. Native troops are inexpensive, but few. Mercenaries are plentiful, but expensive. They are listed by the names they are called by contemporaries;
Light Horse are called Skyths by the Byzantines, Turcomen by Muslims, Turcopoles by Christians. Alan Light Horse are also available to Byzantines. There is no qualitative difference. The same goes for Cavalry; you have Ghulams and Cataphracts. Always note the image rather than the name. You'll get used to it.

This is a web-published game that is free to download and play.

name: Lecker, lecker!
description:
Each time the correct symbol appears on the dice, the little caterpillars move on a little further through the fruit.

With suggestions for 1 - 2 children.

A first dice game for little ones.

Illustrations by Anja Wrede.

name: Hotspots
description:
From the designer's website:

"A free modern wargame representing conflicts between smaller third-world nations you can printout and use, or play others by email.

"Hotspots is a wargame with a new playing system in which two players must both: choose a home map, choose home force colors, choose a mission, then buy their units for deployment. In order to win, a player must complete their mission requirements as well as preventing their opponent from completing theirs. The die rolls (2d6) are right on the units for the most part.

"The game is complete. If you encounter something that needs to be covered, let me know. To play, you must print out the maps and the units."

name: HÃ¼hnerhof
description:
From the box: Early morning six hungry chickens wait to be fed. There is the farmer's daughter with food. She doesn't put it all in one place, but distributes the food across the farm yard. Now one has to make sure to be quickly at the right spot, to eat the food before it's gone.

Children's game Ages 5 and up.

name: Wolf im Schafspelz
description: Wolf im Schafspelz (Wolf in Sheep's Clothing) is a deduction game, wherein players take turns trying to pick the wolf out from a flock of sheep using sheepdogs. For those desiring a more complex game, trees are included to break up the sheepdogs' lines of sight.

name: JoBa
description: This trick-taking game is played with a standard deck of playing cards. Each game, a pair of dice is rolled. The first die determines how many cards are held in each player's hand (1-6); the other die is special and determines the trump suit. The second die may come up "no trump" (there is no trump suit) or "no suit" (suit doesn't matter, only face value). Chips are used to keep score. Players must ante up before each hand, and the pot is won by the first player to reach eleven points (or to have the highest score after four hands). Scoring centers around the fact that at start of each game, players use bidding wheels to predict how many hands they can win. Penalties are applied for guessing incorrectly, while guessing correctly and winning all tricks in a hand can lead to an instant win.

name: Splittin Infinitives
description:
Splittin Infinitives is a space-strategy board game where each player takes command of an entire race and attempts to conquer the galaxy by military force, colonial expansion, superior technology, underhanded politics, or any combination of the above.

The board is made up of space-tiles each with a different geography laid out randomly, and each player has their own space fleet and starting technology. A technology deck describes the various technological advances players can get. Older races begin with more tech, younger races can acquire more.

The beginning of the game is primarily exploration and colonization using the star-fleet, dealing with random anomalies in space such as black holes, or space-pirates. Once players make 1st contact, then military force and star fleets, and the political deck, come into play.

The winner is the player with the most colonies on the board when the last planet in the galaxy is colonized. Planets are also drawn from a random deck, each with different difficulty ratings, mineral wealth and population maxima.

Splittin Infinitives is suitable for an afternoon's or evening's gaming. The various decks give variety, and keep it light-hearted, while the base allows for strategic serious play. The rules are simple enough to fit on one page, and it can be played right out of the box.
categories: Economic, Miniatures, Negotiation, Political, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: The Battle of Bentonville
description:
The Battle of Bentonville: Johnston's Last Stand is a grand-tactical simulation of the Battle of Bentonville, which was fought in eastern North Carolina on 19-21 March 1865.

A self published wargame developed in the late 1970's and published in 1980. Designed by Eric D. France, developed by Michael Scott and printed by Dixie Press in Gulfport, MS. This was a limited edition, only a thousand copies, depicting the last large land battle of the American Civil War.

The Battle of Bentonville has large, oversized counters for the introductory game. There is a roster sheet for both the Union and Confederate armies. There is also a roll up hex based board that is flexible (much like the portable chess boards used in tournaments.

There are both introductory and advanced rules, as well as smaller,traditional sized counters for the advanced version. A historical commentary booklet is also included.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 2 hours
Hex: 200 yards / 183 meters
Units: Brigade

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 29" five color mapsheet
Two single-side printed countersheets (240 1/2" & 120 3/4" counters)
One 16-page Battle of Bentonville rulebook
One 20-page Battle of Bentonville historical commentary folder
One Unit Effectiveness record keeping pad
One 6-sided dice

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-10 hours

name: Curtatone Montanara
description:
"Curtatone Montanara" is a wargame about 2 battles (Curtatone e Montanara and Goito) of the initial periods of the "First Independence War" in the Italian Risorgimento.

Each battle has a map and a set of counters.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points

name: Spaced Out
description:
Fast-action family card game with a Science Fiction theme. Features a unique blend of strategy, skill, and chance.

Spaced Out is a fast-paced card game with exciting variables. "Cloning" is an exhilarating part of Spaced Out game play! Players are often on the edge of their seats, hoping to play out-of-turn, take extra turns, attack and defend against attacks. Utilize multiple scoring strategies. Every hand of SPACED OUT is unique, making the game enjoyable for different ages, size groups, and time-frames.

name: CHECKCHESS RoundBoard
description:
CHECKCHESS RoundBoard contains standard sets of chessmen and checkers, but as the name implies the real star is the game board. The circular board consists of eight rings of eight spaces each. Each ring corresponds to one of the eight ranks on a standard chessboard, and each radially-aligned group of spaces corresponds to a file. (They're even labeled 1-8 from outside to inside and a-h counterclockwise, and the rulebook calls them "squares" despite their curved shape.)

The pieces are set up with one player on the outside of the circle facing in and the other in the center facing out (but otherwise exactly as in ordinary chess or checkers) and the rules of those games are unchanged except that file "a" and file "h" are considered adjacent for the purposes of movement. This is equivalent to the variant in which pieces are allowed to move off the right side of a square chess board onto the left and vice versa, but on the round board all legally-adjacent spaces are also physically adjacent.

From the designer's notes included with the game:

"An engineer by profession, I have always had a fascination with the game of chess. As a member of my high school chess team, I played hooky from school to strengthen my game.

"In the 1960's the concept of a round board interested me as a novelty. However, some 25 years later I made a serious study of that novelty and concluded that the round board is a major evolutionary advancement in the games of chess and checkers. I hope you share my belief and enjoy your games on CHECKCHESS RoundBoard(TM)."

name: Puzzle Perfection
description:
Roll the die, and it'll show one of 6 colors. Pick a piece of that color, and fit it into your 5x5 rack. If there are no pieces left of the color rolled, then steal one of that color from someone else's rack! When someone gets a full rack, the round ends.

Each of the 6 colors contain 7 pieces: 3 odd-shaped 5-square pieces (with 3 symbols), 1 3-square 'corner' (with 2 symbols), 1 2-square (with 1 symbol), and 2 1-squares.

Scoring is achieved by matching the symbols either beside each other, or at angles, for 1 point per unique pair. If you can't fit a piece in your rack, you get -1 per piece. If you achieved the full rack, and called PUZZLE PERFECTION to end the round, then you get 5 extra points.

The game is played for several rounds, as agreed upon before the game started.

name: Futbol Cacho
description:
This a little dice game that we play in our town (Oruro, Bolivia), the popular name is Capi Futbol because it's based on another dice game called Capi Manda (or The Captain give orders) that is kind of like poker dice...

In order to play you just need 5 dice, a cup, and you have to draw a sketch of a football pitch (divided in 5 areas: goal area - field - midfield (the mid line does is not a divisor line) - field - goal area) and a counter that represent the ball (we almost always use a bottle cap).

The game starts with the "ball" at midfield. After a "toss" the one who has the kick off shakes the dice in the cup and the other player does the same (always after the one who is the Captain at time), then the non-captain player can re-roll from 1 to 5 dice, after he does the captain can do the same, they both can no use the re roll (see SIT DOWN below).

This way they play "poker hands" with rankings like this: 5 same (Grande), 1 different (Poker), 2 same 3 same (Full House), 1,2,3,4,5 or 2,3,4,5,6 or 3,4,5,6,1 (Escaleras, in ties the higher straight wins, 3 of the same (Tricas, 111 the higher, 222 the lowest), pairs, if neither of you has anything then both players put all the 5 dice in their cup and play simultaneously with no re-rolls with highest winning.

Every time a player wins a hand, he moves the ball one space towards the opponents goal area.

When you are playing in the goal area if the Attacking player wins it's a goal, you can play to a certain amount of goals,or with a time limit.

suggested optional rules.
DESPEJE (Shot from the goal keeper) after winning a hand in his own goal area a player may choose to made a Despeje.

If he does he rolls one die and moves the number of pips in spaces towards the Goal area of the opponent, but when it reaches the goal area then the ball goes back towards the field (some people choose to not let the ball go back to the goal area or field of the shooter).

After this shot the opponent keeps possession and is now the Captain).

SIT DOWN (Mid distance shot at the goal) there is no re roll if you are in the "Field" area next to your opponent's Goal area, if the attacker wins its a goal (some people prefer to Announce the shot before a SIT DOWN happens), if the defender wins it's a DESPEJE but this time the defender keeps control after the play.


3 LINEUP CHANGES to represent the 3 substitutions of players allowed in a football match, the player can Voltear (turn a dice over to its opposite side) 3 times in a match (i.e. a 3 can become a 4 if using a change, a 2 can become a 5, a 6 can become a 1 etc.) Some people let the attacking player do 1 Volteo each hand if he desires except when he is at the opponent's Goal area.

Well this game is fun and you can play it anywhere (because it is a modified game of Generala it's like our national game) and of course it's about luck but not pure luck.

name: Stringbags! Wargames Rules for Aerial Combat 1915 - 1918
description:
A miniatures game of air combat from 1914-1918. 40 page rulebook. Recommended for 1/144 or 1/300 scale aircraft.

"Like Scramble, these rules operate in three dimensions while only physically using two. Different types of machine gun are taken into account, and the skill of your aircrew is paramount. The system also caters for game balance to ensure that no game is a walkover. There are simple rules for ammunition expenditure and players can handle about 4 planes each. An added feature appropriate to the period is the availability of Luck, (assuming you are lucky enough to get any)."

"The rules are quite short, but are supplemented by data with over 150 aircraft and variants from World War One. The aircraft factors illustrate the differences caused by new designs. The rules incorporate a number of options to make life even more exciting for the unwary. An optional campaign system is provided."

Publisher's ratings: Complexity - 4/10. Level of detail - 7/10.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Os Quatro Elementos
description: In this game wizards battle against each other in an arena. The player moves his wizard one space and place a block in any other space of the 10x10 board. The player who isn't able to move his wizard in his turn is out of the game. Each player has three magic spell cards that can help his wizard's movement.

name: Special Forces
description:
Counter-Terrorist Warfare in the Modern Age

Special Forces is a miniatures game of close combat in the modern era. Inspired by first-person shooter computer games such as Delta Force and Rainbow Six, he rules are designed for small scale battles with one or two dozen figures per side.

Special Forces is easy to learn and fast playing, with an emphasis on playability. It includes rules for infantry action and vehicles and comes with two sample scenarios; Columbian Crack-Down and Hostage Rescue - Iraq.

13 pages

Download version can be found at www.wargamedownloads.com

name: Fractions Supreme Pizza Game
description:
From Discovery Toys:

"Pizza parts make a "whole" lot of fun. Help children visualize and understand the concept of fractions, using a favorite food and a fun strategy game. Game variations challenge players to master fraction equivalencies, addition and more."

name: Barbie's Keys to Fame Game
description: Object: Build up the "Careers" in the 8 pockets of the tray by playing matching Career Cards, numbered 1 to 6. Whoever spins the spinner to point at the matching Gold Key to Fame takes that career and scores for it later. The winner is the player with the highest score after 2 rounds. The game consists of a tray with eight circular slots, a center spinner on the tray which points to the slots and keys, circular "Careers" cards, and Eight gold keys representing each of the careers.

name: The Compleat Strategyst
description:
An analysis of "matrix games" where each player has a set of "strategies" to choose from - these are just labels, could be rock/paper/scissors - and there are pre-arranged "payoffs" according to which strategies are chosen. Prisoner's Dilemma is a well-known example of such a "game". Or, consider the following example, paraphrased from the text.

Aldie and Derk decide to play a game for daiquiris. Each throws one or two fingers. If both throw one finger, Aldie buys Derk a daiquiri. If both throw two fingers, Derk buys Aldie two daiquiris. If they don't match, Aldie pays Derk a dime. (At the time this book was written, daiquiris were 55 cents.) How much per game should Derk demand of Aldie in order to make this game worthwhile?

This text can help you solve this problem, or others like it. In particular, this is the type of game theory floating around behind certain sports simulations like Football Strategy or MLB SportsClix, although the latter has dice as well as the strategy selection.

name: Yoshitsune
description:
This is a Japanese wargame about the Genpei war (1180-1186) opposing Taira and Minamoto clans.

120 counters with yearly turns.

name: UnStack
description: UnStack was created by Professor João Pedro Neto, Lisbon (Portugal), in 2001. It is a stacking game in which counters are distributed in a way that resembles the "sowing" in Kalah games.

name: Abracadabra
description:
A card game for children (6+ years).

The game is played in teams of 2 players. The goal of each team is to have in their hand the same group of cards without being able to show their hand to each other or say anything about them.

name: Le combat des trente
description:
The day is the 26. March 1351. The place is Brittany. The event is the meeting of sixty fighters and two captains in front of numerous people from the region.

On one side, the Montfort army with the English commander Bamborough, on the other the "blésistes" under command of Jean de Beaumanoir. That day, after epic events, the "blesists" won. Will your "combat des Trente" go the same way ? Or will you change the course of history ?

A game based on the books describing the historical events, but made by gamers / game developers.

Home Page: http://www.coop-breizh.fr/boutik-4/boutik-4/jeux-bretons-hoa...
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Tricky
description:
Simple Trick taking game with a nice twist: You don't have the cards on the hands but they are on the table on 4 face-up piles. So you have to play the upper cards to get to the lower ones.
Also you can play several cards at once, adding their value up but with the risk of running out of cards before the end of the round

name: Yellow Ribbon
description:
Campaign Book 5
Yellow Ribbon - Rules for Indian Wars 1850-1890

designed by Greg Novak, publisher Ulster Imports

This 46 page A5 black and white booklet provides a background and rules for Indian Wars of the 1860s. Miniatures are typically 15mm Plain Indian wars range.

Figures represent from 2-5 actual soldiers (with 16 figures representing a troop). Sequence of Play is divided into several phases, including Command (where one of seven orders are issued to army units, and one of six to Indians), Movement, Fire, Morale/Medicine and Close Combat.

Both sides can Hold and Move, but the Army can March, Reform, Charge, Mount/Dismount, and Disengage. The Indians can Close, Skirmish, Withdraw and Watch. And the use of Medicine Points to determine what various bands do is well done.

There is an associated booklet "And Continually Wear The Blue" sub-titled "A Short Guide to the US Army and the Indian Wars 1850-90", about half background on army organization and tactics and about half scenarios.

both "Yellow Ribbon" and "And Continually Wear The Blue" are originally published 1988, revised 1989

name: The Clash of Armor
description: Tactical WWII miniatures rules, emphasising tank on tank combat.

name: Invasion
description:
Described in the book Calculate!, Invasion is a game where players try to capture regions forming a path to the opponent's capital.

Each region has a number on it, increasing in value the closer to the capital. Play alternates between attacking and defending. The attacker selects a region in the opponent's country that borders either the common border or one of the previously captured regions. The attacker and the defender each secretly select a set of contiguous numbers from their grid of numbers. The attacker selects from three to six and the defender selects one to three numbers. The product of the attackers numbers is divided by the product of the defenders numbers. If the resulting value is larger than the region number, the attacker colors the region in. If the value is lower, the defender colors the region in. Once a region is colored in, it may not change hands again. Numbers used in attack or defense may not be used again either.

A player wins when the other capital is captured or when he seals off all paths to his own capital. If a player does not have three contiguous numbers on his grid, he may no longer attack. If neither player may attack, then the winner is determined by comparing the sum of the regions that each would need to take including capturing the capital - the lower sum wins.

name: Spanish Civil War
description: Simple 2 player card game Simulation of the Spanish Civil War 1936-39. One player is the Nationalists (Rebels). The other player is the Republicans (Loyalists).

name: Bold Adventure
description:
From back of box:

Three centuries ago, a man named John Bunyan wrote an adventure narrative called Pilgrims Progress that has captured the imagination Western Christendom like no other book since the Bible.

Rock Harbor Creations has now brought the dramatic highlights of that perennial bestseller vividly to life in an exciting new board game called Bold Adventure. Like the book's hero, Christian, you leave the City of Destruction behind on your way to the Cross, and ultimately to the Celestial City. Like him, you'll go slowly at first, using the lower numbers on the inner circle of the spinner (there are no dice). But once you reach the Cross and leave your burden there, again like him, you'll find your pace increases, as you shift to the higher numbers on the outer circle of the spinner.

Along the way, you'll meet Mr. Evangelist who'll warn you to avoid such perils as the Slough of Despond and Beelzebub's Castle, and beware the enticements of Vanity Fair. Once you've made your way past Doubting Castle, and Giant Despair, you get a glimpse of your destination from the peak Delectable Mountain.

Designed to appeal especially to youngsters, bold adventure is a fast playing game for two to six players, taking no more than 30 to 45 minutes per game, on the average. It is also easy to play; all you have to do is the old enough to read instructions and follow the directions on the board. And, it is fun to play: the game is designed so that the lead will change frequently, and no one will be left too far behind. There are also some interesting lessons to be learned in route. For instance, if someone else lands on your space, instead of him having to go back to the beginning (disease or sending you there), you, being a good pilgrim say, "Please go ahead of me," and he moves one space in front of you. Similarly, lest you get discouraged at how far ahead the others are, there are three squares along the way marked "The last shall be first" -- land on one of these, and you immediately move one space in front of the leader.

Nor are you necessarily the winner if you arrive at the last square first, for there is still the River of Death to cross. There are two ways to attempt that, as indicated on the River of Death cards in two random piles. Draw a card and see if you: ford the river and enter the Celestial City, or except the invitation of Captain Vain-hope, to avoid getting your feet wet, and let him ferry you across. Alas, if you choose the latter, his boat capsizes and you are swept down the river and over the falls into Perilous Pool. When you climb out, you'll find that you have a fair ways to go before you again attempt across the river.

The first player to ford the river wins, but all pilgrims may enter the Celestial City if they embark on the bold adventure set before them.

name: Dabbawalla
description:
Every day, amid the hustle and bustle on the busy streets of Mumbai, a remarkable feat of logistics occurs. Hundreds of thousands of Tiffin boxes are delivered from individual houses, to the city and then onto the working people in the businesses and offices of Mumbai. What is in these Tiffin Boxes? Why, their lunch of course!
You take the role of the owner of a Dabbawalla team; your goal is to make more money than the other teams, by ensuring that you deliver the Tiffin Boxes that the businesses want, as quickly and as effectively as possible. To do this you will need to train your team in three disciplines, Speed, to help you move faster, Service, so that you get lots of Tips as you deliver, and finally Recruitment, to help grow your team.

The winner will be the player that makes the best use of their Dabbawallas, both in terms of delivering the most Tiffin Boxes, but also by recruiting the right amount of Dabbawallas and using them in chains to move Tiffin as far and as fast as possible.

Have you got what it takes to be the best of the best? Well, let’s play Dabbawalla and find out!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver

name: City Council
description:
A game for the piecepack.

Equipment:

* 1 piecepack
* 50 pennies
* 1 City Grid (included with the rules)
* 1 Turn Order/Action sheet (included with the rules)
* 3-4 Player Aid sheets (included with the rules)
* pencil(s) and paper for scoring, and clear tape

Welcome to the groundbreaking of a new city! Players will develop the new community through adroit manipulation of zoning and transit laws and important city councilors. The player who does this best wins the game.

name: NFL Strategy Jr.
description: Produced in 1974 with new NFL rule changes, this is a version of the NFL Strategy game for younger children. This game is a generic simulation of American football. (No real teams or players) Each turn the offensive player chooses a run or pass play from a set of cards while the defensive player chooses from 4 run defenses and 4 pass defenses by placing pegs into a hidden matrix. The offensive play is then inserted into the defensive matrix and 5 possible results are revealed. A die is then rolled and the color of the die face indicates which play result to use. Regular football rules are used, such as 4 downs to gain 10 yards, and scoring is the same as in the real game. As in real football, the object of the game is to outscore the opponent.

name: Moto-King
description: On behalf of Moto-King Racing, we would like to welcome you to the sport of kings. Moto-King is dedicated to all riders and fans alike. This game has been created to promote motocross racing. It's a learning tool that takes bench racing a step further. So whether you are a youth or a vet, get set to go racing. Go For It! 2-5 player game that comes with profile cards, playing cards, medical cards, moto buckers, die cast motocross bikers, and a nicely designed board.

name: Hina Clue
description:
Home made variant of Clue/Cluedo, based on the Japanese comic/animation "When they cry…" (Higurashi no naku koro ni)
Differs from standard Cluedo in many ways, mostly due to the fact that not all cards are distributed from the beginning, some are placed on the board. A hand limit also forces players to sometimes put down cards onto the board. Corridors are 1 space narrow, and if you overtake another player, you have to give him/her a card. Also, if you realize you are the killer, you have to announce "festival" and kill everyone else on the board (by overtaking them) before they escape.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Melthoen
description: Melthoen is a game with medieval battle system. It comprises a brown-black-white map, counters need to be cut. The rules are in Polish.

name: Wortschatz
description:
Content:
Board, 6 twarfs, 1 cipher die, 1 norrmal die, 15 pawns

The twarfs hear the word "treasure" and start running.

Each player takes a twarf and places it on a start field outside with a character. Let's take "B". This is also his destination around the board.
The active player throws the dice 13 times to get his characters together and marks them with pawns.All players try to put a word together out of the chosen characters.The twarf on the outside lane is set forward by the numbers of the characters.
If two players do not find any new word the next player's turn starts and he throws the dice.
Winner is the players whose twarf is back on his startinf point.

name: Conestoga: The Game of the Oregon Trail
description:
Conestoga is a game in which players can simulate the feeling of the explorers who traveled west in covered wagons.

The object of the game is for players to get from the East Coast to Oregon and make enough money to buy a ranch. The person who buys the largest ranch wins. Events along the way will help or hinder the players achieve their goal.
categories: Adventure, American West, Economic, Educational, Exploration
mechanics: Events, Open Drafting, Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement
publishers: Broman/Percepta Corporation, Washburne Research and Manufacturing, Inc.

name: Smarty Party! Gamers' Expansion
description:
Smarty Party - Gamers' Expansion adds dozens of new categories focusing on boardgames and card games...and not those silly mass market games, but the games you love that your fellow Board Game Geeks play! Smarty Party! has long been a favorite party game for gamers, and this expansion seals the deal. A must have for BGG readers and serious (and not so serious) gamers of all ages.

This expansion is available for free to download and print. Express permission to create this expansion was received from R&R Games. Two printed copies exist: "Special Gathering Edition 1 of 2" and "Special Gathering Edition 2 of 2," one of which (1) was made available at the 2008 Gathering prize table, while the other one (2) was made available for play during the 2008 Gathering.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Print & Play, Trivia

name: Fishing To Go Card Game
description:
Players (the anglers) strategically cast their lures into a modular lake setup created from the lake deck, as created on the table, in an attempt to catch fish of high point or weight values.

Different lures will catch fish species which are typically attracted to that lure in real life. There are different sizes of each species, and each different point/weight class card includes different information about that species.

The five point cards are new world records for that species, and include thorough information about the current world record for that species.

There are multiple options for play. In tournament play, anglers can pursue victory by accumulation of points of by total weight, much like in actual tournament fishing.

Additionally, specific species can be the target, i.e. largemouth bass, and all other fish would be returned to the lake when caught.

In point play, there are bonuses given for catching fish of three different species or all species in the lake, excluding the carp--which warrant penalties.

If one angler acquires all eight cards of one point value a bonus is earned, but if that bonus is due to acquiring all of the world record fish (5 points), then they are deemed the "Greatest Fisherman (or person) of All Time" and they automatically win the game.

The game was commissioned by, and features a spectrum of lures which are manufactured by Sheldons' Inc., of the Mepps line of spinners and spoons. These are photographed throughout by Doug Stamm of www.stammphoto.com, a famed outdoors photographer.

name: The Seven Years War & The War of Austrian Succession
description:
The Seven Years War & The War of Austrian Succession is an area movement game of these two conflicts.

The game system uses the simple RISK method of combat: highest roll with a twist, cards are not areas conquered but are events that can give the player an advantage or create a disadvantage for an opponent. Cards offer extra troops, use of neutrals, generals, force an opponent out of the conflict, ect.

Number of players can run from 2 to 7 allowing for much diplomacy between players.

Game is available through Calumet Armchair Wargamers at RB1863@Yahoo.com

name: Super Dice
description:
"Dice game simulating 2 Superheroes fighting. Victory: To win reduce your opponent to zero hits." The Superheros start with 50 hits and five Superpowers. There are approximately eighty different Superpowers defined in the rules.

Each turn the players roll five six-sided dice. The players decide which dice are being used for attack and which are being used for defense. Superpowers are then used to alter the dice in various ways. Once these effects are resolved, attack and defense totals are compared. If an attack total is higher, the defender loses a number of hits equal to the difference. If the defense total is higher, the attacker loses the hits.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fighting, Print & Play

name: International Elite S.W.A.T.
description:
International Elite S.W.A.T. the Boardgame (tentative name)

S.W.A.T. the boardgame is a strategic, tactical police simulation game based on modern weapons and technology for 1 to 6 players. Play with pre-made characters or create your own character from scratch and watch your character rise through the ranks. Players may use weapons in accordance with their style of play ranging from assault rifles to sniper rifles that are fully customizable with various scopes, suppressors, and sights.

Play 3 different maps:
- The Bank: Small Map
- The Plane: Medium Map
- The Mansion Estate: Large Map

Play with 6 different weapons:
- Assault Rifles
- Submachine Guns
- Light Machine Guns
- Shotguns
- Sniper Rifles
- Sidearm Pistols

Complete your arsenal with numerous supplementary weapons:
- Grenades
- Smoke Grenades
- Thermal Goggles
- Gas Masks
- Various Suppressors
- Various Gun Scopes
- Various Tactical Sights
- Armor Piercing Bullets
- Tear Gas
- Breaching Charges

Players read through a Mission Booklet and decide which of the missions to perform. Terrorists are set up and players set up on their starting locations. Each mission will have an objective and a secondary objective for those playing with Career Mode Characters.

Types of Missions:
- Hostage rescue
- Escort the V.I.P.
- Retrieve and escape
- Double assassination
- Protect control points
- and many more
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Chit-Pull System, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Fangs and Swords
description:
From the Introduction:
" Battle rages on between orcs and knights. Green and yellow mix into a chaotic melee and no-one knows which side will win this battle. Each player attempts to make his side victorious, orcs or knights.

Mage towers scattered on the battlefield are strategic objectives, and it soon appears that who controls the most towers will reap the seeds of victory. "

Orcs and Knight fight on the battlefield in a chaotic melee.
Each player tries to secure small areas of the battlefield, hoping to regroup and turn the battle to his advantage.

Once an area of the battlefield is completely surrounded by orcs and knights, a tally is made on each flank to determine who controls that area.

Fight for control of 7 towers using tiles that have both Orcs and Humans in the corners. Use your Power Tokens like Drummers, Leaders, Banners, and Shamans to increase your chances of victory on the field of battle. The first player to control 3 towers wins the day.

Batt'l K'haos has well-written rules and is easy to pick up and learn. It is on the lighter end of the game spectrum and plays in about 20 minutes.

name: Royal Ace-assin
description:
Face cards are royal figureheads. Numbered cards are influential members of the royal court. The Aces are royal assassins. There are 3 "years" of play. At the end of the 3 years, the assassins are sent out. After all murders occur, a winner is determined. Figureheads total the political strength of their supporters. A player wins by owning the most powerful living figurehead.

http://www.pagat.com/invented/royal_ace-assin.html

name: Poker Cinese
description:
Component:
52 cards (normal deck of cards)
36 tokens divided into 4 series of colors (each set with values ranging from 0 to 4)
3 cards summary of the scores of poker American
1 block white
rules

Each player receives 9 tokens of a color and places them in front of covered if, so
randomly choose the dealer (which has the sole task of distributing the cards and not influence the course of the game), which distributes 15 cards to each player.
The game is divided into 3 rounds.
The players have split the cards received in 3 "hands" by 5 cards each, as they believe keeping in mind that the value of combinations is the normal poker. At this point the position 3 "hands" constituted, whether before, blankets and order "Pokeristicamente" decreasing (from the most powerful combination to weaker) and puts on each of 3 hands a coin covered under the bet that wants carried out.
(NB 4 players the dealer distributes 13 cards, and the third "hand", one with the lowest value, is made only by 3 cards).

When all have made bets, you start turning the first hand: the player with the highest score receives the chips on the hand, then continues in the same way for the other 2 "hands".
The chips are cashed victory points and can not be used for subsequent ballots, the game is designed so that each player must use all its chips 9 initials. At the end of the third round each player adding up the value of coins collected: who wins the highest value.

name: Hinguere
description:
Two player abstract strategy boardgame with very simple set of rules, but hours of fun gaming. Easy to learn.

Black and white players take turns to place tiles according three rules and tries to make other player into the position, which is impossible to continue.

It can be played on a standard 8x8 chessboard, but smaller and bigger boards are possible. The size of the board will affect the difficulty and length of the game and also the winning tactics and strategies.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Deduction, Math, Print & Play, Puzzle, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: KÃ¶nig Kobra
description: A nice tile-laying game where the goal is to make the longest snake possible, but it's not quite that simple. Snakes are built in various colors, and body sections can be added that match. Players can catch snakes that have a head and at least two body parts, but longer snakes are worth more points. So the idea is to wait long enough to get good points, but not so long that someone else catches the snake you've been building up. The first player to catch a snake gets the "snake bracelet", and they wear this until a snake of a longer length is caught. The person wearing the bracelet at the game's end gets bonus points in addition to their snake points.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Duco
description:
The Kingdom is at the brink of civil war. Diplomats and Chancellors from different parts of the land have come to the King's court to solve the conflicts between the different opposing factions. However, among the Diplomats there is a Traitor - with chaos in his mind. If he can turn the other Diplomats at each other, or eliminate enough Chancellors, total chaos will erupt in the Kingdom, and the Traitor will be greatly rewarded...

At the beginning of the game players are secretly assigned the roles of one Traitor the rest being Senators. Each player receives three advisers (that act like life points) and a counter is placed in the middle of a 20 or 30 (depending on # of players) diplomatic point track. The Senators win by taking the point count to 30 or eliminating the Traitor's all three advisers. The Traitor wind respectively by taking the point count to 0 or when all the advisers of a senator have been eliminated.

The heart of the game lies in negotiation and bluffing. The game is played using action cards that manipulate the diplomatic point track, number of advisers in the game and the ever useful resource of gold. Much like in Werewolf, the task of the Traitor is to turn the Senators against one other while getting away with actions with which he tries to end the game in his favour.

name: Bedlam: The Countdown
description:
From Mike Petty:

Bedlam: The Countdown
This is a resource management and negotiation game set in the dark future. Most simply, it's an auction game where the characters you buy provide the options you'll have for actions on your turn. Instead of using the usual approach with character based card games--when cards refer to broad classes of characters such as "thief" or "wizard"--the cards in Bedlam refer to specific characters and they give the game an excellent sense of narrative. Prepare for some surprises, some backstabbing and plenty of tough decisions.

I know that, as the game's creator, my own opinion doesn't count for much. I have to say this is my favorite game of all that I have created. I'm glad to be able offer it for the first time in this form. I trust expansions and other editions will follow as more people discover the simple system and explore the possibilities it offers.

The game is for three to five players and it can be completed in 45- 60 minutes. You'll need to print and cut out about 50 cards, a player sheet for each player and some counters (if you don't want to use poker chips or other tokens).
publishers: (Web published), Black & White Games, New World Games (I), Print & Play Productions

name: Rekenen met Dora
description:
Child's game about learning how to count. The correct puzzle pieces must be put together with the correct number of symbols on the tiles.

"Counting with Dora the Explorer"
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math, Memory, Puzzle

name: KapitÃº
description:
A Trivia type of game, played in teams (2 to 4 teams - 8 max. per team).

The goal of the game is to name the maximum correct answers in one minute. Sample questions are: "In one minute name all the birds you know, for example seagull". Team members start, in order, naming birds. If one of the members repeats an answer or makes a mistake, the teams loses and only the previous answers count.

The board is used to advance in difficulty, and the game ends when the first team reaches the final box. Corrects answers are then added and the team with the highest score wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game

name: Pumpking
description:
The old Pumpkin King has recently passed to the great beyond.
there is a battle being waged between his two heirs for control of the patch. Who will take the throne?
Pumpking is a 2 player abstract strategy game that was inspired by the ancient game Latrunculorum.
Players face off on a grid 6 squares wide by 11 squares
long. Each army consists of a Pumpkin Prince, two bats and six pumpkin warriors. The three pieces move following different rules.

name: Area 51
description:
Everyone knows that Area 51 is for real and that aliens have infiltrated the populace of Roswell. An FBI agent, devoted to uncovering the truth, is trying to discover the identity of these aliens as townsfolk are abducted during the night and taken to the mother ship.

During the day, the Roswellians meet, discuss, make accusations, and then send someone off to Area 51 to be "examined." Yeah, these people are a suspicious bunch ... but they're right! They know they've been invaded by aliens and Area 51 is going to help them sort things out.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Sink the Bismarck!
description:
Sink the Bismarck! is based upon the Battle of the Denmark Straits, May 1941."

"The game is designed to be played by a team or 'Flag Staff' determining the actions of each ship in their force. The Flag Staff can consist of any number of players; though recommend not more than 8 - 10 per staff. The staff must have one Admiral in charge of the staff and acting as commander of one ship, and a Flag Captain, commanding the second ship. The remainder of the staff is divided among three departments; the Navigation Department (NAV DEPT) responsible for ship movements, the Engineering Department (ENG DEPT) responsible for battle damage repairs and generating smoke screens, and the Operations Department (OPS DEPT) responsible for guns, torpedoes, and air operations. Each department executes its duties through the use of 'action cards' which they hold. These cards are described below.”

“During each turn, or hand, only up to two departments may contribute to the four action cards forming the hand for each ship. These four cards are placed next to the ships face down. Each round a ship commander turns over a card from the hand and the actions resolved. The commanders may, based on the course of events, change the order of the remaining cards to the played, or declare emergency maneuvers, however they cannot consult any other member of the staff unless using the Send Signals Card.”

“To simulate the pace of combat operations, admirals and their staffs have only three minutes to select and order all their cards. If any ship's commander is not ready at the end of the three minutes, play begins with the ready commanders.”

“The game can be played with either paper or model ships of various sizes on a large table top or floor. Scale can be set to whatever units are convenient for play; all movement and hit probability charts are based on generic 'unit distances.' One unit can equal 1 inch, 1 foot, 1 yard or any other unit of length which suits the dimensions of the playing area. For table top play, 6 inches per unit is recommended. For floor play, 1 foot per unit can be used.”
categories: Educational, Fighting, Miniatures, Nautical, World War II

name: Tokugawa
description:
Based in medieval Japan the two players try to capture their opponent's capital. To reach this goal you have to hire troops. The interesting part is that there is no central "bank" - every province has its own bank. So you pay money for the troops into the bank where you are hiring them and you get money for taxes from the bank where you tax your people (only in provinces you control). The results are richer and poorer provinces - with usually the richer provinces closer to the front lines (since that's where you want to hire troops).

Troops come in different types, with different movement ranges and fighting strengths.

Two German grade-school designers invented this game, which was chosen by the Deutsche Kinderhilfswerk to receive a grant, and Günter Cornett at Bambus Spieleverlag has been helping the two develop the game over the past 2+ years.

name: Otterburn 1388
description:
Covers the battle of Otterburn 1388 in the Au fil de l'épée game series.

A tactical wargame where one map hexagon represents about 200 meters and each game turn represents about 1/2 hour of real time.

Published as second game in VV 78, jan 2008.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: Rencontre Cosmique: Extension No. 1
description:
This expansion was published by Descartes Editeur & West End Games. It is different than EON's Expansion #1 in the fact that it contains two planet systems (rather than one) and 15 aliens (rather than 10).

Add to the base game:

* 15 new powers
* Two planet systems and tokens for a fifth and sixth player

Expands:
* Rencontre Cosmique (Cosmic Encounter- French Edition)

Other expansions:
* Cosmic Encounter: Expansion Set #1
* Cosmic Encounter: Expansion Set #2
* Cosmic Encounter: Expansion Set #3
* Cosmic Encounter: Expansion Set #4
* Cosmic Encounter: Expansion Set #5
* Cosmic Encounter: Expansion Set #6
* Cosmic Encounter: Expansion Set #7
* Cosmic Encounter: Expansion Set #8
* Cosmic Encounter: Expansion Set #9
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Kokorin Kastle
description:
This author brings to us a new game playable even by 'blind' people.

Each player must get safely back to his/her room at Kokorins' Kastel, but they can only do so using the clues that are given by the rooms that are on the path back to their own room. These clues are about the smells of the rooms caused by bats, rats, zombies, and so on ... that live in the Kastel

name: Joias
description: Joias is a small card game for 3 to 6 players. Its objective is to get rid off all cards in your hand. The first player in each round plays a single, a pair, a trio, a quartet or a quintet (with a Joker), and other players must play the same type of combination, but with lower numbers. When nobody is capable of playing a new combination on that round, a new one start.
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Set Collection

name: Slip Disc
description:
Each player has 15 discs that are secretly placed on opposite sides if the plastic box on spring loaded pins. Players take turns pulling the pins. The discs fall and are either trapped by un-pulled discs or end up on the pulling players side via a ramp. First to get all 15 wins.

The Mattel game is item number 5447 dated 1969

name: L'esprit de Marie Antoinette
description:
Each player assigns Scents from his hand between the various Preparations of his parfumothèque. At the end of the game and taking into account the Trends that are marked by the Parisian Nobility, the Preparations are presented to Marie Antoinette. The player who gets more points wins; one of his Preparations would become "The spirit of Marie Antoinette" and that player will become part of the court as royal perfumer!.


L'esprit de Marie Antoinette Project wiki (in Spanish)



Playtestings & Design Notes (in Spanish)



A redesign of @EvePizzagalli (in Spanish/English/French)



Portfolio @EvePizzagalli


This game is one of the 10 finalists of the 2009 Concurs Ciutat de Granollers de creaciÃ³ de jocs.

The game is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike licence.

name: Rhodos 1522
description:
Rhodos 1522 is a solitaire wargame covering the war between the Turks and the Crusaders on Rhodos in 1522. The game itself is card-driven and battles are resolved by dice rolling.

The game is free for download for print and play, however rules, cards and map are all in German.

Download link: http://www.ghs-kosim.de/index.php/cosimm/rhodosm
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Heirs of the Golden Horde
description:
Heirs of the Golden Horde (HGH) is the sixth volume of Red Sash Games Lace Wars series. The game is companion to Volume V, Türkenkrieg. The subject of both games is the little known Russo-Austro-Turkish War of 1735-39. Türkenkrieg dealt with the war between the Imperials (the Habsburg Austrian Empire) and the Ottoman Empire along the Danube. HGH investigates the theatre of the Ukraine, where the Russians attempted to destroy the power of the Crimean Tatars as a first step toward Peter the Great's dream of a warm water port.

On the Danube, the Ottoman Turks dealt a critical blow to Charles VI and the House of Habsburg, leading almost immediately to the War of the Austrian Succession (1740-48). In the Ukraine, things were different. Forgotten or dismissed as "futile" by historians, the campaigns of the Muscovites against the remnants of the Mongols' Golden Horde were in fact brutally effective.

8 scenarios and 1 Campaign

HGH is not a complete game. Although it is possible to play a few of the scenarios with the counter mix provided, HGH is intended to be an expansion module for TÃ¼rkenkrieg (1737-1739).
categories: Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Reservat
description:
This is a pentacube placement game. At the start of the game, the players choose twelve pieces apiece. They then take turns placing the pieces squarely into the box so that nothing protrudes above the top edge.

Players try to form "reserves," which are holes in the structure that may only be filled by pieces that they themselves hold.

A player who passes is eliminated and loses. Every piece left in the loser's hand counts as a point for the winner, but the other player may continue placing pieces in order to rack up extra points, one per piece so placed.

There are minor variants of this game in the rule booklet for three and four players, as well as a quick game called "Home and Dry" for two through 12(!) players. There was apparently also a separately obtainable second booklet, entitled "Spiele mit Pentakuben," that provided eight additional games and a variety of puzzles that could be built with the pentacubes.

name: Lightning Strike Companion
description:
