Lightning Strike Companion is an 80 page supplement to Lightning Strike 2nd Edition, adding more advanced rules, an expanded campaign game, and fleet lists for smaller and non-aligned forces.

Expands:

Lightning Strike
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Yin-Yang
description:
Yin-Yang is a two player game of claiming territory. It is played on a checkered board with dark and light stones. The board starts with some stones on it, then players take turns moving and adding stones until no more moves are possible.

Player One tries to have stones on squares of matching color (dark on dark or light on light), and Player Two tries to have stones on squares of contrasting color (dark on light or light on dark). At the end of the game, count up each player's score. Player One scores one point for each stone that is on a square of the same color, and Player Two gets one point for each stone that is on a square of the opposite color. No one gets points for unoccupied squares.

The player with the higher score wins the game. If scores are tied, Player Two wins the game.

An entry into the About.com: 2004 Shared Pieces Game Design Competition.

name: Big Rock Candy Mountain
description: Big Rock Candy Mountain is a game for 2-5 players. Each player controls a miniature hobo (from now on referred to as a meebo). The players have their meebos hop trains in order to move around the U.S. to find work. When a meebo works it collects dimes. These dimes are than cashed in at a hobo jungle to throw a ho-down and increase the meebos reputation. Watch out for the bull (train yard cop) he'll take all of a meebos money! The first hobo to become famous (or infamous) across the country is titled king/queen of the hobos and can retire at Big Rock Candy Mountain.

name: Poliladron
description: From the game box: An extraordinary police brigade will try to stop 6 thieves from escaping. The police brigade place barricades in the city's main streets.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Actiles
description:
The Actiles (ACTion tILES) sytem was designed for the "4 cards or tiles only" contest, and explores how much complexity you can squeeze into 4 simple tiles. Each turn, a player matches the tiles along at least one side; this can trigger additional actions by matching up verb-condition combinations, Example: "score 1 point" - "if the colours match".

The Actile games are presented here as print & play games.

Actiles 20 is a point-scoring game. The players aim to trigger clever combinations to gain additional turns and points; first to 20 points wins. 4 tiles. Enough combos to melt most brains.

In Actiles Loops, players attempt to complete a loop of their shape - square or circles. Combos allow the tiles to be moved and rotated.

Other games in the series will follow.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Game System, Print & Play
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Tokyo Express:  Naval War In the Solomons, 1942
description:
From Introduction:

Tokyo Express: Naval War In the Solomons, 1942 is primarily a two-player game covering six major battles of the Solomons Campaign, between the Imperial Japanese Navy (IJN) and the United States Navy (USN). Also included is a hypothetical scenario. Each scenario covers roughly one day of air and naval action.
This game was not designed for cut-throat play and required both honesty and friendly cooperation between the two players. In order to learn how to play the game, examine all the components, skim over the game rules, and then re-read them in their entirety.

Components:
Two Playing Maps
Two Rules Booklets
Two USN Unit Charts
Two IJN Unit Charts
Two sets of Combat Tables
Four Counter Sheets (Two USN, Two IJN)

name: Arthurian Ghost Knights
description:
'Arthurian Ghost Knights is a game of conflict for Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game. The players represent deceased Arthurian knights, fighting evil spirits for glory at Stonehenge. Each turn, you draw a card, then play a card from your hand. If it's your color, you simply place one of your guards at any trilithon. If it's an opponent's color, you place one of her guards at a trilithon, and gain glory for "helping" her, and get to place a sword (bar) on the altar stone. If it's black, it's Morgan Le Fay's, and you may do either, but getting no reward for "helping" an opponent.

Four times during the game - two random times in the first half, two random times in the second half - there will be a struggle round followed by a scoring round. During the struggle round, you use the swords you have on the altar stone, each coupled with a card, to forcibly alter the situation at the trilithons, jockeying for positions that will gain you the most glory: If you play a card of your color, you add one of your guards to any trilithon. Playing a card of an opponent's color lets you remove one of her guards from any trilithon. Playing a black card (Morgan Le Fay) lets you do either.

When the struggle is done, the scoring occurs. At each trilithon, the player with a plurality of guards gets one glory for each guard she has there - double if you're alone there. In a tie, everyone gets their respective glory there. If you have a guard at each of the five trilithons, you get 5 glory.

After the fourth scoring round (or someone gets lapped!), the game is over. The player with the most glory wins! (There are a couple of tie-breakers.)

Arthurian Ghost Knights is an official game for Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game.

name: Grapeshotte
description: Grapeshotte adds artillery to the Flintloque/Deadloque system. The box contains a 94 page book containing not only the rules for adding artillery but 9 scenarios, a couple of new races and details for all small arms in the game to that point. There are also copies of the required templates and a couple of lead miniature cannons ready for assembly.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame
publishers: Alternative Armies, Crescent City Industries Limited

name: Pest Control
description:
A (very) quick playing real-time rummy style game the aim in Pest Control is to clear your hand of pests (cards) before the other players.

Players have a hand of 7 cards, which they play down by making nests (melds) of 3 or more cards either of the same type or in sequential order, i.e. a run. Cards may also be added to nests played by any player. On their turn players either pick up a card off the draw deck or the entire discard pile, they then discard a card. However cards may be played down by any player at any time during their turn or other players turns,in other words the game can end at any point, meaning you have to keep a close eye on what the other players are doing and how many cards they have left. Cards left in the hand score negative points, the person with the lowest points at the end of the game is the winner.

Pest Control is a print & play game which can be tried out first with an ordinary pack of cards if you are only playing 2-4 players.

The decks can be easily printed at Artscow:

Pest Control Creepies Deck
http://www.artscow.com/share/r9a406xevpm3

Pest Control Creepies Deck Crawlies Deck
http://www.artscow.com/share/7ys9l128kc5s

If you are only planning on playing 2-4 players you can print and play with either deck, if you plan on playing with 5-8 players you will need both.

name: Lay's Lunar Landing Game
description: Spin and move space game that was a Premium for Lay's Potato chips. A rather thrifty price of $2 was pre-printed on the cover.

name: Round 'em Up
description: Round em Up is a push your luck game about rounding up the animals on your land and taking them to market. You'll have a chance to hear what market demands there are and then take your chances trying to find those animals, or be content to take the animals in right away.

name: Railway Rivals Map SWE: Southern Sweden
description:
A map for use with the Railway Rivals game.

The map covers southern Sweden. The hills do not interfere with network building very much, though there are large lakes to negotiate. This was a relatively late stand-alone map, which was not released in the large (approx A2) size, but just as an A3 black and white map.

name: Railway Rivals Map AUS: Austria
description:
A map for use with the Railway Rivals game.

The map covers Austria with connections to surrounding countries. The map is very hilly and is for 3 or 4 players only, preferably experienced ones. There are 2 in 7 special runs to neighbouring countries, and some routes into neighbouring countries may be built by players, or assumed to exist and be usable for racing on. This was a relatively late stand-alone map, which was not released in the large (approx A2) size, but just as an A3 black and white map.

name: Monopoly: Houston Astros 2005 National League Champions Edition
description: 2005 National League Champions! 2005 marks the year the Astros brought a National League Championship to Houston for the first time in the history of the franchise! The MONOPOLY Brand is proud to present the Houston Astros 2005 National League Champions Edition of the world's most famous board game.This collector's game captures and brings to life the glory of the 2005 National League Champions, the Houston Astros, featuring photos from the 2005 playoffs. Some of the greatest moments in playoff history have been forever preserved like winning the longest game in playoff history - an 18-inning victory against the Atlanta Braves and upsetting the heavily favored St. Louis Cardinals. Players such as Lance Berkman, Roy Oswalt and Roger Clemens make for exciting play in this classic game of risk taking and deal making. The tried and true Astros fan can now buy, sell and trade the best of the 2005 Astros, in an effort to own and control one of the most famed seasons in Astros team history.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Empire (4th Edition)
description:
A complex set of miniatures rules for playing large-scale Napoleonic battles.

Revised edition of

Empire (Third Edition)


According to the designers:

"The majority of the changes have been applied to the tactical portion of the rules. Many more of the movements, particularly those that concern tactical reactions to enemy moves and movements of less-reliable troops, have been randomized. A new combat mode has been added to represent the protracted firefight between bodies of formed infantry. We have also included new tests of commander and troop resolve at the maneuver element level. These will work more than ever to increase the need for reserves and limit the numerous and unrealistic fights to the last man, and hopeless charges which plague so many games."

name: Kimavu
description:
Two children play hide and seek in the garden of the house. The first to find the other is the winner.

A deducation game for two children. Each player takes a grid map of a garden, and play on either side of the screen. The gardens has a number of unique items in each column and row.

Taking turns, each players rolls two dice. One die shows the number of questions they may ask the other player to discern their location. The other die is the number of spaces the player may move their pawn.

When they suspect they are in the same square as the opponent, the player announces their location. If it is the same, the player wins.

name: Heavy Gear Tactical Pack Two: Shadow War
description:
From the back of the book:

The Shadow War tactical campaign pack is a full tactical campaign for use with the Heavy Gear tactical system. The booklet features two brand new regiments, the 42nd Combined Company (Death Jesters) and the 68th Companie (Chasseurs d'Ombres), and a bundle of scenarios that can be played independently or as part of the campaign. The pack also includes two maps and three counter sheets.

Stock number: DP9-054.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Heavy Gear Demo Game
description:
From the introduction:

This introductory game contains a basic version of the Heavy Gear tabletop rules that is easy to learn and fast to play. It does not require the use of the rulebook or any of the older Heavy Gear supplements. The Heavy Gear Demo Game includes ten cut-out Gear counters, one color arena map and a condensed version of the tactical rules. All you need is pen, paper and a few six-sided dice!

Stock number: DP9-100
ISBN-13: 9781894814096

name: Lightning Strike Demo Game
description:
This demo game, printed on a folded single sheet of paper, contains the game basic rules, an introduction to the setting, cut-out counters, rulers and data-sheets for the following vehicles: Pathfinder, Lancer, Syreen, Wraith.

Stock number: DP9-300
ISBN-13: 9781894814102

name: Eagles & Kings
description:
A chess-style game with 20 pieces per side, secret / variable set-up. 2 players, ages 8 and up. Print-n-play.

Standard chessboard
40 pieces

Based on E. R. Burroughs' Chessmen of Mars' (Jetan). I made a set of the original game Burroughs used as a plot device for the book and quickly discovered the design was flawed - 99% of all games ended in a draw. Not much fun. As I changed and clarified the rules to make the game competitive and fun, I soon hit upon the idea of dropping the specialized board and introducing secret set-up.

No longer using the 10x10 square board, EAGLES & KINGS uses a standard chessboard. With 20 pieces per side, this leaves 4 pieces in the third rank. Set-up for each player is done in secret. This makes each game potentially unique, as each player can place any of his pieces anywhere within the first 3 ranks.

Everything needed to play EAGLES & KINGS can be found in the files section, and permission is given by the designer for print-n-play. The piece designs and rules are my own and copyrighted.

name: Galactic Conquest: A Star Fleet Universe Campaign Engine
description: The newly-updated Fourth Edition of the most famous campaign rules in the Star Fleet Universe. Use this in the official campaigns or to build your own. Includes everything! Conquest, exploration, alliances, diplomacy, construction, technology development, ships, bases, and a thousand more things. It is designed to use with SFB (it might work with FC if you go to some effort) and assumes you either create your own map or use the map provided by the campaign masters.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Such mich: fang mich
description: Two players try to move 10 points worth of playing pieces (each of the eight pieces counts 1-3 points) into the target area. The points also say how far a piece can move. At the beginning of the game, about 50 wooden bricks are set up on marked fields. They contain holes to put the playing pieces in secretly. At a player's discretion, he or she can take out a hidden piece and start moving. If the other player passes a wooden brick with a hidden piece, that piece has to move out (and might eliminate the triggering piece immediately, if the hidden piece was a 1 point piece).
publishers: Edition Perlhuhn (GÃ¶ttinger Spiele), Otto Maier Verlag

name: Market Square
description:
Each player tries to collect the most income by purchasing and rehabilitating buildings in Market Square.
Strategy game in which you experience the pleasures and pitfalls of the real estate market. Players buy dilapidated properties and develop them into successful enterprises while at every turn a roll of the dice may wreak havoc with their plans. The challenge is to buy the right properties at the right time and outsmarting your opponents as a developer. Each time you play, your strategy will change-and sharpen.

Game Board
Property deeds
Playing bricks, markers and rings
Instructions and Playing Guides
Rehab cards
Bulletin, Bulletin! cards
Market Square money
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Masters of Dice
description:
This is a whole familiy of games that is played on a board using dice to score points.
Depending on the number of players you choose your gameboard. For example for a 2 player game this is a 5x5 grid. One player takes the columns the other one the rows. You fill the grid by throwing and choosing the dice which are 3x d6 (0-5). At the end, the player with the weakest line loses.
Inspired by Reiner Knizia's Robot Master

name: Euro Pack V: Eastern Front Warfare
description:
Eight more eastern front scenarios for ASL, from ASL News designers.

Contains the following scenarios:

EP 7: Rescue Behle
EP79: Teutonic Knights
EP81: Katukov Turns the Tables II
EP84: Battle for the Odessa Line
EP91: A Taste of Things to Come
EP96: 40 Miles Behind
EP99: Lords of the Steppe
EP 18: Winter Hell
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Who Am I? Domi-Knows Game
description:
"Fur" goodness sake...
Spot the spots for matches...
Learn the "skin" they're in to win!
Four distinct games showcase different ways to uncover animal pairs.

Domi-Knows feature photos that enhance memory and expand visual learning. They’re also great for hand/eye coordination. Perfect for learning or game time!

Kids develop creative thinking and strengthen hand/eye coordination as they uncover Domi-Knows pairs.

name: More Cowbells
description:
In More Cowbells, players are cows trying to have beautiful spots on their hide in a game of luck pushing. The bigger the spot, the more beautiful it is.

Players makes points by rolling dice and creating closed patterns. If a player gets enough cow bells, he can double his next score.

But rerolling is risky, as every cow dung result can't be rerolled, and a player can lose his turn without spot or enough cow bells.

name: EAT
description:
From the Deep Dish website:

Welcome to the ultimate showdown of man against food. Pick the dish you want to try to eat from the buffet, roll the special EAT dice and see if you manage to force it down or if you lose your lunch. Be careful not to eat too many different flavors and avoid gross food if you can while you race to victory.

EAT is easy to learn, plays quickly and is an ideal family or party game.

name: Ice Palace
description:
Ice Palace is an abstract strategy game for 3 or more players using the Icehouse Pieces game system.

To play the game one needs:

Different single-color stashes of Icehouse Pieces per player, plus two additional stashes in White and Black
An opaque bag or hat for blindly drawing pieces
A turn marker or token


Ice Palace is divided into two fundamental, repeating phases:

In the first phase, players alternate playing pieces from their six-piece hands into a temporary structure designated "the yard", subject to three restrictions;

Pieces on any color may be placed on top of another provided the new pyramid is larger than any of the pyramids in the stack
A new stack can be started orthogonally adjacent to a previous stack provided the top pyramids are the same color
Black pieces match no colors, and white pieces match all colors


The player who is last able to play into the yard wins the hand. They then proceed to the second phase, building the ice palace. During the ice palace phase, the winning player takes all the pieces from the yard and adds them onto the ice palace structure, subject to three restrictions:

A pyramid can only be placed on top of a larger pyramid
Orthogonally adjacent new stacks can only be formed provided the topmost pyramids of both are the same color
All pieces from the yard must be added to the ice palace


Players then draw back up to 6 pieces in their hand and the yard-building phase begins anew. Play continues in this manner until a player draws the last piece from the bag, at which point the game ends and is scored.

Players get points for every pyramid in a stack (in the ice palace) which has a piece of their color as the topmost pyramid.

Ice Palace was designed by Geoff Hanna. The rules are available online.

Ice Palace tied for 2nd with Undercut in the Autumn 2004 Icehouse Game Design Competition.

name: CthulinÃ¡ria
description:
Those Iron Chef guys were wimps. Their ingredients never fought back, and only the giant squid had a chance of driving them insane. But you’re not wimps. You’re up to the challenge of non-euclidean food preparation.

Welcome to the annual Miskatonic Bar-B-Que Cook-Off. You’re racing against your opponents to transform freshly-summoned monsters into mouth-watering dishes. Be strong, don’t freak out, and remember the cook-off’s motto:

Eat Cthulhu before Cthulhu eats you!

About
A game for 2-5 chefs who aim to have the most delectable Cthulhu Mythos themed dishes in your Serving Area at the end of the game.

What you need
• A bunch of 6-side dice. About 12 will do. (Don't eat them they are not a tasty snacks)
• Assorted tokens. Beads, counters, or ancient artefacts from Ry’leh will do.
• A deck of Cthulinaria cards. (See files Section)
• 5 Cthulinaria chef cards (See files Section), pawns and 3 chef tracker tokens for each Chef.
• A yellow sign totem. (See files Section)
• A Copy of the rules. (See files Section)
• A hunger for the Old Gods, Om nom nom nom.

Cthulinária is a visual (and somewhat) mechanical redesign of Invisible City's Cthul-B-Que (released in 2008).

Assistants: Mini Expansion (Beta)

Those cantankerous upstarts think they can baste a beast, better than you. Hanging around you while you're trying to cook, trying to prove themselves by taking on the tasks to difficult for you. What a nuisance, they never follow orders and many times they just mess things up. They are like that annoying person at the Miskatonic University that would follow you around all day pretending to be your friend and trying to help but really they are clueless, but in a way you feel sorry for them.

Bring Assistants into your game and watch them create havoc, rather than food. Sometimes you can even hear The Great Cthulhu moaning about them.

What you need
• 4 Assistant Cards (See files Section)
• 3 Item Cards (See files Section)
• 1 Recipe (See files Section)
• Expansion Rules (Forum)
• Cthulinária Main Game (See files Section)
categories: Card Game, Dice, Horror, Humor, Print & Play

name: Abstrac
description: This game uses a 24-card pack consisting of A-K-Q-J-10-9 in each suit. All the cards are laid out in a sequence face up. Players in their turn draw the next one, two or three cards. When all the cards are taken, players score for certain combinations, and then multiply the result with the number of cards the opponent has taken in order to get the final score.

name: La Gran Trivia Chilena
description:
A trivia were all the questions are related with Chile and it's culture.
It has 550 question cards with more than 10 categories: history, geography, music, movies, t.v., culture, sports, etc..

name: Atrium
description:
Atrium is played on a 5x5 square board.First player has 3 white and 3 black stones,second player has 3 red and 3 blue stones.
On each turn,a player must move one friendly stone to an orthogonal empty space.
The player that makes a orthogonal or diagonal 3 in-a-row with friendly stones of the same color,wins the game.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement

name: Caterpillar
description: This game uses a standard deck of cards. Each player is dealt 13 cards, and in their turn they play a card and draw a card (therefor the game normally last 13 turns). The card played has to either match the suit of the previous card, or be a face card. If the sum of all the cards played so far is divisible by five, the player scores points. At the end of the game they also score for the remaining face cards. However, if one cannot play any more cards (does not have face cards or matching cards), the game ends, and that player scores for the opponents's remaining face cards.

name: Barbarossa Junior
description:
A simplified version of the classic Teuber game and Spiel des Jahres winner. Although the title implies that this is a children’s version, the box says it is still for ages 8 and up.

The game is here reduced to its core mechanism of forming clay sculptures that are not too difficult nor too easy for other players to guess. The dice rolling and special spaces are no longer present; each player instead has the opportunity to ask 3 yes/no questions about one sculpture, and then make a guess. Instead of arrows, the sculptures are moved up a staircase each time a player asks questions about it. The middle steps award the most points to the sculptor if their riddle is solved there, while the first steps (too easy) award fewer points, and the top step (too difficult) penalizes the sculptor points.

The players are also dealt cards at the beginning of the game, and must choose their sculptures from these cards. Player mats provide suggested questions to ask during the game.

name: Legions of Steel Junction Point: Campaign Pack 1
description:
(from the interior of the book)
INTRODUCTION

Welcome to the newest addition to the Legions of Steel universe. Junction Point contains rules and information on dozens of new figures and weapons. You will also find a series of scenarios where the outcome of one scenario effects later ones.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Thalatha
description:
A 2 player game play on a 3 by 3 grid. Each player has 3 stones and the object is to get 3 stones in a row (not diagonal.) Once a player has placed his three stones he moves one of his stones on his turn.

There is a note that comes with the game that says this game was taught to the publisher by an Iraqi boy while he was serving in Iraq. They played this game in the sand with stones.

name: Kremlin: Destalinization Expansion
description:
A 1953 variant for Kremlin posted in The General Vol.31,No.2. that included 5 new intrigue cards reflecting the political situation of the 1950's. This expansion was meant to be played with the basic Kremlin game and the "Revolution" expansion.

The cards and scenario in this set allow for picking up after Stalin leaves the scene.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Negotiation, Political

name: Bethump'd with Words: Book Edition
description:
From front cover:
Games about words and the story of English

From publisher's web page:
The Book Edition of Bethump'd with Words is a companion to the board and travel editions of the game. Its purpose is to present the history of English in a succinct and humorous but memorable form, and also provide more entertaining and enlightening questions about the language and its words...

The book also contains 44 games with 1,032 questions which, like those in the board and travel game editions, are devoted to the comical and peculiar aspects of everyday words and the story of the language. It's a 'must-have' source of supplemental questions and an armchair companion for everyone who plays and enjoys the board games.

name: Sinful Rummy
description: In Sinful Rummy each player is competing to achieve the highest karma over a variable number of rounds. Karma is measured in karma points which are achieved from the karma value of cards in your playing area. These cards are typically sin cards which players will play from their hand to their playing area which represents the player choosing not to succumb to the temptations of the 7 deadly sins. Playing sin cards can help you invoke special abilities called divine favors. During a round players will be trying to empty their hand because any cards left in your hand will likely cause you to receive negative karma points. The game ends after a scoring round in which a player achieves 100 karma points or more.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Tandems
description:
This game is played on a 5x5 board. Game starts with an initial setup position. On each turn, each player must move two friendly stones to adjacent (diagonal or orthogonal) empty cells, both in the same direction. Stones cannot move into the restricted points on game board.

The player that first moves 5 stones to the last row wins the game.

name: Diceopolis
description: This is a strategic placement game wherein each of 2 to 4 players begins with 25 regular 6-sided dice. In the center of the playing surface is a cross of dice ("the wall" - see diagram) against which dice are placed to score. Each die placed must touch two other dice, and only dice touching the same number in the wall in an uninterrupted perpendicular alignment will score. (Two players may begin with 36 dice each if available.)

name: Who's who
description:
This game is played with a standard deck of cards, including two jokers but without twos, threes and fours. Each player is dealt 14 cards. The two players with the same number of jokers are partners, the third player is the soloist. But players do not know this until enough jokers are played.

The object of the soloist is either to win the middling number of tricks (for example, four if one partner wins five or more and the other three or fewer), or to force the partners to win the same number of tricks each. This means he can win with 14 tricks if they both win none, or with none if they both win seven.

Tricks are played and the trick is normally taken by the second-highest card of the suit led, or by the leader if nobody follows suit.

If a Joker is played, its player may decide who wins the trick. If both are played at the same trick, the soloist decide who takes the trick. Jokers cannot be led unless there are no other cards in hand.

The score is always 10 points plus the number of tricks won by the soloist (making anything from 10 to 24 points). This amount is credited to the soloist if successful, otherwise to each partner.

name: miQube Duo
description:
Surround * Capture * Conquer

miQube Duo takes the award winning miQube to the next level. Players gain points by surrounding, capturing and conquering territory on the board’s surface by strategically selecting and placing games pieces so that they block and cover their opponents. Its durable wooden design will ensure it can withstand the rigours of play.

* Anyone from the age of 7 upwards can enjoy this game!
* Simple rules for up to 2-4 players
* The perfect game for family and friends
* Encourages planning ahead to outsmart your opponent
* Requiring all the strategic cunning of a chess game, but with a three dimensional twist

name: Deflections
description:
A two player abstract strategy game played on a hex grid board that represents a gladiator pit. Players fire "projectiles" (represented by red arrowheads) from the central space trying to hit their opponent's pawn. These projectiles reflect or deflect off the arena walls and "shields" that the players can slot into the board on their turn in lieu of movement. Projectiles that finish their normal movement in the same space multiply and move off in different directions. Projectiles that finish in the same space after this secondary movement detonate removing themselves and all adjacent shields. Play continues until one or both players is hit by a projectile, resulting in a loss for the hit player or a draw if both are hit on the same turn.

--user summary

name: Teken van Nederland
description:
A trivia game.
The Player or team throw a die. Each side of the die represents a category. The player or team get a card and draw the word on the card. The other player or team has to guess the word the other player or team has drawn, within the time of the hourglass.
The player or team who has guessed the most drawings correctly wins the game.

name: Chop Suey
description:
From the rules on the back of the box.

"Try to pick up colourful morsels as many as possible from the platform and put them into the small cup. Kindly use chopsticks enclosed."

In this game, the cup is placed at the top of the platform. The chopsticks are placed in the rings at the bottom of the platform. The wooden morsels are placed in the center. The first player spins the top and starts collecting the morsels with the chopsticks and places them in the cup. When the top stops spinning, the player stops. The cup is emptied and the score is added up. The board is then reset for the next player. The game continues until all players have had an equal number of agreed upon rounds. The player with the highest total score wins.

Points by colors:
Green square (broccoli) = 15 points
Yellow triangle (bamboo shoot) = 20 points
Red circle (meat) = 30 points

name: Colonial Lemuria: New Worlds To Conquer
description:
From the publishers website

Colonial Lemuria: New Worlds To Conquer is a source book that provides you with a complete continent to explore with both Colonial Adventures and Larger Than Life. But it's also our first step into the world of Victorian Science Fiction.

Lemuria - land of adventure. Old when Eden was young, it is a land of secrets both ancient and new. It beckons travelers, both experienced and new. Lost civilizations, exotic people, and strange steam driven machines open the door to a world of wonder.

Lemuria - where the established European powers of Colonial Adventure will vie with ancient peoples for control of the land and its people. To bring their bustling markets, mines, and gems under their control. Fight fierce desert warriors. Travel from steaming jungles to freezing mountains and beyond in search of great wealth.

Inside you'll find
-Ten new army lists for Colonial Adventures.
-Sixteen new types of unique to Lemuria animals to hunt.
-A detailed map with over 25 exotic cities that will be the scene for future Larger Than Life adventures.
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Chain Lightning
description:
description provided by designer

Essentially, an asymmetric square 'Hex'.

The board is an nxn square grid (19×19 is probably a good start) Two opposite edges are designated white goals, and the other two are black goals. Corners count as part of both edges. Each player's objective is to connect their two goal edges with an unbroken chain of their stones. White (O) stones may use both orthogonal and diagonal connections to complete their chain, while black (+) stones may only use orthogonal connections. However, black places three stones on each of their turns, while white places only two. White moves first, then turns alternate. If there are not enough spaces remaining to place all of a player's stones for their turn, place as many as possible. Play ends when the victorious player completes a valid connection. Draws should not occur.

Any serious two-player abstract requires a great many playtests before being deemed 'unbreakable', so I consider this to be a beta version. Though its name (and possibly some minor points of the rules) are still subject to change, please feel free to implement it for online/AI play (given proper attribution).
mechanics: Action Points, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleTech: Record Sheets â 3075
description:
Publisher Blurb:

MORE BATTLEMECHS FOR THE BATTLEFIELD

You’ve grasped the tactics involved with the additional units and weapons from Total Warfare to defeat your opponents. Now you own Technical Readout: 3075 and want to deploy some of those ’Mechs, battle armor and vehicles on your gaming table. Grab your dice and start rolling, because these sheets are for you!

Record Sheets: 3075 contains forty pre-printed ’Mech record sheets that will have players firing autocannons, missiles and PPCs at each other in no time. More than forty battle armor, vehicle and aerospace fighter sheets bring the excitement of combined-arms game play to any table top. Two ready-to-play scenarios focus on the highlights of this volume, while an extensive Rules Addendum section provides a sneak peak of all the advanced rules options provided in Tactical Operations and Strategic Operations. Finally, the Quick-Start Manei Domini rules introduce the Word of Blake super soldiers of the current Inner Sphere-shaking Jihad storyline for easy use on your gaming table.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Pocket Rocket Bonus Cards
description:
Essen 2009 give-away with 5 bonus cards.

Each player gets one randomly at the start of the game and can use the effect once per game.

name: Blue Zone Hockey
description:
'Blue Zone Hockey' is the third in our 5/6 System range of replay simulations, the others being 'The Beautiful Game' (soccer) and 'Rugby World'(Rugby Union), both available from www.owzatgames.com. It is also, incidentally, our first foray into the realms of North American sports, so it is with some trepidation that we launch this latest project, with phrases like 'bearding the lion in his own den'carrying coals to Newcastle' and, perhaps more appropriately, 'trying to sell ice to the Eskimos' springing to mind. But anyhow, despite what our great leaders tell us to the contrary (starting wars in other people's countries obviously excepted) life has to have some element of risk, so here goes.

This is a case of the title saying it all. 'Blue Zone Hockey' concerns itself only with the action in and around the net, strictly blue zone only. We wanted a quick-playing simulation - you already have some great detailed hockey sims out there in the lions' den - but we also wanted to capture at least a little of the excitement of top-grade ice hockey so we have adapted the 5/6 System to produce a game that takes only 6-8 minutes to play an entire match but one which also provides some blue zone commentary, covers such aspects as sin-binning, Power Play, Short-Handed play, injuries, Overtime and Empty Net situations as well as suggesting ways to identify goal-scorers and assists and even goal times if you want that detail.

What we don't provide are team and player details, you will need to do that for yourself. We have no intention of getting involved with the US/Canadian laws relating o the use of such information which, in this country thankfully, would be regarded as being 'in the Public Domain' and therefore not subject to the payment of Royalties. And long may it remain that way. We do explain, however, how you might go about all that.

Publisher Blurb

name: Berserk Junior
description:
Game Berserk Junior is the battle of 2 fantasy creature squad.

Cards
There are 4 kinds of symbols:
Elements - steppes, forests, mountains or swamps - upper-right corner
Unit type - warrior or rifleman - upper-left corner
Dice - D6, D8 or D12 - lower-left corner
Hit points - how many hits you need to cause to creature gain victory over it - lower-right corner

Battlefild
The cards arranging at the battlefild of size 3Ñ4 squares, one opposit the other, warriors in the first line and rifleman in the second one.

Turn sequence:
1. Chose your Creature
2. Move you Creature to one square or Chose target creachure (warriors can attack adjacent units, rifleman can attack any units on the battlefield)
3. Roll die (dice type in left down corner), then opponent roll die
- if you roll more or that much as your opponent, you hits (put one damage counter to thecreature)
- if you roll less then your your opponent, you miss
4. End turn

Victory
Gain a victory over all cratures

name: Grasshopper
description:
"Grasshopper is a Backgammon variant invented by Matt Crispin and its most significant feature, compared to the classic Backgammon, is that there are no dice and no luck factor at all. The game strategy fully depends on player's skills."

My brief description of how the game is played and the goal:

During the game, players attempt to race their 14 pieces around the Backgammon board, counter-clockwise, blocking their opponent's pieces along the way by occupying a point (a single piece on a point cannot be captured in this variant, in fact, there is no capturing at all) or by building a "wall" (two stacked pieces on a point make a wall) that no piece, friendly or otherwise, can pass over. Movement, in this game, is only from quadrant to quadrant, each quadrant consisting of 6 points (1 thru 6, 7 thru 12, 13 thru 18, 19 thru 24). The second piece on the wall has special ability of jumping over any wall that might be in the way to land in the next quadrant (hense the name "Grasshopper"). Walls can only be built by moving a piece from the previous quadrant that is exactly 6 points away to a point that has one piece on it. Once the players get their pieces to the 4th quadrant, they must build walls on the quadrant. These walls (two piece stacks) can be borne off the board as a unit for the players turn. The winner is the first player to bear off two walls consecutively, but not necessarily in two consecutive turns.

name: mIZÃria
description: You create funny sentences using randomly drawn cards in this game. The box contains 1500 words on 250 word cards (also a die, player figures, sheets for notes) and the rulebook provides 4 different modes on how you can play the game. If you play it four-play it can be played as a partnership game as well. It's a game of fun but you also have to use your brain to make your partner or the other players find out the words. But be careful as you can use only three words!
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Modern Havok
description:
"Well, Punk? Do you feel lucky?"
Rebel Minis is proud to announce our new 15mm modern skirmish game, Modern Havok.
Modern Havok is a fast paced set of skirmish rules for modern urban warfare. Designed for our 15mm modern miniatures line, these rules are based on the award winning Chain Reaction System by Two Hour War Games. Players control gangs, law enforcement or even mercenaries in a bid to control the streets. The PDF even has 3 starting scenarios designed by Ed himself!
Modern Havok is a standalone game and a great way to get started in the Chain Reaction system.

name: Ora et Labora
description:
"Ora et Labora" is Latin for for pray and work is a principle of the Benedictine monasteries. In this game players are young helpers arriving to the monastery to learn about the life of Benedictine monks. This can be done by completing tasks (that ask players to collect sets of cards like writing materials, sentences etc.). Board presents a clock with main activities of the monastery (like prayers, work in the scriptorium or in the garden) and players can can choose in which of the shortly starting activities they want to participate (represented by them moving pawn on board). Next the player can use the ability of the field he moved to (drawing card, exchanging card with a common poll, completing tasks etc.). Each completed task gives a player certain amount of points and allows him or her to draw another task card. Game follows this pattern until one of the players collect enough points.

Game presents Christian spirituality and sentences of st. Benedictine. "Skryptorium" was prepared in cooperation with Benedictine monastery in Tyniec, Poland

name: Yatzi Zoo
description: Idea of the game: The zoo is in a muddle: all the animals may get out of their enclosures and are drawn today. The colour combination of the dice decides which is the next animal to be drawn to complete one's row. Who can draw the longest row of animals. A drawing and dice game. Contains rules for older players.

name: KaBam!
description: The fastest word-builders win this quick thinking, head-to-head word game. Two players or teams draw cards and set them down next to each other, face up. Each card features word parts including suffixes, prefixes, single vowels, consonants and dipthongs. Be the first to build a word by adding one or more letters to the sets of letters on the cards, and you can win the round. This game includes over 70 unique 3"W x 5"H cards featuring letter combinations.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Word Game

name: Psiduel
description:
Psiduel is an intense, psychological dueling game for two players. Players take the role of psionic test subjects, pitted against one another in an "experiment" only one of them can survive. It is visceral and fast; playable in under 15 minutes.

At the beginning of a game, each player prepares a grid consisting of six cards face down. This grid represents the player’s psionic defenses. The card backs display a number from one to three, letting the opponent know the strength of the defense, but not the type.

Each player has an offense and defense deck to draw from. During a round, players burn cards off the top of a deck in order to play cards from their hand, either to replenish their defenses or attack.

The object of the game is to destroy your opponent’s defenses, and reduce them to zero life by attacking unoccupied spaces on their grid.

72 cards (2 decks of 36, one for each player) and a simple rule sheet come in the box. No add-ons required.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Science Fiction

name: Classic BattleTech: Record Sheets 3067
description:
From the publisher's website:

With war a constant fact of life for the last five years, the Federated Suns and Lyran Alliance have pushed massive resources into deploying new units as quickly as possible. Additionally, they have continued to refit classic 'Mech designs to better cope with the current devastating firepower found on the modern battlefield. The other Houses and Clans have encountered their own conflicts and have also fielded their own new units of destruction.

Classic BattleTech Record Sheets: 3067 provides filled-out record sheets for the vehicles and BattleMechs described in Classic BattleTech Technical Readout: 3067. Additionally, more than 100 filled-out record sheets are included for variants and configurations for numerous standard 'Mech designs presented in Technical Readouts: 3050 and 3055.

User comment:

One of the heftier sets of Record Sheets released as a part of the BattleTech range, this set includes Record Sheets for the Classic BattleTech Technical Readout: 3067, BattleTech Technical Readout: 3050 and BattleTech Technical Readout: 3055. This created a certain amount of overlap with other record sheet sets, such as the FASA-produced BattleTech Record Sheets Volume Six: 3055 'Mechs and BattleTech Record Sheets: 3055 & 3058.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Linkology: Animals
description: The Linkology game is a fast and fun card game that links science concepts together in a way that reinforces vocabulary and classification skills. The deck of 100 self-checking cards contains word cards and beautifully illustrated photo cards. Each player starts with a hand of 5 cards. One card starts the discard pile. On your turn, try to find a card in your hand that shares an attribute with the top card of the discard pile. For example, if the word card "bone" is on the discard pile, you could play the picture card of "skull" from your hand. If you don't have a match, you must draw a card to add to your hand. If you're the first person with an empty hand, you win.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Linea
description:
In Linea, two players duel on a special board of 12 round spaces linked by 12 lines. On their turn, the player places one of their pieces, numbered 1 through 6, on an open space. The aim of the game is to dominate the majority of the 12 lines that connect the spaces. A line is considered dominated if the sum of the spaces of a player’s pieces on the line is higher than that of the opponents. When all spaces are occupied, the game ends.

Originally published in spielbox 1992 #4.

Reimplemented by:


Stonehenge

name: Tactical Assault: Fantasy Cards
description:
The Tactical Assault: Fantasy Cards™ is an elegant card-driven rule set for bringing exciting clashes of sword & sorcery - including command & control and the fog of war - to the tabletop battlefield in a very playable fashion. The rules are even able to incorporate the some of the more obscure aspects of pre-gunpowder warfare such as war machines, artillery, obstacles, sappers and so forth into the same fast-play, narrative based system.

Despite being deceptively simple in appearance, the Fantasy Cards provide a very challenging game full of hard choices and long range planning. The fact that every card can offer multiple options, that there is no way of knowing exactly when certain cards will appear in a player's hand, and that not every unit will be available at all times (e.g. due to combat effects, confusion, etc.) forces players to carefully weigh the benefits and risks of almost every tactical decision within the framework of their overall strategic plan.

In addition, with the incorporation of expansion decks, even more challenge and detail can be easily added to the base game. This allows players to customize the rules to the level of complexity they most enjoy.

And if folks prefer their battles more in the form of a traditional board game, the Fantasy Cards can be combined with the new Tactical Assault: Legendary Battles™ print-n-play packs. These sets give Fantasy Card players everything they need to play exciting battles in a hex and counter style format - including unique scenarios, beautiful full color maps and more than enough counters to allow players to develop their own scenarios. The only thing the players need to provide is their own Fantasy Card decks!

All of this is offered in an easy to download print-n-play format available at the Tactical Assault Games website - along with articles on tactics, tips & tricks, designer's notes and more!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid

name: Anima Tactics: Harod
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Born in the shadows, Harod is the perfect assassin. Without remorse or guilt, this angel of death spread his wings to bring silence and doom upon anyone in his path.

Prowler - Azur Alliance - Level 40

Stealth (Subterfuge, Effect) Becomes Hidden. This skill can not be activated if Harod is inside an enemy Control Zone.

Murder Attack (Subterfuge, Attack) Special Impact, +5 Attack / +5 Damage. If Murder Attack causes any damage, target unit suffer Lv3 Poison. Effect 16. This skill can be used only if Harod is Hidden.

Snake Blades (Ki, Attack) Special Impact, +2 Attack. If Snake Blades cause any damage, target unit suffer Lv3 Poison. Effect 15

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

name: Rapid Fire!: First Supplement â Unit Organisation for the 1944-45 Campaign in North West Europe
description: Rapid fire! Supplement giving the organisations and equipment got the Commonwealth, German and American forces that took part in the fighting in the North West Europe theatre from 1944 to 1945. Include orders of battle for some divisiononal sized historical units.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Chattanooga Choo-Choo III
description:
This game was designed specifically for the 2011 Gulf Games 27 Convention, held in Chattanooga, Tennessee, at the "Chattanooga Choo-Choo" hotel in the historic Chattanooga train station.

Game play is card driven and consists of placing passengers in their departure cities and delivering them to their destination cities. One point (one dollar) is scored for each passenger delivered although bonuses points can increase the value of delivering a passenger.

Each card can be used in one of three ways:
- To add three passengers to their departure cities,
- To deliver one or two passengers to a single destination, or
- For its special ability such as earning bonus points or drawing additional cards.

Inside the game box are:
- A playing board/map with eight cities marked
- Wooden cubes (and wooden houses) representing passengers (and restaurants)
- A deck of cards
- Paper money
- A set of rules
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Boa
description: The player throws the 3 dices . If he obtains the combination "B.O.A" he wins cards to enlarge his snake. The largest Boa wins

name: Fosfofou
description:
A luminous observation game: The cards all look the same at first glance, so it's not so easy to pair them up.

Object of the game is create as many pairs as You can. Players mix the cards then place them on the table with the "5 geometric forms" side facing upwards. All the players play at the same time. Once the signal is given, each player looks at the cards and tries to find identical pairs. As soon as a player thinks he has created a pair, he takes two cards, places them in front of him and continues to search for other pairs. But watch out for mistakes as the cards are very similar!In fact, all the cards contain the 5 same geometric shapes; only their location differs from one card to the other. You are not allowed to touch the cards except to finally take them!

Game ends when there are no more cards in the centre of the table, or it does not seem possible to create another pair (if the players have taken incorrect pairs), each player checks the pairs that he has created. Winner is the player with the most correct pairs.

Components:

48 luminous cards

name: Naval Battle of Hakodate Bay
description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #6.

This is small sized naval battle wargame based on Boshin war.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Miyako_Bay
Players control one to five ships belong Tokugawa shogunate navy or newly formed Imperial Japanese Navy.

Main actions in game resolve by chit-pull order. Each side has four action chits for movement, fire starboard, fire port and rally.ãAnd initiative players can hold some randomly selected chits to use any timing.

Victory decide by various scenario special rule.

name: Ð¨Ð°ÑÐ¼Ð°ÑÑ Ð¥Ð°Ð¾ÑÐ°
description:
From publisher:

"Chaos Chess. A revolution on the back-and-white field" is a variation of the classic game of chess. The goal of the game remains the same – checkmate your opponent. However, your arsenal is no longer limited by the 16 pieces on the board!

During the course of the game, you can use special cards: mutations, intrigues and maneuvers. Each card introduces a temporary or permanent change into the normal rules of chess. The game strategy becomes much more diversified as it becomes impossible to foretell your opponent’s tactic. An element of chance is added to the game (something completely absent from the classic game of chess). The tables can turn at any time, imposing drastic changes on either side. This is why players in extremely dire situations still have a legitimate chance to win.

In addition to this game set, you will need a chess board with the standard pieces for both sides. You will also at least need to be able to play chess at the most rudimentary level.

"Chess of chaos" is a card addition to classic chess, the idea was created on the base of the game "Tempête sur l'échiquier". "Chess of chaos" is produced in Russia with the permission of the original authors.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement
publishers: Fantasy World, Inc., Hobby World, Igrology

name: The Second Battle of Corinth
description:
The game uses the divisional system for American Civil War operations introduced in Hampton Newsome's At all Hazards for a very small and quick simulation of the two-day 2nd Battle of Corinth. Like their real counterparts, units accumulate fatigue and disorder, and stop working long before they are eliminated by combat. Corps and armies are activated by chitpulls, a simple order system (no writing!) captures the delays inherent in 19th century campaigning and the unreliability of individual leaders.

Scale:
half mile per hex
3.5 hours per daylight turn (4 daylight, one night turn per day)
division level units
Individual army and corps commanders

name: Good 'Ol Punchin' Planes
description:
"I remember back before the great war, we didn't have any fancy machinery guns to add to our two-winged air-scrapers. So, when two hot-shot fly-boys needed to settle their differences, they grabbed a buddy and had them duke it out mano-a-mano on the wings of aeroplanes. Those crowds would sure hoot and holler as we flew nearly 50 mph to heights of almost 30 feet. You kids wouldn't remember those days. So, I made this paper and card game-set box to show you nancies how we used to do it. Back when flying and racing was pure.

Did I say racing? Why I can't really remember why we were racin' too. But, hell, that's exactly how I remember it, so that's how you're gonna play it. The old-fashioned way. We called it "Punchin' Planes" and that's how it was." ~Grandpappy

In "Good 'Ol Punchin' Planes" players relive the days of early Pre-WW1 aviation. The days when the only way to fight was to have a buddy stand on your wing and engage in fisticuffs (machine-guns were too heavy, or course). Through the use of dual-purpose action cards, players have to navigate obstacles on the modular race-track while their fighters spar on the wings of their planes. Will you win over the crowd and cross the finish line or go down in a ball of flames?

Play is fast and actions are revealed simultaneously. While the game uses a rock-paper-scissors mechanic for fighting (punch, kick, grapple), there is always the option for the losing player to "trade blows," essentially turning the tables. But, since cards are not always drawn each turn, losing a battle may sometimes be more beneficial than winning. With obstacles that bring players one step closer to explosion, hand management, and plane positioning complicating each situation, "Punchin' Planes" is a short game for 2 players with a surprising strategic depth.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Fighting, Racing
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Rimau
description:
A Malaysian abstract board game for two players. One takes the role of the Tiger, who is trying to eat the Men (orang-orang) and avoid capture. The Men must corner (or otherwise immobilize) the Tiger in order to win.

The Tiger is just one token on the board, and the Tiger can only jump over (eat) rows with an odd number of Man tokens. Men can move, but before that, the Man player takes their turn placing new Man tokens down on the board. Once the pool of 22 Men (some versions call for 24) has been emptied, the Man player may freely move the Man tokens.

Rimau is an asymmetrical strategy abstract that uses an expanded Alquerque board.

name: Spaiji
description:
Spaiji is an evolution of TAIJI that can be played with a Series: Shibumi set, as it uses a 4x4 holes board and balls in two colours (white and black).

Rules: The 4x4 board starts empty. Two players, White and Black, take turns placing one ball of each colour adjacent to each other. The balls can be placed on board holes or on top of 2x2 platforms. Notice that you can place a ball on a hole and the other on a platform, as long as they touch each other.

Aim: The player with the largest group of connected balls of his/her colour when the pyramid is full wins. In case of a tie, the second player wins.

Variant for beginners: Consider only visible balls for scoring (not the 5 hidden ones).

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf

name: Goal! Game expansion pack: Dutch Team
description: This expansion is packaged like a CCG booster. It contains 14 player cards of the Dutch football team and one new special tactics card.

name: Assault on Galactus Prime Expansion Kit 1: The Empire Shoots Back
description:
As the Empire stood and witnessed the surprise assault on their beloved Galactus Prime, they plotted revenge. Now, they're rebuilding and retaliating in full force! The first expansion for Tom Decker's Assault on Galactus Prime, The Empire Shoots Back, broadens your options and promotes wilder gameplay in this deck-building, push-your-luck game. Now it's time for you to fight back before it's too late!

Note, the Assault on Galactus Prime Expansion Kit 1: The Empire Shoots Back is not a ‘stand alone’ game. You must own a copy of Assault on Galactus Prime to use this expansion kit.

Game Data:

Complexity: 3 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 1 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each unit is a pilot or an assault craft battling at the capital of Galactus Prime.

Game Components:

• One 2-page full color Rules booklet
• 40 units and markers
• 20 Deck cards
• One Pilot Worlds mat extension
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Invasion of the Garden Gnomes
description:
The gnomes are fighting for dominance of the gardens. Gnomes from the lawn, hedge, veggie garden, orchard, flower garden, and herb garden can be recruited to build a ceramic empire.

In Invasion of the Garden Gnomes, players form melds (sets of gnomes from the same part of the garden), each representing a columns of garden gnomes armed to the teeth. The smallest set of each color will be squished and not score, and larger sets score more points. Whenever a new column is formed, a special effect is triggered (usually good). Between games, twelve different special powers are randomly allocated between the six type of gnomes, making for very different games and necessitating different tactics.

This game's core mechanisms are based on Knizia's card game Vampire. Invasion of the Garden Gnomes introduces special powers for each color and more vicious competition within each color of meld. The game includes "junior rules" that allow you to play a simpler game, more similar to Vampire, and the "full rules" are notably different from the the game's predecessor and involve deeper strategy.

name: Anima Tactics: Hel
description:
Hel is Jerome's sister and last member of the Three People in the Abyss. As only a young child, Hel displayed an unnatural faculty to kill people with a mere brush of her skin, a power which cast her from her clan. After the encounter of the siblings with Dead Moon Hel and Jerome were fascinated by Pirate Queen's lifestyle, Hel was able to polish her skills, transforming her into one of the most feared assassins of the seas.

Dark Azur Alliance Warrior/Prowler - Lv. 40
At 5 | Dm 3 | Df 9 | Ar 0 | LP 12 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4
Jigoku no Musume: If any unit (friendly or enemy) dies inside Hel's Control Zone, Hel recovers an action point. If Hel's Action Bar is already full, she recovers 3 Life Points instead.
ooo - Gates of Hell (Ki, Attack)
+2 Attack. If Gates of Hell causes damage, target unit must pass a Resistance Control or target unit is removed from the game. Effect 14. Put a lvl 1 Doom counter on Hel after using Gates of Hell.
ooo - Hell Calling (Ki, Attack)
+4 Attack
A part of Team Lords of the Abyss along with Jerome and Deadmoon.

name: Anima Tactics: Feng Yi
description:
Feng Yi was a prominent agent of the Selene Order, well recognised by her remarkable martial skills as well as her friendly behaviour. After her apparent death at the hands of the High Inquisitor Lostaroth, she was saved by the Wissenchaft Researcher Reist Ebersbacher, thus becoming a member of his mysterious organization. Now, Feng's loyalty is split between her former companions and the people to whom she owes her life.

Neutral Wissenschaft Warrior - Lv. 40

At 5 | Dm 2 | Df 9 | Ar 0 | LP: 10 | Re 10 | Mo 12/16 | AP 3/5

Innate Abilities: Feng Yi may have two Advantage Cards attached to her.

oo - First Stand: Xian Wu Jian (Ki, Attack)
-1 Damage.

o - Second Stand: San Hua (Ki, Attack)

+ 1 Attack / +1 Damage. This attack may only be executed following a successful hit with Xian Wu Jian.

o - Third Stand: Jing Niao (Ki, Attack)

+ 2 Attack / +2 Damage. This attack may only be executed following a successful hit with San Hua.

o - Final Stand: Yan Feng (Ki, Attack)

+ 3 Attack / +3 Damage. This attack may only be executed following a successful hit with Jing Niao.

name: Abstractables
description:
From Publisher Website:

Abstractables is the fast-paced, creative thinking, word guessing game where you try to get your team to correctly guess a word or phrase by arranging and interacting with simple shapes before the time runs out.

Do you know what a cow looks like? Of course you do, but can you design one with basic shapes? And get your team to guess it correctly? And do it all in 60 seconds while your teammates are screaming hilariously wrong answers at you? Welcome to ABSTRACTABLES!

With 2000 words and phrases from 8 categories, including animals, people, locations, food, sayings, motions, objects and entertainment, the possibilities for fun for the whole family are endless and the replay value incredibly high. You simply roll the die, draw a card, and start moving the pieces. It’s so fun and easy, anyone can play. Bring Abstractables to your next family gathering or game night and watch the hilarity ensue!

It levels the playing field. Not artistic, don't worry, you don't need to draw anything. Just move the pieces to form the shape to communicate the word or phrase to your team.

Abstractables contains 3-layer European Birch hardwood pieces, category cards with over 2000 words or phrases, a one-minute timer, and an 8-sided category die.

name: The 1911 Revolution of China
description:
This is two-player game that simulates the Battle of Yangxia after Wuchang Uprising during the Xinhai Revolution of 1911.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Yangxia

Gaming period is more than 40 days from late October to December 1. Gaming map covers three towns of Wuhan (Wuchang, Hankou and Hanyang). One player commands Revolutionary Army and the other player commands Qing Forces.

name: Spaghetti
description:
Spaghetti is a two player game that serves up spaghetti, sauce, and meatballs on a Series: Shibumi plate.

One player takes the white spaghetti marbles; the other takes the red sauce marbles. The black meatball marbles are neutral and are used by either player as needed. Any small object, such as a napkin or black marble, is used as a tie-breaker token to indicate which player last played a black marble to the board.

To start, White plays a black meatball marble anywhere on an empty Shibumi board and takes the tie-breaker token.

Players then alternate placing one of their own marbles adjacent to the last placed marble. Here, adjacent means orthogonally or diagonally adjacent to and on the same level as the last placed marble or onto a 2x2 platform just completed by the last placed marble.

If a player is unable to place a marble in this way, she or he places a black meatball marble on any empty space or platform and takes the tie-breaker token.

The game ends when the only space left is the peak of the Shibumi pyramid. A black meatball marble is then placed on the top of the pyramid. This is a neutral move and the tie breaker token stays with its current owner.

The player who created the longest strand of touching spaghetti or sauce marbles (when the board is viewed from above) wins the game. If there is a tie, the player who last played a meatball marble loses.

A strand is a connected set of like-colored marbles such that each marble in the strand is connected to one or two other marbles in the strand as in a chain of links. There is no looping back where a single marble is passed through more than once and there is no branching.

So now the meal is served. Enjoy.

Buon Appetito!

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf

name: The World's Greatest Hockey Game
description:
The World's Greatest Hockey Game is a simulation hockey game based on player performance from the previous year.

The player cards are broken down on a percentage basis, reflecting how often a particular player shot the puck, forced a face-off, took a penalty, threw an interception or passed. Separate sections on the cards reflect a player on a powerplay or playing shorthanded.

Delayed penalties and shooting off the rebound were also factored in by special rules reflecting these aspects.

One additional detail regarding TWGHG should be noted. In this game, the players for each team in a given season are those who were set to appear on opening day for the current year. This differs from hockey game systems such as Strat-O-Matic or Statis Pro, where card sets were published only after a season was completed. TWGHG was intended for players who wanted to use the opening day rosters and play out a season as it was progressing.

name: Dinofarm Buildgame: Let's Build the Mezoic Creature Farm
description:
English Translation title
"Dinofarm Buildgame: Let's Build the Mezoic Creature Farm"

The card game that be added to the educational-purposed comic-like book with same title.

You are a dinosaur rancher. Build the farm and raise the dinosaurs or reptiles from Mezoic era.

Winning the game by having the most victory point at the end of the game. The victory point is calculate at the end of game by the Farm Card and raised Dinosaur Card in the farm.

The game flow - at the start of the round, 2 Assistance cards is dealt to each player. Start from the starting player each player solves their turn by drawing 2 Dinosaur cards and play 3 actions from 4 available (Build Farm, Raise dinosaur, play Assistance card and discard and re-deal the farm card in the market). At the end of round, all player discard their Assistance cards and shuffle all Assistance cards to rebuild the Assistance deck.

name: Splink
description:
Splink (SP + link) is a ball-stacking game that can be played with a Series: Shibumi set, as it uses a 4x4 holes board and balls in two colours (white and red).

RULES

2 players ('attractor' and 'repulsor') share a supply of 16 red and 16 white balls.

Splink has two types of game play:

- Duel: The players play two complete games, switching roles after the first game. Whoever gets the maximum score as the 'attractor' wins.

- Bid: Before the game starts, players take turns increasing bids as to how many ponts they think they can make playing the 'attractor' role. The player who passes first plays the 'repulsor'; the other player plays the 'attractor' and must get as many points as he bid to win.

The board starts empty. Starting with 'attractor', players take turns either:

a) placing TWO balls, one of each colour, on ANY TWO valid locations (empty spaces or 2x2 platforms) or...

b) removing a ball from the board that supports exactly ONE ball on the level above and placing a new one of the other colour from the supply onto the board on any valid location; even on top of the dropped balls. Notice that you can only do this action if there is at least one ball on the supply of a different colour of the ball that you want to remove.

GAME END

The game ends when the pyramid has been completed.

SCORING

To get the attractor's score, count the number of all different red-white visible connections on the pyramid (the 5 inner balls don't count for connections). A red ball and a white ball must be touching to consider it a connection.

VARIANT

Consider an unlimited supply for both colours.

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf

name: BattleTech: Jihad â Final Reckoning
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Jihad: Final Reckoning completes the Jihad plot book series begun with Blake Ascending, wrapping up the final years of the war between the Word of Blake and the Inner Sphere, and establishing the birth of the Republic of the Sphere. This book also provides a snapshot of the postwar universe, laying the groundwork for future campaigns. Also included is a glimpse at the more fantastic weapons and assets the Word of Blake was developing before its fi nal fall-complete with rules for top-secret units, including the Caspar III system and Spectral LAMs.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Order of the Stick Adventure Game: Zombie Gamers card
description: This is the Order of the Stick Adventure Game promo card released at GenCon 2006. It may also have been available for those who pre-ordered the original Order of the Stick Adventure Game. A single-card expansion, this promo card adds the "Zombie Gamers" monster to the Battle Card deck, allowing you to inflict a horde of foul-smelling yet oddly familiar creatures on another unsuspecting player.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Memento Mori
description:
In this card game for 1 or 2 players from the hour objective is simple, you progress in your cursus honorum, your political career during the Roman Republic in the first century BC, living to tell, and be finally proclaimed Emperor of Rome.

We traveled back in time to the glorious Roman Republic, following the footsteps of statesmen and its ruling elite. In Memento mori assume the role of leader of a patrician family in a power struggle that will decide if Jupiter gives its approval, the fate of Rome, and the Known World!.

In an abstract way, over your long life, events or developments will be happening very important and permeated Roman society that affect you directly or indirectly, and will have to make important decisions for your political career as your goal is to become Emperor of Rome, but your political rival, belonging to another patrician family expects the same, and make every effort to come on or get tripped up. In order to be proclaimed Emperor of Rome must overcome dangers and betrayals in the turbulent waters of politics in the Senate, and find faithful allies among the patricians to rely in order to get their votes and support.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: LEGO Architect
description:
This game is played with lego pieces.

One player is the Architect. He creates a Rule to which a lego-building must comply. The other players take turns to create small lego-buildings from a few pieces. The Architect reviews these buildings; ‘good’ buildings are free, ‘faulty’ buildings cost money. Players earn Victory Points for guessing the Rule. A round continues until either the Rule is guessed, or until all players are out of money. Then the next player is Architect. After all players haven been Architect once, the player with the most Victory Points wins. Rules below in dutch and english.

name: You've Been Sentenced! Add-On Deck: NASA Space Terminology
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Additional cards for You've Been Sentenced. Turn outer space into inner classroom fun with the officially licensed NASA deck. Packed full of out of this world words that will amuse and inform students learning their planets and points beyond.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game

name: The European Championship Dice Game
description:
A free print and play dice game based off Shaun Derrick's excellent World Cup Game.

Moving the footballing battlefield from the World Cup to the UEFA European Championships, 2-4 players can print off tournament sheets for Euro '96 in England, Euro 2000 in Belgium/Netherlands and Euro 2004 in Portugal.

Set up is simple. Print off one A4 tournament sheet and the rules sheet. Grab six dice (preferably one red, one blue, one green, one yellow and two others). Find a pencil. You're ready to go.

The teams in the tournament will be divided out between the players who will then choose the dice they want to roll and designate the dice roll results to the teams, scoring goals, defending, scoring penalties and competing to get their teams through to the quarter finals, semi finals and ultimately the final to compete for the Championship trophy!

The European Championship Dice Game is designed to be highly portable with a short play time. Perfect to take on trips or to whip out during lunch breaks.

name: Mystery Party: Meurtre sur le Nil
description:
Mystery Party: Meurtre sur le Nil is the first title in Cocktail Games' "Mystery Party" collection of games in which players take on the role of different characters and try to determine which among them has committed the crime they are now investigating.

Meurtre sur le Nil takes place in April 1937 on board the ship Le Sobek, during a cruise down the Nile. Roger Hastings’ lifeless body has just been found in his cabin with a bullet in his skull. As soon as the corpse is discovered, Le Sobek heads towards Assouan where the local police will take over the investigation. In the meantime the eight suspects are gathered in Le Sobek’s restaurant trying to make sense of the "murder on the Nile"...

name: Adventure 3: The Lost Books (fan expansion for HeroQuest)
description:
In this third adventure we set out to create for the Wizard some more spells that He could use. The challenge was to make Him more of a valuable member to the team, without making Him too powerful and becoming God like. In this adventure the Wizard asks His friends to join Him on a quest to recover ancient spells that have become lost. Once found, these spells will help the Heroes battle against Zargon and His evil plans. Two new elements, Wood and Spirit, are added to the game. Giving the Heroes 18 new spells to use. All of these spells are used in future games. This is what is so amazing about the adventure series. The game keeps growing, making it more fun to play. We hope that you and your fiends will enjoy your adventure.
This game's pdf files are available for downloading. They are made in a way that will allow you to make the books and cards. The pages are available at "Dragonkingdoms.co.uk" and yahoo's group site "Hero Quest Game board" for free. You do need to join the group to access the file's section where they are stored. The photo section of this site will allow you to read the story and look at the maps to see if this game is something you would like to play.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fantasy, Miniatures

name: Modern Artists Go Fish for Art
description:
Go Fish for Great Art!

A game that introduces children to modern art by playing "Go Fish" and "Concentration" card games.! Get to know 8 great artists and read about the genius and fun behind each work of art in the companion fact book.

A deck of 36 museum-quality playing cards and a guide to the artists. Ages 7 to adult.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: Inkognito
description:
Inkognito is a simple yet elegant abstract game from Germany. The board contains a 5 x 5 squared grid, with the squares in two of the opposite corners being of a different colour to the rest, and designated as Castles. Each player has a set of five plastic pieces. These are cup-shaped and placed ‘upside down’ on the board. Inside one cup of each set is a marker which identifies the piece as a Spy.

The objectives of the game are to manoeuvre one's Spy into the enemy Castle and to discover the whereabouts of the opposing Spy. The achievement of either of these will cause that player to win the game.
